Sense.DEF: the second letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第二个字母

Sense.DEF:
the seventh note in the musical
scale
of C
major
or the musical
key
based on this note
Sense.TRAN: B音〔C大调音阶的第七音〕﹔B调

Sense.DEF: a mark given to a student’s work to show that it is good but not excellent
Sense.TRAN: B级﹐乙级﹐乙等〔表示学业成绩良好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a B in history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我历史得了个B。

Sense.DEF: used to refer in a short way to one of two different things or people. You can call the first one A.
Sense.TRAN: 乙﹐B〔两个不同事物或人中的一个﹐第一个称甲或A〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the advantages and disadvantages of choosing product A or B
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选择产品A或B的利和弊

Sense.DEF:
the name of a road in Britain that is smaller than an
A-road
Sense.TRAN: B4509/B1049等公路〔英国公路名称﹐比A级公路小〕

Sense.DEF: a common type of blood

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= born 出生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andrew Lanham, b. 1885
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁·拉纳姆﹐生于1885年

Sense.DEF:
a first university
degree
in a subject such as history, languages, or English literature

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has a BA in French.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一个法语文学士学位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan Potter, BA
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊·波特﹐文学士

Sense.DEF: to make a sound like a sheep
to speak quickly in a way that is difficult to understand or sounds silly
Sense.TRAN: 含糊不清地说﹔唠唠叨叨
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no idea what he was babbling on about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他在唠叨些什么。

Sense.DEF: to make a sound like water moving over stones
the confused sound of many people talking at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the babble of a crowded party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥挤的聚会上嘈杂的人声

Sense.DEF: a sound like water moving over stones
a baby

GramExa.GLOSS: one that has to be carried

Sense.DEF: a word for an attractive young woman
Sense.TRAN: 宝贝儿〔指年轻貌美的女子〕

Sense.DEF: a way of speaking to a young woman, often considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 小妞〔对年轻女子的称呼﹐常被认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a way of speaking to someone you love, especially your wife or husband
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的〔对自己所爱的人﹐尤指对妻子或丈夫的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: someone who can be easily deceived
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was like a babe in the woods when he first came to New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他初到纽约时就像一个不谙世事的幼稚小孩。

Sense.DEF: the confusing sound of many voices talking together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a babel of French and Italian
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法语﹑意大利语混杂的说话声

Sense.DEF: a large monkey that lives in Africa and South Asia
a very young child who has not yet learned to speak or walk
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby is crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝在哭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave birth to a baby on Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她于星期四产下一名婴儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you think of your new baby sister?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得你刚出生的妹妹怎么样？

Sense.DEF: a very young animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: baby birds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雏鸟

Sense.DEF: a type of vegetable which is grown to be much smaller than usual or is eaten before it has grown to its normal size
Sense.TRAN: 幼嫩的蔬菜〔指未长成就可食用的蔬菜〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: baby carrots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小胡萝卜
Sense.EXAMPLE: baby sweetcorn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小玉米

Sense.DEF: a younger child in a family, often the youngest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clare is the baby of the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔是家里最小的孩子。

Subsense.DEF: used to address someone that you love
Subsense.TRAN: 亲爱的〔用于称呼所爱的人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Relax, baby – we’re on holiday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放松﹐亲爱的﹐我们这是在度假。

Subsense.DEF: used to address a young woman that you do not know
Subsense.TRAN: 小妞〔用于称呼不认识的年轻女子〕

Sense.DEF: someone, especially an older child, who is not behaving in a brave way
Sense.TRAN: 幼稚的人〔尤指较大的孩子〕﹔胆怯的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be a baby!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别像个三岁孩子似的！

Sense.DEF: something special that someone has developed or is responsible for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t ask me about the building contract – that’s Robert’s baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要问我建筑合同的事——那是罗伯特的事情。

Sense.DEF: something, especially a piece of equipment or a machine, that you care about a lot
Sense.TRAN: 宝贝东西〔尤指你很喜欢的器材或机器〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This baby can reach speeds of 130 miles per hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这宝贝能开到时速130英里。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: throw the baby out with the bath water

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let me know as soon as the baby is born.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿一出生就告诉我。

Collocate.COLLOC: have a baby/give birth to a baby
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had the baby at home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是在家里分娩的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be pregnant
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My wife’s expecting a baby.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妻子怀孕了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: is expected to be born
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 预产期是﹐宝宝预计出生
Collocate.EXAMPLE: When is your baby due?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的预产期是什么时候？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have a baby that dies when it is born too soon
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was three months pregnant when she lost the baby.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怀孕三个月时小产了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: help a woman to give birth to a baby
leave your baby somewhere because you do not want it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s plenty of help and advice for people with newborn babies.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多为刚生下孩子的人提供的帮助和建议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not yet born
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Drinking alcohol is bad for your unborn baby.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝酒对胎儿不好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: born before the normal time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Lesley’s baby was three weeks premature.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯莉的宝宝早产了三周。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: born to an unmarried mother

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s just had a lovely healthy baby girl.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚刚产下一个可爱健康的女婴。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 刚出生的儿子/女儿/弟弟/妹妹

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘she is waiting a baby’. Say 而要说 she is expecting a baby.

Exponent.DEF: a very young child who has not yet learned to speak or walk
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I sat next to a woman holding a baby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐在一个抱着婴儿的妇女身边。

Exponent.DEF: a baby who has learned how to walk
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The playground has a special area for toddlers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游乐场有专供学步幼儿玩耍的区域。

Exponent.DEF: a baby or a very young child
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The disease is mainly found in infants.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病主要见于幼儿。

Exponent.DEF: a baby, or a small child up to the age of about three
Exponent.TRAN: 小家伙﹐小东西〔指婴儿或不超过三岁左右的幼儿〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How old is your little one?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的宝宝多大了？

Exponent.DEF: the babies of an animal or bird
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kangaroos carry their young in a pouch.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 袋鼠让幼崽待在育儿袋里。

Exponent.DEF: a group of baby animals that are born at the same time to the same mother
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our cat has just had a litter of six kittens.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家的猫刚生下一窝六只小猫。

Sense.DEF: to be too kind to someone and look after them as if they were a baby
an illness in which a woman feels unhappy and tired after her baby is born
Sense.TRAN: 产后抑郁症﹐产后忧郁症

Sense.DEF: an increase in the number of babies born during a particular period, compared to other times – used especially about people born between 1946 and 1964
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指1946年至1964年间的〕生育高峰（期）
Sense.EXAMPLE: the baby boom generation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生育高峰期出生的那一代人

Sense.DEF: someone born during a period when a lot of babies were born, especially between 1946 and 1964
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指1946年至1964年间〕生育高峰期出生的人

Sense.DEF: a thing like a small bed with four wheels, used for taking a baby from one place to another
a baby-faced adult has a face like a child
a piece of clothing for a baby, that covers their whole body
the period of time when you are a baby
like a baby, or suitable for a baby
Sense.TRAN: 婴儿似的﹐孩子气的﹔适合婴儿的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The games were a little babyish for nine-year-olds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些游戏对九岁的孩子来说太幼稚了一点。

Sense.DEF: dried milk that is mixed with water and fed to babies instead of breast milk
to take care of children while their parents are away for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔临时代外出的父母〕照料（小孩）

Sense.DEF: sounds or words that babies use when they are learning to talk
a tooth from the first set of teeth that young children have
a small frame on wheels that a baby uses to support itself while it is learning to walk
an examination in a range of subjects that students do in their final school year in France and some other countries, and in some international schools
Sense.TRAN: 〔法国等国家和一些国际学校的〕中学毕业考试

Sense.DEF:
a
bachelor’s degree
a card game
Sense.TRAN: 巴卡拉纸牌游戏﹐百家乐

Sense.DEF: a bacchanalian party involves a lot of alcohol, sex, and uncontrolled behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bacchanalian orgy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 醉酒纵欲的狂欢宴乐

Sense.DEF: tobacco
a man who has never been married
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Gerald was 38, and a confirmed bachelor
a man who has decided that he will never marry
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰拉德38岁﹐抱定主意独身。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The Crown Prince was Japan’s most eligible bachelor
a rich young man who has not yet married
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇太子是日本最理想的适婚男子。

Sense.DEF:
a first university
degree
in an
art s
subject, a science subject etc
Sense.TRAN: 文学士/理学士/教育学士等

Sense.DEF: an apartment where an unmarried man or woman lives
a party for a man and his male friends before he gets married, especially on the night before his wedding
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在男子结婚前一晚举行的〕单身聚会

Sense.DEF:
a first university
degree
, such as a
BA
,
B.S.
, or
BSc

a type of
bacteria
. Some types of bacillus cause diseases.
in, into, or to the place or position where someone or something was before
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be back in a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put that book back where you found it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那本书放回原处！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rory plugged the cable back into the socket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗里把缆线插回插座。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel like going back to bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想回去睡觉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We ought to try and get back before it gets dark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该尽量在天黑之前回去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was back home by half past eleven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是11点半之前回家的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s possible to travel there and back in a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那里一天来回是可以的。

Sense.DEF: in or into the condition or situation you were in before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gary woke at 4am and couldn’t get back to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里凌晨4点钟醒来后就再也睡不着了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took me a long time to get my confidence back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了很久我才找回自信。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
If you decide to marry him, there will be no going back
you will not be able to get back to your previous situation
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是决定嫁给他﹐就没有回头路可走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no way I’m going back to being poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无论如何都不会让自己再过穷日子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’ll take a while for things to get back to normal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要过一阵子才能恢复正常。

Sense.DEF: in or to a place where you lived or worked before
Sense.TRAN: 在以前的地方﹔回到以前的地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was the one who had fired him from his first job back in South Africa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就是以前在南非的时候炒他鱿鱼﹑使他失去第一份工作的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: in the place that you come from and think of as your home
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It reminded me of evenings back home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让我想起了以前晚上在老家的时候。

Sense.DEF: in the opposite direction from the way you are facing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He glanced back at the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回头看了一眼那房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kirov stepped back a pace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基洛夫往后退了一步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tilted her head back to look at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仰起头来看着他。

Sense.DEF: if you do something back, you do it as a reply or reaction to what someone has said or done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I call you back later?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我稍后再给你回电话好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay you back on Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期五还钱给你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No, thanks!’ he shouted back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不用了﹐谢谢！”他大声地回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he hits you, you just hit him back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他打你﹐你就还手打他。

Sense.DEF: if you give something, get something etc back, you return it to the person who first had it, or you have it returned to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we have our ball back, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以把球还给我们吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want all my books back as soon as you’ve finished with them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看完书之后马上全部还给我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me back that letter! It’s none of your business!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那封信还给我！跟你无关！

Sense.DEF: in or towards a time in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pile of newspapers dating back to the 1970s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆20世纪70年代的报纸
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of emotional problems can be traced back to childhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多情感问题都可以追溯到童年时期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Looking back on it, I should have known he was unhappy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在回想起来﹐我早该知道他当时并不开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At times, I think back to my life in Moscow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我会回想起我在莫斯科的生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was built back in 1235.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子始建于1235年。

GramExa.GLOSS: three years ago etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His wife died a couple of years back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子几年前过世了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He called me a while back .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚才打电话给我了。

Sense.DEF: once again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go back over your work to check for any mistakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查一遍你的作业有没有错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liverpool were back level again two minutes later with a superb goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两分钟以后﹐利物浦队一记精彩的进球将比分再次扳平。

Sense.DEF: to sit or lie in a comfortable relaxed way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit back, relax, and enjoy the show!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐好﹐放松﹐好好欣赏节目吧！

Sense.DEF: away from a surface, person, or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pulled the bandage back very carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常小心地拉开绷带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was brushed back from her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发往后梳着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman nodded and stood back, allowing Patrick to enter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人点点头﹐退后让帕特里克进去。

Sense.DEF: going in one direction and then in the opposite direction, and repeating this several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: We travel back and forth all the time between Canada and England.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直是在加拿大和英格兰之间来回跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was pacing back and forth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在来回踱步。

Sense.DEF: towards the beginning of a book, tape, document etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn back to the summaries at the end of section 1.5.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回到前面1.5节最后的总结。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wind the tape back to the beginning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把磁带倒回到最前面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clicking on the icon will take you back to the previous web page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点击这个图标可以回到前一网页。

Subsense.DEF: the part of the body between the neck and legs, on the opposite side to the stomach and chest
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The cat arched its back and hissed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只猫拱起背发出嘶嘶的声音。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My feet were sore and my back was aching.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脚酸背痛。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Keep your head up and your back straight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抬起头﹐挺直背。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: To avoid back problems, always bend your knees when you lift heavy objects.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为防止背部出现问题﹐提重物时一定要曲膝。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He lay on his back and gazed at the ceiling.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仰面躺着﹐眼睛盯着天花板。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Johnny was lying flat on his back in the middle of the floor.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 約翰尼正仰面直直地躺在地板中央。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Anna stood with her back to the window.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜背对窗站着。

GramExa.GLOSS: carried on someone’s back
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girl appeared again, now with a little baby on her back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女孩又来了﹐这次背上背了一个小婴孩。

Subsense.DEF: the bones between your neck and the top of your legs
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He broke his back in a motorbike accident.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一次摩托车事故中摔断了脊梁骨。

Sense.DEF: the part of something that is furthest from the front
Sense.EXAMPLE: a T-shirt with a picture of a snake on the back
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后背印了一条蛇的T恤衫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He kissed her on the back of her head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在她后脑勺上亲了一下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her window faced the backs of the houses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的窗户对着这些房屋的后面。

GramExa.GLOSS: used especially about the back of a vehicle
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two men were sitting in the back of the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子坐在汽车的后排。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small shop with an office at the back
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面有一间办公室的小商店

GramExa.GLOSS: in or at the back of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kids should always wear seat belts, even in back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子每次都应该系安全带﹐即使是坐在后排位置。

GramExa.GLOSS: behind a house or other building
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom’s working on the car out back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆在屋后弄汽车。

GramExa.GLOSS: behind a house or building
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you looked round the back?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子后面找过了没有？

Sense.DEF: the less important side or surface of something such as a piece of paper or card
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul scribbled his address on the back of an envelope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗把他的地址草草地写在一个信封的背面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The credits are listed on the back of the album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制作人员名单列在专辑的背面。

Sense.DEF: the part of a seat that you lean against when you are sitting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rested his arm on the back of the sofa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把胳膊搭在沙发的靠背上。

Sense.DEF: the last pages of a book or newspaper

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sports pages are usually at the back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育版通常在最后。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The answers are in the back of the book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 答案列在书后。

Sense.LEXUNIT: at/in the back of your mind
Sense.DEF: a thought that is at the back of your mind is one you try to ignore because you do not want it to be true
Sense.TRAN: 在内心里〔指不希望某个想法是真实的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the back of her mind was the thought that he might be with someone else.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她内心里觉得说不定他是和别的什么人在一起呢。

GramExa.PROPFORM: put/push sth to the back of your mind
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tried to push these uncomfortable thoughts to the back of his mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽量把这些不安的念头抛诸脑后。

Subsense.DEF: with the backs towards each other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Stand back to back and we’ll see who’s tallest.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背靠背站好﹐我们来看看谁个子最高。

Subsense.DEF: happening immediately one after the other
Subsense.TRAN: 一个接一个的﹐连续发生的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a couple of back-to-back wins for the team
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队一场接一场的胜利

Subsense.DEF: in an incorrect position so that what should be at the back is at the front
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got your sweater on back to front.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把毛衣前后穿反了。

Subsense.DEF: doing something the wrong way round and starting with the part that should be at the end
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He got the commands back to front and the program didn’t work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把指令颠倒了﹐程序没有运行。

Sense.DEF: if you do something behind someone’s back, you do it without them knowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t like the idea of the two of them talking about me behind my back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢他们俩在背后议论我。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I should have realized that he’d go behind my back
do something without telling me
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早该想到﹐他会背着我去干的。

Sense.DEF: if something happens when your back is turned, it happens when you are not able to see or know what someone is doing
Sense.TRAN: 在某人转身的时候〔指在看不见或不知道的时候〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are your kids up to when your back is turned?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的孩子在你不知道的时候会搞些什么鬼？

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone
Sense.TRAN: 使某人生气﹐使某人产生反感﹐惹怒某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simone was the kind of person who was always putting people’s backs up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙娜是那种老是惹人生气的人。

Sense.DEF: to stop annoying someone with a lot of questions, criticisms etc, or to make someone stop annoying you in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe the only way to get him off my back is to tell him the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许﹐要他不来烦我﹐唯一的办法就是告诉他实话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do me a favour and get off my back !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳驾﹐别烦我好不好！

Sense.DEF: to be trying to make someone do something they do not want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why are you and Dad always on my back?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和爸爸为什么总是要逼着我干这干那？

Sense.DEF: as a result of something that already exists or something you have already done
Sense.TRAN: 由于某事物〔指已存在的某物或已做成的某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company should be able to generate business on the back of existing contracts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依靠现有的这些合同﹐公司应该能开展业务。

Sense.DEF: using the work of a particular group to achieve something that they will not get any advantage from
Sense.TRAN: 依靠某人〔指依靠从中得不到好处的某一群体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economic prosperity was won on the backs of the urban poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济繁荣靠的是城市里的贫民。

Sense.DEF: a defending player in a sports team
a place that is a long way from other places and is difficult to get to
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a nice little cottage but it really is in the back of beyond.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这小别墅不错﹐不过地方实在偏远。

Subsense.DEF: to be lying on your back – used to emphasize that someone seems unlikely to get up soon
Subsense.TRAN: （直直地）仰卧〔用于强调某人一下子起不来〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was drunk and flat on his back on the street.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝醉了﹐直挺挺地仰卧在街头。

Subsense.DEF: to be so ill that you cannot get out of bed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Their best player was flat on his back in hospital.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的最佳球员在医院里卧病不起。

Subsense.TRAN: 〔生意﹑国家﹑经济等〕不景气﹐疲弱
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The UK market was flat on its back.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国市场疲软。

Sense.DEF: to work extremely hard at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we really put our backs into it, we could finish today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们加把劲﹐今天能干完。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be glad/delighted/pleased etc to see the back of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to be happy that someone is leaving or because you no longer have to deal with something
Sense.TRAN: 很高兴看到某人离开/某事结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, I’m not too upset that he left – in fact, I was glad to see the back of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 才不呢﹐他走了我并不难过——其实我很高兴他走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I can’t wait to see the back of this project, I can tell you
I will be happy when it ends
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐我巴不得这个项目早点结束。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your back to/against the wall
Sense.DEF: to be in a difficult situation with no choice about what to do
Sense.TRAN: 陷入绝境﹐被逼得走投无路

Subsense.DEF: behind you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They had the wind at their backs as they set off.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出发时顺风。

Subsense.DEF: supporting you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Caesar marched into Rome with an army at his back.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯撒在军队的支持下长驱直入罗马。

Sense.DEF: if someone achieves something on their back, they achieve it by having sex with someone
Sense.TRAN: 在床上搞定〔指通过与别人发生性关系而达到目的〕

Sense.DEF: with a high, straight, low etc back
Sense.TRAN: 高背的/直背的/低背的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-backed chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高背椅

Crossrefto.REFLEX: know sth like the back of your hand

Subsense.DEF: to support someone or something, especially by giving them money or using your influence
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The scheme has been backed by several major companies in the region.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划得到了该地区几家大公司的资助。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Some suspected that the rebellion was backed and financed by the US.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人怀疑那次叛乱有美国在背后支持并提供资金。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: government-backed loans
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府担保的贷款

Subsense.DEF: to support an idea by providing facts, proof etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His claims are not backed by any scientific evidence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的说法没有任何科学依据。

Sense.DEF: to move backwards, or make someone or something move backwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She backed into a doorway to let the crowds pass by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她退到门口让人群过去。

GramExa.PROPFORM: back sb into/towards/out of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He began to back her towards the open door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始逼着她朝开着的门退去。

GramExa.PROPFORM: back sth into/towards/out of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I backed the car into the garage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把汽车倒进车库。

Sense.DEF: to put a material or substance onto the back of something, in order to protect it or make it stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Back the photo with cardboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在照片后面垫上硬纸板。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plastic-backed shower curtain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衬有塑料的浴帘

Sense.DEF: to be at the back of something or behind it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Jandia Peninsula is a stretch of white sands backed by a mountain range.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉迪亚半岛是一片依傍山脉的白色沙滩。

Sense.DEF: to play or sing the music that supports the main singer or musician
Sense.EXAMPLE: They performed all their hits, backed by a 40-piece orchestra.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在一支40人乐队的伴奏下﹐演唱了他们所有的热门歌曲。

Sense.DEF: to risk money on whether a particular horse, dog, team etc wins something
to support someone or something that is not successful
to move backwards and away from something, especially because you are frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因害怕而〕躲开﹐向后退﹐退缩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She backed away from the menacing look on his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脸凶相﹐吓得她直往后退。

Sense.DEF: to stop supporting a plan or idea, or stop being involved in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has backed away from its nuclear weapons strategy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已经放弃核武器战略。

Sense.DEF: to admit that you are wrong or that you have lost an argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides have refused to back down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都不肯退让。

Sense.DEF: to move backwards, away from someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She backed off and then turned and ran.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一步一步往后退去﹐然后转身跑了。

Sense.DEF: to stop telling someone what to do, or stop criticizing them, especially so that they can deal with something themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you should back off for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你应该放手一阵子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Back off, Marc! Let me run my own life!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走开点﹐马克！我的生活我自己来安排！

Sense.DEF: to stop supporting something, or decide not to do something you were planning to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jerry backed off when he realized how much work was involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里知道有多大的工作量之后﹐就放弃了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has backed off from investing new money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司已不再投入新的资金。

Sense.DEF: if a building backs onto something, its back faces it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel backs onto St Mark’s Square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆背靠圣马可广场。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to do something that you had promised to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too late to back out now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在反悔已经太晚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After you’ve signed the contract, it will be impossible to back out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 签好合同之后你就不可以变卦了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government is trying to back out of its commitment to reduce pollution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府当初承诺减少污染﹐可现在又想打退堂鼓。

Sense.DEF: to say or show that what someone is saying is true
Sense.TRAN: 证实某人的说法﹐为某人作证﹔证明某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane would back me up if she were here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是简在这儿﹐她可以为我作证。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no evidence to back up his accusations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的指控没有证据支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These theories have not been backed up by research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些理论尚未获得研究证实。

Sense.DEF: to provide support or help for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan’s success depends on how vigorously the UN will back it up with action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划成功与否﹐取决于联合国是否会积极采取行动予以支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police officers are backed up by extra teams of people at the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了周末﹐警察会有增派人员支援。

Sense.DEF: to make a copy of information stored on a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you back up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要做好备份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These devices can back up the whole system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些装置可以为整个系统备份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Back all your files up onto floppy disks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你所有的文档都复制到软盘上去。

Sense.DEF: to make a vehicle move backwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truck stopped and then backed up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车停下来﹐然后倒车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I backed the car up a little.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把汽车往后倒了一点。

Sense.DEF: to move backwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: Back up a bit so that everyone can see.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往后点让大家都能看得见。

Sense.DEF: if traffic backs up, it forms a long line of vehicles that cannot move
Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic was starting to back up in both directions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个方向的车辆都开始排起了长龙。

Sense.DEF: if a toilet, sink etc backs up, it becomes blocked so that water cannot flow out of it
at or in the back of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll be sleeping in the back bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你睡后面的卧室吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn to the back page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翻到背页。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I keep my keys in my back pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把钥匙放在后兜里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was the sound of giggling from the back row.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后排传来咯咯的笑声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rabbit had one of its back legs caught in a trap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兔子有一条后腿被夹子夹住了。

Sense.DEF: behind something, especially a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: the back garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋后花园
Sense.EXAMPLE: We left by the back gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是从后门离开的。

Sense.DEF: from the back
Sense.EXAMPLE: The back view of the hotel was even less appealing than the front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家旅馆从后面看比前面还要难看。

Sense.DEF: a street etc that is away from the main streets
Sense.TRAN: 偏僻的街道/小巷/马路等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short cut down a back lane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从小巷走的一条近路

Sense.DEF: money that someone owes from an earlier date
Sense.TRAN: 拖欠的租金/税款/薪水等

Sense.DEF: a copy of a magazine or newspaper from an earlier date
a back vowel sound is made by lifting your tongue at the back of your mouth
a pain in your back
a backbench Member of Parliament is an ordinary British Member of Parliament who does not have an important official position
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has the support of a lot of backbench MPs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有不少后座议员的支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backbench revolt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次后座议员的反抗

Sense.DEF: an ordinary British Member of Parliament who does not have an important official position
Sense.TRAN: 后座议员﹐普通议员〔指不担任要职的英国议会议员〕

Sense.DEF: the seats in the British parliament where ordinary Members of Parliament sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国议会内的〕后座议员席﹐普通议员席

Sense.DEF: unpleasant or cruel talk about someone who is not present
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this backbiting is destroying company morale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背后的所有这些议论正在摧垮公司的士气。

Sense.DEF:
the board behind the basket in the game of
basketball
the row of connected bones that go down the middle of your back
the most important part of an organization or group of people
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的骨干[主力﹐中坚]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farmers are the backbone of this community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场主是这个团体的中坚力量。

Sense.DEF: courage and determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stuart doesn’t have the backbone to be a good manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特不具备一个优秀管理人员应有的毅力。

Sense.DEF: backbreaking work is physically difficult and makes you very tired
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作〕累死人的﹐吃力的﹐非常繁重的

Sense.DEF: to delay doing something, because it does not need your attention immediately or because it is not as important as other things that you need to do immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allison back-burnered her prestigious law career when she had a baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾莉森生孩子的时候把她那声名显赫的律师事业暂时搁在了一边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project has been backburnered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目已暂缓进行。

Sense.DEF: music that a performer has recorded in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏家在过去录制的〕过往音乐作品（目录）

Sense.DEF: a rude reply to someone who is telling you what to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: None of your backchat – do your homework!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要顶嘴﹐做你的作业！

Sense.DEF:
a
backdrop 3

a
backdrop 2
to comb your hair against the way it grows in order to make it look thicker and shape it into a style
Sense.TRAN: 倒梳﹐反梳（头发）〔使之蓬松〕

Sense.DEF: a country area where few people live
an area, especially in the mountains, away from roads and towns
Sense.TRAN: 〔远离大路和城镇的〕偏远山区

Sense.DEF: to make something have its effect from an earlier date
Sense.TRAN: 追溯到﹐从〔过去某个日期〕开始生效

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pay increase will be backdated to January.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次加薪将追溯至1月份。

Sense.DEF: to write an earlier date on a document or cheque than when it was actually written
Sense.TRAN: 在〔文件或支票〕上倒填日期

Sense.DEF: secret, or not publicly stated as your intention
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backdoor tax rise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗中的增税

Sense.DEF: a door at the back or side of a building

Sense.LEXUNIT: get in through the back door
Sense.DEF: to achieve something by having an unfair secret advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father works there, so he got in through the back door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲在那里做事﹐所以他走了后门。

Sense.DEF:
the
scenery
behind something that you are looking at

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sea made a splendid backdrop to the garden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大海成了花园壮丽的背景。

Sense.DEF: the conditions or situation in which something happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a love story set against a backdrop of war and despair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在战争和绝望背景之下的一个爱情故事

Sense.DEF: a painted cloth hung across the back of a stage
Sense.TRAN: 〔 悬挂在舞台后部的〕背景幕布

Sense.DEF: someone who supports a plan, especially by providing money
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still trying to find backers for the housing development scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还在努力寻找住房开发计划的出资人。

Sense.DEF: if a plan or action backfires, it has the opposite effect to the one you intended
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划或行动〕发生意外﹐产生事与愿违的结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s new policy backfired when a number of employees threatened to quit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的新政策事与愿违﹐有好几名员工威胁说要辞职。

Sense.DEF: if a car backfires, it makes a sudden loud noise because the engine is not working correctly
a new word formed from an older word, for example ‘televise’, which is formed from ‘television’

a game for two players, using flat round pieces and
dice
on a special board
Sense.TRAN: 西洋十五子棋﹐西洋双陆棋〔一种掷骰子决定棋子行进的两人游戏〕

Sense.DEF: someone’s family, education, previous work etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要理解别人﹐理解那些来自不同背景的人﹐这是很重要的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know anything about his background?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

Sense.DEF: the situation or past events that explain why something happens in the way that it does

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Without knowing the background to the case, I couldn’t possibly comment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这案件我不了解背景情况﹐所以无法评论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The peace talks are being held against a background of increasing violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次和平谈判正在暴力冲突愈演愈烈的背景下进行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The author included a new chapter of background material for the second edition of the book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作者为本书第二版新加了一章背景材料。

Sense.DEF: the area that is behind the main thing that you are looking at, especially in a picture
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指图片上主要事物的〕背景﹐后景
Sense.EXAMPLE: The background looks out of focus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背景看上去是模糊的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the background, you can see my college friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在背景中可以看到我的几个大学朋友。

Sense.DEF: the pattern or colour on top of which something has been drawn, printed etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: red lettering on a white background
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白底红字

Sense.DEF: someone who keeps or stays in the background tries not to be noticed
Sense.TRAN: 在不显著的位置﹐在幕后
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president’s advisors are content to remain in the background.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的顾问甘居幕后。

Sense.DEF: the sounds that you can hear apart from the main thing that you are listening to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the background, I could hear the sound of traffic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到背景中有车辆来往的声音。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All of the background noise made it difficult to have a phone conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背景杂音很大﹐电话交谈很困难。

PIC.HEADING: BACKGROUND 背景
PIC.PICCONTENT: foreground 前景；background 背景

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many kids lack a stable family background.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多小孩子缺乏稳定的家庭背景。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Universities aim to attract students from varied social backgrounds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学都力求吸引来自各种各样社会背景的学生。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of his attitudes were due to his cultural background.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的某些态度源自他的文化背景。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We do not discriminate against people because of their ethnic background or gender.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不会因为人们的种族背景或性别而对他们产生歧视。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Smokers often come from poorer socio-economic backgrounds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟民往往来自比较贫困的社会经济背景。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The interviewer will ask you about your educational background and work experience.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试主持人会问你的教育背景和工作经验。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 工人阶级/中产阶级背景
特权阶层的/富裕的家庭背景

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are looking for someone who has a background in science.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在找一个理科背景的人选。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mark and I came from very similar backgrounds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克和我的背景非常相似。

Sense.DEF: a way of hitting the ball in tennis and some other games, in which the back of your hand is turned in the direction of the ball when you hit it

a backhanded remark or
compliment
seems to express praise or admiration but in fact is insulting
a backhanded shot is a backhand shot
a hit or shot that you do using the back of your hand
money that you pay illegally and secretly to get something done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investigators estimate that £35m had been spent on bribes and backhanders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查人员估计有3500万英镑用于行贿。

Sense.DEF: a large digging machine used for making roads etc
support or help, especially with money
Sense.EXAMPLE: She flew to New York to try to raise some financial backing for the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她飞到纽约设法为这个计划募集一些资助。

Sense.DEF: material that is used to make the back of an object
the music that is played at the same time as a singer’s voice
a strong negative reaction by a number of people against recent events, especially against political or social developments
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对政治或社会事件的〕强烈反应﹐反对﹐抵制

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 1970s saw the first backlash against the women’s movement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪70年代首次出现对妇女运动的抵制。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The management fear a backlash from fans over the team’s poor performances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层担心球迷会对球队的拙劣表现作出强烈反应。

Sense.DEF:
a backless dress,
swimsuit
etc does not cover much or any of a woman’s back
a large amount of work that you need to complete, especially work that should already have been completed
Sense.TRAN: 积压未办之事﹐积压的工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a backlog of requests
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 积压的请求

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s going to take us months to clear the backlog .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得花好几个月才能处理完积压未办的事情。

Sense.DEF: the department of a bank or other financial institution that manages or organizes the work of the institution, but that does not deal with customers
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行等金融机构的〕后勤部门﹐后台

Sense.DEF:
a
rucksack
someone who is travelling for pleasure, usually with not very much money, and who walks or uses public transport and carries a backpack
Sense.TRAN: 背包客〔通常指钱不多﹑背着背包徒步或乘坐公共交通工具旅行的人〕

Sense.DEF: the activity of travelling for pleasure, usually without very much money, and carrying a backpack
Sense.TRAN: 背包旅行〔通常指钱不多的人背着背包旅行〕

Sense.DEF: to change your opinion or not do something that you had promised to do
Sense.TRAN: 变卦﹐改变主意﹔出尔反尔
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are backpedalling on the commitment to cut taxes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在违背减税的承诺。

Sense.DEF:
to
pedal
backwards on a bicycle
to run or walk backwards
the part of a chair or seat that supports your back
someone such as an engineer or scientist whose work is important but who does not get much attention or fame
Sense.TRAN: 幕后英雄﹐无名功臣〔指工作很重要但默默无闻的工程师、科学家等〕

Sense.DEF: the act of doing nice things for someone in order to get something in return
a seat at the back of a car, behind where the driver sits

Subsense.DEF: a passenger in the back of a car who gives unwanted advice to the driver about how to drive
Subsense.TRAN: 后座驾驶员〔指坐在后座对司机指手画脚﹑瞎指挥的乘客〕

Subsense.DEF: someone in business or politics who tries to control things that they are not really responsible for
Subsense.TRAN: 〔商业或政治上〕干涉与自己职责无关的事情的人﹐多管闲事的人

Sense.DEF: to accept a less important position than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 退居次要地位﹐退居二线
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally, Bryant decided to take a back seat and let his son run the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐布赖恩特决定退居二线﹐让儿子来管理公司。

Sense.DEF: the part of your body that you sit on
to start doing something or taking action, instead of not doing anything

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be a pain in the backside

Sense.DEF: behaviour in which people praise each other’s achievements more than they deserve
a line(\) used in writing to seperate words, nubers, or letters
to start doing the bad things that you used to do, after having improved your behaviour

a button on a computer
keyboard
or
typewriter
that you press to move backwards towards the beginning of the line
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机键盘或打字机的〕退格键﹐回格键

Sense.DEF: a turning movement in a ball that has been hit so that the top of the ball turns backwards as the ball travels forwards
the act of secretly doing bad things to someone else, especially saying bad things about them, in order to gain an advantage for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 暗箭伤人﹐背后中伤〔以获得好处〕

Sense.DEF: behind the stage in a theatre, especially in the actors’ dressing rooms
Sense.TRAN: （在）后台（的）〔尤指在演员化妆室〕

Sense.DEF: in private, especially within the secret parts of an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: intensive backstage negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密集进行的秘密谈判

Sense.DEF: the things that happened to a character in a book or film before the beginning of the story being told in the book or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或电影中人物的〕背景故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The back story of why she hates her father is a bit too contrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于她为何憎恨自己父亲的这个背景故事编得太牵强。

Sense.DEF: backstreet activities are done in a secret or illegal way, and are often done badly
Sense.TRAN: 秘密的﹐私下的﹐偷偷摸摸的〔通常指处理手法低劣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backstreet abortion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法堕胎

Sense.DEF: a small quiet street that is away from the main part of a town
a way of swimming on your back by moving first one arm then the other backwards while kicking your feet
a rude reply to someone who is telling you what to do
happening one after another
Sense.TRAN: 一个接一个的﹐连续发生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have had five back-to-back wins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一连赢了五次。

Sense.DEF:
a house in a row or
terrace
built with its back touching the back of the next row of houses
to change an opinion or promise that you gave so that it is not as strong as it was earlier

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President is backtracking on his promise to increase health care spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统食言﹐不想增加医疗保健开支了。

Sense.DEF: to return by the same way that you came
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to backtrack about a mile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只得往回走了一英里左右。

Sense.DEF: something that you can use to replace something that does not work or is lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always have a backup plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么时候都要有一个备用计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backup generator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 备用发电机

Sense.DEF: a copy of a computer document, program etc, which is made in case the original becomes lost or damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make a backup of any work you do on the computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在电脑上做的任何工作都要备份。

Sense.DEF: people or things that can be used to provide support and help if they are needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Army units can only operate if they have sufficient backup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队要有足够的后备力量才能作战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backup team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后备小组

Sense.DEF: someone who will play in a sports team if one of the other players is injured or ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backup goalie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 替补守门员

Sense.DEF: looking or facing in the direction that is behind you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went without a backward glance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头也不回地走了。

Sense.DEF: developing slowly and less successfully than most others
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backward country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落后的国家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backward child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟钝的孩子

Sense.DEF: using the methods and ideas of the past rather than modern ones – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 方法落后的﹐思想过时的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darwin transformed a backward-looking organisation into a respected art school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文把一个保守落后的机构变成了一所有名望的艺术学校。

Sense.DEF: in the direction that is behind you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hannah took a step backward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜往后退了一步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pushed me and I fell backwards into the chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她推了我一下﹐我便往后倒在椅子上。

Sense.DEF: towards the beginning or the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Count backwards from 100.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从100倒数。

Sense.DEF: with the back part in front
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your T-shirt is on backwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的T恤衫前后穿反了。

Sense.DEF: towards a worse state
Sense.TRAN: 倒退地﹐退步地﹐每况愈下地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new measures are seen by some as a major step backwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新举措在有些人看来是一个很大的倒退。

Sense.DEF: first in one direction and then in the opposite direction, usually many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kip stumbled backwards and forwards before falling down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基普前后踉跄了几步便摔倒了。

Sense.DEF: to try as hard as possible to help or please someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔指为了帮助或取悦某人〕拼命（做某事）﹐竭尽全力（做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: City officials bent over backwards to help downtown businesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政府官员竭力帮助发展市中心的企业。

Sense.DEF: to know something very well or perfectly
Sense.TRAN: 对某事了如指掌﹐熟知某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She practiced her part until she knew it backwards and forwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她反复练习她的台词和动作﹐直到非常熟练。

Sense.DEF:
a backward flow of water, caused by an
oar
, wave etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔划桨、波浪等引起的〕反流﹐回浪

Sense.DEF: the bad situation that remains after something bad has happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔不好的事情发生后产生的〕余波﹐后果﹐恶果
Sense.EXAMPLE: the backwash of the company’s failure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司倒闭后的余波

Sense.DEF: a very quiet place not influenced by outside events or new ideas – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 与世隔绝的地方﹐闭塞的地方〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rural backwater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个闭塞的乡村地区

Sense.DEF: a part of a river away from the main part, where the water does not move
a distant and undeveloped area away from any towns
someone who lives in the backwoods
a member of a political party or parliament, especially the House of Lords, who is not very active politically and only sometimes votes, attends meetings etc
Sense.TRAN: “蛮荒”党员[议员]（指政治上不太积极的政党成员或议员，他们只是偶尔投票或出席会议，尤指上议院议员〕

Sense.DEF: a small area behind a house, covered with a hard surface
an area of land behind a house, often covered with grass
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old man grew vegetables in his backyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人在屋后院子里种了蔬菜。

Sense.DEF: very near where someone lives, works etc
Sense.TRAN: 在自己的后院﹐在自己的家门口〔指离某人居住﹑工作等的地方很近〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Americans would probably react differently to the war if it was in their own back yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争要是发生在自己的家门口﹐美国人可能就会有不一样的反应。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not want something to happen near where you live
Sense.TRAN: 别在我家门口〔指不希望某事发生在自己住所附近〕

Sense.DEF: salted or smoked meat from the back or sides of a pig, often served in narrow thin pieces
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常切成薄片的〕咸猪肉﹐熏猪肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: bacon and eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咸猪肉煎蛋

GramExa.GLOSS: piece of bacon

Sense.DEF: to provide enough money to support your family
very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease
the scientific study of bacteria
unpleasant or likely to cause problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have some bad news for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有坏消息要告诉你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought things couldn’t possibly get any worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想事情最坏也不过如此了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was delayed for several hours by bad weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气不好﹐飞机延误了好几个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to break bad habits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坏习惯很难改。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bad smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难闻的气味

Sense.DEF: low in quality or below an acceptable standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The failure of the company was due to bad management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司倒闭是因为管理不善。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your handwriting is so bad I can hardly read it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你写的字太差﹐我几乎看不懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was the worst movie I’ve ever seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我看过的最差劲的一部电影。

Sense.DEF: not sensible, or not suitable in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 不好的﹐不明智的﹐不合适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cutting spending at this time is a bad idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时候削减开支不是好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Making big changes in your diet all at once is a bad thing to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食突然大变是不好的。

Sense.DEF: morally wrong or evil
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bad man – keep away from him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个坏人﹐离他远一点。

Sense.DEF: doing something you should not do, or behaving in a wrong way – used especially about children or pets
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指儿童或宠物〕顽皮的﹐表现差的﹐表现不好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katie was very bad today!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯蒂今天很顽皮！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bad cat! Get off the table!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坏猫咪！下去﹐别待在桌子上！

Sense.DEF: serious or severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was in a bad accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遭遇了一场严重的事故。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain in my side is worse than it was yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身体一侧的疼痛比昨天厉害了。

Sense.DEF: a time that is not suitable or causes problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a bad time to have to borrow money, with interest rates so high.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在借款真不是时候﹐利率这么高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve come at the worst possible moment. I have a meeting in five minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来得真不是时候﹐我五分钟后有个会议。

Sense.DEF: damaging or harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pollution is having a bad effect on fish stocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染正在使鱼类数量下降。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoking is bad for your health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟有害健康。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Too much salt can be bad for you .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄入太多的盐对身体不好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is bad for kids to be on their own so much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子总是独处并不好。

Sense.DEF: food that is bad is not safe to eat because it has decayed
Sense.EXAMPLE: bad fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坏掉的鱼
Sense.EXAMPLE: This milk has gone bad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这牛奶变质了。

Sense.DEF: having no skill or ability in a particular activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m really bad at chess.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我国际象棋下得很糟。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They have got to be the worst band on the planet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一定是天底下最糟糕的乐队。

Sense.DEF: a heart, leg etc that is injured or does not work correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been able to do much because of my bad back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我因为背不好一直不能干太多的活。

Sense.DEF: bad language is rude or offensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were shocked to hear the little boy using bad language in front of his mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听见那小男孩在他母亲面前说粗话﹐感到非常震惊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jacky said a bad word!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰基说脏话了！

Sense.DEF: to feel annoyed or angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boss is in a bad mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板情绪不好。

Subsense.DEF: to feel ashamed or sorry about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt bad about not being able to come last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨天晚上没能来﹐心里很愧疚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel bad for Ann – she studied so hard for that test and she still didn’t pass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为安感到遗憾——那次测验她已经很用功了﹐可还是没有通过。

Subsense.DEF: to feel ill

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is good, or better than you expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How are you?’ ‘Oh, not bad.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你好吗？”“哦﹐还不错。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s not a bad idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个主意不错。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not as bad as expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exams weren’t so bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试并不是太差。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not care that something bad happens to someone
Subsense.TRAN: 算你倒霉〔表示并不关心某人碰到了不好的事情〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m going to be late now!’ ‘Too bad – you should have gotten up earlier.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要迟到了！”“活该﹐你应该早点起床的。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you are sorry that something bad has happened to someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s too bad that you couldn’t come to the party last night.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你昨晚没能来参加聚会﹐真遗憾。

Sense.DEF: to become even more unpleasant or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: The schools have gone from bad to worse in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区的学校越来越差了。

Sense.DEF: to be very ill, unhappy, or injured, or not in a good condition
Sense.TRAN: 病情严重﹔不高兴﹔受伤﹔处于困境
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in a bad way after the funeral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葬礼之后﹐她非常难受。

Sense.DEF: if something has a bad name, people do not respect or trust it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bar had a bad name and was avoided by all the locals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个酒吧名声不好﹐当地人都不愿意去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These annoying tourists give all Americans a bad name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些讨厌的游客给所有的美国人脸上抹黑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is morally bad or cannot be trusted
someone or something that causes trouble and is difficult to avoid
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌又避不开的人[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Sure enough, Steve turned up like the proverbial bad penny
suddenly appeared
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫果然来了﹐就像俗话中说的讨债鬼一样。

Sense.DEF: to become ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was taken bad in the middle of the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他半夜里发病了。

Sense.DEF: if someone does something in bad faith, they are behaving dishonestly and have no intention of keeping a promise
Sense.TRAN: 存心不良地﹐背信弃义地
Sense.EXAMPLE: In order to sue, you have to prove that the company was acting in bad faith .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要打官司﹐你必须证明这家公司有欺诈行为。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that always causes trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d avoid her if I were you. She’s bad news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我就躲着她﹐她总是给人惹麻烦。

Sense.DEF: socially unacceptable behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s bad form to argue with the umpire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟裁判员争辩是一种无礼的行为。

Sense.DEF: angry or bitter feelings between people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s too much bad blood between them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间的仇恨太深。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have a bad word to say about/against sb
Sense.DEF: if no one has a bad word to say about a particular person, everyone likes and respects that person
Sense.TRAN: 如果没有人说某人一句不好﹐那某人口碑很好

Sense.DEF: used to say that you already have one problem, so that you do not want to worry about or deal with another one
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s bad enough having to bring up three kids on your own, without having to worry about money as well!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就算不需要担心钱的问题﹐单是一个人抚养三个孩子也是够你受的！

Sense.DEF: used to persuade someone that something is good or worth doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: You only pay £10 deposit and no interest – that can’t be bad, can it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只要付十英镑的保证金﹐又不用付利息﹐那可真不错﹐对吧？

Subsense.DEF: used when you think something is very good
Subsense.TRAN: 非常好的﹐很棒的﹐顶呱呱的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now that’s a bad car!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇﹐真是辆好车！

Subsense.DEF: someone who is bad is very determined and does not always obey rules – used to show approval

Exponent.DEF: not good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bad idea
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 坏主意
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His behaviour is getting worse.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他行为越来越糟了。

Exponent.DEF: not as good as it could be or should be
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A poor diet can lead to ill health.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食不良会导致健康欠佳。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his poor performance at school
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在学校的糟糕表现

Exponent.DEF: not good – often used instead of saying directly that something was ‘bad’, especially when you were disappointed by it
Exponent.TRAN: 不怎么好﹐一般〔委婉说法﹐尤用于表示失望的时候〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film wasn’t very good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影很一般。

Exponent.DEF: not as good as you hoped or expected
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her exam results were disappointing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的考试成绩令人失望。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a disappointing start to the campaign
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场让人失望的运动开场

Exponent.DEF: bad – used when talking about the bad result or effect of something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某事的结果或影响〕不良的﹐负面的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the publicity had a negative impact on sales.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些推广宣传对销售产生了负面影响。

Exponent.DEF: bad and not wanted
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The policy had some undesirable consequences.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一政策造成了一些不良后果。

Exponent.DEF: unfavourable conditions are not good for doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boat race was cancelled because of unfavourable weather.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 划船比赛因天气不好被取消了。

Exponent.DEF: very bad
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The movie was awful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影糟透了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her house is in a terrible state.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的房子状况极差。

Exponent.DEF: very bad, especially in a way that shocks or upsets you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He describes prison as ‘a horrible place’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他形容监狱是“一个可怕的地方”。

Exponent.DEF: smelling or tasting very bad
Exponent.TRAN: 〔气味或味道〕极糟的﹐令人恶心的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The food was disgusting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物非常糟糕。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fish smelled disgusting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这鱼闻上去很恶心。

Exponent.DEF: very bad or disappointing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The weather has been lousy all week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个星期天气都很糟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m fed up with this lousy job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这份讨厌的工作已经受够了。

Exponent.DEF: very bad
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a ghastly day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我倒霉透了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a ghastly mistake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的错误

Exponent.DEF: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad and serious
Exponent.TRAN: 〔问题﹑伤势﹑病情等〕严重的﹐恶劣的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The country faces severe economic problems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国面临严重的经济问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: severe delays
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大的延误

Exponent.DEF: extremely bad in a way that is shocking
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her behaviour has been absolutely atrocious.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的行为极其恶劣。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The country has an appalling human rights record.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的人权记录令人发指。

Exponent.DEF: very bad and of a very low standard
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The team’s performance was abysmal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队的表现一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF: if you are a particular amount to the bad, you are that much poorer or you owe that much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks to your mistake, I’m £500 to the bad!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于你的失误﹐我损失了500英镑！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have made a mistake or that something is your fault
to begin living in a wrong or immoral way
a word used to mean ‘badly’ that many people think is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 很﹐非常〔很多人认为此用法是错的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need that money bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我急需那笔钱。

Sense.DEF: very good or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: bad-ass biker gear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一流的摩托车手装备

Sense.DEF: a bad-ass person is very determined and does not always obey rules – used to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson plays this bad-ass cop named O'Riley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊扮演这位名叫奥里利的倔强警察。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
cholesterol
chemical substance found in your blood
that can gradually turn into a hard substance that can stop your blood flowing properly and can eventually cause heart disease
a debt that is unlikely to be paid
someone who is bad, especially in a book or film

the past tense of
bid
a small piece of metal, cloth, or plastic with a picture or words on it, worn to show rank, membership of a group, support for a political idea etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔戴在身上显示职衔﹑组织身份﹑支持某一政治思想等的〕徽章﹐标记
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were each handed a badge with our name on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都拿到一个徽章﹐上面有我们的名字。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of metal or plastic that you carry to show people that you work for a particular organization, for example that you are a police officer
Sense.TRAN: 〔随身携带显示所属机构的〕徽章﹐证章﹐徽牌

Sense.DEF: something that shows that you have a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: He now sees his wartime injuries as a badge of honor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在﹐他把自己在战争中受的伤看成是一种光荣标记。

Sense.DEF:
a small piece of cloth with a picture on it, given to
scout s
,
guide s
etc to show what skills they have learned
Sense.TRAN: 〔发给童子军等表示学会某些技能的〕布制徽章
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve won a photography badge in the Boy Scouts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫在童子军里获得了一枚摄影奖章。

Sense.DEF: an object which shows that you have an official position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mayors wear chains around their necks as badges of office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长在脖子上佩戴象征职位的链徽。

Sense.DEF: an animal that has black and white fur, lives in holes in the ground, and is active at night
to try to persuade someone by asking them something several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: She badgered me for weeks until I finally gave in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她缠了我好几个星期﹐直到我最终答应了她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My friends keep badgering me to get a cell phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那些朋友老是催着我去买手机。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to badger the kids into doing their homework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得不断催促孩子们做家庭作业。

Sense.DEF: a man in a film, book etc who is evil or dangerous
a day when you are unhappy and easily upset, especially because your hair does not look the way you want it to look
Sense.TRAN: 心情不好的一天〔尤因为这一天头发梳得不合心意〕

Sense.DEF: conversation that involves a lot of jokes or humour
in an unsatisfactory or unsuccessful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has been very badly managed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的管理非常差。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The novel was translated badly into English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部小说被拙劣地翻成了英语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: badly made furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做工粗糙的家具
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rob did very badly in the History exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布的历史考得很差。

Sense.DEF: to a great or serious degree
Sense.TRAN: 大大地﹐非常﹔严重地﹐厉害地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been limping badly ever since the skiing accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了那次滑雪事故以后﹐他的腿跛得很厉害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We badly wanted to help, but there was nothing we could do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很想帮忙﹐可又无计可施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was beaten so badly that his brother didn’t recognize him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被打得连他哥哥都认不出他了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The school is badly in need of
very much needs
some new computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校急需一些新电脑。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Things started to go badly wrong
go wrong in a serious way
for Eric after he lost his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克失去工作以后﹐一切都很不如意。

Sense.DEF: to have a bad opinion of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事有负面的看法[意见]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure they won’t think badly of you if you tell them you need some help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定﹐你要是跟他们说需要帮忙﹐他们不会对你有什么不好的看法。

Sense.DEF: not having much money
not having enough of something that you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school is rather badly off for equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校相当缺乏设备。

Sense.DEF:
a game that is similar to tennis but played with a
shuttlecock
small feathered object
instead of a ball
to criticize someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her former colleagues accused her of bad-mouthing them in public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以前的同事指责她在公开场合说他们的坏话。

Sense.DEF: someone who is bad-tempered becomes easily annoyed and talks in an angry way to people
Sense.TRAN: 脾气不好的﹐易躁易怒的

Sense.DEF: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question baffled me completely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有人都困惑至极。

Sense.DEF: a board, sheet of metal etc that controls the flow of air, water, or sound into or out of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔控制空气﹑水流或声音进出的〕隔板﹔折流板﹔隔音板

Sense.DEF: a prize given each year by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts for the best films, television programmes, actors etc
Sense.TRAN: 英国电影和电视艺术学院奖
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her film won two BAFTAs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的影片获得两项英国影视艺术学院奖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the BAFTA award ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国影视艺术学院奖颁奖典礼

Subsense.DEF: a container made of paper, cloth, or thin plastic, that usually opens at the top
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a paper bag
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸袋
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a plastic bag
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料袋
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a garbage bag
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾袋

Subsense.DEF:
a
handbag
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t leave your bag in the car.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要把手提包留在汽车里。

Subsense.DEF: a large bag that you use to carry your clothes etc when you are travelling
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just throw your bags in the back of the car.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的行李放在车后部好了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a garment bag
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放衣服的旅行袋

Sense.DEF: the amount that a bag will hold

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bag of popcorn
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一袋爆玉米花

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for an old woman
Sense.TRAN: 老东西﹐老太婆〔侮辱性用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You silly old bag!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这愚蠢的老东西！

Sense.DEF: a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got bags of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有的是钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No need to rush – we’ve got bags of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用急﹐我们还有很多时间。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place where you have been living, usually after an argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常在争吵之后〕收拾行李离开
Sense.EXAMPLE: We told her to pack her bags at once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们叫她立刻收拾东西走人。

Sense.DEF: dark circles or loose skin under your eyes, usually because of old age or being tired
a person or animal who is too thin
Sense.TRAN: 瘦骨嶙峋的人[动物]﹐皮包骨

Sense.DEF: certain to be won or achieved
Sense.TRAN: 囊中之物﹔十拿九稳﹐稳操胜券
Sense.EXAMPLE: The governor’s advisors believe the election is in the bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长的顾问认为这次选举已经胜券在握。

Sense.DEF: loose-fitting trousers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oxford bags
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛津裤

Sense.DEF: something that someone is not very interested in or not very good at
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks, but dancing is not really my bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐可跳舞我实在不行。

Sense.DEF: with all your possessions
Sense.EXAMPLE: They threw her out of the house, bag and baggage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把她连人带东西全都撵出了房子。

Sense.DEF: the number of birds or animals that someone kills when they go hunting
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a good bag that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天我们猎获甚丰。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: let the cat out of the bag

PIC.HEADING: BAGS 袋﹔包
PIC.PICCONTENT: bin liner BrE【英】/garbage bag AmE【美】垃圾袋；label 标签；ribbon 丝带；gift bag 礼品袋；shopping bag BrE【英】/grocery bag AmE【美】购物袋；money belt 腰包；strap 带子；satchel 小背包；holdall BrE【英】/carryall AmE【美】大旅行袋；handle 提手；handbag BrE【英】/purse AmE【美】(女用)手提包；toilet bag BrE【英】/toiletry bag AmE【美】(旅行)盥洗包；backpack/rucksack BrE【英】背包；sack 大口袋；briefcase 公文包；cord 细绳；laundry bag 洗衣袋；handle 提手；label 标签；suitcase 手提箱

Sense.DEF: to put things into bags
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got a job bagging groceries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他找到一份工作﹐负责把杂货装袋。

Sense.DEF: to manage to get something that a lot of people want
Sense.TRAN: 占有﹐抢占〔许多人都想要的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to bag a couple of seats at the front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想办法抢几个前面的座位。

Sense.DEF:
to score a
goal
or a point in sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: Larsson bagged his thirtieth goal of the season in Celtic’s win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔森在凯尔特人队获胜的那场比赛中射入他本赛季第30粒进球。

Sense.DEF: to kill or catch an animal or bird
Sense.EXAMPLE: We bagged a rabbit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们抓到一只兔子。

Sense.DEF: if prisoners are bagged and zip-tied, bags are put over their heads and their hands are tied together
to put things into bags
Sense.EXAMPLE: We bagged up the money before we closed the shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把钱装进袋子﹐然后关上店门。

Sense.DEF: a small ring-shaped type of bread
the amount a bag can hold
the cases, bags, boxes etc carried by someone who is travelling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check your baggage in at the desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在服务台托运行李。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Baggage is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it
F2NBox.TRAN: baggage是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐它后面要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What happens if my baggage is lost?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我的行李丢失了怎么办？
F2NBox.EXPL: You can refer to one or more pieces/items of baggage.
F2NBox.TRAN: 一件或几件行李可以说 piece(s)/item(s) of baggage。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say bags rather than baggage
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说bags﹐而不说 baggage
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Shall I help you take your bags upstairs?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来帮你把行李拿到楼上去吧？

Sense.DEF: the beliefs, opinions, and experiences that someone has, which make them think in a particular way, especially in a way that makes it difficult to have good relationships
Sense.TRAN: 先入之见﹐条条框框﹐固有看法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each employee brings his or her own psychological baggage to the workplace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个职员都会把自己固有的思维模式带入工作当中。

Sense.DEF: the part of a train where boxes, bags etc are carried
the place at an airport where you collect your cases and bags after a flight
a place, usually in a station, where you can leave your bags and collect them later
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常指车站里的〕行李寄存处

Sense.DEF: baggy clothes are big and do not fit tightly on your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing jeans and a baggy T-shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一条牛仔裤和一件宽松的T恤衫。

Sense.DEF: an impolite word for a homeless woman who lives on the streets and carries all her possessions with her
Sense.TRAN: 携带行李露宿街头的女人﹐流浪女〔不礼貌用语〕

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument played especially in Scotland, in which air blown into a bag is forced out through pipes to produce a sound

a long thin
loaf
of bread, made especially in France
used to show disapproval of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bah! That’s stupid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呸！ 真蠢！

Sense.DEF:
money left with a court of law to make sure that a prisoner will return when their
trial
starts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carpenter is free on bail while he appeals his conviction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡彭特取保获释﹐同时对判决提出上诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was murdered by a man who was out on bail for rape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被一名犯强奸罪获保在外的男子杀害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The three men were released on bail pending an appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这三名男子获准保释等候上诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is not likely to be granted bail .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不大可能获保释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carter has been refused bail and will remain in custody.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特已经被拒绝保释﹐继续拘押。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge ordered that Jones be held without bail .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官下令琼斯不得保释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why can’t you ask your father to put up bail for you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不能叫你父亲帮你交保释金？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of the defendants jumped bail and fled to New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名被告弃保潜逃到了纽约。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bail was set at $30,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保释金定为三万美元。

Sense.DEF:
one of the two small pieces of wood laid on top of the
stump s
in a game of
cricket
to escape from a situation that you do not want to be in any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: After ten years in the business, McArthur is baling out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做了十年的生意﹐麦克阿瑟现在不想干了。

Sense.DEF:
if someone is bailed, they are let out of prison to wait for their
trial
after they have left a sum of money with the court
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dakers was bailed to appear at Durham Crown Court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴克斯取保候审﹐将在达勒姆刑事法庭出庭。

Sense.DEF: to do something to help someone out of trouble, especially financial problems
Sense.TRAN: 帮助…摆脱困境〔尤指解决经济问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some local businesses have offered to bail out the museum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地一些企业表示愿意帮助博物馆渡过难关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sutton bailed his team out with a goal in the last minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨顿在最后一分钟进球﹐拯救了他的球队。

Sense.DEF:
to leave a large sum of money with a court so that someone can be let out of prison while waiting for their
trial
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clarke’s family paid £500 to bail him out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉克的家人交了500英镑保释他出来。

Sense.DEF:
to escape from a plane, using a
parachute
to remove water that has come into a boat
Sense.TRAN: 从〔船〕中舀出水﹐舀出〔船中的水〕

Sense.DEF: an open area inside the outer wall of a castle
Sense.TRAN: 城堡内之庭院﹐城堡外庭

Sense.DEF: someone who looks after a farm or land that belongs to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 农场管理人﹔农场主[地主]的管家

Sense.DEF: an official of the legal system who watches prisoners and keeps order in a court of law
an official of the legal system who can take people’s goods or property when they owe money
Sense.TRAN: 〔查封欠债人财产的〕查封官﹐执达吏

Sense.DEF: financial help given to a person or a company that is in difficulty
a pan that floats in a larger pan full of water, used for cooking things gently
a baby or child – used in Scotland
food used to attract fish, animals, or birds so that you can catch them
Sense.EXAMPLE: We used worms as bait.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用小虫子作诱饵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fish wouldn’t take the bait .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼儿不上钩。

Sense.DEF: something attractive that is offered to someone to make them do something or buy something, especially when this is done in a dishonest way that tricks people
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Plenty of people took the bait
accepted what was on offer
and lost their life savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多人受骗上当﹐一生的积蓄都没了。

Sense.DEF: to become angry when someone is deliberately trying to make you angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Senator O'Brien just smiled, refusing to rise to the bait.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥布赖恩参议员只是笑了笑﹐没有中计发火。

Sense.DEF: to put bait on a hook to catch fish or in a trap to catch animals
Sense.TRAN: 在〔鱼钩或捕兽器〕上装饵

Sense.DEF: to deliberately try to make someone angry by criticizing them, using rude names etc
the activity of attacking a wild animal with dogs

thick cloth that is usually green, and is used to cover tables on which games such as
pool
are played
Sense.TRAN: 桌面呢﹐台面呢〔多为绿色﹐用来铺于落袋台球桌等桌面上〕

Sense.DEF:
to cook something using dry heat, in an
oven
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m baking some bread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在烤一些面包。
Sense.EXAMPLE: baked potatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤马铃薯
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bake at 250 degrees for 20 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用250度的温度烤20分钟。

Sense.DEF: to make something become hard by heating it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bricks were baked in the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砖块放在太阳光下晒硬。

Sense.DEF: small white beans cooked in a sauce made from tomatoes, usually sold in cans
Sense.TRAN: 〔加番茄酱的〕烘豆〔通常以罐装出售〕

Sense.DEF: a hard plastic used especially in the 1930s and 1940s to make things such as telephones and radios
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在20世纪30和40年代用于制造电话和收音机的〕酚醛树脂﹐酚醛电木[胶木]

Sense.DEF: someone who bakes bread and cakes, especially in order to sell them in a shop
a shop that makes and sells bread and cakes
thirteen of something
a place where bread and cakes are baked, or a shop where they are sold
Sense.TRAN: 面包[糕饼]烘房﹔面包[糕饼]店

Sense.DEF: the activity of making cakes, bread etc
used to say that a person or place is very hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m baking!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我快烤熟了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baking hot day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酷热的一天

Sense.DEF: a powder used when baking cakes to make them lighter
a baking tray
a powder used when baking cakes to make them lighter
a flat piece of metal that you bake food on

money that people in the Middle East give to poor people, to someone who has helped them, or as a
bribe
Sense.TRAN: 〔中东地区的〕施舍﹔小费﹐赏钱﹔贿赂

Sense.DEF: a warm hat made of wool, that covers your head and most of your face
Sense.TRAN: 巴拉克拉瓦盔式帽，盔式大绒帽〔遮住头部和大部分脸部的羊毛帽〕

Sense.DEF:
a musical instrument like a
guitar
, with a body shaped like a
triangle
and three strings, played especially in Russia
Sense.TRAN: 巴拉莱卡琴﹐三角琴〔形似吉他的俄罗斯弦乐器〕

Sense.DEF: a state in which all your weight is evenly spread so that you do not fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: I lost my balance and fell on my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我失去平衡﹐脸着地摔倒了。

Sense.DEF: a state in which opposite forces or influences exist in equal or the correct amounts, in a way that is good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to keep a balance between work and play.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量保持工作和娱乐的平衡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pesticides seriously upset the balance of nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农药严重破坏了自然界的平衡。

Sense.DEF: if you think something on balance, you think it after considering all the facts
Sense.TRAN: 全面考虑之后﹐权衡利弊﹐总的说来
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think on balance I prefer the old system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的说来﹐我更喜欢旧的那套制度。

Sense.DEF: to surprise someone and make them confused and no longer calm
Sense.TRAN: 使某人乱了方寸﹐使某人慌了手脚
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question caught him off balance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题使他不知所措。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that you have in your bank account
Sense.EXAMPLE: My bank balance isn’t good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的银行账户里余额不多了。

Sense.DEF: the balance of a debt is the amount of money that you still owe after you have paid some of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The balance is due at the end of the month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 余款要在月底支付。

Sense.DEF: the amount of something that remains after some has been used, spent, mentioned etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm owns about 96% of the portfolio, with the balance belonging to our family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资产组合中﹐公司拥有96%左右的股份﹐剩余部分为我们家族所有。

Sense.DEF: if the future or success of something hangs in the balance, you cannot yet know whether the result will be bad or good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meanwhile, the fate of the refugees continues to hang in the balance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与此同时﹐难民的命运仍然悬而未决。

Sense.DEF: to influence the result of an event
Sense.TRAN: 影响某事的结果，使结果倾向某方
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dignity and courage shown by the President may tip the balance in his party’s favour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统所表现出来的尊严和勇气可能对他的政党有利。

Sense.DEF: an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar
when someone’s mind is healthy and their emotional state is normal
Sense.TRAN: 心境的平稳﹐正常的神志
Sense.EXAMPLE: The death of her friend had disturbed the balance of her mind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋友的死使她心神不宁。

Sense.DEF: the most likely answer or result produced by opposing information, reasons etc
Sense.TRAN: 权衡各种证据/可能性等后得出的结论

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meaning 义项 1

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stay steady
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sea was so rough that it was hard to keep your balance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 海上波涛汹涌﹐很难保持身体平衡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become unsteady
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She nearly lost her balance as the bus suddenly moved forward.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车突然向前移动﹐她差一点失去平衡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become steady again
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He held onto Carrie until he regained his balance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拉住卡丽直至重新站稳。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 把某人打得/推得失去平衡
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The blow was hard enough to knock him off balance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一拳力量很大﹐足以使他失去平衡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A good sense of balance is always useful when you are sailing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的平衡感在驾驶帆船时总是很有用的。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meaning 义项 2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed in getting the right balance
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is necessary to strike a balance between the needs of employers and employees.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有必要在劳资双方的需求之间达成某种平衡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Try to keep a balance between your spending and your earnings.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要设法在支出和收入间保持平衡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it less equal or correct
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The move could upset the delicate balance of power in the Middle East.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一行动会破坏中东脆弱的均势。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Will this alter the balance of power in the EU?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会改变欧盟内部的权力平衡吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it equal or correct again
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What can be done to redress the balance in favour of women?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎样才能改变局面﹐对女性更公平？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You should eat a good balance of carbohydrates and protein.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该摄入适当比例的碳水化合物和蛋白质。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: easily damaged
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Too much carbon dioxide in the atmosphere upsets the delicate balance of gases.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大气中二氧化碳含量过高会破坏各种气体的微妙平衡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: With sport, you have to find the right balance between competition and fun.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于体育比赛﹐你需要在竞争和乐趣之间找到平衡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Chemicals will upset the natural balance of the pond.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学物质会破坏这池塘内的自然平衡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the European balance of power
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的均势

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Nothing can justify permanent damage to the balance of nature.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何理由都不能成为永久破坏大自然平衡的借口。

Sense.DEF: to be in or get into a steady position, without falling to one side or the other, or to put something into this position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was balancing a plate of food on her knees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把一盘食物稳稳地放在膝上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned around, balancing awkwardly on one foot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转过身去﹐笨拙地单腿站立着。

Sense.DEF: to be equal in importance, amount, value, or effect to something that has the opposite effect
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔重要性﹑数量﹑价值或影响〕均衡﹐相抵﹐相等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Job losses in manufacturing were balanced by job increases in the service sector.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造业职位减少了﹐而服务行业就业机会却增加了﹐正好相抵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: just enough sugar to balance the acidity of the fruit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正好可中和水果酸味的适量的糖

Sense.DEF: to consider the importance of one thing in relation to something else when you are making a decision

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The courts must balance our liberty against the security of the nation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭必须在我们的自由和国家安全之间作出权衡。

Sense.DEF: if a government balances the budget, they make the amount of money that they spend equal to the amount of money available
to show that the amount of money a business has received is equal to the amount spent
if two or more things balance out, the final result is that they are equal in amount, importance, or effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I look after the kids and sometimes John does – it all balances out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我看孩子﹐有时候约翰看孩子——两个人差不多。

Sense.DEF:
a long narrow wooden board on which a
gymnast
performs
giving equal attention to all sides or opinions
Sense.TRAN: 客观公正的﹐不偏不倚的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a balanced account of what happened
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于所发生之事的客观描述

Sense.EXAMPLE: balanced reporting of the election campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对竞选活动的公正报道
