Sense.DEF: arranged to include things or people of different kinds in the right amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a balanced programme of events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 均衡的活动安排
Sense.EXAMPLE:
the importance of a balanced diet
one that is healthy because it contains the right foods in the right amounts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食均衡的重要性
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nature is perfectly balanced .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大自然是非常平衡的。

GramExa.GLOSS: very carefully balanced
GramExa.EXAMPLE: soup with a delicately balanced flavor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 味道恰到好处的汤

Sense.DEF: someone who is balanced is calm and sensible, and has good mental health
when a government is not spending more money than it has available
the difference between what a country spends in order to buy goods and services abroad, and the money it earns selling goods and services abroad
Sense.TRAN: 国际收支差额﹐国际收支平衡

Sense.DEF: a situation in which political or military strength is shared evenly
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治或军事上的〕权力平衡﹐势力均衡﹐均势
Sense.EXAMPLE: The election of so many Republicans to Congress has changed the balance of power in Washington.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么多共和党成员入选国会改变了华盛顿的均势。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
A small centre party holds the balance of power
is able to make either side more powerful than the other by supporting them
in the Assembly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小的中间党派决定着议会里的势力均衡。

Sense.DEF: the difference in value between the goods a country buys from abroad and the goods it sells abroad
a statement of how much money a business has earned and how much money it has paid for goods and services
Sense.TRAN: 资产负债表﹐决算表〔显示收支总差额的报告表〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy balance sheet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良性的资产负债表﹔稳健的资产负债结构

Sense.DEF: when you are trying to please two or more people or groups who all want different things, or who have ideas that are completely different from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gilmore had to perform the difficult balancing act of attracting moderate voters without losing his Conservative base.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔摩不得不艰难地两面讨好﹐既要吸引温和派的选民﹐又不能失去他在保守党里的支持基础。

Sense.DEF: a structure that you can stand on, that is attached to the outside wall of a building, above ground level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has your flat got a balcony?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的公寓有阳台吗？

Sense.DEF: the seats upstairs at a theatre
having little or no hair on your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bald man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名秃顶男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: his shiny bald head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那亮闪闪的光头
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad started going bald when he was in his thirties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸在三十多岁的时候开始谢顶。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He combed his hair and tried to hide his bald patch
part of someone’s head where there is no hair
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他梳了梳头﹐试图把头顶的秃块遮掩起来。

Sense.DEF: not having enough of what usually covers something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s tires are completely bald.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车的轮胎已经彻底磨平了。

Sense.DEF: a statement etc that is correct but gives no additional information to help you understand or accept what is said
Sense.TRAN: 不加修饰[直话直说]的声明/事实/道理
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bald truth was that Lori didn’t love her husband anymore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实很简单﹐洛丽不再爱她的丈夫了。

Sense.DEF: a large North American bird with a white head and neck that is the national bird of the US
Sense.TRAN: 白头海雕﹐白头鹫﹐秃鹰〔产于北美﹐为美国国鸟〕

Sense.DEF: talk or writing that is silly nonsense
making no attempt to hide the fact that you know you are saying or doing something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bald-faced lie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无耻的谎言

Sense.DEF: a balding man is losing the hair on his head
Sense.EXAMPLE: a balding man in his mid-thirties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个开始谢顶的三十五六岁的男人

Sense.DEF: in a way that is true but makes no attempt to be polite
Sense.TRAN: 直言不讳地﹐直截了当地﹐赤裸裸地
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m not coming,’ Rosa said baldly next morning at breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不去。”第二天早上吃早餐的时候﹐罗莎直截了当地说。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is
bald
– used humorously

a large quantity of something such as paper or
hay
that is tightly tied together especially into a block
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bale of straw
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大捆稻草

Sense.DEF:
to tie something such as paper or
hay
into a large block
Sense.TRAN: 把〔纸﹑干草等〕绑成一大捆

Sense.DEF: expressing anger, hatred, or a wish to harm someone
Sense.TRAN: 邪恶的﹐恶毒的﹐带威胁性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baleful look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶狠狠的目光

Sense.DEF: to not want to do or try something, because it seems difficult, unpleasant, or frightening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people would balk at setting up a new business during a recession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济衰退的时候﹐许多人都不愿开新公司。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Westerners balk at the prospect of snake on the menu.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到菜单上可能有蛇肉菜肴﹐西方人就会犹豫回避。

Sense.DEF: if a horse balks at a fence, it stops in front of it and refuses to jump over it
Sense.TRAN: 〔马在障碍物前〕突然止步﹐拒绝跳跃

Sense.DEF: in baseball, to stop in the middle of the action of throwing the ball to the player who is trying to hit it
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球投手在投球时〕做假动作﹐佯投

Sense.DEF: to stop someone or something from getting or achieving what they want
the practice of dividing a country into seperate independent states-used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 巴尔干化〔指把一个国家分裂成几个独立的小国﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is balky does not do what they are expected to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: a balky air-conditioning system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不听使唤的空调系统

Sense.DEF: a round object that is thrown, kicked, or hit in a game or sport

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Weiskopf hit the ball 330 yards and a cheer went up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦斯科夫把球击出330码﹐人群欢呼起来。

Sense.DEF: something formed or rolled into a round shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ball of string
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 线团
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shape the dough into balls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面团搓成丸子。

Sense.DEF:
any game or sport played with a ball, especially baseball or
basketball
Sense.TRAN: 球类运动〔尤指棒球或篮球〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: D'you want to go out and play ball ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想出去打球吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad likes college ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸喜欢看大学生球赛。

Sense.DEF: the rounded part of the foot at the base of the toes, or the rounded part of the hand at the base of the thumb
able to think or act quickly and intelligently
Sense.EXAMPLE: an assistant who’s really on the ball
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名非常机灵的助手

Sense.DEF: to start something happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: To start the ball rolling, the government was asked to contribute £1 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府被要求出资100万英镑作为启动经费。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the ball is in sb’s court
Sense.DEF: it is their turn to take action or to reply
Sense.TRAN: 现在轮到某人〔采取行动或回答〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve emailed him – now the ball’s in his court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我写过电子邮件给他了——现在要看他的了。

Sense.DEF: a large formal occasion at which people dance
to have a very good time

Subsense.DEF: courage
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have the balls to ask.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有胆量问。

Subsense.DEF: something that is stupid or wrong
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s a load of balls!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那简直是放屁！

Sense.DEF: a ball that is thrown, hit, or kicked fast etc in a game or sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hit a long ball to right field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他往右场击出一记长球。

Sense.DEF:
a ball that is thrown too high, low etc towards someone trying to hit it, in the game of
cricket
or
rounder s
a ball that the hitter does not try to hit, because it is not within the correct area
the whole thing
someone who has a lot of energy and enthusiasm
Sense.TRAN: 精力充沛的人﹐生龙活虎的人

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep several/too many etc balls in the air
Sense.DEF: to struggle to deal with more than one problem or job at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 同时应付许多问题[工作]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company just won’t be able to keep that many balls in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同时出现那么多的问题﹐公司根本招架不住。

Variant.LEXVAR: take your eye off the ball

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake when dealing with something because you stop thinking carefully or paying attention

Subsense.DEF: a problem that is very difficult to deal with
an offensive word for a woman who uses her authority over men
Subsense.TRAN: 泼妇﹐悍妇〔冒犯用语﹐指对男人发号施令的女人〕

Sense.DEF: to make something form a small round shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ray balled up his fists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷握起拳头。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with a woman
a slow love song
a short story in the form of a poem or song
something that limits your freedom and stops you from doing what you want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lower-tech side of the business was seen as a ball and chain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落后的技术被视为企业发展的羁绊。

Sense.DEF: a heavy metal ball on a chain, tied to a prisoner’s legs, to stop the prisoner from escaping
Sense.TRAN: 球镣〔囚犯脚上系有铁球的脚链〕

Sense.DEF: heavy material that is carried by a ship to make it more steady in the water

material such as sand that is carried in a
balloon
so that it can be thrown out to make it rise
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于控制热气球高度的〕沙囊﹐压载物

Sense.DEF: a layer of broken stones that a road or railway line is built on
Sense.TRAN: 〔道路或铁路铺路基用的〕道砟﹐石碴

Sense.DEF: small metal balls that move in a ring, to make a part inside a machine turn more easily
one of these metal balls
a boy who picks up the balls for people playing in important tennis matches
Sense.TRAN: 〔在重要的网球比赛中为球员拾球的〕球童

Sense.DEF: a hollow floating ball on a stick that opens and closes a hole to allow water to flow into a container, for example in a toilet
Sense.TRAN: 〔抽水马桶等中的〕浮球阀﹐浮球栓﹐浮球旋塞

Sense.DEF:
a
basketball
player, especially a good player in informal games
Sense.TRAN: 篮球运动员〔尤指非正式比赛中的优秀运动员〕

Sense.DEF: a woman who dances in ballets
a performance in which dancing and music tell a story without any speaking
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to the ballet tomorrow evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们明天晚上要去看芭蕾舞演出。

Sense.DEF: this type of dancing

a group of
ballet
dancers who work together
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Bolshoi ballet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: （莫斯科）大剧院芭蕾舞团

Sense.DEF: someone who dances in ballets
movements that are balletic are graceful like the movements in ballet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a balletic leap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优美如芭蕾舞的一个跳跃动作

Sense.DEF:
a game of baseball, football, or
basketball
Sense.TRAN: 球赛〔指棒球赛﹑橄榄球赛或篮球赛〕

Sense.DEF: any game played with a ball
a situation that is very different from the one you are used to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used to be a teacher, so working in an office is a whole new ball game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前是老师﹐所以在办公室工作对我是完全陌生的事。

Sense.DEF: a girl who picks up the balls for people playing in important tennis matches
Sense.TRAN: 〔在重要的网球比赛中为球员拾球的〕女球童

Sense.DEF: a long dress made of expensive material, that a woman wears to formal parties
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性参加正式派对穿的〕晚礼服

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t believe it! She went ballistic just because there were peas in her pasta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我都没法相信！就因为面里有豌豆﹐她就勃然大怒。

Sense.DEF: a powerful weapon that can travel extremely long distances, and that flies very high up into the sky and then back down to earth, where it explodes
the scientific study of the movement of objects that are thrown or fired through the air, such as bullets shot from a gun
an object made of brightly coloured thin rubber, that is filled with air and used as a toy or decoration for parties
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you help me blow up these balloons?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我把这些气球吹起来好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He burst the balloon in my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对着我的脸弄爆了气球。

Sense.DEF: a large bag of strong light cloth filled with gas or heated air so that it can float in the air. It has a basket hanging below it for people to stand in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a balloon flight over the Yorkshire Moors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞越约克郡沼泽区的热气球航行

Sense.DEF:
the circle drawn around the words spoken by the characters in a
cartoon
Sense.TRAN: 〔卡通漫画中表示人物对白的〕气球状对话框﹐对白圆圈

Sense.DEF: money borrowed that must be paid back in one large sum after several smaller payments have been made
Sense.TRAN: 〔分期付款中〕最后一笔数目特大的还款
Sense.EXAMPLE: a $10,000 balloon payment due in two years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一笔两年后到期该付的一万美元付款额

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the moment when a situation starts to become really bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to get out of there before the balloon goes up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得趁事情还没闹大的时候赶快脱身。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: go down like a lead balloon

PIC.HEADING: BALLOON 气球
PIC.PICCONTENT: gondola 吊舱；hot-air balloon 热气球；balloon 气球

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become larger in amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s debt has ballooned in the past year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去一年里﹐公司的债务激增。

Sense.DEF: if someone balloons, they suddenly become fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul ballooned after he got married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗婚后吹气球似地胖了起来。

Sense.DEF: to get bigger and rounder
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sheet flapped and ballooned in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被单在风中飘动﹐被吹得鼓鼓的。

Sense.DEF: the sport of flying in a balloon
someone who flies a balloon
Sense.TRAN: 乘热气球飞行者﹔驾驶热气球的人

Sense.DEF: a system of voting, usually in secret, or an occasion when you vote in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party leader is elected by secret ballot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政党领袖是通过无记名投票选举产生的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers at the plant held a ballot and rejected strike action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂工人举行投票﹐否决了罢工行动。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper on which you make a secret vote
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only 22% of voters cast their ballots .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有22%的选民投了票。

Sense.DEF: the total number of votes in an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won 54% of the ballot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赢得了54%的选票。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to vote for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Train drivers are being balloted on industrial action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车司机被要求就劳工行动一事进行投票表决。

Sense.DEF: to vote for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Staff balloted for strike action yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天员工投票赞成罢工行动。

Sense.DEF: a box that ballot papers are put in after voting
the system or process of voting in an election

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The people have expressed their views through the ballot box.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们通过投票的方式表达了自己的意见。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper on which you record your vote

GramExa.GLOSS: ones that have been marked incorrectly and so cannot be counted

Sense.DEF: the practice of cheating in an election by not counting the ballot papers correctly
a field for playing baseball with seats for watching the game
close to the amount, price etc that you want or are thinking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their estimate is in the right ball park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的估计大致正确。

Sense.DEF: a number or amount that is almost but not exactly correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said $25,000, but it’s just a ball-park figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说是25,000美元﹐不过这只是个大致的数目。

Sense.DEF: someone who plays baseball
a pen with a ball at the end that rolls ink onto the paper
a very large room used for dancing on formal occasions

a type of dancing that is done with a partner and has different steps for particular types of music, such as the
waltz
Sense.TRAN: 交际舞﹐交谊舞〔如华尔兹舞等〕

Sense.DEF: used to show strong disapproval or disappointment
Sense.TRAN: 胡说八道〔表示强烈反对或失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Balls to that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡说！

Sense.DEF: to do something very badly or unsuccessfully
Sense.TRAN: 把…弄得一团糟﹐弄得一塌糊涂

Sense.DEF: something that has been done very badly or not successfully
Sense.TRAN: 一团糟﹐一片混乱﹐烂摊子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nigel made a complete balls-up of the arrangements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奈杰尔把安排全搞乱了。

Sense.DEF: brave and determined, and not afraid of other people’s disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 胆识过人的﹐敢作敢为的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very ballsy lady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个敢作敢为的女子

Sense.DEF:
an expression meaning
bloody 1
– used to avoid offending people
when there is a lot of excitement or anger about something – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 大吹大擂﹐哗众取宠〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After all the ballyhoo, the film was a flop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管炒作得厉害﹐这部电影还是不卖座。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a much ballyhooed program to recruit more police officers
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个大吹大擂的募警计划

Sense.DEF: an oily liquid with a strong pleasant smell that you rub into your skin, often to reduce pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔涂在皮肤上常起止痛作用的〕油﹐膏﹐香脂﹔镇痛软膏
Sense.EXAMPLE: lip balm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 润唇膏

Sense.DEF: something that gives you comfort

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A drive through the countryside is balm for a weary soul.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 驱车穿越乡间是对疲惫心灵的安慰。

Sense.DEF: balmy air, weather etc is warm and pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a balmy summer night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个宜人的夏夜

Sense.DEF: something that is silly or not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t give me that baloney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别跟我吹牛。

Sense.DEF: a tropical American tree or the wood from this tree, which is very light
Sense.TRAN: 〔美洲热带地区产的〕轻木，轻木木材

Sense.DEF:
balm
, or the tree that produces it

a type of dark-coloured
vinegar
that has a strong taste

a row of wooden, stone, or metal posts that stop someone falling from a bridge or
balcony
used to show that something happens quickly
Sense.TRAN: 猛然﹐蓦地〔表示事情发生之快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a run for it and, bam, they shot him in the leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要逃跑﹐他们就砰的一枪打在他腿上。

Sense.DEF: used to show that something has hit something else
Sense.TRAN: 砰〔表示某物击中另一物〕

Sense.DEF: used to make the sound of a gun
a tall tropical plant with hollow stems that is used for making furniture
to deceive, trick, or confuse someone
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a total ban on cigarette advertising
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟广告的全面禁止

Sense.EXAMPLE: a call to lift the ban on homosexuals in the military
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求取消军中严禁同性恋的呼声

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They are seeking a complete ban on nuclear testing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在寻求彻底禁止核试验。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a complete ban
Collocate.EXAMPLE: an outright ban on gun ownership
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全禁止拥有枪支

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 国际禁令﹔全球范围内的禁止
Collocate.EXAMPLE: an international ban on trade in endangered species
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际濒危物种贸易禁令

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: including all possible cases
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They imposed a blanket ban on beef products from Europe.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们全面禁止进口欧洲的牛肉制品。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He faces a lifetime ban from athletics.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临终身禁赛的处罚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The export ban on live cattle was brought in some years ago.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 活牛出口禁令是几年前实施的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has imposed an outright ban on fox hunting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府实施了彻底的猎狐禁令。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They promised to lift the immigration ban.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们承诺取消移民禁令。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: French farmers have called for a ban on imports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国农民要求出台进口禁令。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make sure that it is obeyed

Sense.DEF: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is banned in the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Charlie’s been banned from driving for a year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理被禁驾一年。

GramExa.GLOSS: a drug that people competing in a sport are not allowed to take because it improves their performance

Sense.DEF: ordinary and not interesting, because of a lack of new or different ideas
Sense.TRAN: 平淡无奇的﹐平庸的﹐陈腐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: conversations about the most banal subjects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最无聊的谈话

Sense.DEF: a long curved tropical fruit with a yellow skin
an embarrassing mistake made by someone in a public position, especially a politician or someone in a government
Sense.TRAN: “香蕉皮”﹐〔尤指政治人物或政府官员的〕出丑﹐洋相

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for a small poor country with weak government that depends on financial help from abroad
Sense.TRAN: 香蕉共和国〔侮辱性用语﹐指政府软弱﹑需依赖他国财政援助的贫穷小国〕

Sense.DEF: to become very angry or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum went bananas when I said I was going to leave nursing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说我要放弃护理工作﹐妈妈十分生气。

Sense.DEF: crazy or silly
an embarrassing mistake made by someone in a public position, especially a politician or someone in a government
Sense.TRAN: “香蕉皮”﹐〔尤指政治人物或政府官员的〕出丑﹐洋相
Sense.EXAMPLE: This government has an unhappy knack of slipping on banana skins .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这届政府真有本事﹐总能踩到香蕉皮让自己出丑。

Sense.DEF:
a dish with bananas and
ice cream
Sense.TRAN: 香蕉圣代﹐香蕉船〔用香蕉和冰激凌做成的甜点〕

Sense.DEF: a group of musicians, especially a group that plays popular music
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指演奏流行音乐的〕乐队﹐乐团
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队正在演奏披头士的老歌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I grew up playing in rock bands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在摇滚乐队里玩音乐长大的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith joined the band in 1989.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯在1989年加入这个乐队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They formed a band when they were still at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还在读书的时候就组建了一个乐队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The entertainment includes a disco and live band .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 娱乐活动有跳迪斯科和乐队现场演奏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: interviews with band members
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对乐队成员的采访

Sense.DEF: a group of people formed because of a common belief or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 一伙﹐一群﹐一帮〔志趣相投的人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small band of volunteers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小批志愿者
GramExa.EXAMPLE: bands of soldiers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群群士兵

Sense.DEF: a range of numbers within a system
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest rates stayed within a relatively narrow band.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率在一个相对较小的范围内波动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people within the $20,000–$30,000 income band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收入在两万至三万美元这个范围的人

Sense.DEF: a flat narrow piece of something with one end joined to the other to form a circle
Sense.EXAMPLE: papers held together with a rubber band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用橡皮筋捆在一起的文件
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slim gold band on her finger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手指上戴的一枚细细的金指环

Sense.DEF: a narrow area of light, colour, land etc that is different from the areas around it
Sense.TRAN: 带状物﹐条纹〔指异于周围的狭窄光带﹑色带﹑土地等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds have a distinctive blue band round their eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鸟的眼圈是蓝色的﹐很特别。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a thin band of cloud
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条细细的云彩

Sense.DEF: a range of radio signals
to put people or things into different groups, usually according to income, value, or price
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常按收入﹑价值或价格〕给…分级
Sense.EXAMPLE: After valuation, properties will be banded in groups of £20,000 or more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过估价﹐房产将归在两万英镑或以上的组别里。

Sense.DEF: if people band together, they unite in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people have banded together to fight the company’s plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地民众联手抵制该公司的计划。

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of cloth that you tie around a wound or around a part of the body that has been injured
to tie or cover a part of the body with a bandage
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse bandaged up his sprained ankle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士用绷带包扎他扭伤的脚踝。

Sense.DEF: a piece of thin material that is stuck to the skin to cover cuts and other small wounds
Sense.TRAN: 邦迪牌创可贴〔一种护创胶布〕

Sense.DEF: a Band-Aid solution to a problem is temporary and will not solve the problem – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 临时措施﹐应急措施〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This idea is criticized by some as a Band-Aid solution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人批评这个办法只是权宜之计﹐并不能真正解决问题。

Sense.DEF: a large brightly coloured piece of cloth that you wear around your head or neck

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= bed and breakfast 住宿加早餐﹔提供住宿和早餐的私人住家[小旅馆]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small B and B in the Cotswolds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科茨沃尔德的一家提供住宿和早餐的小旅店

Sense.DEF: if an object or animal is banded, it has bands of colour or bands of a material around it
Sense.EXAMPLE: banded snakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有条纹的蛇

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a heavy door banded with steel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一扇嵌钢条的沉重的门

Sense.DEF: someone who robs people, especially one of a group of people who attack travellers
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指袭击旅游者的〕强盗﹐土匪﹐歹徒
Sense.EXAMPLE: They travelled 30 miles through bandit country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走了30英里﹐穿过强盗横行的乡间。

Sense.DEF:
someone who
conduct s
a band, especially a dance or
jazz
band
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指舞曲或爵士乐的〕乐队领队

Sense.DEF:
someone who
conduct s
a military band,
brass
band etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔军乐队﹑铜管乐队等的〕乐队指挥

Sense.DEF: a belt that goes over someone’s shoulder and is used to carry bullets

a musician who plays in a military band,
brass
band etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔军乐队﹑铜管乐队等的〕乐队队员

Sense.DEF: a structure in a park that has a roof but no walls and is used by a band playing music
an activity that a lot of people are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The keep-fit bandwagon started rolling in the mid-80s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八十年代中期﹐健身热潮开始涌现。

Sense.DEF: to start doing or saying something that a lot of people are already doing or saying – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 赶浪头﹐赶时髦﹐顺应潮流〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to look as if I’m jumping on a green bandwagon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想显得我是在随大溜参与环保。

Sense.DEF: the amount of information that can be carried through a telephone wire, computer connection etc at one time
bandy legs curve out at the knees
Sense.TRAN: 两膝向外曲的﹐罗圈腿的

Sense.DEF: to argue
to mention an idea, name, remark etc several times, especially in order to seem impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many names have been bandied about in the press as the manager’s replacement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报上传着许多人的名字﹐说是要接替经理的位置。

Sense.DEF: something that causes trouble or makes people unhappy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drugs are the bane of the inner cities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品是贫民区的祸害。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her brother is the bane of her life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她弟弟是她生活中的灾星。

Sense.DEF: evil or bad
a sudden loud noise caused by something such as a gun or an object hitting a hard surface
Sense.TRAN: 砰﹐啪〔枪声或撞到硬物的声音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a loud bang outside the kitchen door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房门外传来砰的一声巨响。

Sense.DEF: a painful blow to the body when you hit against something or something hits you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bang on the head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头上一记猛烈的撞击

Sense.DEF: hair cut straight across your forehead
in a very successful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stock markets started the year with a bang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股市开年大吉。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (get) a bigger/better etc bang for your buck
Sense.DEF: something that gives you a good effect or a lot of value for the effort or money you spend on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔从自己投入的努力或金钱中〕得到好处
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are taxpayers getting enough bang for their buck?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税人得到足够的回报了吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: get a bang out of sth
Sense.DEF: to enjoy something very much
to hit something hard, making a loud noise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop banging on the door!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别砰砰打门了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She banged her fist on the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她砰的一拳砸在桌子上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby kept banging the table with his spoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝不停地拿调羹敲桌子。

Sense.DEF: to put something down or against something with a lot of force, making a loud noise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She banged the phone down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她啪的一声把电话扔下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He banged a teapot on the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把茶壶往桌子上一摔。

Sense.DEF: to close something violently, making a loud noise, or to be closed in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ran out, banging the door behind me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我冲出去﹐砰的一声把门摔上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The window banged shut .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户砰的一声关上了。

Sense.DEF: to hit a part of your body, or something you are carrying, against something by accident

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I fell and banged my head on the pavement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我摔了一跤﹐头撞在人行道上。

Sense.DEF: to make a loud noise or loud noises
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gate keeps banging in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大门被风吹得乒乓作响。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be (like) banging your head against a brick wall

Sense.DEF: to move around a place, making a lot of noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could hear them banging about upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到他们在楼上咚咚咚地跑来跑去。

Sense.DEF: to talk continuously about something in a boring way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish he wouldn’t keep banging on about politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他不要一直哇啦哇啦地讲政治了。

Sense.DEF: to play a tune or song loudly and badly on a piano
Sense.TRAN: 〔在钢琴上〕使劲乱敲地弹奏〔乐曲或歌曲〕

Sense.DEF:
to write something in a hurry, especially using a
keyboard
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用键盘〕匆忙赶写﹐匆匆地打出来

Sense.DEF: to put someone in prison
to seriously damage something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a banged-up old Buick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆破破烂烂的旧别克轿车

Sense.DEF: directly or exactly
Sense.TRAN: 直接地﹔准确地﹔正巧﹐恰恰
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train arrived bang on time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车准点到达。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The technology is bang up to date .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种技术绝对是最新的。

Sense.DEF: exactly correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is that right?’ ‘Bang on!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那样对吗？”“绝对没错！”

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are unhappy because something you had hoped for will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 某事完蛋了﹐某事告吹了〔表示因期待的事不会发生而不开心〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bang goes my brilliant plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的美好计划泡汤了。

Sense.DEF: in a sudden violent way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I skidded and went bang into the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的车打滑了﹐一下子撞到了墙上。

Sense.DEF: to explode or burst with a loud noise
used to make a sound like a gun or bomb
Sense.TRAN: 砰〔用作模仿枪声或炸弹的声响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bang bang, you’re dead!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砰﹐砰 — 你死了!

Sense.DEF:
a
sausage
Sense.EXAMPLE:
bangers and mash
sausages and mashed potato
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香肠和土豆泥

Sense.DEF: an old car in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old banger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆老爷车

Sense.DEF:
a type of noisy
firework
a solid band of gold, silver etc that you wear loosely around your wrist as jewellery
very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did a bang-up job fixing the plumbing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把水管修得棒极了。

Sense.DEF: to not allow someone or something to stay in a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was banished to a distant corridor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被赶到远处的一条走廊里。

Sense.DEF: to send someone away permanently from their country or the area where they live, especially as an official punishment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thousands were banished to Siberia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万的人被流放到西伯利亚。

Sense.DEF: to try to stop thinking about something or someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They tried to banish the memory from their minds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图抹掉心中的记忆。

Sense.DEF: a row of wooden posts with a bar along the top, that stops you from falling over the edge of stairs

a musical instrument like a guitar, with a round body and four or more strings, played especially in
country and western
music

Subsense.DEF: a business that keeps and lends money and provides other financial services

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have very little money in the bank.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们存在银行里的钱很少。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Barclays Bank
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克莱银行
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a bank loan
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行贷款

Subsense.DEF: a local office of a bank
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I have to go to the bank at lunch time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午饭时间我得去银行。

Sense.DEF: land along the side of a river or lake

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the banks of the River Dee
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪河两岸

Sense.EXAMPLE: the river bank
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河岸

Sense.DEF: a place where human blood etc is stored until someone needs it
a large mass of clouds, mist etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fog bank
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团雾气

GramExa.EXAMPLE: banks of mist
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 团团薄雾

Sense.DEF: a large sloping mass of earth, sand, snow etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was sitting on a grassy bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在草坡上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: steep banks of snow
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡峭的雪坡
GramExa.EXAMPLE: banks of flowers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 满坡的野花

Sense.DEF: a large number of machines, television screens etc arranged close together in a row

GramExa.EXAMPLE: banks of TV monitors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排排的电视监视器

Sense.DEF:
a supply of money used to
gamble
, that people can win
to earn a lot of money for the work that you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check out Omar’s new car. The brother must be makin' bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看奥马的新车﹐这位兄弟肯定是在赚大钱了。

Sense.DEF:
a slope made at a bend in a road or
racetrack
to make it safer for cars to go around
Sense.TRAN: 〔公路或赛道拐弯处防止车辆侧滑或侧翻的〕内侧斜坡﹐边坡

Subsense.DEF: to put or keep money in a bank
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did you bank that check?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把那张支票存入银行了吗？

Subsense.DEF: to keep your money in a particular bank

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who do you bank with?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把钱存入哪家银行？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always banked at First Interstate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是在第一州际银行存钱。

Sense.DEF: if a plane banks, it slopes to one side when turning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane banked, and circled back toward us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机倾斜着绕了个圈﹐朝我们飞回来。

Sense.DEF: to arrange something into a pile or into rows
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snow was banked up on either side of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪堆积在路的两旁。

Sense.DEF: to form a mass of cloud, mist etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Banked clouds promised rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 云团密布﹐预示有雨。

Sense.DEF: to cover a fire with wood or coal to keep it going for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Josie banked up the fire to last till morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔西把炉火封好﹐好让它保持到第二天早晨。

Sense.DEF: to depend on something happening or someone doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was banking on being able to get some coffee on the train.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我指望在火车上能弄点咖啡喝喝。

Sense.DEF: likely to be profitable or make a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hollywood’s most bankable stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞最叫座的明星

Sense.DEF: an arrangement between a bank and a customer that allows the customer to pay in and take out money
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to open a bank account .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想开一个银行账户。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money someone has in their bank account
Sense.TRAN: 账户余额﹐银行存款余额

Sense.DEF: a book in which a record is kept of the money you put into and take out of your bank account

a
credit card
provided by your bank

Sense.TRAN: 支票保付卡﹐银行支票证

Sense.DEF: a cheque from one bank to another, especially a foreign bank, to pay a certain amount of money to a person or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行与银行﹐尤指与外国银行之间的〕银行汇票

Sense.DEF: someone who works in a bank in an important position

the player who is in charge of the money in some
gambling
games

Sense.TRAN: 支票保付卡﹐银行支票证

Sense.DEF: an official holiday when banks and most businesses are closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next Monday is a bank holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期一是银行假日。

GramExa.GLOSS: a weekend on which there is a bank holiday on Friday or Monday
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 带银行假日的周末〔指周五或周一为银行假日的周末〕﹐周末银行假日

Sense.DEF: the business of a bank
Sense.EXAMPLE: the international banking system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际银行业体制

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a local bank
a piece of paper money

the rate of
interest
charged by banks lending money, decided by a country’s main bank
Sense.TRAN: 〔中央银行所定的〕银行利率﹐银行贴现率

Sense.DEF: to provide the money that someone needs for a business, a plan etc
Sense.TRAN: 对…融资﹐为…提供资金﹔资助
Sense.EXAMPLE: a software company bankrolled by the Samsung Group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家由三星集团提供资金的软件公司

Sense.DEF: a supply of money
without enough money to pay what you owe
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm went bankrupt before the building work was completed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工程尚未竣工﹐公司就破产了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
In 1977 he was declared bankrupt
by a court
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1977年﹐他被宣布破产。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Trent lost his house when he was made bankrupt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特伦特先生破产以后房子也没有了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seventeen years of war left the country bankrupt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17年的战争把国家耗空了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bankrupt electrical company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家破产的电力公司

Sense.DEF: completely lacking a particular good quality
Sense.TRAN: 缺乏〔某种美德〕的﹔沦丧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opposition attacked the government as morally bankrupt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党抨击政府道德败坏。

Sense.DEF: to make a person, business, or country bankrupt or very poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johns had been nearly bankrupted through a failed business venture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰斯因为商业投资失败几近破产。

Sense.DEF: someone who has officially said that they cannot pay their debts

GramExa.GLOSS: one a court does or does not allow to start a business again
GramExa.TRAN: 核实的/未核实的破产者

Sense.DEF: the state of being unable to pay your debts
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1999 it was revealed that he was close to bankruptcy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1999年他被披露几近破产。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When inflation rises, so do bankruptcies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀加剧﹐破产个案也会增加。

Sense.DEF: a total lack of a particular good quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: the moral bankruptcy of terrorism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖主义的道德沦丧

Sense.DEF:
a document sent regularly by a bank to a customer that lists the amounts of money taken out of and paid into their
bank account
not officially allowed to meet, exist, or be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaders of the banned party were arrested last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被取缔党派的领导人昨晚被捕。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He was suspended for using a banned substance
a drug that people competing in sport are not allowed to take
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为使用违禁药品而被禁赛。

Sense.DEF: a long piece of cloth on which something is written, often carried between two poles
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常用两根竿子撑开的〕横幅﹐横幅标语
Sense.EXAMPLE: The onlookers were shouting, cheering, and waving banners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众挥动着横幅﹐又是叫喊又是欢呼。

Sense.DEF: a belief or principle
Sense.TRAN: 旗帜﹐口号〔指信仰或原则〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: carry/raise/wave etc the banner of sth
GramExa.GLOSS: publicly support a particular belief etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 打着/举起/挥舞等某事物的旗帜
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’d never felt the need to carry the banner of feminism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来都不觉得有必要打出女权主义的旗号。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They marched under the banner of equal educational opportunity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们打着平等教育的旗号游行示威。

Sense.DEF: as part of a particular group or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The oil-producing countries joined together under the banner of OPEC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产油国都加入了石油输出国组织。

Sense.DEF: a flag
an advertisement that appears across the top of a page on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 〔网页上的〕横幅广告﹐标题广告

Sense.DEF: words printed in very large letters across the top of the first page of a newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLE: The front-page banner headline read ‘Disgraced police chief to stand trial’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头版的通栏标题写着“落马警察局局长将接受审判”。

Sense.DEF: a year that is good because something is successful
a public statement that two people intend to get married, made in a church in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔在英国﹐预先在教堂发布的〕结婚公告

Sense.DEF: a formal dinner for many people on an important occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a state banquet
one attended by heads of government and other important people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国宴

Sense.DEF: a large and impressive meal
a large room in which banquets take place

a female
spirit
whose loud cry is believed to be heard when someone is going to die

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was screaming like a banshee .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她像鬼一样地尖叫。

Sense.DEF: a type of small chicken

a
boxer
who weighs less than 53.52 kilograms, and who is heavier than a
flyweight
but lighter than a
featherweight
Sense.TRAN: 最轻量级拳击手〔体重在53.52以下，级别在蝇量级和羽量级之间〕

Sense.DEF: friendly conversation in which people make a lot of jokes with, and amusing remarks about, each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: easy banter between her cousins
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表兄妹之间轻松的打趣说笑

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I watched the guys as they bantered with the waitresses.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着那些家伙和女服务员开玩笑。

Sense.DEF:
a round soft bread
roll
a Christian religious ceremony in which someone is touched or covered with water to welcome them into the Christian faith, and sometimes to officially name them
a difficult or painful first experience of something
Sense.TRAN: 火的洗礼﹐初次的痛苦经历[考验]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The campaign has been a baptism of fire.

RunOn.EXAMPLE:
a baptismal font
container for holding the water used at baptism

Sense.DEF: a member of a Christian group that believes baptism should only be for people old enough to understand its meaning
to perform the ceremony of baptism on someone
to accept someone as a member of a particular Christian church by a ceremony of baptism
Sense.TRAN: 为…施行洗礼并吸纳入教
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was baptized a Roman Catholic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受洗成为罗马天主教徒。

Sense.DEF: to give a child a name in a baptism ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was baptized Jane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受洗时取名为简。

Subsense.DEF: a place where alcoholic drinks are served
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has a licensed bar .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾馆里有一家有售酒许可证的酒吧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a cocktail bar

Subsense.DEF: one of the rooms inside a pub

Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

Sense.DEF:
a
counter
where alcoholic drinks are served
Sense.EXAMPLE: They stood at the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们站在吧台旁边。

Sense.DEF: a place where a particular kind of food or drink is served
a place in your kitchen at home where you eat breakfast or a quick meal
a small block of solid material that is longer than it is wide
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chocolate bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条巧克力
Sense.EXAMPLE: a candy bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根糖果棒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bar of soap
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块肥皂

Sense.DEF: a length of metal or wood put across a door, window etc to keep it shut or to prevent people going in or out
Sense.TRAN: 〔门﹑窗等的〕闩﹔铁栅﹔横木﹔阻碍物
Sense.EXAMPLE: houses with bars across the windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

Sense.DEF: in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her killer was finally put behind bars .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀害她的凶手终于被关进了监狱。

Sense.DEF:
a group of notes and
rest s
, separated from other groups by vertical lines, into which a line of written music is divided
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few bars of the song
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌的几个小节

Sense.DEF: something that prevents you from achieving something that you want

the group of people who are
barrister s

to become a
barrister

Subsense.DEF: to become a lawyer
Subsense.TRAN: 取得律师资格﹐成为律师

Sense.DEF:
a long narrow shape along the sides or at the top of a computer screen, usually containing signs that you can
click
on

Sense.EXAMPLE: the main menu bar at the top of the screen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屏幕上方的主菜单栏
Sense.EXAMPLE: the toolbar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工具条

Sense.DEF: the long piece of wood or metal across the top of the goal in sports such as football
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ball hit the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球打在球门的横梁上。

Sense.DEF:
a long pile of sand or stones under the water at the entrance to a
harbour
a narrow band of colour or light
a narrow band of metal or cloth worn on a military uniform to show rank
the part of an electric heater that provides heat and has a red light

PIC.HEADING: BARS 条﹔馆﹔柜台
PIC.PICCONTENT: wrapper 包装纸；a bar of chocolate 一条巧克力；a bar of soap 一块肥皂；bar code 条形码；bars on a window 窗栅；the bar 吧台；coffee bar BrE【英】咖啡馆

Sense.DEF: to officially prevent someone from entering a place or from doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They seized his passport and barred him from leaving the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没收了他的护照﹐禁止他出境。

Sense.DEF: to prevent people from going somewhere by placing something in their way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran back, but Francis barred her way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往回跑﹐可是弗朗西斯拦住了她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A locked gate barred my entrance to the wood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上了锁的大门挡住了我进入树林的路。

Sense.DEF: to shut a door or window using a bar or piece of wood so that people cannot get in or out
except
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had recorded the whole album, bar one track.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把整张专辑都录了下来﹐除了一首歌。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone is the best of a particular group
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the most talented actor in the country, bar none.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是国内最有天分的演员﹐无人可比。

Sense.DEF:
the sharp curved point of a hook,
arrow
etc that prevents it from being easily pulled out
a remark that is clever and amusing, but also cruel

someone from a different tribe or land, who people believe to be wild and not
civilized
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Roman Empire came under severe pressure from the barbarians across the Rhine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马帝国受到了来自莱茵河对岸的蛮族的巨大压力。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not behave properly, and does not show proper respect for education, art etc
Sense.TRAN: 大老粗 ，无教养的人﹐粗野的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The youths were described as uncivilised barbarians who savagely attacked innocent victims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些青年人凶残地袭击无辜的人﹐被描述为缺乏教养的野蛮人。

Sense.DEF:
someone who behaves in a way that is cruel and
uncivilized
Sense.TRAN: 残酷野蛮的人﹐残暴的人

Sense.DEF: very cruel and violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way the whales are killed is nothing short of barbaric.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对鲸的捕杀方式简直就是野蛮。

Sense.DEF: extremely violent and cruel behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 残暴的行为﹐粗野的举止

Sense.DEF:
a situation in which people have no respect for
civilized
things such as art and culture
Sense.EXAMPLE: cultural barbarism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文化荒漠

Sense.DEF: a very cruel act
Sense.EXAMPLE: the medieval barbarity of putting people in prison for debt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中世纪时把欠债人关进监狱的野蛮做法

Sense.DEF: extremely cruel in a way that is shocking
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trade in exotic birds is barbarous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买卖奇异鸟类是很残忍的。

Sense.DEF:
wild and not
civilized
Sense.TRAN: 野蛮的﹐未开化的﹐粗鄙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a savage barbarous people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶猛野蛮的民族

Sense.DEF: a meal or party during which food is cooked on a metal frame over a fire and eaten outdoors
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a barbecue on the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在海滩上烧烤。

Sense.DEF: a metal frame for cooking food on outdoors
to cook food on a metal frame over a fire outdoors
Sense.EXAMPLE: barbecued chicken
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔用烤架烧的〕烤鸡

Sense.DEF:
a barbed hook or
arrow
has one or more sharp curved points on it
a barbed remark is unkind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a barbed comment on his appearance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他外表的挖苦讽刺

Sense.DEF: wire with short sharp points on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high barbed wire fence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高架带刺铁丝网

Sense.DEF: a metal bar with weights at each end, that you lift to make you stronger

a man whose job is to cut men’s hair and sometimes to
shave
them
Sense.TRAN: 〔为男性剪发或刮脸的〕男理发师

Sense.DEF: a shop where men’s hair is cut
a style of singing popular songs with parts for four men, usually without music

Sense.EXAMPLE: a barbershop quartet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男声四重唱

Sense.DEF: a shop where men’s hair is cut

a
barbecue
Sense.TRAN: 烧烤野餐﹔〔用于户外的〕烤架

Sense.DEF:
a popular type of
doll
in the shape of an attractive young woman, that can be dressed in a large variety of fashionable clothes. A woman is sometimes compared to a Barbie doll if she is attractive and always has new clothes, but is not very intelligent.
Sense.TRAN: 芭比娃娃〔有时喻指漂亮时髦但并不很聪明的女子〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of
billiard s
played in
pub s
in Britain
a powerful drug that makes people calm and helps them to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 巴比妥类镇静剂〔一种强效镇静安眠药〕

Sense.DEF: a type of good-quality expensive coat made in the UK, traditionally worn by farmers and country people to protect them from wind and rain. It has also become fashionable with some people in cities.
Sense.TRAN: 巴伯尔外套〔英国生产的一种优质外套﹐可防风雨〕

Sense.DEF: a picture of boxes of different heights, in which each box represents a different amount or quantity
Sense.TRAN: 条形图﹐柱状图〔用不同高度的条形表示数量的图表〕

Sense.DEF: a group of thin and thick lines printed on products you buy in a shop, that a computer can read. It contains information such as the price.
a poet
William Shakespeare
Sense.TRAN: 大诗人〔指威廉·莎士比亚〕

Sense.DEF: not covered by clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ragged child with bare feet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个衣衫褴褛﹑光着脚的小孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt the sun warm on her bare arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉到阳光照在她裸露双臂上的暖意。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 光着头的/裸着胸的/光着腿的等

Sense.DEF: not covered by trees or grass, or not having any leaves
Sense.TRAN: 〔土地〕草木不生的﹔〔树木〕光秃秃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees soon gave way to bare rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久﹐树也没有了﹐只剩下一片光秃秃的岩石。

Sense.DEF: empty, not covered by anything, or not having any decorations
Sense.TRAN: 空的﹔无覆盖物的﹔无装饰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked round her tiny bare room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她环顾她那空荡荡的小房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bare wood staircase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未铺地毯的木楼梯

Sense.DEF: a statement that tells someone only what they need to know, with no additional details
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspaper had simply published the bare facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报上只刊登了最基本的事实。

Sense.DEF: the very least amount of something that you need to do something
Sense.TRAN: 最低限度的﹐仅有的﹐勉强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got 40% – a bare pass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得了40分﹐勉强及格。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The room had the bare minimum
the smallest amount possible
of furniture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里只有最基本的一些家具。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her bag was light, packed with only the bare essentials.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的包很轻﹐只装了一些最基本的生活必需品。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
If you ask her about herself, she gives only the barest
the smallest amount possible
of details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你问关于她的事﹐她只会告诉你只言片语。

Sense.DEF: the most important parts or facts of something without any detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have outlined only the bare bones of the method.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只粗略地介绍了这个方法的基本要点。

Subsense.DEF: to uncover something that was previously hidden
Subsense.TRAN: 显示出某事物﹐使某事物暴露
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When the river is low, vast stretches of sand are laid bare.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河水水位低的时候﹐就会露出大片的沙地来。

Subsense.DEF: to make known something that was secret
Subsense.EXAMPLE: historical writing which seeks to lay bare the true nature of an event
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 力求揭示事件真相的历史著作

Sense.DEF: without using a weapon or a tool
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had killed a man with his bare hands .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他徒手杀死了一名男子。

Sense.DEF: the basic form of a verb, for example ‘go’ or ‘eat’
to remove something that was covering or hiding something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog bared its teeth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗露出了牙齿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bared his back to the hot sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他露出脊背在炎热的太阳下暴晒。

Sense.DEF: to reveal your most secret feelings
very, or a lot of – used by young people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check out this new game – it’s bare hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试试这种新游戏——很难的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His dad’s got bare money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爸爸很有钱。

Sense.DEF: having no clothes on

on a horse without a
saddle
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d been riding bareback all his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他骑了一辈子无鞍马。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a remark or action that is clearly untrue or unpleasant, and that shows that you do not care about offending someone
Sense.TRAN: 厚颜无耻的﹔露骨的﹔公然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why are you telling such barefaced lies ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么要说这种无耻的谎言？

Sense.DEF: without shoes on your feet
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked barefoot across the sand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赤脚走过沙地。

Sense.DEF: without a hat or other covering on your head
Sense.TRAN: 光着头的[地]﹐不戴帽子的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t go out bareheaded in this weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的天气你不能光着头出去。

Sense.DEF: only with great difficulty or effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was very old and barely able to walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她年纪非常大﹐只能勉强走几步路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary had barely enough money to live on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽的钱只够勉强度日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His voice was barely audible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音勉强能听见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She could barely understand English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她勉强懂一点英语。

Sense.DEF: almost not
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was barely aware of his presence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something happens immediately after a previous action
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham had barely finished his coffee when Henry returned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆刚刚喝完咖啡﹐亨利就回来了。

Sense.DEF: used before amounts or numbers to emphasize that they are surprisingly small
Sense.TRAN: 只有﹐仅仅〔强调数量之少〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nowadays, the village has barely 100 inhabitants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今这个村庄只有100个居民。

Sense.DEF:
to
vomit
someone who spends a lot of time in bars
something you buy cheaply or for less than its usual price
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are no bargains in the clothes shops at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这阵子服装店里没有什么便宜货。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an attractive little home, and I think it’s a bargain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个漂亮的小居所﹐我觉得是合算的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That second-hand table was a real bargain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张二手的桌子非常便宜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good watches don't come at bargain prices .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好表不会便宜。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Bargain hunters
people looking for things to buy at low prices
queued outside the store for hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想淘便宜货的人排着队在商店外面等了很久。

Sense.DEF: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Management and unions have struck a bargain over wage increases.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 资方和工会就加薪问题达成了协议。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我履行了我的承诺﹐希望你也履行你的承诺。

Sense.DEF: in addition to everything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am now tired, cold, and hungry, with a headache into the bargain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在又累又冷又饿﹐而且还头痛。

Sense.DEF: to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price
Sense.TRAN: 讲价钱﹐讨价还价﹔商谈条件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: workers bargaining for better pay
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求提高薪水的工人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They bargained over the level of wages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们就工资水平进行商谈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: women bargaining with traders
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He’s the hardest bargainer in the business.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是这一行业里最强硬的谈判对手。

Sense.DEF: to expect that something will happen and make it part of your plans
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hadn’t bargained for such a dramatic change in the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有料到天气会有如此大的变化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t bargained on being stuck in traffic on the way home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有料到回家路上会遇到堵车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The thief got more than he bargained for , as Mr Cox tripped him up with his walking stick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷始料未及﹐考克斯先生竟用拐杖把他绊倒在地上。

Sense.DEF: a part of a large shop, usually below ground level, where goods are sold at reduced prices
discussion in order to reach an agreement about a sale, contract etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government would not intervene in private-sector wage bargaining.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府不会介入私营公司的工资谈判。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The 4% pay raise was the result of some hard bargaining .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4%的加薪是经过一番艰苦谈判后才取得的结果。

Sense.DEF: the amount of influence someone has and their ability to achieve what they want when starting a discussion or making an agreement
Sense.TRAN: 谈判中所处的地位/讨价还价的能力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most new artists and bands aren’t in a strong bargaining position .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数新出道的艺人和乐队在谈判中都处于不利的地位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will increase the bargaining power of management in wage negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将会提高资方在工资谈判中讨价还价的能力。

Sense.DEF: something that one person or group in a business deal or political agreement has, that can be used to gain an advantage in the deal

a large low boat with a flat bottom, used for carrying goods on a
canal
or river
to move somewhere in a rough careless way, often hitting against things
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran outside, barging past bushes and shrubs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跑了出去﹐磕磕绊绊经过一些灌木丛。

GramExa.PROPFORM: barge your way through/to etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She barged her way through the shopping crowds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她横冲直撞地挤过购物的人群。

Sense.DEF: to enter somewhere rudely, or to rudely interrupt someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: George barged into my office without knocking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治门也不敲就冲进了我的办公室。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Sorry to barge in on your evening,’ James said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “不好意思﹐晚上还来打扰你们。”詹姆斯说道。

Sense.DEF: someone who drives or works on a barge
a long pole used to guide a barge

Crossrefto.REFLEX: not touch sb/sth with a bargepole

Sense.DEF:
a
bar chart
to visit and drink at several bars, one after another
Sense.TRAN: 串游酒吧〔从一家酒吧喝到另一家酒吧〕

Sense.DEF:
the area of medicine that deals with
obesity the condition of being very fat

someone whose job is to prepare coffee in a
coffee bar

a male singing voice that is lower than a
tenor
but higher than a
bass
, or a man with a voice like this
Sense.EXAMPLE: a famous baritone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名男中音

Sense.DEF: the part of a musical work that is written for a baritone voice or instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you sing the baritone?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你唱男中音好吗？

Sense.DEF:
a baritone voice or instrument is lower than a
tenor
but higher than a
bass

a soft silver-white metal that is used to make
pigment s
dry coloured powders used to make paints
. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Ba.
Sense.TRAN: 钡〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Ba〕

Sense.DEF:
a substance containing barium that you swallow or that is put in your
bowel s
before you have an
X-ray
, because it makes the organs in your body easier to see
Sense.TRAN: 钡餐/钡灌肠剂/钡液〔X光造影剂〕

Sense.DEF: when a dog barks, it makes a short loud sound or series of sounds

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog always barks at strangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗总是对着陌生人叫。

Sense.DEF: to say something quickly in a loud voice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t just stand there, give me a hand,’ she barked at the shop assistant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “别光站在那里﹐帮我一把。”她对那店员吼道。

Sense.DEF: to have a wrong idea, or do something in a way that will not give you the information or result you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police spent three months barking up the wrong tree on the murder investigation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方调查这起凶杀案时方向不对头﹐枉费了三个月的精力。

Sense.DEF: to rub the skin off your knee, elbow etc by falling or knocking against something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I barked my shin against the step.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在台阶上蹭破了胫部。

Sense.DEF: the sharp loud sound made by a dog
the outer covering of a tree
a loud sound or voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amy’s voice was a hoarse bark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾美发出的是粗哑的吼声。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s bark is worse than their bite
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone who seems unpleasant or difficult to deal with is not really too bad
Sense.TRAN: 某人表面上厉害﹐某人嘴凶心不狠

Sense.DEF: someone who serves drinks in a bar

in the past, someone who stood outside a place where there was a
circus
or
fair
, shouting to people to come in

Sense.DEF: completely crazy or acting very strangely – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 疯狂的﹐发疯的﹔行为古怪的〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a plant that produces a grain used for making food or alcohol
a hard sweet made of boiled sugar
a drink made from barley boiled with water, with the flavour of lemon or orange

Sense.DEF: a type of very strong beer
a woman who serves drinks in a bar

Sense.DEF: a man who serves drinks in a bar

Sense.DEF: the religious ceremony held when a Jewish boy reaches the age of 13 and is considered an adult

slightly crazy

Sense.DEF: a large farm building for storing crops, or for keeping animals in

Sense.DEF: a large plain building
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge barn of a house

Sense.DEF: a small sea animal with a hard shell that sticks firmly to rocks and the bottom of boats

Sense.DEF:
a social event at which there is
country dancing

Sense.DEF: hair, or a way of wearing your hair
a noisy argument
to travel from place to place making short stops to give political speeches, theatre performances, or aircraft flying shows
Sense.TRAN: 巡回演讲﹔巡回演出﹔巡回飞行表演

Sense.DEF: done with a lot of energy and very exciting to watch
Sense.TRAN: 热烈的﹐精彩的﹐令人兴奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a barnstorming speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精彩的演说

Sense.DEF: an area on a farm, surrounded by farm buildings
Sense.TRAN: 谷仓场院﹐农家粮仓旁的院子

Sense.DEF: an instrument that measures changes in the air pressure and the weather, or that calculates height above sea level
something that shows any changes that are happening in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔反映事物变化的〕晴雨表﹐指标﹐标志
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skin is an accurate barometer of emotional and physical health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮肤是反映一个人身心健康状况的准确指标。

Sense.DEF:
a man who is a member of a low rank of the British
nobility
or of a rank of European
nobility
Sense.TRAN: 男爵〔英国爵位较低的贵族﹐或欧洲贵族的一个等级〕

Sense.DEF: a businessman with a lot of power or influence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大毒枭
Sense.EXAMPLE: conservative press barons like Beaverbrook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像比弗布鲁克这样的保守派报业大王

Sense.DEF:
a woman who is a member of a low rank of the British
nobility
the wife of a baron

a member of the British
nobility
, lower in rank than a baron, whose title passes to his son when he dies
Sense.TRAN: 准男爵〔英国爵位低于男爵的贵族﹐称号世袭〕

Sense.DEF: the rank of a baronet
very large and richly decorated
Sense.EXAMPLE: a splendid baronial house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富丽堂皇的房子

Sense.DEF:
belonging to or involving
baron s

the rank of
baron
relating to the very decorated style of art, music, buildings etc, that was common in Europe in the 17th and early 18th centuries
Sense.TRAN: 巴洛克风格的〔17至18世纪初在欧洲流行的一种华丽的风格﹐尤见于艺术﹑音乐﹑建筑等方面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: furnished in a baroque style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以巴洛克风格陈设的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 巴洛克风格的音乐/建筑/绘画等

Sense.DEF: used to describe baroque art, music, buildings etc

a sailing ship with three, four, or five
mast s
poles that the sails are fixed to
to interrupt someone, especially a performer or a player, by shouting criticism at them
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the 1965 Newport Folk Festival Bob Dylan was barracked for using electric instruments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在1965年的纽波特民间音乐节上﹐鲍勃·迪伦因为使用电子乐器而被喝倒彩。

Sense.DEF: to shout to show that you support someone or something
a building or group of buildings in which soldiers live
a large tropical fish that eats flesh
Sense.TRAN: 梭子鱼〔大型热带食肉海鱼〕

Sense.DEF: the continuous firing of guns, dropping of bombs etc, especially to protect soldiers as they move towards an enemy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a barrage of anti-aircraft fire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高射炮火网

Sense.DEF: a lot of criticism, questions, complaints etc that are said at the same time, or very quickly one after another
Sense.TRAN: 连珠炮似的批评[问题﹑投诉等]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a barrage of questions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 连珠炮似的问题

Sense.DEF: a wall of earth, stones etc built across a river to provide water for farming or to prevent flooding
a large bag that floats in the air to prevent enemy planes from flying near the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔阻止敌机低飞的〕阻拦气球﹐阻塞气球

Sense.DEF: a barred window, gate etc has bars across it
having bands of different colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: red barred tail feathers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有红色条纹的尾羽

Sense.DEF: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine is aged in oak barrels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种葡萄酒是用橡木酒桶放陈的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: barrels of beer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一桶桶啤酒

Sense.DEF: a unit of measurement for oil, equal to 159 litres
Sense.TRAN: 桶〔石油计量单位﹐相当于159升〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two million barrels of oil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两百万桶石油

Sense.DEF: the part of a gun that the bullets are fired through
to put someone in a situation in which they are forced to accept or do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 使某人处于被动[不利]的地位
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manager has us over a barrel – either we work on a Saturday or we lose our jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理迫使我们就范﹐要么星期六上班﹐要么丢掉工作。

Sense.DEF: to be very enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life is not exactly a barrel of laughs at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下的生活景况不容乐观。

Sense.DEF: to move very fast, especially in an uncontrolled way
Sense.TRAN: 高速行驶﹐飞奔﹔〔尤指失控地〕飞驰
Sense.EXAMPLE: A vehicle barreled out of a shopping center and crashed into the side of my car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆汽车从购物中心飞也似地冲出来﹐一头撞到了我车子的一侧。

Sense.DEF: a man who is barrel-chested has a round chest that sticks out
Sense.TRAN: 〔男性〕胸部厚实发达的﹐胸肌发达的

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument that you play by turning a handle, often used on the streets in order to get money, especially in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在旧时街头卖艺常用的〕手摇风琴

Sense.DEF: land or soil that is barren has no plants growing on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很久很久以前﹐地面还是一片荒漠。

Sense.DEF: unable to produce children or baby animals – used of a woman or of female animals
Sense.TRAN: 〔妇女或雌性动物〕不孕的﹐不育的

Sense.DEF: a tree or plant that is barren does not produce fruit or seeds
used to describe something that does not look interesting or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 沉闷无趣的﹐没有吸引力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sports hall was a rather barren concrete building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育馆是一幢了无生气的混凝土建筑。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a period of time during which you do not achieve anything or get any useful results
Sense.TRAN: 〔一段时间〕不出成绩的﹔无效果的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I scored five in the first seven games, but I’ve had a bit of a barren patch since then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在头七场比赛中进了五个球﹐但是后来一段时间就一直交白卷。

Sense.DEF: a small metal or plastic object used to keep a woman’s hair in place
a temporary wall or fence across a road, door etc that prevents people from going through
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fans were kept back behind barricades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歌迷们被拦在路障后面。

Sense.DEF: to build a barricade to prevent someone or something from getting in
Sense.TRAN: 设路障于﹔以障碍物阻塞
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the riots, some of the prisoners barricaded their cells.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴动期间﹐有些囚犯把牢房堵了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shopkeepers had to barricade themselves in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 店主们只得把自己关在里面。

Sense.DEF: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do
Sense.TRAN: 〔妨碍或限制人们做事的〕障碍﹐壁垒
Sense.EXAMPLE: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Problems with childcare remain the biggest barrier to women succeeding at work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照顾子女问题依然是女性争取事业成功的最大障碍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: barriers between doctors and patients
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生和病人之间的隔阂

Sense.DEF: a type of fence or gate that prevents people from moving in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

Sense.DEF: a physical object that keeps two areas, people etc apart

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

Sense.DEF: a level or amount of 10 seconds, 40% etc that is seen as a limit which it is difficult to get beyond
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m hoping to crash the 20-second barrier in the final and get a bronze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望决赛的时候能突破20秒的关口﹐拿到一枚铜牌。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: things such as taxes that make trade between countries difficult
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The aim was to remove trade barriers and open up free markets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 目标是消除贸易壁垒﹐开放自由市场。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the problem of understanding people who do not speak the same language.
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Living in China was hard for me at first because of the language barrier.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为有语言障碍﹐在中国生活一开始对我来说很困难。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most companies have broken down the old barriers of status among the workers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数公司打破了工人中旧有的地位障碍。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: avoid barriers that usually exist
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Music has the great advantage of crossing cultural barriers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐具有超越文化隔阂的巨大优势。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Will this remove the barriers to change?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将会为变革清除障碍吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are still many more barriers that need to be overcome.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍有许许多多的障碍需要克服。

Sense.DEF:
barrier methods of
contraception
involve the use of
condom s
etc, which physically prevent the
sperm
from reaching the egg
Sense.TRAN: 阻隔避孕法〔如使用避孕套等〕

Sense.DEF:
a line of
coral
pink stone-like substance
separated from the shore by water
unless something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barring a miracle, he won’t walk again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非出现奇迹﹐他是不可能再行走了。

Sense.DEF: a part of an American town or city where many poor Spanish-speaking people live
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国城镇中的〕西班牙语区﹐西裔贫民区

Sense.DEF: a lawyer in Britain who can argue cases in the higher law courts
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国有资格在高等法院出庭的〕讼务律师﹐大律师

Sense.DEF: a bar
a small vehicle like a box on wheels, from which fruits, vegetables etc used to be sold

a large pile of earth like a small hill that was put over a
grave
in ancient times

a
wheelbarrow
a man or boy who sells fruit, vegetables etc from a barrow
someone who makes, pours, and serves drinks in a bar or restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 酒吧侍应生﹐酒吧招待﹔酒保

Sense.DEF: to exchange goods, work, or services for other goods or services rather than for money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to barter with the locals for food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得和当地人换点食物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They bartered their grain for salt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用谷物换取盐。

Sense.DEF: a system of exchanging goods and services for other goods and services rather than using money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trading was carried out under a barter system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时的贸易是物物交换。

Sense.DEF: goods or services that are exchanged by bartering
Sense.TRAN: 易货贸易中的商品[服务]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We used cigarettes for barter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用香烟作交换。

Sense.DEF: a type of dark green-black rock
to have your main place of work, business etc in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paper had intended to base itself in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家报社原来打算把总部设在伦敦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new organization will be based in Dallas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新的机构总部将设在达拉斯。

Sense.DEF: to use something as the thing from which something else is developed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their relationship was based upon mutual respect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间的关系以相互尊重为基础。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an economy based on farming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以农业为基础的经济

Subsense.DEF: the lowest part or surface of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a door at the base of the tower.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔基上有一扇门。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the base of a triangle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三角形的底边

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a frozen dessert with a biscuit base
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个以脆饼作底的冻甜品
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a wine glass with a heavy base
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个杯底厚实的葡萄酒杯
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The leather of his left trainer was coming away from its rubber base.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他左脚运动鞋上的皮面快要从橡胶底上脱落下来了。

Subsense.DEF: the lowest point on a plant or part of your body, where it joins another part
Subsense.TRAN: 〔植物或身体部位的〕基部，连接处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hole in the base of the tree
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这棵树根部的一个洞
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was killed by an axe blow to the base of his skull.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是颅底遭斧子重创死亡的。

Sense.DEF: the most important part of something, from which new ideas develop
Sense.EXAMPLE: India has a good scientific research base.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度有良好的科研基础。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were laying the base for a new economic recovery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在为经济的再次复苏打基础。

Sense.DEF: a place where people in a military organization live and work
the main place from which a person, company, or organization controls their activities
Sense.TRAN: 基地﹐根据地﹐总部﹐大本营

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He used the house as a base for his printing business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把这房子作为他印刷业务的基地。

Sense.DEF: the people, money, groups etc that form the main part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has built up a loyal customer base .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司已经建立了一个稳定的客户基础。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
By broadening the tax base
all the people who pay taxes
, he could raise more revenues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过扩大征税来源﹐他就可以增加财政收入。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an attempt to strengthen the city’s economic base
things that produce jobs and money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加强本市经济基础的一项举措
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The country’s manufacturing base
all the factories, companies etc that produce goods in a country
has shrunk by 20%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的制造业基础萎缩了20%。

Sense.DEF: the main part of a substance, meal etc to which other things are added
Sense.EXAMPLE: paint with an oil base
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油基涂料

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vodka is the base for many cocktails.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伏特加是许多鸡尾酒的基酒。

Sense.DEF:
one of the four places that a player must touch in order to get a point in games such as
baseball
to be completely wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: His estimate for painting the kitchen seems way off base.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对粉刷厨房的费用估计似乎差得太远了。

Sense.DEF:
a chemical substance that combines with an acid to form a
salt

the number in relation to which a number system or mathematical table is built up, for example 10 in the
decimal
system
to talk to someone to find out what is happening about something
not having good moral principles
Sense.EXAMPLE: base attitudes and desires
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑鄙的态度和欲望

Sense.DEF:
an outdoor game between two teams of nine players, in which players try to get points by hitting a ball and running around four
base s
the ball used in baseball

Sense.DEF: a hat that fits closely around your head with a round part that sticks out at the front
a narrow board fixed to the bottom of indoor walls where they meet the floor

Sense.DEF: if you are based somewhere, that is the place where you work or where your main business is
Sense.TRAN: 办公地点在…的﹔以…为总部的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is a professional service based at our offices in Oxford.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项专业服务由我们在牛津的办事处提供。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a London-based firm of accountants
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总部设在伦敦的一家会计师事务所

Sense.DEF: used to describe the basic feature or part of something

Sense.EXAMPLE: community-based services

Sense.DEF: based on many kinds of things or people

a sport in which people jump off tall objects such as buildings, bridges, or cliffs, using a

not based on facts or good reasons – used to show disapproval

Sense.DEF: a standard measurement or fact against which other measurements or facts are compared, especially in medicine or science
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指医学或科学中的〕基线﹐准线
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s waste emissions were 14% lower than in 1998, the baseline year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司废弃物的排放比基准年1998年低14%。

the line at the back of the court in games such as tennis or

the area that a player must run within, on a

a room or area in a building that is under the level of the ground
a metal that is not very valuable, such as iron or lead

in Britain, the standard rate of

, set by the Bank of England, on which all British banks base their charges

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
basis
to hit someone or something hard, in a way that causes pain or damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone bashed him on the back of his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人猛击他的后脑勺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police bashed down the door to get in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察破门而入。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He bashed his head on the back of the seat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一头撞在椅子背上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I accidentally bashed into a woman pushing a pram.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不小心撞到了一个 推着婴儿车的妇女。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was always bashing the trade unions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他动不动就大肆抨击工会。

Sense.DEF: to continue working in order to finish something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I’d better bash on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐我得加把劲了。

Sense.DEF: to produce something quickly or in great quantities but without much care or thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bashed out replies as fast as I could.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用最快的速度草草写了几封回信。

Sense.DEF: to seriously hurt someone by attacking them violently
a hard strong hit

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bash on the head
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 头上的一记痛击

Sense.DEF: a party or an event to celebrate something
Sense.TRAN: 热闹的聚会﹔痛快的玩乐﹐狂欢
Sense.EXAMPLE: a birthday bash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生日聚会

Sense.DEF: to try to do something, especially when you are not sure that you will succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why not have a bash at windsurfing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不尝试一下帆板运动？

Sense.DEF: easily embarrassed in social situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bashful grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腼腆的笑容
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be bashful about telling people how you feel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要羞于说出自己的感受。

Sense.DEF: the action of attacking someone and hitting them
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Gay-bashing
attacks on gay people
is on the increase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 殴打同性恋者的事件越来越多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They gave him a real bashing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们狠狠地打了他一顿。

Sense.DEF: strong and usually unfair public criticism of a particular group or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: union-bashing in the right-wing press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 右翼报纸上对工会的抨击

Sense.DEF: forming the most important or most necessary part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the basic principles of chemistry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学的基本原理
Sense.EXAMPLE: The basic idea is simple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基本思想很简单。
基础研究
基本信息

GramExa.EXAMPLE: medical techniques basic to the control of infection
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制感染最基本的医疗技术

Sense.DEF: at the simplest or least developed level
Sense.TRAN: 基本的﹐最简单的﹐最初级的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the basic skills of programming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编程基本技巧
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their knowledge is very basic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们所掌握的知识是相当初级的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The farm lacks even basic equipment .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个农场连最基本的设备都没有。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that you are paid before any special payments are added
Sense.TRAN: 基本工资/底薪/基本养老金等
Sense.EXAMPLE: On top of the basic salary, there are numerous other benefits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了基本工资外还有许多其他的福利。

Sense.DEF: basic rights, needs etc are ones that everyone needs or should have
Sense.TRAN: 〔权利﹑需要等〕最基本的﹐起码的
Sense.EXAMPLE: basic human rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基本的人权
Sense.EXAMPLE: poor families unable to meet their basic needs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连最基本的需求都得不到满足的贫困家庭

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the most important reason or fact about something, or a simple explanation of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Basically, I’m just lazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说穿了﹐我就是懒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, basically, it’s a matter of filling in a few forms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐其实也就是填几张表的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used to see him every night, basically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基本上﹐我以前每天晚上都见他。

Sense.DEF: in the main or most important ways, without considering additional details or differences
Sense.EXAMPLE: All cheeses are made in basically the same way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的干酪基本上都是相同的做法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I believe that human beings are basically good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信人本质上都是善良的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Basically, he hadn’t changed at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他基本上一点也没变。

Sense.DEF: the most important and necessary facts about something, from which other possibilities and ideas may develop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the basics of French grammar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法语语法基础

Sense.EXAMPLE: Here are some of the basics you will need to know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有些基本原则你需要掌握。

Sense.DEF: things that everyone needs in order to live or to deal with a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: basics like food and education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粮食和教育等基本需求

Sense.DEF: used to describe a return to teaching or doing the most important or simplest things
Sense.TRAN: 回归到基本的教育[做法]﹐返璞归真
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of parents want schools to get back to basics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多家长希望学校回归基础教育。

a strong-smelling and strong-tasting
herb
used in cooking

Sense.DEF: a church in the shape of a long room with a round end

Sense.DEF: an imaginary animal like a snake in ancient stories, supposed to be able to kill people by looking at them

Sense.DEF: a round container attached to the wall in a bathroom, where you wash your hands and face

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗脸盆

Sense.DEF: a large bowl-shaped container for liquids or food

Sense.DEF: the amount of liquid that a basin can contain

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is lower at the centre than at the edges, especially one from which water runs down into a river
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Amazon basin
