Sense.DEF: a place where the Earth’s surface is lower than in other areas
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Pacific Basin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太平洋海盆

Sense.DEF: the facts, ideas, or things from which something can be developed
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Their claim had no basis in fact
it was not true
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的说法没有事实根据。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bread forms the basis of their daily diet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 面包是他们日常饮食中的主食。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The video will provide a basis for class discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像将为课堂讨论提供基本内容。

Sense.DEF: because of a particular fact or situation
Sense.TRAN: 在某事的基础上﹔根据某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: discrimination on the basis of sex
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性别歧视

Sense.DEF: every day, week etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m saving money on a regular basis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我定期存钱。

Sense.DEF:
a system or agreement by which someone or something is
voluntary
etc
Sense.TRAN: 自愿性质/以兼职的形式/临时性地等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nurses are employed on a full-time basis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士是全职的。

Exponent.DEF: the facts, ideas, things etc from which something can be developed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His work will be used as a basis for future research.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作将作为未来研究的基础。

Exponent.DEF: the thing on which something is based, especially something important that continues for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指长期持续的重要之事的〕根据﹐基础﹐基本原理
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their ideas were the foundation for the political system that exists in the UK today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的观点是今日英国政治体系的基础。

Exponent.DEF: the most important thing that something depends on in order to be successful
Exponent.TRAN: 〔获得成功所必需的〕基础﹐基石
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Honesty is the bedrock of any healthy relationship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 诚实是任何良好关系的基础。

Exponent.DEF: the most important thing that something depends on in order to be successful, especially in business and politics
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指商业或政治的〕基础﹐柱石
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Confidence is the cornerstone of our business.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 信心是我们这一行的基石。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat of the sun or a fire

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lizards were basking in the morning sun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜥蜴正在享受早晨的阳光。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们到达的时候﹐特内里费正沐浴在午后的阳光中。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy the approval or attention that you are getting from other people

a very offensive word for someone, especially a man, who you think is unpleasant. Do not use this word.

Sense.DEF: a man who you think is very lucky or very unlucky – often used humorously

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些俱乐部是男人特权的最后堡垒。

Sense.DEF: a place where a country or army has strong military defences

Sense.DEF: a part of a castle wall that sticks out from the rest

Subsense.DEF: a long wooden stick with a special shape that is used in some sports and games

Sense.DEF:
to be the person who is trying to hit the ball in a game of

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth off your own bat

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth right off the bat
Sense.DEF: to do something immediately

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当即就答应了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: like a bat out of hell
Sense.DEF: very fast

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant old woman

to hit the ball with a bat in
cricket
or

Sense.DEF: to not seem to be shocked, surprised, or embarrassed

Sense.DEF: if a woman bats her eyes, she opens and closes them several times quickly, in order to look attractive to men

Sense.DEF: to help and support someone

Sense.DEF: to discuss various ideas or suggestions

a boy whose job is to look after the equipment of a

team

Sense.DEF: a quantity of food, medicine etc that is produced or prepared at the same time

Sense.DEF: a set of jobs that are dealt with together on a computer

Sense.DEF: a type of computer system in which the computer does several jobs one after the other, without needing instructions between each job

Sense.DEF: if you take a bath, you wash your body in a bath

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我露营了一个星期﹐实在得洗个澡了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll have a bath and go to bed.

I’ll give the children their bath
wash them in a bath
.

water that you sit or lie in to wash yourself

put water into a bath
.

Sense.DEF: a bathroom, used especially in advertising

Sense.EXAMPLE: All our luxury bedrooms have a private bath.

Sense.DEF: a container full of liquid in which something is placed for a particular purpose

Sense.DEF: to lose money, especially in a business deal

Crossrefto.REFLEX: throw the baby out with the bath water

Sense.DEF: to wash someone in a bath

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要给孩子们洗澡。

Sense.DEF: to wash yourself in a bath
a special chair with wheels and a cover, used in the past for moving someone old or sick around

Sense.DEF: to wash yourself or someone else in a bath

F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say go for/have a swim rather than bathe

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of wood that is attached to other pieces of wood or another building material to strengthen them and keep them in place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Armed police battered his door down.

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is hit many times
a long heavy piece of wood, used in wars in the past to break through walls or doors

Sense.DEF: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to take the top off to change the batteries .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得把顶盖拿掉才能更换电池。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the red light comes on, you should recharge the battery .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红灯亮起的时候你就应该给电池充电了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s got a flat battery .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的蓄电池没电了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a battery-operated hairdryer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用电池的吹风机

Sense.DEF: a group of many things of the same type

Sense.EXAMPLE: a battery of medical tests

Sense.DEF:
a row of small
cage s
in which chickens are kept, so that the farm can produce large numbers of eggs
Sense.EXAMPLE: battery hens

Sense.DEF: several large guns used together
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anti-aircraft battery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防空炮

Sense.DEF: the crime of hitting someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was charged with assault and battery .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控殴打和侵犯人身罪。

Sense.DEF: to rest or relax in order to get back your energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: A week in the mountains should recharge my batteries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在山里待一个星期，我的精力应该能恢复过来。

Sense.DEF: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指大型战争中的〕战斗﹐战役
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Battle of Trafalgar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特拉法尔加战役

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her son was killed in battle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她儿子在战斗中阵亡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a knight riding into battle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 策马上战场的一名骑士

GramExa.EXAMPLE: battles between government forces and the rebels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府军和叛军之间的战斗

Sense.EXAMPLE:
a pitched battle
a long and serious battle
between police and drug gangs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

Sense.DEF: a situation in which opposing groups or people compete or argue with each other when trying to achieve success or control
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-running legal battle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场旷日持久的法律争讼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a battle for custody of their children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 子女监护权之争

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fierce ratings battle between rival TV stations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相互竞争的电视台之间一场激烈的收视率大战

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an ongoing battle with my mother about eating properly
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和母亲有关合理饮食的持续争论

Sense.DEF: an attempt to solve a difficult problem or change an unpleasant situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a battle against the racism of the school system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场反对学校种族歧视的斗争

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long battle with lung cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与肺癌的长期抗争

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientology has fought long battles for acceptance as a religion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学论派为使人们承认它是一种宗教而进行了长期的斗争。

Sense.DEF: to be a difficult or important part of what you have to do
Sense.TRAN: 是（完成某事）的关键（最艰难阶段）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just getting an interview is half the battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要得到面试机会就等于成功了一半。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which opposing sides try to win by using their intelligence
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good mystery story is a battle of wits between author and reader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的悬疑故事是作者和读者之间智慧的较量。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which opposing sides refuse to change what they want, in the hope that the other side will decide to change first
Sense.EXAMPLE: a battle of wills between teacher and student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 师生之间意志的较量

Sense.DEF: to argue with someone or fight against someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked into the room with her eyes blazing, ready to do battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼里燃着怒火走进房间﹐一副随时准备吵架的样子。

Sense.DEF: to argue with someone, or compete in a difficult situation, without having help from other people – used to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s all right, Mum. I can fight my own battles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没关系﹐妈妈﹐我自己能应付。

Sense.DEF: the relationship between men and women when it is considered as a fight for power
Sense.TRAN: 两性的较量〔指争夺权力〕

Sense.DEF: the act of trying to lose weight – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 反肥战﹐减肥之战〔幽默用法〕

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - Meaning 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police are fighting a tough battle against crime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在和犯罪活动进行艰苦的斗争。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s essential to win the battle against inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须打胜抑制通货膨胀这场战斗。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a brave little girl who lost her battle against cancer
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没能战胜癌症的勇敢小女孩

Collocate.EXAMPLE: his long battle with alcoholism
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与酗酒所作的长期斗争

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is very difficult
Collocate.EXAMPLE: For most people losing weight is an uphill battle.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大多数人而言﹐减肥是一场艰苦的斗争。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He faces a tough battle to prove his innocence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为证明自己清白而面临一场艰难的斗争。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As a student, life was a constant battle against debt.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生时期的生活就是不停地应付债务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is going to fail
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was fighting a losing battle to stop herself from crying.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她极力忍住不哭却只是徒劳。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to achieve something that is difficult or dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firefighters battled the flames.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员与烈火搏斗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had battled against cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她曾与癌症抗争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pressure group battling for better schools
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为改善学校条件而斗争的压力团体

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors battled to save his life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生奋力挽救他的生命。

Sense.DEF: to keep fighting or opposing each other until one person or team wins

Sense.DEF: to take part in a fight or war

Sense.EXAMPLE: a storage bay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 储藏室
Sense.EXAMPLE: loading bay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装货区

Sense.DEF: the part of a ship or plane where things are stored
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cargo bay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 货舱

Sense.DEF: a tree that has leaves that smell sweet and are often used in cooking
a horse that is a reddish brown colour
if a dog bays, it makes a long high noise, especially when it is chasing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: dogs baying at the moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对着月亮狂吠的狗

Sense.DEF: to make strong demands to get answers to questions or force someone to give you something

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
Reporters began baying for the president’s blood
demanding that he be punished
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者开始大声疾呼﹐要求给予总统惩罚。

Sense.DEF: a bay horse is reddish brown in colour
a sweet-smelling leaf from the bay tree, used in cooking

an area on the south coast of Cuba which is famous for a military attack that took place in 1961. A group of Cubans living in the US tried to enter Cuba with the aim of ending the government of Fidel Castro. They were trained and supported by the US, but the attack failed and they were all put into prison or killed.
Sense.TRAN: 猪湾〔古巴南部海湾﹐1961年美国在此策动一次失败的入侵〕

Sense.DEF:
a long knife that is fixed to the end of a
rifle
long gun
to push the point of a bayonet into someone
a large area of water in the southeast US that moves very slowly and has many water plants
Sense.TRAN: 牛轭湖﹐长沼〔美国东南部水流缓慢﹑水草繁多的大片水域〕

Sense.DEF: a window that sticks out from the wall of a house, usually with glass on three sides
a market or area where there are a lot of small shops, especially in India or the Middle East
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指印度或中东的〕市场﹐集市

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a lot of people sell different things to collect money for a good purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a church bazaar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂义卖

Sense.DEF:
a long light gun that rests on your shoulder and is used for shooting at
tank s
Sense.TRAN: 〔扛在肩上发射的〕反坦克火箭筒

Sense.DEF: the British radio and television company that is paid for by the public

a standard form of British English pronunciation that was traditionally taught to people learning English in many parts of the world. For many years, almost everyone speaking on BBC programmes used this form of pronunciation, but many different types of British pronunciation can now be heard on the BBC.
Sense.TRAN: 英国广播公司标准英语﹐BBC英语〔一种标准的英国英语发音﹐传统上都以这种英语教授给世界各地的英语学习者〕

Sense.DEF: a gun that uses air pressure to shoot small round metal balls

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= barbecue 烧烤野餐

Sense.DEF: used after a date to show that it was before the birth of Christ
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Great Pyramid dates from around 2600 BC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大金字塔建于公元前2600年左右。

Sense.DEF:
used in an
email
when you are sending a copy of a message to various people, when you do not give a complete list of all the people you are sending the message to
Sense.TRAN: 〔电子邮件的〕密件抄送﹐密件副本

Sense.DEF: used after a date to show that it is before the birth of Christ

a
vaccine
used to protect people from getting the disease
tuberculosis
Sense.TRAN: 卡介苗〔一种预防结核病的疫苗〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a BCG vaccination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡介苗的接种

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= body dysmorphic disorder 躯体变形障碍﹐自觉躯体畸形症

Sense.DEF:
used with a present participle to form the
continuous 4
tenses of verbs
Sense.TRAN: 〔和现在分词构成动词的进行时态〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t disturb me while I’m working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我工作的时候不要打扰我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gemma was reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉玛正在看书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve been asking a lot of questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经问了许多问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That guy’s always causing trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家伙总是惹麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be starting in about an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过一小时左右开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He isn’t leaving, is he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不会走吧？

Sense.DEF:
used with past participles to form the
passive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is not permitted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止吸烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was told about it yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天有人告诉了我这件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house is being painted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子正在上油漆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been invited to a party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受邀参加聚会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flames could be seen several miles away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熊熊的火焰在几英里以外都能看见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police should have been informed about this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察本应获悉此事。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about arrangements for the future
Subsense.TRAN: 将要做某事〔用于表示将来的安排〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Audrey and Jimmy are to be married in June.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥德丽和吉米将在六月份结婚。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Two men are to appear in court on charges of armed robbery.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子因被控持械抢劫将出庭受审。

Subsense.DEF: used to give an order or to tell someone about a rule
Subsense.TRAN: 必须做某事〔用于下命令或解释规则〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You are to wait here in this room until I return.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须留在这个房间里等到我回来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All staff are to wear uniforms.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有员工都必须穿制服。

Subsense.DEF: used to say or ask what someone should do or what should happen
Subsense.TRAN: 应该做某事〔用于表示或询问某人应该做什么或应该会发生什么事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What am I to tell her?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该对她说什么呢？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He is not to be blamed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不应该怪他。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask how something can be done
Subsense.TRAN: 应该做某事〔用于询问某事可以怎么做〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How are we to get out of the present mess?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该如何摆脱目前的困境呢？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something can be seen, found, or heard somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large range of species are to be seen in the aquarium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水族馆里可以看到许许多多不同种类的鱼。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
We searched everywhere but the ring was nowhere to be found
could not be found
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找遍了所有地方﹐却怎么都找不到那枚戒指。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only sound to be heard was the twittering of the birds above us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一能听到的声音就是鸟儿在我们头顶上的啁啾。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about a time in the past to say what happened later
Sense.TRAN: 后来发生某事〔用于谈及过去某时间之后发生的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This discovery was to have a major effect on the treatment of heart disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一发现后来对心脏病的治疗产生了重大影响。

Subsense.DEF:
used in
conditional 1 2
sentences about an imagined situation
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于条件句﹐表示虚拟的情况〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: were sb to do sth/if sb were to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even if England were to win the next two matches, Germany would still be three points ahead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使英格兰队在接下来的两场比赛中都胜出﹐德国队也还是领先三分。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Were we to offer you the job, would you take it?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们给你这份工作﹐你会接受吗？

Subsense.DEF:
used in
conditional
sentences to introduce an aim when you are saying what must be done in order to achieve it

GramExa.PROPFORM: if sb/sth is to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If we are to succeed in this enterprise, we shall need to plan everything very carefully.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要是想把这个企业办好﹐每一件事情都要认认真真地去计划。

Sense.DEF:
used instead of ‘have’ to form the
perfect 3
tense of some verbs
Sense.TRAN: 〔代替have构成某些动词的完成时态〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hour is come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一时刻已经来临。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is the same as the subject of the sentence
Sense.TRAN: 是〔表示某人或某物与主语相同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My name is Susan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的名字叫苏珊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are my favourite pictures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些是我最喜欢的照片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s my brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我弟弟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem is finding the time to get things done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题是要抽出时间把事情做好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our aim was to reduce the number of accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是减少事故。

Sense.DEF: used to say where something or someone is
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示某物或某人在哪里〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane’s upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简在楼上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are my keys in the drawer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钥匙在抽屉里吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The principal’s in his office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长在自己的办公室里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long has she been here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来这儿有多久了？

Sense.DEF: used to say when something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert was last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会在昨晚举行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party is on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会在星期六。

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone or something, or say what group or type they belong to
Sense.TRAN: 是 〔描述某人或某物的特征或所属的群体或类型〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky was grey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空灰蒙蒙的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spiders are not really insects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜘蛛实际上不是昆虫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Cardew was a tall thin man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡迪尤先生是个又高又瘦的男人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wants to be a doctor when she leaves school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她毕业后想当医生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dress was pure silk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的连衣裙是真丝的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not ready yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没准备好呢。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something exists or happens
Sense.TRAN: 有﹐存在〔表示某物存在或某事发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a hole in your trousers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的裤子上有个洞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a loud explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传来巨大的爆炸声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I thought there was going to be a party.’ ‘No, there isn’t.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我以为要举行派对呢。”“没有派对。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there a problem?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有问题吗？

Sense.DEF: to behave in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was just being rude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当时就是很无礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be silly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别傻了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better be careful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好小心点。

Sense.DEF: used to say how old someone is
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother died when he was 20.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲是在他20岁的时候去世的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel will be three in November.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到十一月蕾切尔就三岁了。

Sense.DEF: used to say who something belongs to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whose is this bag? It isn’t mine and it isn’t Sarah’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个包是谁的？不是我的也不是萨拉的。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the price of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How much are the melons?’ ‘The big ones are £2 each.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这甜瓜多少钱？”“大的两英镑一个。”

Sense.DEF: to be equal to a particular number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: 32 divided by 8 is 4.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 32除以8等于4。

Sense.DEF: used to say that even though you accept that something is true, it does not change a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He was only joking.’ ‘Be that as it may, silly remarks like that can do a lot of harm.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他不过是开个玩笑。”“即便如此﹐像这样的蠢话也会造成很大的伤害。”

Sense.DEF: to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: What was once a great and powerful empire has effectively ceased to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个曾经伟大而强盛的帝国实际上已经不复存在了。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a natural way, rather than trying to pretend to be different
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t try too hard – just be yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要太刻意——你该怎么样就怎么样吧。

Sense.DEF: to be behaving in a way that is unusual for you, especially because you are ill or upset
Sense.TRAN: 不是你正常的状况﹐状态不好〔尤因为生病或不高兴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry – I’m not myself this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起——我今天上午状态不好。

Sense.DEF: the most important part of a situation or of someone’s life
Sense.TRAN: 首要的事情﹐最要紧的事情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For Jim, making money was the be-all and end-all of his job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对吉姆来讲﹐挣钱是他工作中最要紧的事情。

Sense.DEF: used to mean that someone or something is treated in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Don’t belittle him
say he is unimportant
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要小看他。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He befriended me
became my friend
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他待我如朋友。

Sense.DEF: wearing or covered by a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a bespectacled boy
wearing glasses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴眼镜的男孩

Sense.DEF: an area of sand or small stones at the edge of the sea or a lake
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sandy beach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙滩
Sense.EXAMPLE: surfers on the beach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙滩上的冲浪者

Sense.DEF: to pull a boat onto the shore away from the water

if a
whale
beaches itself or is beached, it swims onto the shore and cannot get back in the water
a large coloured plastic ball that you blow air into and use for playing games on the beach
a folding chair with a seat and back made of cloth or plastic that is used outdoors, especially at the beach
Sense.TRAN: 沙滩椅〔帆布或塑料制的折叠躺椅﹐尤在海滩上使用〕

Sense.DEF: someone who searches beaches for interesting or useful things
an area of shore that has been taken from an enemy by force, and from which the army can prepare to attack a country
clothes that you wear for swimming, lying on the beach etc
a light that is put somewhere to warn or guide people, ships, vehicles, or aircraft

a radio or
radar
signal used by aircraft or boats to help them find their position and direction
a person, idea etc that guides or encourages you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The education program offers a beacon of hope to these children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项教育计划为这些儿童燃起了希望之光。

Sense.DEF: a fire on top of a hill used in the past as a signal
one of a set of small, usually round, pieces of glass, wood, plastic etc, that you can put on a string and wear as jewellery
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore a string of green glass beads around her neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脖子上戴着一串绿色的玻璃珠子。

Sense.DEF: a small drop of liquid such as water or blood
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体的〕小珠子﹐小滴〔如水珠﹑血滴等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beads of sweat trickled down his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上淌着汗珠。

Sense.DEF: to aim carefully before shooting a weapon
decorated with beads
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beaded dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条缀有珠子的连衣裙

Sense.DEF:
having drops of
sweat
liquid produced by your body when you are hot
on your skin
long thin pieces of wood or stone that are used as a decoration on the edges of walls, furniture etc
a lot of beads sewn close together on clothes, leather etc as decoration
an officer in British churches in the past, who helped the priest in various ways, especially by keeping order
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国旧时教区的〕执事﹐牧师助手

Sense.DEF: beady eyes are small, round, and shiny – used especially about someone who you think looks dishonest or strange
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛〕珠子般又圆又亮的〔尤指某人看上去不诚实或奇怪〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: have/keep your beady eye(s) on sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to watch someone or something very carefully – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 睁大眼睛看某人/某物〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a dog with short legs and smooth fur, sometimes used in hunting
Sense.TRAN: 毕格尔犬〔短腿软毛﹐有时用于狩猎〕

Sense.DEF: the hard pointed mouth of a bird
a large pointed nose – used humorously
a judge or a male teacher
a drinking cup with straight sides and no handle, usually made of plastic
Sense.TRAN: 〔直身无柄﹐一般用塑料做成的〕杯子

Sense.DEF: a glass cup with straight sides that is used in chemistry for measuring and heating liquids

Subsense.DEF: a line of light shining from the sun, a lamp etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the beam of a powerful flashlight
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手电筒的一道强光

Subsense.DEF: a line of light, energy etc that you cannot see
Subsense.TRAN: 束﹐柱〔指看不见的光﹑能量等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a laser beam
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光束

Sense.DEF: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc
a wide happy smile
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beam of delight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜悦的笑容

Sense.DEF: incorrect or mistaken
Sense.TRAN: 不正确的﹐错误的﹐不对头的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our guesses were way off beam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的猜测完全错了。

Sense.DEF:
a
balance beam
the widest part of a ship from side to side
to smile very happily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sherman looked at his sons and beamed proudly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢尔曼看着儿子们﹐自豪地笑着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Connie beamed with pleasure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康妮喜笑颜开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: McLeish beamed at her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克利什笑容满面地看着她。

Sense.DEF: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant
Sense.TRAN: 发送〔无线电或电视信号〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first sports broadcast to be beamed across the Atlantic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首次向大西洋彼岸播送的体育节目

Sense.DEF: to send out a line of light, heat, energy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun beamed through the clouds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光穿透了云层。

Sense.DEF: a name for any car made by BMW
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s his white Beamer convertible over there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那边是他的那辆白色宝马敞篷车。

Sense.DEF:
a seed or a
pod
case containing seeds
, that comes from a climbing plant and is cooked as food. There are very many types of beans.
Sense.EXAMPLE: baked beans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烘豆
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soak the beans overnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把豆子浸泡一夜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: kidney beans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芸豆
Sense.EXAMPLE: green beans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青刀豆﹐四季豆

Sense.DEF: a plant that produces beans
a seed used in making some types of food or drinks
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于做某类食物或饮料的〕籽实
Sense.EXAMPLE: coffee beans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡豆
Sense.EXAMPLE: cocoa beans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可可豆

Sense.DEF: to be very eager and full of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s full of beans this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她今天早上精神十足。

Sense.DEF: to have no money at all
to not know anything or care at all about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: （对某人/某物）一无所知/毫不关心

Crossrefto.REFLEX: it doesn't amount to a hill of beans

Sense.DEF: to hit someone on the head with an object
a very large cloth bag that is filled with small balls of soft plastic and used for sitting on
a small cloth bag filled with beans, used for throwing and catching in children’s games
someone whose job is to examine the cost of doing something, and who is concerned only with making a profit – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 很会算计钱的人﹐只重赢利的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since the bean counters took over the radio station, it’s become a boring place to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从那些只知道算计钱的家伙接手电台以后﹐在这里工作就没劲了。

Sense.DEF:
a soft white food made from
soya bean s
a party or celebration
a small round hat that fits close to your head
a very tall thin person – used humorously
the small white stem from a bean seed that is eaten as a vegetable
to bravely accept or deal with a painful, difficult, or upsetting situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was afraid she wouldn’t be able to bear the pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恐怕自己忍受不了这种痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Overcrowding makes prison life even harder to bear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过度拥挤使监狱生活更加难以忍受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make the water as hot as you can bear .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把水温调到你能忍受的最高温度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The humiliation was more than he could bear .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的羞辱是他万万不能忍受的。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Black people continue to bear the brunt of most racial violence
have to deal with the most difficult or damaging part
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大多数种族暴力事件中﹐黑人仍然是首当其冲的受害群体。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Passengers could be insulting, and stewardesses just had to grin and bear it
accept it without complaining
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客有时会破口大骂﹐而乘务员只能微笑着默默忍受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Experts were worried the financial system would not be able to bear the strain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家担心现行金融体系承受不了这样的压力。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that they can’t stand something, rather than that they can't bear it
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说can’t stand﹐而不说can’t bear
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stand the noise any longer.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再也受不了那噪音了。

Subsense.DEF: to be so upset about something that you feel unable to accept it or let it happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Please don’t leave me. I couldn’t bear it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你不要离开我﹐我受不了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: can’t bear the thought of (doing) sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just can’t bear the thought of having to start all over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想都不敢想要从头开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t bear to see her cry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不忍心看见她哭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t bear not seeing him again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能忍受再也见不到他。

Subsense.DEF: to dislike something or someone very much, often so that they make you feel annoyed or impatient
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Oh, I really can’t bear him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐我实在受不了他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He can’t bear people smoking while he’s eating.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受不了有人在他吃饭的时候吸烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t bear being cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怕冷。

Sense.DEF: to remember a fact or piece of information that is important or could be useful in the future
Sense.TRAN: 记住（某事）﹐把（某事）记在心里

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bear in mind that some children will need help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住﹐有些孩子需要帮助。

Sense.DEF: to be responsible for or accept something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each company will bear half the costs of development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家公司将均摊开发费用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Fares have gone up, perhaps to more than the market will bear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 票价上涨了﹐而且可能超出了市场的承受能力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Developed countries bear much of the responsibility for environmental problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发达国家对环境问题负有主要责任。

Sense.DEF: to be under something and support it
Sense.EXAMPLE: My leg was painful, and I wasn’t sure it would bear my weight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的腿痛﹐不知道是否还能承受我身体的重量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tray bearing a bottle and several glasses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆着一个瓶子和几个杯子的托盘
Sense.EXAMPLE: a load-bearing wall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 承重墙

Sense.DEF: to have or show a sign, mark, or particular appearance, especially when this shows that something has happened or is true
Sense.TRAN: 带有〔某种标记或外观特征〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The letter bore no signature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信上没有署名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car bearing diplomatic license plates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挂外交牌照的车
Sense.EXAMPLE: The labels bear a yellow and black symbol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标签上有一个黄黑两色的标记。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town still bears the scars of the bombings during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城里依然可见战时轰炸留下的疮痍。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The store bears the hallmarks
it has the qualities
of a family-owned business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个商店有家族企业的特色。

Sense.DEF: to be similar to someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child bore a striking resemblance to his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个孩子长得跟他父亲非常相像。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The things she says bear little relation to what she actually does.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她言行不一。

Sense.DEF: to give birth to a baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: She might never be able to bear children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能永远无法生育。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She bore him three sons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为他生了三个儿子。

Subsense.DEF: if a plan, decision etc bears fruit, it is successful, especially after a long period of time
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指计划﹑决定等经过长时间之后〕有成果﹐成功
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Charles’s diplomacy eventually bore fruit.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯的外交手段终于取得了成果。

Subsense.DEF: if a tree bears fruit, it produces fruit

Sense.DEF: to be suitable or good enough to be examined, compared, repeated etc without failing or being wrong
Sense.TRAN: 经得起〔检验﹑比较﹑重复等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The production figures did not bear scrutiny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个产量数据经不起推敲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We believe our pupils’ results will bear comparison with any in Scotland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相信﹐我校学生的成绩堪与苏格兰的任何一所学校相比。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story is well known, but it certainly bears repeating .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事是广为人知的﹐但它无疑也经得起传诵。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is so upsetting or shocking that you prefer not to think about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The long-term consequences of a nuclear leak don’t bear thinking about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核泄漏造成的长期后果不堪设想。

Sense.DEF: to carry someone or something, especially something important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wedding guests arrived, bearing gifts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加婚礼的宾客带着礼物到来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US Constitution states that the people have a right to bear arms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国宪法上写明民众有权携带武器。

Sense.DEF: to use your influence or power to get what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unions can bring pressure to bear on governments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会可以对政府施加压力。

Sense.DEF: to show that something is true or exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: The empty workshops bear witness to the industrial past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空空的工场见证了工业的历史。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular feeling, especially a bad feeling
Sense.TRAN: 怀有〔某种情感﹐尤指不好的情感〕

GramExa.GLOSS: continue to feel annoyed after a long time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was an accident. I don’t bear any grudges.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个意外﹐我并没有放在心上。

GramExa.PROPFORM: bear sb no malice/ill will etc
GramExa.GLOSS: not feel angry
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对某人没有恶意/敌意等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was just doing his job, and I bore him no malice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是在做他的工作﹐我不怨他。

Sense.DEF: to turn towards the right or left
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you reach the fork in the trail, bear left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走到小路分岔的地方时左转。

Sense.DEF: to walk, stand etc in a particular way, especially when this shows your character
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bore herself with great dignity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她端庄极了。

Sense.DEF: if wind, water, or air bears something, it carries it somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sound of music was borne along on the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐声随风飘送。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular name or title
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bore the name ‘Magnus’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有“伟大者”之称。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verbs bear, stand, and endure in spoken and written English, with the meaning 'accept or deal with an unpleasant situation'. 动词bear﹐stand和endure(作“忍受”解时)在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

All three verbs are used to mean 'accept or deal with an unpleasant situation'. This graph shows that in this meaning stand and bear are much more common than endure in spoken English. In written English, bear is the most common, and endure, a formal word, is fairly common. 这三个动词都有“忍受”的意思。本图表显示﹐作此义解时﹐stand和bear 在英语口语中的使用频率远远高于endure。在英语书面语中﹐bear最常用﹐endure语气正式﹐也比较常用。

Subsense.DEF: to move quickly towards a person or place in a threatening way
Subsense.TRAN: 向某人/某物逼近﹔冲向某人/某物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a storm bearing down on the island
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逐渐逼近该岛的一场暴风雨

Subsense.DEF: to behave in a threatening or controlling way towards a person or group
Subsense.TRAN: 向某人施加压力﹔严厉对待某人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Federal regulators have been bearing down on campaign contributors.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦监管人员一直向竞选捐助人施加压力。

Sense.DEF: to use all your strength and effort to push or press down on something
to relate to and possibly influence something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the national policies which bear on these problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及此类问题的国家政策

Sense.DEF: if facts or information bear out a claim, story, opinion etc, they help to prove that it is true
Sense.TRAN: 为…作证﹐证实﹐支持〔某种说法﹑看法等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evidence bears out the idea that students learn best in small groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有证据显示﹐学生以小组方式学习效果最佳。

Sense.DEF: to show courage or determination during a difficult or unpleasant time
Sense.EXAMPLE: How is he bearing up since the accident?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次事故以后他是怎么挺过来的？

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone politely to wait while you find out information, finish what you are doing etc
Sense.TRAN: 等我一会儿﹐请你稍等〔用于礼貌地请求某人等你找出信息﹑做完手头的事情等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bear with me a minute, and I’ll check if Mr Garrard’s in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请等一下﹐我看看加勒德先生在不在。

Sense.DEF: to be patient or continue to do something difficult or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s boring, but please bear with it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是很没劲﹐但请你忍耐一下。

Sense.DEF: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mother bear and her cubs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母熊和它的熊崽们

Sense.DEF: something that is very difficult to do or to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 难做的事情﹔棘手的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chemistry test was a bear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个化学测验难度很大。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be like a bear with a sore head
Sense.DEF: to be rude to people because you are feeling bad-tempered

someone who sells
share s
or goods when they expect the price to fall
Sense.TRAN: 〔股市或期货〕看跌的人﹐卖空的人

PIC.HEADING: BEARS 熊
PIC.PICCONTENT: bear 熊；panda 熊猫；polar bear 北极熊

Sense.DEF: something that is bearable is difficult or unpleasant, but you can deal with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His friendship was the one thing that made life bearable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有他的友情在，生活还可以过下去。

Sense.DEF:
a
pastry
filled with fruit, that has a row of long cuts across the top
Sense.TRAN: 〔顶部带有平行切条的〕熊掌形水果馅饼

Sense.DEF: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks
something similar to a beard, such as hair growing on an animal’s chin
Sense.TRAN: 须状物〔如动物的颔毛等〕

Sense.DEF: to go and see someone who has influence or authority, and tell them what you want, why you disagree with them etc
Sense.TRAN: 摸老虎屁股﹐老虎头上拍苍蝇﹐太岁头上动土〔指敢于当面责问有权势者〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who carries something such as a flag or a
stretcher
light bed for a sick person
Sense.TRAN: 持…的人﹔抬[担﹐背]着…的人﹔旗手

Sense.DEF: someone who brings you information, a letter etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate to be the bearer of bad news , but ...
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不愿意报告坏消息﹐但是…

Sense.DEF:
the bearer of a legal document, for example a
passport
, is the person that it officially belongs to
someone who knows about traditions and customs, and makes sure that younger people learn about them
Sense.TRAN: 〔传统和习俗的〕传授者﹐传播者
Sense.EXAMPLE: They see themselves as the bearers of Jewish tradition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们视自己为犹太传统的传承者。

Sense.DEF: an action in which you put your arms around someone and hold them very tightly because you like them or are pleased to see them

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a/some/no etc bearing on sth
Sense.DEF: to have an effect or influence on something, or not have any effect or influence
Sense.TRAN: 对某事有影响/有一些影响/没有影响等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise has a direct bearing on how healthy you are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼直接影响你的身体状况。

Subsense.DEF: to become confused about where you are
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I completely lost my bearings in the dark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在黑暗中完全迷失了方向。

Subsense.DEF: to become confused about what you should do next
Subsense.EXAMPLE: young men who have lost their bearings in a changing society
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在不断变化的社会中迷失了方向的年轻人

Subsense.DEF: to find out exactly where you are
Subsense.TRAN: 弄清自己的方位﹐辨明方向
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He paused to get his bearings.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停下来看自己在哪里。

Subsense.DEF: to feel confident that you know what you should do next
Subsense.EXAMPLE: An introduction session helps new students get their bearings.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 介绍会可以帮助新生找到自己的方向。

Sense.DEF: the way in which you move, stand, or behave, especially when this shows your character

a direction or angle that is shown by a
compass
Sense.TRAN: 〔罗盘显示的〕方向﹐方位﹔方位角
Sense.EXAMPLE: learning to take a compass bearing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习用罗盘辨别方向

Sense.DEF: a part of a machine that turns on another part, or in which a turning part is held

Subsense.DEF:
a bearish market is one where the prices of
share s
are decreasing
Subsense.TRAN: 股票行情看跌的﹐熊市的

Subsense.DEF: someone who is bearish expects the price of business shares to go down
Subsense.TRAN: 〔人〕看跌的﹐预料股市行情下跌的

Sense.DEF:
a situation in which the value of
stock s
is decreasing
the skin of a bear
a tall hat made of black fur, worn by some British soldiers for special ceremonies
Sense.TRAN: 〔一些英国士兵在特殊仪式上戴的黑色〕熊皮高帽

Sense.DEF: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体型庞大或危险的〕野兽

Sense.DEF: someone who is cruel or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 性情凶残的人﹐畜生﹐禽兽
Sense.EXAMPLE: You beast! Let go!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这畜生﹐放开我！

Sense.DEF: something of a particular type or that has a particular quality – usually used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某种东西﹐具有某种特点的事物〔一般为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A city at night is a very different beast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜晚的城市又别有一番景象。

Sense.DEF: the part of someone’s character that makes them experience hatred, strong sexual feelings, violence etc
very unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹐讨厌的﹔恶劣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: beastly weather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶劣的天气

Sense.DEF: an animal that does heavy work
to get the most points, votes etc in a game, race, or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴西队以1比2告负。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I beat him more often at pool than he beats me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他打落袋台球胜多负少。

GramExa.GLOSS: defeat them easily

Sense.DEF: to hit someone or something many times with your hand, a stick etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: photographs of rioters beating a policeman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴徒殴打一名警察的照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was questioned and beaten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受到了审问和拷打。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman had been beaten to death by her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女子已被丈夫殴打致死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two prisoners were beaten unconscious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名囚犯被打昏过去。

GramExa.GLOSS: hit someone until it makes marks on their body
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 把某人打得青一块紫一块

GramExa.PROPFORM: beat the living daylights out of sb
GramExa.GLOSS: beat someone very hard

Sense.DEF: to hit against something many times or continuously

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Waves beat against the cliffs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海浪拍打着悬崖。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: rain beating on the windows
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 敲打着窗户的雨滴
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sid beat on the door with his hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 锡德用手打门。

Sense.DEF: to do something better, faster etc than what was best before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The record set by Kierson in '84 has yet to be beaten.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基尔逊在1984年创下的记录至今无人打破。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s profits are unlikely to beat last year’s £10 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司不太可能突破去年的一千万英镑利润。

Sense.DEF: to be much better and more enjoyable than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fresh milk beats powdered milk any time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜牛奶任何时候都比奶粉好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Well,’ said Culley, ‘it beats going to the office.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “好吧﹐”卡利说﹐“那总比到办公室去好。”

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t beat swimming as a good all-body exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳是再好不过的全身运动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing beats homemade cake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么也比不上家里做的蛋糕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For excitement, you just can’t beat college basketball.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要说刺激﹐没有什么可以跟大学篮球赛比。

Sense.DEF: to mix things together quickly with a fork or special kitchen machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beat the eggs, then add the milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鸡蛋搅一搅﹐然后加入牛奶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gradually beat in the sugar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一边打﹐一边慢慢地加入糖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beat the butter and sugar together until fluffy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄油和糖混在一起搅打到松软为止。

Sense.DEF: to successfully deal with a problem that you have been struggling with
Sense.EXAMPLE: advice on how to beat depression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何战胜忧郁症的建议
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s long fight to beat inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府为抑制通货膨胀所进行的长期斗争

Sense.DEF:
when your heart beats, it moves in a regular
rhythm
as it pumps your blood
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average person’s heart beats 70 times a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般人的心跳是一分钟70次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jennifer’s heart was beating fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮弗心跳得很快。

Sense.DEF: if you beat drums, or if drums beat, they make a regular continuous sound
if a bird beats its wings, or if its wings beat, they move up and down quickly and regularly
Sense.TRAN: 拍打〔翅膀〕﹔〔翅膀〕有节奏地拍动

Sense.DEF: if something or someone will take some beating, it will be difficult for anyone or anything to be or do better
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raikkonen has 42 points, which will take some beating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱科宁得到42分﹐很难超越。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Florida takes some beating as a vacation destination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗里达是个难得的度假胜地。

Sense.DEF: to avoid situations in which a lot of people are trying to do something, usually by doing something early
Sense.EXAMPLE: We left at four a.m. to beat the traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们凌晨四点就出发了﹐以避开交通拥堵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shopping by mail order lets you beat the queues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮购可免去排队之苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shop now and beat the Christmas rush !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲购从速﹐避开圣诞高峰！

Sense.DEF: to get or do something before someone else, especially if you are both trying to do it first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John had beaten me to the breakfast table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰抢在我前面跑到早餐桌边。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted the last piece of pie, but somebody beat me to it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想吃那最后一块馅饼﹐可是有人抢先一步拿走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They wanted to make it into a film, but another studio beat them to the punch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想把它拍成电影﹐可是被另一家电影公司捷足先登了。

Sense.DEF: to avoid or delay talking about something embarrassing or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t beat around the bush. Ask for your account to be paid, and paid quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别转弯抹角的﹐就跟人明说拿钱来把账结了﹐马上结掉。

Sense.DEF: to find ways of avoiding or breaking the rules of an organization, system etc, in order to achieve what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Accountants know a few ways to beat the system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当会计的多少知道一点钻制度空子的办法。

Sense.LEXUNIT: beat a path to sb’s door
Sense.DEF: if people beat a path to your door, they are interested in something you are selling, a service you are providing etc
Sense.TRAN: 踏破某人的门槛〔指对某人出售的东西或提供的服务等感兴趣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new design was supposed to have consumers beating a path to their door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款新的设计预计将会吸引大批顾客。

Sense.DEF: to leave somewhere or stop doing something very quickly, in order to avoid a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔为避免困境〕（赶紧）溜走﹐（匆忙）撤退
Sense.EXAMPLE: He beat a hasty retreat when he spotted me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一看到我就赶紧溜走了。

Sense.DEF: to finish something very quickly, especially before a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company managed to beat the clock on delivering its new system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司终于提前发布了新的系统。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not know something, or cannot understand or explain it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beats me why he wants such a big car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搞不懂他为什么要这么大的一辆车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s he saying?’ ‘Beats me.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他说什么？”“我也搞不清楚。”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to leave at once, because they are annoying you or should not be there
used to show that you are surprised or annoyed by something
Sense.TRAN: 你相信吗？你想得到吗？ 〔表示惊讶或恼火〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got eight children! Can you beat that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有八个孩子！ 你想得到吗？

Sense.DEF: to think about something very hard and for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been beating my brains out all week trying to finish this essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整个星期都在搜肠刮肚﹐想写完这篇文章。

Sense.DEF: used when you decide to take part in something even though you disapprove of it, because everyone else is doing it and you cannot stop them
Sense.TRAN: 斗不过他们就随了他们﹐随大流

Sense.DEF: to avoid being punished for something you have done
to make regular movements or sounds to show the speed at which music should be played
Sense.EXAMPLE: a conductor beating time with his baton
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用指挥棒打拍子的乐队指挥

Sense.DEF: to make a path by walking over an area of land
in large amounts or with great force
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s raining to beat the band.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在正下着倾盆大雨。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself cooler
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fresh lemonade is a great way to beat the heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝新鲜柠檬水是解热的好办法。

Sense.DEF: to hit metal with a hammer in order to shape it or make it thinner
to force wild birds and animals out of bushes, long grass etc so that they can be shot for sport
Sense.TRAN: 将（猎物）赶出〔树丛﹑草丛等〕

Sense.DEF: to show clearly that you are very upset or sorry about something
Sense.TRAN: 捶胸顿足〔表示难过或愧疚〕

Exponent.DEF: to get more points, votes etc than someone-used especially in spoken English
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We should have beaten them easily.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们本来应该能够轻松击败他们。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I always beat my brother at tennis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 打网球我总是赢我弟弟。

Exponent.DEF: to beat someone. Defeat is more formal than beat and is used especially in writing
Exponent.TRAN: 打败﹐击败〔defeat比beat正式﹐尤用于书面语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: England were defeated by 2 goals to 1.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队以一比二败北。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bush defeated Kerry in the election.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 布什在大选中击败了克里。

Exponent.DEF: to defeat someone completely in a game
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were trounced 20–0 by Kuwait.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以0比20惨败给科威特队。

Exponent.DEF: to beat someone very easily in a game
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Of course, they totally creamed the other team.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐他们轻松击败了另一队。

Exponent.DEF: to beat someone completely in a game or argument
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在体育比赛或争论中〕彻底击败某人﹔把某人驳得体无完肤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She wiped the floor with her opponent in the debate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在辩论中把对手驳得体无完肤。

Sense.DEF: if the sun beats down, it shines very brightly and the weather is hot
if the rain beats down, it is raining very hard
to hit a door so hard that it falls down
to persuade someone to reduce a price
Sense.TRAN: 跟某人还价﹐跟某人杀价

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wanted £4,500 for the car, but I beat him down to £3,850.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车他想卖4,500英镑﹐但最后我压到了3,850英镑。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel defeated, so they no longer respect themselves
Sense.TRAN: 使某人颓丧﹐使某人沮丧
Sense.EXAMPLE: The women seemed beaten down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些女人好像很颓丧。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in defeating someone who is attacking, opposing, or competing with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: McConnell beat off a challenge for his Senate seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦康奈尔挫败了一个挑战他参议员席位的人。

Sense.DEF:
if a man beats off, he
masturbate s

if a drum or something else beats out a
rhythm
, or if you beat out a rhythm on a drum, it makes a continuous regular sound
to defeat someone in a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lockheed beat out a rival company to win the contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛克希德公司击败竞争对手﹐得到了那份合同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roberts beat out Tony Gwynn for the Most Valuable Player Award.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯茨击败托尼·格温﹐获得最有价值球员奖。

Sense.DEF: to put out a fire by hitting it many times with something such as a cloth
to hurt someone badly by hitting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her boyfriend got drunk and beat her up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她男朋友喝醉了﹐把她狠狠揍了一顿。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone and harm them, especially someone younger or weaker than yourself
Sense.TRAN: 欺负殴打某人〔尤指弱小的人〕

Sense.DEF: to blame yourself too much for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you do your best and you lose, you can’t beat yourself up about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是尽了最大努力后还是失败﹐就不用太责怪自己了。

Sense.DEF: one of a series of regular movements or hitting actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heart rate of 80 beats a minute
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一分钟80跳的心率
Sense.EXAMPLE: the steady beat of the drum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节奏均匀的鼓声

Sense.DEF: a regular repeated noise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the beat of marching feet
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 列队行进的脚步声

Sense.DEF:
the main
rhythm
that a piece of music or a poem has
Sense.EXAMPLE: a song with a beat you can dance to
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有舞蹈节奏的一首歌曲

Sense.DEF: a subject or area of a city that someone is responsible for as their job
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人在工作中〕负责的领域﹐辖区
Sense.EXAMPLE: journalists covering the Washington beat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驻华盛顿地区的新闻记者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People like to see police officers on the beat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们愿意看到有警察在执勤巡逻。

Sense.DEF: one of the notes in a piece of music that sounds stronger than the other notes
very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m beat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come and sit down – you must be dead beat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过来坐下吧﹐你肯定累坏了。

Sense.DEF:
someone who provides the words or other spoken sounds that go with
hip hop
a computer program that is used to mix the sounds of popular electronic music with a strong beat, or the type of music produced by this
Sense.TRAN: 节奏箱〔给流行电子音乐配节奏的计算机程序〕﹔电子节奏乐曲

Sense.DEF: a place that is off the beaten track is not well known and is far away from the places that people usually visit
a beaten path, track etc has been made by many people walking the same way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-beaten path through the forest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林中一条经过很多人踏出来的小路

Sense.DEF: a beaten person feels defeated and not respected
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beaten man who had lost his job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个丢了工作的失意男人

Sense.DEF: beaten metal has been shaped with a hammer to make it thinner
an object that is designed to beat something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an egg beater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打蛋器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carpet beater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯掸子

Sense.DEF: someone who hits his wife or child, especially someone who does this often
someone who forces wild birds or animals out of bushes, long grass etc so that they can be shot for sport
Sense.TRAN: 赶出猎物的人﹐猎人助手〔指把鸟兽从树丛中赶出来以便猎杀的人〕

Sense.DEF: an old car in bad condition
a beatific look, smile etc shows great peace and happiness
Sense.TRAN: 〔外表﹑笑容等〕极乐的﹐幸福安详的

Sense.DEF: if the Pope beatifies someone, he says officially that they are a holy or special person

PronCodes.PRON: biˌætɪfɪˈkeɪʃ ə n, biˌætɪfəˈkeɪʃ ə n, biˌætəfɪˈkeɪʃ ə n, biˌætəfəˈkeɪʃ ə n

Sense.DEF: an act of hitting someone many times as a punishment or in a fight
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brutal beating
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顿毒打

Sense.DEF: to lose very badly in a game or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Dodgers took a real beating on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六道奇队遭遇惨败。

Sense.DEF: one of a group of young people in the late 1950s and early 1960s, who did not accept the values of society and showed this by their clothes and the way they lived
Sense.TRAN: “垮掉的一代”一员﹐披头族成员〔20世纪50年代末和60年代初的一些年轻人﹐他们不接受当时的社会价值观﹐并通过穿着和生活方式表现出来〕

Sense.DEF: a beat-up car, bicycle etc is old and in bad condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑自行车等〕破旧的﹐破烂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beat-up old Ford Escort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆破旧的福特护卫者汽车

Sense.DEF: a woman’s close friend or lover
a fashionable well-dressed man
Sense.TRAN: 衣着入时的男子﹔花花公子﹐纨袴子弟

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is either very good, attractive, or impressive
Sense.TRAN: 非常好的东西﹐非常漂亮的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: That last catch was a beaut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一个球接得漂亮极了。

Sense.DEF: beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the beauteous Helen of Troy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特洛伊美人海伦

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to give beauty treatments to your skin, hair etc
someone or something that is beautiful is extremely attractive to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was even more beautiful than I had remembered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比我记忆中更美。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful bunch of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一束美丽的花

Sense.DEF: very good or giving you great pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: beautiful music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美妙的音乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a beautiful shot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么漂亮的射门！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather was beautiful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气好极了。

Exponent.DEF: a beautiful woman or child has perfect good looks
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Grace Kelly was a very beautiful woman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 格蕾丝·凯丽是一个非常美丽的女人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a beautiful baby
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个漂亮的宝宝

Exponent.DEF: a good-looking person looks nice. Good-looking is very common in spoken English
Exponent.TRAN: 好看的﹐漂亮的〔口语中很常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a good-looking guy, but he’s a bit boring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相貌不错﹐但性格有点乏味。

Exponent.DEF: an attractive person looks nice, especially in a way that makes you feel sexually interested in them
Exponent.TRAN: 有吸引力的﹐有魅力的〔尤指性感〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s a very attractive woman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个相当有魅力的女人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A lot of women find him attractive.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多女人觉得他很有魅力。

Exponent.DEF: a pretty girl or woman looks nice – used especially about a woman who has a nice face
Exponent.TRAN: 〔女性〕漂亮的﹐好看的〔尤指相貌标致〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You look pretty with your hair down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把头发披散下来看上去很漂亮。

Exponent.DEF: a handsome man or boy looks nice – used especially about a man who has a nice face. Handsome is also sometimes used, especially in literature, to describe a woman who is good-looking and has a strong face
Exponent.TRAN: 〔男子〕英俊的﹐漂亮的〔尤指相貌端正〕﹔〔女子〕美丽而轮廓分明的〔尤用于文学作品中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was tall, dark, and handsome.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身材高挑﹐肤色黝黑﹐非常英俊。

Exponent.DEF: extremely attractive. Gorgeous is used especially by women
Exponent.TRAN: 非常漂亮的﹐极其吸引人的〔gorgeous尤为女性使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She thinks Brad Pitt is gorgeous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得布拉德·皮特帅极了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You look absolutely stunning in that dress!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿那条裙子太漂亮了！

Exponent.DEF: nice to look at – used about animals, babies, children, and young adults
Exponent.TRAN: 漂亮的﹐逗人喜爱的〔用于动物﹑婴儿、儿童和小青年〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cute little puppy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可爱的小狗
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She thinks you’re cute!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得你很可爱！

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that someone looks very nice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You look lovely tonight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚你看上去很迷人。

Exponent.DEF: used to describe something that looks, feels, sounds etc so good that it gives you a lot of pleasure
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a beautiful tropical beach
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片美丽的热带沙滩
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a beautiful song
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首动听的歌曲
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The weather was beautiful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气很好。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that something looks, feels, or sounds very nice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What a lovely day!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 多好的天气！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a lovely voice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 动听的嗓音

Exponent.DEF: pleasant to look at – often used about things that are not big or impressive
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指不大或不抢眼的事物〕漂亮的﹐好看的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pretty little pink dress
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条漂亮的粉红色小裙子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pretty village
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座风景秀丽的村庄

Exponent.DEF: pleasant to look at. Attractive sounds more formal than pretty
Exponent.TRAN: 有吸引力的﹐漂亮的〔attractive比 pretty正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an attractive white-painted cottage with green shutters
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿窗白墙的美丽村舍

Exponent.DEF: very big, beautiful, and impressive – used about buildings, objects, and views
Exponent.TRAN: 〔建筑﹑物品或景色〕宏伟的﹐壮丽的﹔华丽的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Taj Mahal always looks magnificent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰姬陵看上去总是那么宏伟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a magnificent Persian carpet
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条华美的波斯地毯

Exponent.DEF: pleasant to look at – used in written descriptions of towns, buildings, and places
Exponent.TRAN: 美丽的﹐如画的〔用于对城镇﹑建筑和地方的书面描写〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the picturesque harbour town of Castleton
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 风景如画的海港城卡斯尔顿

Exponent.DEF: extremely beautiful and impressive – used especially about views
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指景色〕极具吸引力的﹐令人惊叹的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All around is a stunning view of Cape Town.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 四周是开普敦的迷人美景。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The landscape is breathtaking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色十分迷人。

Exponent.DEF: used to describe things that have very beautiful small details, especially things that have been made with a lot of skill
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指工艺制品〕精美的﹐精致的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an exquisite piece of jewellery
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件精致的首饰
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an exquisite flower
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 精美的花朵

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants to beautify the garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使花园增色的花草

Sense.DEF: a quality that people, places, or things have that makes them very attractive to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: her beauty and grace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的美貌和优雅风姿
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area of outstanding natural beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个自然风景极美的地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of dollars are spent each year on beauty products .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年都有上千万的钱花在美容产品上。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is very beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was considered a great beauty in her youth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她年轻时被视为大美人。

Sense.DEF: a quality that something such as a poem, song, emotion etc has that gives you pleasure or joy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the beauty of Shakespeare’s verse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚诗歌的美

Sense.DEF: a particularly good quality that makes something especially suitable or useful
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的优点[好处﹑妙处]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beauty of e-mail is its speed and ease of use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子邮件的好处就是快捷和便利。

Sense.DEF: a very good, large etc example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should have seen the boat – a real beauty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该一早看看那艘船——棒极了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: beauty is in the eye of the beholder
Sense.DEF: used to say that different people have different opinions about what is beautiful
Sense.TRAN: 情人眼里出西施﹔对美的判别因人而异

Sense.DEF: used to say that how someone looks is not as important as a good character
Sense.TRAN: 美貌只是一张皮﹐内在美比外在美更重要

Sense.DEF: a competition in which women are judged on how attractive they look
a small dark mark on a woman’s face – used when you think it is attractive
a beauty salon
the winner of a beauty contest
Sense.TRAN: 选美王后〔选美比赛的冠军〕

Sense.DEF: a place where you can receive treatments for your skin, hair, nails etc to make you look more attractive
enough sleep to keep you healthy and looking good – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 美容觉〔幽默用法﹐指使人保持健康美丽的充足睡眠〕

Sense.DEF: a place in the countryside that is famous because it is very pretty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guests will be able to visit some of the local beauty spots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来宾可以游览当地的一些景点。

Sense.DEF: a small dark mark on a woman’s face – used when you think it is attractive
a North American animal that has thick fur and a wide flat tail, and cuts down trees with its teeth
to work very hard, especially at writing or calculating something
Sense.TRAN: 卖力地干﹐努力工作〔尤指写作或计算〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been beavering away at his homework for hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他埋头做作业已经有几个小时了。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
jazz
music
a sailing boat that is becalmed cannot move because there is no wind
Sense.TRAN: 〔帆船因无风而〕静止不动的﹐不能航行的

Sense.DEF: if something such as a company, the economy, or a discussion about something is becalmed, no progress is being made
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑经济或讨论等〕处于停顿状态的﹐没有进展的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Stock Market was becalmed yesterday as dealers waited for company results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天交易商等待公司发布业绩﹐股市交投淡静。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
become
used when you are giving the reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t enjoy the day because the weather was so awful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天我们很不尽兴﹐因为天气实在太糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why can’t I go?’ ‘Because you’re not old enough.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我为什么不能去？”“因为你年纪太小。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hubert never experienced any fear, and this was partly because he was not particularly intelligent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休伯特从来都没有害怕的感觉﹐部分原因是他这人不大聪明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many exam candidates lose marks simply because they do not read the questions properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多应试者失分只是因为没有好好地读题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to go with them, mainly because I had nothing better to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定和他们一起去﹐主要是因为我没有更好的事情可做。

Sense.DEF: used to say that, although one thing is true, it does not mean that something else is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just because you’re my brother doesn’t mean I have to like you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是我兄弟﹐那也不代表我一定得喜欢你呀！

Exponent.DEF: used when giving the reason for something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I went home because I was tired.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为累了﹐我就回家了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The streets were flooded because of all the rain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下了这么多雨﹐街道被水淹了。

Exponent.DEF: used to give the reason why something has happened. Due to and owing to are more formal than because
Exponent.TRAN: 因为﹐由于〔due to和owing to比 because正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The delay was due to a problem with the ship’s engines.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 误点是因为船的引擎出了问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The parade had to be cancelled owing to bad weather.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气不好游行活动只得取消了。

Exponent.DEF: because of something-used especially when saying why someone succeeded or failed to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 由于﹐因为〔尤用于说明某人成功或失败的原因〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They won the game, more through luck than skill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们赢了这场比赛﹐更多是靠运气而不是技巧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You failed that test through carelessness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没能通过那次测验是因为粗心大意。

Exponent.DEF: used when explaining that something good has happened because of someone’s efforts, or because something exists
Exponent.TRAN: 归功于﹐多亏〔用于解释某件好事的发生是由于某人的努力或某事物的存在〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Thanks to modern medicine, the disease can now be cured.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有赖于现代医学﹐这种疾病现在可以治愈了。

Exponent.DEF: used when giving the reason why someone decides to do something or decides that something is true
Exponent.TRAN: 因为﹐由于〔用于解释某人为何决定做某事或认为某事属实〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We decided to go to the beach since it was a nice day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气晴朗﹐我们决定去海滩。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I thought Kevin was out as his car wasn’t there.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想凯文出去了﹐因为他的车不在那里。

Exponent.DEF: because of a particular feeling or quality
Exponent.TRAN: 出于﹐因为〔某种感情或品质〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He started reading the book out of curiosity.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始读那本书是出于好奇。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I only asked out of politeness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是出于礼貌问了一问。

Sense.DEF: used to say who or what causes something to happen or is the reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had to retire because of ill health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为健康问题不得不退休。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent three hours waiting in the rain because of you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为你﹐我们在雨里等了三个小时！

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use the expressions due to something, owing to something, or as a result of something, which sound more formal than because of something
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们往往更喜欢用due to﹐owing to或as a result of﹐这些表达法听起来比because of正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Many businesses fail due to cash-flow problems.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多企业因为现金流转出了问题而倒闭。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at sb’s beck and call
Sense.DEF: to always be ready to do what someone wants
Sense.TRAN: 听命于某人﹐对某人唯命是从
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was tired of being at her beck and call all day long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我厌倦了整天受她支使。

Sense.DEF: a small stream
to make a signal to someone with your hand, to show that you want them to come towards you or to follow you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see my husband beckoning me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到我丈夫在向我招手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She beckoned to the waitress to bring more wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她示意服务员再拿些酒来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He beckoned us over and introduced us to his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他招呼我们过去﹐把我们介绍给他的妻子。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a place or opportunity beckons, it appears so attractive that you want to have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A career in the film industry beckoned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影事业令人向往。

Sense.DEF: if something beckons for someone, it will probably happen to them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Early retirement beckoned for George.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治可能会提早退休。

Sense.DEF: an informal name for the English football player David Beckham, used especially in newspapers and magazines
Sense.TRAN: 小贝〔对英格兰足球运动员大卫·贝克汉姆的昵称﹐尤用于报刊杂志〕

Sense.DEF: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather became warmer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气变暖和了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slowly my eyes became accustomed to the darkness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen became increasingly anxious about her husband’s strange behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦越来越担心她丈夫的反常行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pollution from cars has become a major problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车污染已成为严重的问题。

Sense.DEF: to start to have a job or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: George became king at the age of 54.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治在54岁时当上了国王。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When did you first want to become a teacher?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最早是什么时候想要当一名教师的？

Sense.DEF: to be suitable for someone, or to look attractive on them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blue really becomes her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝色非常适合她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to be clever – it doesn’t become you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要装聪明——这样跟你不相称。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what became of ...?/whatever will become of ...?
Sense.DEF: used to ask what has happened to someone or something, especially when you have not seen them for a long time, or what will happen to someone that you are worried about
Sense.EXAMPLE: What became of those Chinese vases that Mum used to have?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈以前的那些中国花瓶呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever will become of Sam when his wife dies?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果妻子死了﹐萨姆会怎么样呢？

Exponent.DEF: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His parents became worried when he was late home from school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放学回家晚了﹐父母担心起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Violent crime is becoming a major problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪问题越来越严重。

Exponent.DEF: to start to have a feeling or quality. Get is less formal than become and is much more commonly used in everyday English
Exponent.TRAN: 变得〔get没有become正式﹐在日常英语中常用得多〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was getting very tired.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很累了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Make sure you’re home before it gets dark.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要在天黑前到家。

Exponent.DEF: to become something – used about things becoming a different colour, or things or people becoming worse in some way
Exponent.TRAN: 变为﹐变成〔用于指物体变成不同的颜色﹐或指物体或人变得不好〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her hair was going grey.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头发变白了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He went blind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他失明了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think I’m going mad.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我快疯了。

Exponent.DEF: to become something – used about things becoming a different colour, or the weather or people’s behaviour changing
Exponent.TRAN: 变得﹐变为〔用于指颜色﹑天气或人的行为的变化〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The water had turned bright green.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水变成了鲜绿色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The weather is expected to turn cold again.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计天气将再次转冷。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He suddenly turned nasty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然凶起来。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually become something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People were growing impatient.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们开始不耐烦起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rich grew richer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有钱人越来越有钱。

Exponent.DEF: to become undone, loose or seperated into pieces
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The screws had come loose.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 螺丝松动了。

Exponent.DEF: to become something completely different
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The caterpillar changed into a beautiful butterfly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛虫变成了一只美丽的蝴蝶。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing, a hairstyle etc that is becoming makes you look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her short hairstyle is very becoming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她剪的短发很适合她。

Sense.DEF: words or actions that are becoming are suitable for you or for the situation you are in
Sense.EXAMPLE: She received the praise with becoming modesty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谦逊得体地接受了赞誉。

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring
radioactivity
Sense.TRAN: 贝克勒尔〔放射性强度单位〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture that you sleep on

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Simon lay in bed thinking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙躺在床上想事情。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You should go to bed early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该早点上床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got into bed and turned out the light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上了床﹐关掉灯。

GramExa.GLOSS: before going to bed
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad has a whisky before bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸睡觉前要喝一杯威士忌。

PIC.HEADING: BEDS 床
PIC.PICCONTENT: camp bed 折叠床；bunk beds 双层床；cot BrE【英】/crib AmE【美】婴儿床；double bed 双人床；futon 日本床垫；hammock 吊床；four-poster bed 四柱大床；single bed 单人床；twin beds 成对的单人床

Sense.DEF: used to refer to having sex
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I came home and found him in bed with
having sex with
my best friend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回到家里﹐发现他和我最要好的朋友在床上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted me to go to bed with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要我跟他上床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been trying to get his secretary into bed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直想把他的秘书弄上床。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She told me he was good in bed
a skilful lover
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跟我说他的床上功夫很好。

Sense.DEF: the flat ground at the bottom of a river, lake, or sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sea bed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海底

Sense.DEF: an area of a garden, park etc that has been prepared for plants to grow in
Sense.EXAMPLE: rose beds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰花坛

Sense.DEF: a layer of rock
a layer of something that forms a base that other things are put on top of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: prawns on a bed of lettuce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺在生菜上面的大虾

Sense.DEF: an area at the edge of a river or in deeper water where things grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oyster bed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牡蛎层
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds build their nests in reed beds along the river bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟儿把巢筑在河边的芦苇丛中。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get out of bed on the wrong side

Variant.ORTHVAR: get up on the wrong side of the bed

Sense.DEF: to feel slightly angry or annoyed for no particular reason
Sense.TRAN: 〔无缘由地〕感觉不对劲﹐心情不好

Sense.DEF: not a happy, comfortable, or easy situation
Sense.TRAN: 不是一帆风顺﹐不是称心如意
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life isn’t always a bed of roses, you know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要知道﹐人生并非总能事事如意。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you’ve made your bed and you must lie on it
Sense.DEF: used to say that you must accept the results of your actions, even if they are bad
Sense.TRAN: 自己铺的床自己躺﹔自作自受﹐自食其果

Sense.DEF: to complete a newspaper, magazine, or book, so that it is ready to be printed

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What time do you go to bed at night?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你晚上什么时候上床睡觉？

Collocate.COLLOC: get into bed/get out of bed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I usually read for a bit after I get into bed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上床后一般都要看一会书。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Lucy climbed into bed and lay awake thinking.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西上床后躺着想事情。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get into bed feeling very tired
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We finally crawled into bed at three in the morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨三点钟我们终于爬上了床。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I jumped out of bed and ran over to the window.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跳下床跑到窗口。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tidy the sheets and covers after you get up
put clean sheets on it
put a child in their bed
go to bed because you feel ill
for one person
a bed for two people
a very big double bed
a big bed for two people
two single beds in a room
two single beds joined together one above the other
a bed for visitors to your home
the bottom/top of the bed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I woke up to find someone standing at the foot of the bed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我醒来时发现有人站在床尾。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She sat and sewed until it was time for bed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐着缝缝补补﹐直到该上床睡觉的时候。

Sense.DEF: to fix something firmly and deeply into something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The foundations were bedded in cement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地基埋在水泥中。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone
to sleep somewhere which is not your bed and where you do not usually sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I bed down on your sofa?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能睡在你的沙发上吗？

Sense.DEF: to make a person or animal comfortable in a place where they do not usually sleep
Sense.TRAN: 安置〔人或动物在一个临时的地方〕睡觉

Sense.DEF: if a new system or arrangement beds down, problems with it are solved and it gradually starts to work in the way that it should
Sense.TRAN: 〔新制度或安排〕开始生效﹐开始运作

Sense.DEF: to put plants into the ground so that they can grow

a first university
degree
in education
food and a place to sleep
the providing of a room for a night and breakfast in the morning, for example in a hotel
Sense.TRAN: 住宿加早餐〔指宾馆等提供的服务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there anyone who does bed and breakfast round here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这附近有人提供住宿加早餐的服务吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: bed and breakfast accommodation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住宿加早餐的服务

Sense.DEF: a private house or small hotel where you can sleep and have breakfast
Sense.TRAN: 提供住宿和早餐的私人住家[小旅馆]
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a bed and breakfast in the next village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁村子里有一家提供住宿加早餐的旅馆。

Sense.DEF: if you are bedazzled by something, you find it so impressive that it surprises and confuses you
a thorough body wash given to someone who cannot leave their bed
Sense.TRAN: 床浴〔为卧病在床的人擦洗身体〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone stays in hospital because there is no other suitable place where they can go to be looked after. This means that other people cannot go into hospital when they need to, because there is no bed for them.
Sense.TRAN: 占用医院床位﹐赖床住院〔指某人因为找不到合适的地方让自己得到照顾而赖在医院的情况。这会导致其他需要住院的病人因为没有床位而无法住院治疗〕

Sense.DEF: an insect that sucks blood and lives in dirty houses, especially in beds
a bedroom
the sheets, covers etc that you put on a bed
sheets, covers etc that you put on a bed

something soft for animals to sleep on, such as dried grass or
straw
garden plants that will look good for one season and then be removed
to decorate something such as a building or street by hanging things all over it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a balcony bedecked with hanging baskets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用吊篮装饰的阳台

Sense.DEF: to cause a lot of problems and difficulties for someone or something over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a society bedevilled by racial tensions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深受种族间紧张关系困扰的社会

Sense.DEF: two or more people, ideas etc that are related or working together in an unexpected way
Sense.TRAN: 奇怪的组合〔指两个或两个以上的人﹑观点等出人意料地联系在一起〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rugby and art seem strange bedfellows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把橄榄球和艺术联系在一起显得很奇怪。

Sense.DEF: the part of a bed that is behind your head when you are sleeping
a situation where there is a lot of noise and confusion
Sense.TRAN: 混乱嘈杂的场面﹐喧闹的场面
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the bomb exploded, there was bedlam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹爆炸以后﹐现场一片混乱。

Sense.DEF:
the sheets and
pillowcase s
for a bed
someone who belongs to an Arab tribe that traditionally lives in tents in the desert
Sense.TRAN: 贝都因人〔住在沙漠帐篷中的阿拉伯游牧部落成员〕

Sense.DEF: the people who belong to this tribe
a low wide container used as a toilet by someone who is too ill to get out of bed
one of the four main supports at the corners of an old-fashioned bed
looking untidy, wet, and dirty, especially because you have been out in the rain
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指淋雨后〕湿漉漉的﹐又湿又脏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bedraggled soldiers crawled into camp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湿漉漉的士兵们慢腾腾地进了兵营。

Sense.DEF: unable to leave your bed, especially because you are old or ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因年老或生病而〕卧床不起的

Sense.DEF: the basic ideas, features, or facts on which something is based
Sense.TRAN: 基本事实﹐基本原则﹔基石﹐基础
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marriage and children are the bedrock of family life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻和子女是家庭生活的基础。

Sense.DEF: solid rock in the ground below soil or sand

a number of
blanket s
rolled together and used for sleeping outdoors
a room for sleeping in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hotel with 50 bedrooms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有50间客房的旅馆

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve just bought a new four-bedroomed house in Edinburgh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们刚在爱丁堡买了一幢有四间卧室的新房子。

Sense.DEF: a look in your eyes that shows that you are sexually attracted to someone
a place where people live but that does not have many businesses, so that people have to go to another town or city to work
the area beside your bed – used especially when talking about someone who is ill in bed
Sense.TRAN: 床侧﹐床边〔尤用于谈论卧病在床的人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Relatives have been at his bedside all week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲人们整个星期都守在他的床边。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The clock on her bedside table said half past four.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她床头柜上的钟显示4点半了。

Sense.DEF: the way that a doctor talks to the people that he or she is treating
