Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被她弄得神魂颠倒。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
beseech
to be a sign of something
wearing glasses
a bespoke product, especially computer software or a piece of clothing, has been specially made for a particular customer
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指计算机软件﹑服装等产品〕定做的﹐定制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cost of development of a bespoke system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定制系统的开发成本

Sense.DEF: better than anything else or anyone else in quality, skill, how effective it is etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won the best actor award.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得最佳男演员奖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the best way to cook this fish?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这鱼怎么烧最好？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best thing to do is to stop worrying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好的办法就是不要再担心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s best to go later in the season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好是当季晚些时候去。

GramExa.PROPFORM: easily the best/by far the best
GramExa.GLOSS: much better than anything else
GramExa.EXAMPLE: John’s idea is by far the best option.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰的主意绝对是最好的选择。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our pilots are given the best possible training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的飞行员接受最好的训练。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We use only the very best ingredients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只用最好的原料。

Sense.DEF: the friend that you know and like better than anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was my best friend in college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我大学里最要好的朋友。

Sense.DEF: clothing that you keep for special occasions
Sense.TRAN: 最好的礼服/鞋子/衣服等〔指留待特殊场合穿戴的衣物等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put on my best suit for the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我穿上最好的一套衣服参加婚礼。

Sense.DEF: something that is not exactly what you want but is as similar to it as possible
Sense.TRAN: 仅次于最好的东西﹐第二好的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: If sterile equipment isn’t available, the next best thing is to clean equipment with disinfectant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没有消毒设备﹐用消毒剂把设备清洁一下也是可以的。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the fact about a situation that is even better than the other good things
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s clean and well-located, but best of all, it’s affordable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里很干净﹐地段也不错﹐而更好的是﹐价格也承受得起。

Sense.DEF: written on food packets with the date that the food should be eaten before
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一日期〕前食用最佳〔食品包装上注明的最迟食用日期〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Best before 13 July.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7月13日前食用最佳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a best-before date
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最迟食用日期

Sense.DEF: in a way that is better than any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: It works best if you let it warm up first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果先把它预热一下﹐使用效果最佳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This can best be described as a series of steps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最恰当的说法就是，这是一步步的过程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the best-dressed man in Paris
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎穿着最讲究的男人

Sense.DEF: to the greatest degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know him best – you should ask him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最熟悉他﹐应该你去问他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The part I like best is the meal afterwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最喜欢的是后来吃的一餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s perhaps best known for his role in ‘Midnight Cowboy’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最出名的可能是在《午夜牛郎》中的角色。

Sense.DEF: as well as you can, even if this is not very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll try and fix it as best I can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会尽力把它修好。

Sense.DEF: ought to
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d best be getting back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好回去。

Subsense.DEF: the most helpful, most successful etc situation or results that you can achieve
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We all want the best for our children.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都希望给孩子最好的东西。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s the best we can do in the circumstances.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这种情况下﹐我们最多只能做到这样了。

Subsense.DEF: the person or thing that is better than any other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s the best of the new young writers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是新一代年轻作家中最优秀的。

Sense.DEF: to try as hard as you can to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: As long as you do your best, we’ll be happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要你尽力而为﹐我们就满意了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: do your best to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She did her best to make him comfortable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽力让他感到舒服。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is not very good, pleasant, honest etc even if you consider it in the best possible way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The campaign was at best only partially successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场宣传活动充其量只是部分成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The technique is at best ineffective and at worst dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个方法说轻一点是无效﹐说重一点是危险。

Sense.LEXUNIT: to the best of your knowledge/belief/ability etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is as much as you know, believe, or are able to do
Sense.TRAN: 就某人所知/在某人看来/尽某人所能等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he’ll do the work to the best of his ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信他会尽己所能做好这项工作。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: We wish him the best of luck with this venture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们祝愿他在这个风险项目上顺顺利利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hasn’t been in the best of health lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他近来身体状况不怎么好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They didn’t part on the best of terms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不欢而散。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
They became the best of friends
very close friends
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们成了最好的朋友。

Sense.LEXUNIT: with the best of intentions/for the best of reasons
Sense.DEF: used to mean that someone does something with good intentions or for good reasons, even if the result is not always good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he went there with the best of intentions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信他去那里是出于好心。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you have the advantages of two different things without any of the disadvantages
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live in a village but it’s only an hour from London, so they have the best of both worlds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在一个村子里﹐但离伦敦只有一小时路程﹐所以农村和城市的好处他们都能享受得到。

Sense.DEF: performing as well or effectively as you are able to
Sense.EXAMPLE: At her best, she’s a really stylish player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她状态好的时候﹐确实是个很棒的选手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was never at his best early in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大清早他总不在最佳状态。

Variant.LEXVAR: make the best of a bad job/situation etc

Sense.DEF: to accept a situation that is not very good, and do whatever you can to make it better
Sense.TRAN: 尽可能利用〔不能令人满意的事物或处境〕﹔善处逆境
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are stuck here, so we might as well make the best of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反正我们被困在这儿了﹐不如随遇而安吧。

Sense.DEF: used to express good wishes to someone for the future
Sense.TRAN: 一切顺利﹐万事如意〔用于表示祝愿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d just like to wish him all the best in his new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿他在新的工作中一切顺利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the best for the New Year!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新年万事如意！

Sense.DEF: if something is not very good, pleasant etc at the best of times, it is usually even worse than this
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s crowded at the best of times, but today it was unbearable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平时人最少的时候也拥挤，但今天简直让人受不了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the best of a bad lot/bunch
Sense.DEF: the least bad person or thing in a group of not very good people or things
Sense.TRAN: 不好之中最好的﹐差中之优

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular event may seem bad now, but might have a good result later
Sense.EXAMPLE: I still don’t want him to go, but maybe it’s for the best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是不希望他去﹐但这也许是件好事。

Sense.DEF: your best clothes, that you only wear on special occasions
to defeat someone
behaving like an animal, especially in a cruel way
Sense.EXAMPLE: bestial and barbaric acts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶残野蛮的行为

Sense.DEF: sexual relations between a person and an animal
very cruel behaviour
an old book about strange animals, written in the Middle Ages

the man who helps the
bridegroom
at a wedding ceremony
to give someone something of great value or importance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: honours bestowed on him by the Queen
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王授予他的荣誉

Sense.DEF: a description of the best way of performing a particular activity, especially in business, that can be used by other people or companies as a set of rules to follow
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业上可给其他人或公司参照的〕最佳做法﹔最佳工作法

Sense.DEF: a popular product, especially a book, that many people buy
Sense.EXAMPLE: His new book went straight to number one on the best-seller list .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新书跃居畅销书榜首。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game is already a bestseller in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游戏在日本已经很畅销。

Sense.DEF: to risk money on the result of a race, game, competition, or other future event
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much do you want to bet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想赌多少钱？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He bet me £10 that I wouldn’t do it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和我赌10英镑﹐说我不会那么做。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She bet all her money on a horse that came last.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把所有的钱都押在一匹马上﹐结果这匹马跑了最后一名。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t bet against him winning the championship this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会下注赌他今年拿不到冠军。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of verb bet in spoken and written English. 动词bet在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the verb bet is much more common in spoken English than in written English. This is because it is used in some common spoken phrases. 本图表显示﹐动词bet在英语口语中的使用频率远远高于书面语﹐这是因为口语中某些常用短语是由bet构成的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you are fairly sure that something is true, something is happening etc, although you cannot prove this
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bet you wish you’d arrived earlier.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢肯定你后悔没早点来吧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I bet you she won’t come.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟你打赌她不会来的。

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you understand or can imagine the situation that someone has just told you about
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘God, I was so angry.’ ‘I bet you were.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “天哪﹐我当时生气极了。”“那是肯定的。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘It makes things much easier.’ ‘Yeah, I’ll bet it does.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那样就方便多了。”“是呀﹐那是当然的。”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you do not believe what someone has just told you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m definitely going to give up smoking this time.’ ‘Yeah, I bet!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这次我肯定会戒烟。”“哼﹐我才不信呢！”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you agree with someone or are keen to do what they suggest
Sense.TRAN: 的确！ 当然！ 一定！ 一点不错！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Going to the party on Saturday?’ ‘You bet!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “星期六去参加聚会吗？”“当然啦！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think something that someone has just said is not true or not likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 赌不赌？ 敢打赌吗？〔对某人所说的话表示怀疑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sure Tom’ll be here soon.’ ‘Wanna bet?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我肯定汤姆很快就到。”“打赌吗？”

Sense.LEXUNIT: don’t bet on it/I wouldn’t bet on it
Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not think something is likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 不大可能﹐我认为不大可能
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said he’d finish by tomorrow, but I wouldn’t bet on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他明天之前会完成﹐可我认为不大可能。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you (can) bet your life/your bottom dollar
Sense.DEF: used when you are sure that you know what someone will do or what will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can bet your bottom dollar he won’t be back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肯定不会回来了。

Sense.DEF: to risk everything that you own
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do we really want to bet the ranch on this deal?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们真的要为这笔交易赌上全部家当？

Sense.DEF: an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £50 bet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 50英镑的赌注

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A few of us had a bet on who’d get married first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中有些人打赌谁会先结婚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We placed bets on three horses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在三匹马上下了赌注。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bookmakers are already taking bets on the outcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马票商已经开始接受对比赛结果的下注了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he scores now, I’ll win my bet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他现在进球﹐我就赌赢了。

Sense.DEF: used when advising someone what to do
Sense.TRAN: 最好的办法〔用于建议某人怎么做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your best bet is to put an advert in the local newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好是在当地报纸上登一个广告。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train might be a better bet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐火车可能更好。

Sense.DEF: an action or situation that is likely to be successful or does not involve much risk
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re looking for long-term growth, the government’s own saving certificates are a pretty good bet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你希望长期增值﹐政府的储蓄券是比较保险的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something seems almost certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it’s a pretty safe bet that he’ll get the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他得到这份工作应该不成问题。

Sense.DEF: used when saying what you expect to happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: My bet is he’ll be back this time next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为﹐下周的这个时候他会回来。

Sense.DEF: to do something stupid, dangerous etc to win money from someone or to prove that you can do it
Sense.TRAN: 为打赌而做某事﹐赌气做某事〔指为了赢钱或证明自己的能力而做出愚蠢或危险的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He climbed the tree for a bet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爬树是为了打赌。

Sense.DEF: the second letter of the Greek alphabet, β or B
Sense.TRAN: 希腊字母表的第二个字母〔即β或B〕

Sense.DEF:
a drug used to help prevent
heart attack s
Sense.TRAN: 贝塔-受体阻滞剂﹐β-受体阻滞剂〔一种预防心脏病发作的药物〕

Sense.DEF:
an
electron
or
positron
that is sent out by some
radioactive
substances
Sense.TRAN: 贝塔粒子﹐β粒子〔某些放射性物质释放出的电子或阳电子〕

Sense.DEF: a test of software in which it is given to customers to use, so that any problems will be found
Sense.TRAN: 贝塔测试﹐β测试〔指把软件交给用户使用以便发现问题的一种测试方法〕

Sense.DEF: software that is being tested by people who will use it, to see if it works properly
Sense.TRAN: 贝他测试版﹐β版〔指给用户使用以检查是否有问题的软件〕

Sense.DEF: a plant whose leaves have a fresh taste, and that some people chew, especially in Asia
small pieces of red nut with a bitter taste, that are wrapped in a betel leaf and chewed
the person or thing that someone dislikes most
used to say that someone will be in trouble if they do something – often humorous
Sense.TRAN: 某人就会倒霉〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Woe betide anyone who wakes the baby!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁把宝宝吵醒谁倒霉！

Sense.DEF: to be a sign of something
to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset
Sense.TRAN: 背叛〔信任你的人〕﹔对…不忠﹔出卖
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt that she had betrayed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What kind of man would betray his own sister to the police?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向警方出卖自己的妹妹﹐那是什么样的人啊？

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I would never betray a confidence
tell a secret that someone has trusted me with
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

Sense.DEF: to be disloyal to your country, company etc, for example by giving secret information to its enemies
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who betray their country for money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖国求财的人

Sense.DEF: to show feelings that you are trying to hide
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice betrayed his nervousness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音暴露了他的紧张。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
His face betrayed nothing
showed no emotion
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不露声色。

Sense.DEF: to show that something is true or exists, especially when it is not easily noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The slightest sound might betray his presence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍有动静便有可能暴露他的存在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crumpled sheets betrayed the fact that someone had been sleeping there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皱巴巴的床单说明有人在这里睡过。

Sense.DEF: to stop supporting your old beliefs and principles, especially in order to get power or avoid trouble
Sense.TRAN: 背弃自己的信仰/原则/理想等

Sense.DEF: when you betray your country, friends, or someone who trusts you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a ruthless betrayal of their election pledges
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对选举诺言的无情背叛

Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt a great sense of betrayal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一种强烈的被出卖的感觉。

Sense.DEF: an agreement that two people will be married
to have promised to marry someone
the person that someone has agreed to marry
more useful, interesting, satisfactory, effective, suitable etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your stereo is better than mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的音响比我的好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be a better way to do this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定还有更好的办法来做这件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a better-quality car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 质量更好的汽车

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We now have a much better understanding of the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我们对这种疾病有了更深的了解。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was even better than last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这甚至比去年更好。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Better is a comparative form. Do not say ‘more better’. better是比较级﹐不要说more better。

Subsense.DEF: more healthy or less ill or painful than before
Subsense.TRAN: 〔健康状况〕好转的﹔〔疼痛﹑伤势等〕减轻的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She is a little better today, the doctor says.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说她今天有些好转。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling much better , thank you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得好多了﹐谢谢你。

Subsense.DEF: completely well again after an illness
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When you’re better we can see about planning a trip.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等你病好了﹐我们可以计划去旅行。
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
I hope he gets better
recovers from an illness
soon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他早日康复。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it is better/it would be better
Sense.DEF: used to give your opinion or make a suggestion about what you think should be done or happen
Sense.TRAN: 最好是〔用于表明自己的看法或提出建议〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is better to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s much better to get a proper written agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好是取得一份正规的书面协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It might be better if you stayed here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你留在这里也许比较好。

Sense.DEF: to improve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her English isn’t really getting any better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的英语其实没什么进步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things can only get better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况只会越来越好。

Subsense.DEF: not better than something else or something before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The following day the weather was no better.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天的天气还是不好。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is the best

GramExa.PROPFORM: there is no better way/example/place etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no better way of exploring the region.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是考察那个地区的最好办法。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you really like something or think that something is very good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She likes nothing better than a nice long walk along the beach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最喜欢的莫过于在沙滩上好好地散个步。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing better than beating someone who’s playing well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么比打败高手更畅快的了。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a thing or situation is not very good, but is the only thing possible or available

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you got nothing better to do than sit there playing that silly game?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你光坐着玩那个破游戏﹐就找不到更好的事情来做吗？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I only picked it up because there was nothing better to read.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有别的好书﹐我就捡了这本来看。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has improved, that you are happier or more comfortable, or to encourage someone
Sense.TRAN: 这样好一些﹐这就对了〔用以表示高兴﹑舒服或鼓励某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ah, that’s better. I needed to sit down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐现在好多了﹐我需要坐下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you turn it down?’ ‘Is that better?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能把音量调小一些吗？”“这样好些吗？”

Sense.DEF: used to say that even if something happens late or someone arrives late, this is better than it not happening or their not arriving at all
Sense.TRAN: 晚做总比不做好﹔迟到总比不到好

Exponent.DEF:
the
comparative
of good
Exponent.TRAN: 更好的﹐较好的〔good的比较级〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She wants a better job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想要一份更好的工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sales figures were far better than expected.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售数字远远高于预期。

Exponent.DEF: better, especially in quality
Exponent.EXAMPLE: German cars are far superior.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国汽车好得多。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a superior product
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质产品
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He thinks men are superior to women.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为男人比女人优秀。

Exponent.DEF: more suitable or useful – used when saying which one you prefer
Exponent.TRAN: 更合适的﹐更可取的〔用于选择〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cash would be preferable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好是付现金。

Exponent.DEF: to be better than something that existed before
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The engine is a huge improvement on previous diesel engines.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种引擎比先前的柴油引擎有了很大改进。

Exponent.DEF: to be slightly better than another person or thing – used especially when saying which one will win in a game or competition
Exponent.TRAN: 具有优势﹐略胜一筹〔尤用于比赛或竞争中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Federer is likely to have the edge in Sunday’s game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期日的比赛费德勒的赢面更大。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For me, this film has the edge over the others.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这部影片比其他影片好。

Exponent.DEF: to be very much better than someone or something that you are competing against
Exponent.TRAN: （比某人/某物）要好得多〔用于比较竞争对手〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company is streets ahead of its rivals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司远远领先于其竞争对手。

Exponent.DEF: used to emphasize that one person or thing is clearly much better than someone or something else
Exponent.TRAN: 那是不能比的〔强调某人或某物明显优于其他人或物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no comparison between the two teams.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个队根本就无法相提并论。

Sense.DEF: to a higher standard or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can speak French a lot better than I can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他法语讲得比我好多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your bike will run better if you oil it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给自行车上点油就会更好骑。

Sense.DEF: to a higher degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knows this town better than you do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比你更了解这个城镇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I like the red one better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我比较喜欢那个红的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Potter is better known for his TV work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波特更出名的是他的电视作品。

Subsense.DEF: used to give advice about what someone should do, or to say what you should do or need to do
Subsense.TRAN: 最好﹐还是…好〔用于提议或表示自己应该做什么〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d better go and get ready.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是去准备一下好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think you’d better ask Jo first.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你最好先问问乔。
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
You had better not tell Oliver
it is not a good idea
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好不要告诉奥利佛。

Subsense.DEF: used to threaten someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’d better keep your mouth shut about this.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事你最好闭嘴。

Sense.HINTTRAN: In speech, people usually shorten had to ’d , and may not pronounce it at all. But do not leave out had or ’d in writing. 口语中一般将had缩略成’d﹐也可能略去不读﹐但书写的时候不要省略had或’d: You’d better (NOT 不说 You better) come here! 你最好过来！

Sense.DEF: to perform better or reach a higher standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did better than all the other schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的成绩比其他学校都好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can do better than that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还可以做得更好！

Sense.LEXUNIT: the sooner the better/the bigger the better etc
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you would prefer something to happen as soon as possible, want something to be as big as possible etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: School finishes at the end of the week, and the sooner the better as far as I’m concerned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期结束学校就放假了﹐对我来说放得越早越好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The younger you start learning a language, the better you’ll speak it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言学得越早说得越好。

Sense.DEF: to do something more successfully than someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The following year Lewis went one better by winning the gold medal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二年﹐刘易斯表现更加出色﹐赢得了金牌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course, they had to go one better and have the whole garden redesigned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐他们得做得更好﹐把整个花园重新进行设计。

Sense.DEF: the one that is higher in quality, more suitable etc when you are comparing two similar people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to decide which one’s the better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难确定哪一个更好。

Subsense.DEF: if your feelings or wishes get the better of you, they make you behave in a way you would not normally behave
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My curiosity finally got the better of me and I opened the letter.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终我还是按捺不住好奇心﹐打开了信。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think her nerves got the better of her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她是太紧张了。

Subsense.DEF: to defeat someone or deal successfully with a problem
Subsense.TRAN: 战胜〔某人〕﹔成功地解决〔问题〕

Sense.DEF: in a way that improves the situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a definite change for the better
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明显的好转
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The president’s fortunes seem, at last, to have taken a turn for the better
started to improve
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的时运似乎终于出现转机了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something would be even better or bring even more advantages
Sense.EXAMPLE: If they can do them both at the same time, then so much the better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他们可以同时做这两件事情﹐那当然更好。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be all the better for sth
Sense.DEF: to be improved by a particular action, change etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it’s all the better for that extra ten minutes’ cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得多煮十分钟好多了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something must be accepted, whether it is good or bad, because it cannot be changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work is, for better or worse, becoming more flexible nowadays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管是福是祸﹐现在的工作变得越来越有弹性了。

Sense.DEF: people who are more important than you or deserve more respect
Sense.TRAN: 上司﹔比自己地位高的人

Sense.DEF: to be higher in quality, amount etc than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔在质量﹑数量等方面〕胜过﹐超过﹐优于
Sense.EXAMPLE: His total of five gold medals is unlikely to be bettered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一共获得五块金牌﹐这不大可能被人超越。

Sense.DEF: to improve your position in society by getting a better education or earning more money
to improve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: bettering the lot of the working classes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善工人阶级的命运

Sense.DEF: improvement, especially in someone’s social and economic position
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指个人的社会和经济地位的〕改良﹐改善﹐提高

GramExa.EXAMPLE: social change for the betterment of society as a whole
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让整个社会更加美好的社会变革

Sense.DEF: having more money than someone else or than you had before
Sense.TRAN: 有较多钱的﹔比较宽裕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’ll be about £50 a week better off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一个星期将会多大约50英镑。

Sense.DEF: happier, improved, more successful etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think she’s better off without him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得没有他她会更好。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to give advice or an opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d be better off starting with something simpler.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最好从比较简单的开始。

Sense.DEF: when people risk money on the results of games, competitions etc or other future events
used to say that something seems very likely to happen or to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the betting Dan’s involved in this somewhere?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很可能丹也多少参与了这件事吧？

Sense.DEF:
a place in Britain where people go to place
bet s
on the results of races, competitions etc
an expensive hospital in the US where rich or famous people go for treatment to help them stop drinking too much alcohol or taking illegal drugs. Its official name is the Betty Ford Center.
Sense.TRAN: 贝蒂·福特诊所〔美国高级医院﹐是富人和名人接受戒酒﹑戒毒治疗的地方〕

Sense.DEF: in or through the place that seprates two things, people, or places
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat down between Sue and Jane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在苏和简中间坐了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house and stables, with a yard in between
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中间隔着院子的房子和马廐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ball rolled between his feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球在他两脚之间滚来滚去。

Sense.DEF: in the time that seprates two things,or events
Sense.TRAN: 在〔两个时间或事件〕之间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are there any public holidays between Christmas and Easter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节和复活节之间有公众假日吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t eat between meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正餐之间不应该进食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team have a lot of work to do between now and Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在到星期日之前球队有很多事情要做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of students spend a year abroad in between school and university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生在中学毕业后到上大学之前会在国外生活一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a few jobs, with long periods of unemployment in between.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做过几份工作﹐中间有几次失业了很长时间。

Sense.DEF: within a range of amounts, numbers, distances etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project will cost between eight and ten million dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工程的花费在800万到1,000万美元之间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the victims were young men between the ages of 16 and 21.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分受害者都是16到21岁的年轻人。

Sense.DEF: used to say which two places are joined or connected by something
Sense.TRAN: 在…之间〔用于表示两地由某物相连接〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re building a new road between Manchester and Sheffield.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在修建一条连接曼彻斯特和谢菲尔德的新公路。

Sense.DEF: used to say which people or things are involved in something together or are connected
Sense.TRAN: 在…之间〔用于表示某些人或事物共同参与或相互关联〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long-standing friendship between Bob and Bryan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃和布赖恩之间长久的友谊
Sense.EXAMPLE: co-operation between the two countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国之间的合作
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had overheard a private conversation between two MPs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无意中听到了两名议员之间的密谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the link between serious sunburn and deadly skin cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重晒伤和致命的皮肤癌之间的联系

Sense.DEF: used to say which people or things get, have, or are involved in something that is shared
Sense.TRAN: 在…（和…）之间〔指分享或分担〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom divided his money between his children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆把他的钱分给几个子女。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Between the four of them they managed to lift her into the ambulance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们四人合力把她抬上了救护车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We collected £17 between us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们合共凑了17英镑。

Sense.DEF: used to say which two things or people you are comparing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the contrast between town and country life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城乡生活的差异
Sense.EXAMPLE: In her book she makes a comparison between Russian and British ballet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在书中比较了俄罗斯芭蕾舞和英国芭蕾舞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the difference between good music and really great music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的音乐作品和伟大的音乐作品之间的差别

Sense.DEF: used before telling someone something that you do not want them to tell anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 你我私下说说﹐只限于我俩之间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Between you and me, I think Schmidt’s about to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就我们俩说说﹐我觉得施米特打算辞职了。

Sense.DEF: if something comes between two people, it causes an argument or problems between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I let my stupid pride come between us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那可恶的自尊心导致我俩之间产生了芥蒂。

Sense.DEF: used when it is difficult to give an exact description of something and you therefore have to compare it to two things that are similar to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He uttered a sound that was something between a sigh and a groan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发出的声音像是叹气﹐又像是呻吟。

Sense.DEF: between
not quite belonging to one group or to another
Sense.TRAN: 非此非彼﹐两者兼而有之

Sense.DEF: a sloping edge or surface, usually along the edge of a piece of wood or glass
Sense.TRAN: 〔常见于木材或玻璃边缘的〕斜边﹐斜面

Sense.DEF: a tool for making this kind of edge or surface
a hot or cold drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: alcoholic beverages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含酒精的饮料
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Food and Beverage Manager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐饮部经理

Sense.DEF: drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re all going out to get bevvied up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都要出去喝个一醉方休。

Sense.DEF: a drink, especially an alcoholic drink
a large group of people of the same kind, especially girls or young women
Sense.TRAN: 一大群〔同类的人﹐尤指女孩或年轻女子〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bevy of beauties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群美女

Sense.DEF: to express deep sadness or disappointment about something

Head.GRAM: I,T only in imperative and infinitive
Head.GRAMTRAN: 仅用于祈使句和不定式

Sense.DEF: used to warn someone to be careful because something is dangerous

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beware of the dog!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心有狗！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They should beware of making hasty decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该当心不要作出仓促的决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Police warned drivers to beware.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方提醒司机小心行驶。

Sense.DEF: to confuse someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was bewildered by his daughter’s reaction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被女儿的反应弄糊涂了。

Sense.DEF: totally confused
Sense.TRAN: 困惑的﹔不知所措的﹔晕头转向的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bewildered expression on his face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上困惑的表情

Sense.DEF: confusing, especially because there are too many choices or things happening at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 令人困惑的﹐使人糊涂的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bewildering variety of choices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人眼花缭乱的多种选择

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 具体情况复杂得让人不知所措。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being very confused

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked at him in bewilderment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她茫然地看着他。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel so interested or attracted that they cannot think clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim’s utterly bewitched by her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆完全被她迷住了。

Sense.DEF:
to get control over someone by putting a magic
spell
on them
on or to the further side of something
Sense.TRAN: 在更远处﹔往更远处﹔在[向]…的那边
Sense.EXAMPLE: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们翻过山﹐向更远处的山谷进发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河的那边﹐牛在吃草。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她驱车穿过西港﹐在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say on the other side of something rather than use the preposition beyond
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说on the other side of﹐而不用介词beyond
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: People waited on the other side of the barrier.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们等在栅栏的另一边。

Sense.DEF: later than a particular time, date etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: What changes await us in the coming year and beyond?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明年和明年以后会有什么样的变化在等待着我们呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ban has been extended beyond 2003.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁令已经延长至2003年以后。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disco went on until beyond midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪斯科舞会一直持续到午夜以后。

Sense.DEF: more or greater than a particular amount, level, or limit
Sense.TRAN: 超出〔某个数量﹑水平或限度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: More people are choosing to work beyond retirement age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人选择过了退休年龄继续工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation has risen beyond the 5% level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀已经超出了5%的水平。

Sense.DEF: outside the range or limits of something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such tasks are far beyond the scope of the average schoolkid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的作业远远超过了普通学童的学习范围。
Sense.EXAMPLE: expensive luxuries that are beyond the reach of ordinary people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非普通人可企及的昂贵奢侈品

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is impossible to do
Sense.TRAN: 无法…〔表示某事不能做成〕

GramExa.GLOSS: impossible to repair, control, believe etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scott’s equipment was damaged beyond repair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特的设备已损坏得没法修理了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The town centre had changed beyond all recognition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇中心已变得面目全非了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Due to circumstances beyond our control, the performance has had to be cancelled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于我们无法控制的情况﹐这次演出不得不取消。

Sense.DEF: to be too difficult for someone to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole problem was quite beyond him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于整个问题他根本无法理解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why Joan ever married such an idiot in the first place is beyond me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白琼当初怎么会嫁给这样一个白痴。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘except’ in negative sentences
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fred owns nothing beyond the clothes on his back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了身上穿的衣服以外﹐弗雷德一无所有。

Sense.DEF: whatever comes after this life

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= best friend – used by young people and in magazines 最要好的朋友〔年轻人或杂志上使用〕
the abbreviation of 缩写= boyfriend – used by young people and in magazines 男朋友〔年轻人或杂志上使用〕

Sense.DEF: someone's best friend – used especially by young people, in magazines, and in emails
Sense.TRAN: 永远的好朋友〔尤为年轻人﹑杂志上或电子邮件上使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It's my BFF's birthday tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天是我最最好的好朋友的生日。

Sense.DEF:
a hot-tasting Indian vegetable cake cooked in
batter
a liquid mixture of flour, egg, and milk or water
Sense.TRAN: 印度蔬菜饼〔蔬菜外裹以面糊炸成﹐味辛辣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: onion bhajis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度洋葱饼

Sense.DEF: a type of music that is a mixture of Punjabi traditional music and Western popular music
Sense.TRAN: 〔融合旁遮普传统音乐和西方流行音乐的班格拉乐

Sense.DEF: two, twice, or double
Sense.EXAMPLE:
bilingual
speaking two languages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双语的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
to bisect
cut in two
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把…二等分

Sense.DEF: happening twice each year
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biannual report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半年度报告

Sense.DEF: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: political bias in the press
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体的政治偏见

Sense.EXAMPLE: Students were evaluated without bias.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s clear that the company has a bias against women and minorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司很明显对女性和少数族裔抱有偏见。

Sense.DEF: a natural skill or interest in one type of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lydia has a strong artistic bias.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉迪亚有很高的艺术天分。

Sense.DEF:
in a
diagonal
direction
to unfairly influence attitudes, choices, or decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several factors could have biased the results of the study.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能有好几个因素影响了研究结果。

Sense.DEF: unfairly preferring one person or group over another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course I’m biased, but I thought my daughter’s paintings were the best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然我有偏心﹐但我还是认为我女儿的画最好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: racially biased attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带种族偏见的态度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: news reporting that was heavily biased towards the government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 极度偏袒政府的新闻报道

Sense.DEF: more interested in a particular thing than in another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The majority of infants are biased towards being social rather than being antisocial.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数婴儿的性格偏向于合群﹐而非不合群。

Sense.DEF:
a sports competition in which competitors
ski
across fields and then shoot a
rifle

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth or plastic tied under a baby’s chin to protect its clothes when it is eating

the part of an
apron
,
dungaree s
, or
overall s
that covers your chest

Sense.DEF: your best clothes – used humorously

Sense.DEF: an area in the south of the US known for its very religious Christian people who follow the teachings of the Bible very strictly

Sense.DEF: relating to or written in the Bible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease dates back to biblical times .

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the biblical story of Noah

Sense.DEF: a bad situation or event that is of biblical proportions is very great or severe

Sense.EXAMPLE: This could result in an environmental disaster of biblical proportions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能会导致极其严重的环境灾难。

Sense.DEF: a list of all the books and articles used in preparing a piece of writing
a list of books and articles that are all about a particular subject

Sense.DEF: someone who likes books
liking to drink too much alcohol – sometimes used humorously

Sense.DEF:
a bicameral
legislature

consists of two parts, such as the Senate and the House of Representatives in the US Congress
a chemical substance used especially in baking, and sometimes taken with water as a medicine
the day or year exactly 200 years after an important event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bicentenary of Mozart’s death

Sense.DEF: the large muscle on the front of your upper arm

Sense.DEF: to argue, especially about something very unimportant

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你们俩不要吵了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They kept bickering over who should answer the phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们老是为应该谁去接电话的事争吵。

Sense.DEF:

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体

Sense.DEF: an offer to do work or provide services for a specific price

to order or tell someone what to do

The antiques will be sold to the highest bidder
the person who offers to pay the most
.

when you

When they lose, they lose in a big way

There was this great big

spider in the sink.

Sense.DEF: important and serious

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大赛于星期五举行。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理解某事和能够向别人解释清楚﹐两者之间有很大的差别。

Everyone was getting ready for the big day
a day when an important event will happen
.

After years as a small-time actor, he suddenly made it big
became very successful
in Hollywood.

Subsense.DEF: your older sister or brother
older or more like an adult – used especially by children or when you are talking to children

Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐别哭了。 你现在是个大女孩了。

Subsense.DEF: doing something to a large degree

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Des is a big gambler, you know.

GramExa.PROPFORM: be a big fan/admirer of sb/sth
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 是某人/某物的狂热崇拜者

Subsense.DEF: done to a large degree or with great energy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mama gave me a big hug.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈紧紧地拥抱了我一下。

GramExa.GLOSS: clap loudly

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how bad something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: AIDS remains a big problem in many parts of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾滋病在世界上很多地方依然是一个重大问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buying that house was a big mistake .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买那幢房子是一个大错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never said that, you big liar!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没有说过那样的话﹐你这个大骗子！

Sense.DEF: to have impressive plans for the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got big plans for this place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这个地方有宏大的计划。

Subsense.DEF: to like something very much
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not big on kids.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是很喜欢小孩子。

Subsense.DEF: to have a lot of a quality or feature
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The new BMW is big on safety features.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新款宝马的安全性能很好。

Sense.DEF: used when someone has done something annoying, especially when you want them to explain why they did it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, what’s the big idea? Who said you could use my computer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿！ 你这是什么意思？ 谁说你可以用我的电脑？

Sense.LEXUNIT: it is big of sb to do sth

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone is very kind or generous to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 某人做某事很大度[慷慨]

Subsense.DEF: used when you really think that someone is not kind or helpful at all
Subsense.TRAN: 某人真够大度[大方]的〔反语〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: £5! That was big of her!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五英镑！ 她也真够大方的！

Sense.DEF: someone who has a big mouth cannot be trusted to keep things secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have opened my big mouth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不该多嘴的。

GramExa.GLOSS: said when you wish you had not told someone a secret

Sense.DEF:
big letters are
capital s
, for example G, R, A etc
big words are long or unusual and are difficult to read or understand
Sense.TRAN: 长而难读[懂]的﹐生僻的﹐深奥的

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/get too big for your boots

Sense.TRAN: 自以为了不起﹐自高自大﹐自视过高

Sense.DEF: to threaten to use your power to get what you want
Sense.TRAN: 挥舞大棒﹐执行大棒政策〔用权力相威胁以达到自己的目的〕

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a man, who is not brave
used when you want to praise someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Big up to Kelly Holmes! She ran a superb race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯莉·霍姆斯真了不起！她比赛跑得很出色。

Exponent.EXAMPLE: a big city
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大城市
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a big guy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大个子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a big mistake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大的错误
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lack of funding is the biggest problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺少资金是最大的问题。

Exponent.DEF: a slightly more formal word than big , used to describe objects and amounts
Exponent.TRAN: 〔物体或数量〕大的〔比big略为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a large bowl
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大碗
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Large areas of the forest have been destroyed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大片林区被毁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The museum attracts a large number of visitors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家博物馆吸引了大批参观者。

Exponent.DEF: big and important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pollution is a major problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染是个主要的问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There has been a major change in government policy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的政策有一项重大的改变。

Exponent.DEF: quite big – used especially about amounts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They have spent a considerable amount of money on the project.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在这个项目上花费了大笔资金。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A substantial amount of heat is lost through the windows.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 热量通过窗户时大量散失。

Exponent.DEF: extremely big
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The table was enormous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张桌子非常大。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a huge explosion
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的爆炸
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There has been a massive increase in oil prices.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价大幅上涨。

Exponent.DEF: very big – used especially to describe the level or number of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He achieved great success in America.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在美国获得了巨大的成功。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The college offers a great number of courses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学院开设了大量课程。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a great advantage
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的优势

Exponent.DEF: extremely big – used about areas, distances, numbers, or amounts
Exponent.TRAN: 〔面积﹑距离﹑数目或数量〕巨大的﹐广袤的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: vast areas of rainforest
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大片的热带雨林
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A vast number of tourists visit the island every year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有大量游客来这座岛上旅游。

Exponent.DEF: extremely big and much bigger than other things of the same type
Exponent.TRAN: 巨大的﹐庞大的〔指胜过同类的其他事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gigantic waves crashed onto the beach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排排巨浪冲上海滩。

Exponent.DEF: extremely big – used about amounts or objects
Exponent.TRAN: 巨大的〔用于指数量或物体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: James ran up a colossal phone bill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯欠下巨额电话账单。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a colossal statue of Napoleon
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座巨型的拿破仑塑像

Exponent.DEF: having an extremely big effect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There have been some tremendous changes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了一些巨变。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My new job will be a tremendous challenge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的新工作将是一个巨大的挑战。

Sense.DEF: to say that someone or something is very good, especially in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公开地〕称赞某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always on TV bigging up his new band.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是在电视上吹嘘自己的新乐队。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of money and enjoy yourself in a social situation, in a way that other people will notice
the crime of being married to two people at the same time

a large musical band, especially popular in the 1940s and 1950s, that plays
jazz
or dance music and has a leader who plays
solo s

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤米·道尔西的大乐队

Sense.DEF: the idea that the universe began with a single large explosion (the ‘big bang’), and that the pieces are still flying apart
Sense.TRAN: 〔关于宇宙起源的〕大爆炸理论

Sense.DEF: a big-boned person is large without being fat
a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her parents spent big bucks on her wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母为她的婚礼花了一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: very large companies, considered as a powerful group with a lot of influence
a product or type of activity that people spend a lot of money on

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节食减肥现在成了大生意。

Sense.DEF: a large animal of the cat family, such as a lion or tiger

PIC.PICCONTENT: jaguar 美洲豹；cheetah 猎豹；leopard 豹；mane 鬃毛；paw 爪；lion 狮；lynx/bobcat AmE【美】猞猁；tail 尾巴；panther 黑豹；puma/cougar/mountain lion 美洲狮；tiger 虎

Sense.DEF: an important and powerful person in an organization – used humorously
used to say that you do not think something is as important as someone else thinks it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just a game. If you lose, big deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是个游戏﹐就是输了也没什么大不了的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the big deal? It’s only a birthday, not the end of the world.

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no big deal . Everybody forgets things sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有关系﹐谁都有记性不好的时候。

Sense.DEF: an important or exciting event or situation
Sense.TRAN: 重要的事情[情况]﹐令人激动的事情[情况]
Sense.EXAMPLE: This audition is a big deal for Joey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次试演对乔伊来说是一件大事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a big deal of/out of/about sth
Sense.DEF: to get too excited or upset about something, or make something seem more important than it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know I’m probably making a big deal out of nothing, but I’m worried about you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我可能有点小题大做﹐但我是担心你。

Sense.DEF:
a small railway in a
funfair
, with steep slopes and sharp curves to give an exciting ride
a group of seven bright stars seen only from northern parts of the world

large wild animals hunted for sport, such as lions and
elephant s
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big game hunter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猎捕巨兽的猎人

Sense.DEF: something very large, important, or successful
Sense.TRAN: 庞然大物﹔重要事情﹔大热门
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think their new CD is going to be a biggie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他们的新唱片会大卖。

Sense.DEF: said when something is not important or when you are not upset or angry about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh, I’m sorry.’ ‘No biggie.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “噢﹐对不起。”“没关系。”

Sense.DEF: government – used when people think it is controlling their lives too much
Sense.TRAN: 大政府〔用于指政府对人们的生活控制过多〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: big government welfare policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府全包的福利政策

Sense.DEF: a person or company that has a lot of power and influence
Sense.TRAN: 大人物﹐要人﹔有影响力的公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the party’s big guns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党的要员之一

Sense.DEF: someone who is big-headed thinks they are very important, clever etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自高自大的﹐自负的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: very kind and generous
someone who is very important and successful and who has a lot of influence
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the big hitters of the Conservative Party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党的要员之一

Sense.DEF: a wild sheep with long curved horns that lives in the mountains of western North America
a slight bend or curve in a coast
an important and popular male student at a college or university, especially someone who is good at sports
Sense.TRAN: 校园名人﹐校园风头人物〔尤指大学中擅长体育的男生〕

Sense.DEF: a large amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carter won big money in Vegas last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特去年在拉斯维加斯赢了一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: someone who cannot be trusted to keep secrets
Sense.TRAN: 多嘴的人﹐守不住秘密的人

Sense.DEF: a famous person or group, especially a musician, actor etc
Sense.TRAN: 知名人士[团体]〔尤指音乐家或演员等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor attendance at the concert was put down to the lack of big names.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场音乐会上座率低被归咎于缺少大牌。

Sense.DEF: an important and powerful person in an organization
someone who is bigoted
Sense.TRAN: 固执己见的人﹐思想顽固的人﹐执拗的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: racist bigots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏执的种族主义者

Sense.DEF: having such strong opinions about a group of people that you are unwilling to listen to anyone else’s opinions
Sense.TRAN: 固执己见的﹐顽固不化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bigoted old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 思想偏执的老人

Sense.DEF: bigoted behaviour or beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensational news stories that just encourage bigotry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只会助长偏执行为的煽情的新闻报道

Sense.DEF: the cinema, rather than television or the theatre

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was last seen on the big screen in the comedy ‘Jawbreaker’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最近演出的一部影片是喜剧片《风骚坏姊妹》。

Sense.DEF: relating to the cinema, rather than to television or the theatre
Sense.EXAMPLE: his big-screen career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的银幕生涯

Sense.DEF: a big-screen television is very big
someone who has a lot of power or influence in a company or an area of business
Sense.TRAN: 要人﹐大人物﹔有权势的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father’s a big shot and he thinks he is, too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲是个大人物﹐他以为自己也是。

Sense.DEF: expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: big ticket items such as cars or jewelry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车﹑珠宝等高价商品

Sense.DEF: the position of being very famous or important, for example in the entertainment business or in politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔演艺界或政界等的〕头号地位﹐最高成就﹐大红大紫
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 46-year-old author has finally hit the big time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位46岁的作家终于走红了。

Sense.DEF: to a very large degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morris messed up big time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯把事情搞得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: the largest toe on your foot

the very large tent in which a
circus
performance takes place

a machine used in
amusement park s
, consisting of a very large upright wheel with seats hanging from it, that turns round slowly
an important person
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few of the company bigwigs have their own jets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的一些要员拥有自己的喷气式飞机。

Sense.DEF: a bijou house or apartment is small and fashionable – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 小巧雅致的〔指房子或公寓﹐常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bijou residence in Mayfair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅费尔区一座小巧雅致的住宅

Sense.DEF: a bicycle
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a bike ride .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去骑会儿自行车吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ll be coming by bike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将骑自行车来。

Sense.DEF:
a
motorcycle
used to tell someone rudely to go away
to ride a bicycle
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bikes to work every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天骑自行车上班。

Sense.DEF:
to take something to someone by
motorcycle
in order to get it there quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re late for our deadline. Can you bike the photos over to us?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们赶不上截止日期了﹐你骑摩托车把照片送来给我们好吗？

Sense.DEF:
someone who rides a
motorcycle
, especially as part of a group
Sense.TRAN: 摩托车手〔尤指团体成员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the bikers rode Harley-Davidsons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数摩托车手骑的都是哈雷－戴维森。

Sense.DEF: someone who rides a bicycle
Sense.TRAN: 骑自行车[脚踏车﹐单车]的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: trails for bikers and hikers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑车者和远足者行走的小路

Sense.DEF: a set of clothes worn by women for swimming, which consists of a top part covering the breasts, and a bottom part
Sense.TRAN: 比基尼式游泳衣﹐三点式泳装

Sense.DEF: the place on a woman’s legs where the hair around her sexual organs stops growing
Sense.TRAN: 比基尼线〔女性生殖器官的毛发区域边缘〕

Sense.DEF:
a
consonant
sound such as /p/ or /b/ that is made using both lips
involving two groups or nations

GramExa.EXAMPLE: bilateral negotiations between Israel and Syria
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以色列和叙利亚之间的双边谈判

Sense.DEF: a blue-black fruit that grows in Northern Europe, or the bush it grows on

a bitter green-brown liquid formed in the
liver
, which helps you to
digest
fats
anger and hatred
the broad bottom part of a ship
nonsense
written or spoken in two languages
Sense.TRAN: 双语的﹔包含两种语言的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bilingual dictionary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双语词典
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report proposed bilingual education in schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告建议在学校中实行双语教学。

Sense.DEF: able to speak two languages equally well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their kids are bilingual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的孩子会说两种语言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Louis is virtually bilingual in Dutch and German.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 荷兰语和德语路易斯差不多都会讲。

Sense.DEF:
feeling as if you might
vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt a bilious attack coming on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到一阵恶心。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹐使人厌恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: bilious green walls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的绿墙

Sense.DEF: bad-tempered
to cheat someone, especially by taking their money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Consumers were bilked out of more than $15,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者被骗去了15,000多美元。

Sense.DEF: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill for the repairs came to $650.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理费用总计650美元。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you paid the phone bill?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话费你付了吗？

Sense.DEF: a list showing how much you have to pay for food you have eaten in a restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could we have the bill, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我们结账好吗？

Sense.DEF: a written proposal for a new law, that is brought to a parliament so that it can be discussed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The House of Representatives passed a new gun-control bill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 众议院通过了一个新的枪支管制法案。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The senator introduced a bill that would increase the minimum wage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位参议员提交了一个拟提高最低工资的法案。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-dollar bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张五美元的钞票

Sense.DEF: to be exactly what you need
Sense.TRAN: 符合需要﹔最为合适﹔管用
Sense.EXAMPLE: This car fits the bill perfectly. It’s cheap and gets good mileage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车很合适﹐既便宜又省油。

Sense.DEF: a programme of entertainment at a theatre, concert, cinema etc, with details of who is performing, what is being shown etc
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Tricia topped the bill
was the most important performer
at the Children’s Variety Show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里西娅是儿童综艺节目的主角。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb/sth a clean bill of health
Sense.DEF: to officially state that someone is in good health or that something is working correctly
Sense.TRAN: 给某人开具健康证明/给某物开具合格证明
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maddox was given a clean bill of health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马多克斯领到了一张健康证明。

Sense.DEF: a bird’s beak
a printed notice advertising an event

the front part that sticks out on a hat such as a
baseball cap
the police

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most people pay their bills on time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都按时付账单。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She went down to the lobby to settle the bill for their rooms.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下楼去大堂结算房费。

Collocate.COLLOC: foot the bill/pick up the bill
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay for something, especially when you do not want to
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔尤指不情愿地〕承担费用﹐支付
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Taxpayers will probably have to foot the bill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税人可能不得不承担此项支出。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use a lot of something so that you have a big bill to pay
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s easy to run up a big bill on your mobile phone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 用手机很容易欠下一大笔账单。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: is for that amount
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The bill came to $60.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 账单金额为60美元。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Turn off the lights or we’ll get a huge electricity bill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 把灯关掉﹐不然我们的电费账单要吓死人了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: still unpaid

Exponent.DEF: a piece of paper that tells you how much you must pay
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many families are struggling to pay their bills.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多家庭只能勉强付清账单。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We got a huge phone bill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到一份巨额的电话账单。

Exponent.DEF: a bill that tells you how much you must pay in a restaurant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I have the check, please?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我结账好吗？

Exponent.DEF: a document that lists the goods that a company has sent, or the services they have provided, and tells you how much you must pay. It is often sent from one company to another company
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Payment is due ten days after receipt of the invoice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 付款期限是收到发票后十天。

Exponent.DEF: a bill that is added up at the end of a period of time, especially for food or drinks that you have had in a restaurant or hotel
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指餐厅或酒店的食物或饮料〕账单﹐账款
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People staying in the hotel can order food or drinks to be put on their tab.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 住店客人点的食物或饮料可以记在账上。

Sense.DEF: to send someone a bill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clients will be billed monthly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客户会按月收到账单。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was billed for equipment that I didn’t order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有订购过器材﹐却收到了账单。

Sense.DEF: if someone is billed to appear, perform etc somewhere, it has been planned and advertised that they will do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson was billed to speak at two conferences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海报上宣传约翰逊将会在两个会议上发言。

Sense.DEF: to kiss and talk softly
to advertise or describe something in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The castle bills itself as the oldest in England.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城堡号称是英格兰最古老的城堡。

Sense.DEF: a large sign used for advertising
a private house where soldiers are living temporarily
Sense.TRAN: 〔设在民房里的〕部队临时营舍

Sense.DEF: to put soldiers in a private house to live there temporarily

a small flat leather case, used for carrying paper money,
credit card s
etc in your pocket
Sense.TRAN: 〔装钞票﹑信用卡等的〕钱包﹐皮夹子

Sense.DEF: a tool that has a curved blade with a hooked point, used for cutting off tree branches etc

a game played on a cloth-covered table in which balls are hit with a
cue
a long stick
against each other and into pockets at the edge of the table
to name a particular performer, actor etc as being the most important person in a show, play etc
the number 1,000,000,000
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final cost could be as much as one billion dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的费用可能高达十亿美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 3.5 billion years ago
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 35亿年前
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Overseas debt is a staggering £16 billion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外债数字惊人﹐高达160亿英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Airlines have lost billions of dollars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司损失了数十亿美元。

Sense.DEF: an extremely large number of things or people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A billion stars shone in the night sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜空中繁星闪烁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are billions of things I want to say.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有很多很多的话要说。

Sense.DEF: someone who has more than a billion dollars or pounds
a signed document ordering someone to pay someone else a particular amount of money
a list of the food that is served in a restaurant
a list of the goods being carried, especially on a ship
a written statement of the most important rights of the citizens of a country
a written document showing that someone has bought something
if something made of cloth billows, it moves in the wind
Sense.TRAN: 〔布制品在风中〕飘动﹐扬起﹐鼓起
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her long skirt billowed in the breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的长裙在微风中飘动。

Sense.DEF: if a cloud or smoke billows, it rises in a round mass

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was smoke billowing out of the windows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户里冒出滚滚浓烟。

Sense.DEF: a moving cloud or mass of something such as smoke or cloth
Sense.TRAN: 翻滚的云 [烟]﹔翻卷飘动的东西

Sense.DEF: a wave, especially a very large one
a pot for cooking or boiling water when you are camping
Sense.TRAN: 〔露营时煮饭烧水用的〕铁皮罐

Sense.DEF: a male goat – used especially by or to children
someone who has no friends
Sense.TRAN: 孤独的人﹐没有朋友的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was left sitting on my own, looking like Billy no-mates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只剩下我一人坐着﹐孤零零的。

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for an attractive but unintelligent young woman
Sense.TRAN: 漂亮但不聪明的年轻女子〔侮辱性用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He picked up some bimbo at the club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在俱乐部搭上了一个傻乎乎的美艳女郎。

Sense.DEF: appearing or happening every two months or twice each month
Sense.TRAN: 两月一次的﹔一月两次的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bimonthly magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双月刊﹔半月刊

Sense.DEF: a container for putting waste in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Throw it in the bin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它扔到垃圾箱里去。

Sense.DEF: a large container for storing things, such as goods in a shop or substances in a factory

PIC.HEADING: BINS 垃圾箱
PIC.PICCONTENT: pedal bin BrE【英】脚踏式垃圾桶；recycling bin/box 废物回收箱；wastepaper basket BrE【英】/wastebasket AmE【美】废纸篓；dustbin BrE【英】/garbage can AmE【美】垃圾桶；wheelie bin BrE【英】大型轮式垃圾箱；litter bin BrE【英】/trash can AmE【美】垃圾箱

Sense.DEF: to throw something away
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just bin that letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那封信就扔掉吧。

Sense.DEF: a system of counting, used in computers, in which only the numbers 0 and 1 are used
consisting of two parts
Sense.TRAN: 由两部分组成的﹔二元的﹔双重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a binary star system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双星系

Subsense.DEF: to tie someone so that they cannot move or escape
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They bound my arms and legs with rope.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用绳子绑住我的手臂和腿。

GramExa.GLOSS: tied up, and with cloth tied around your mouth so you cannot speak

Subsense.DEF: to tie things firmly together with cloth or string
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The pile of newspapers was bound with string.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这捆报纸用绳子扎着。

Sense.DEF: to form a strong emotional or economic connection between two people, countries etc
Sense.TRAN: 把…紧紧联系在一起﹔使关系密切

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their shared experiences in war helped to bind the two communities together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共同的战争经历使这两个团体紧密团结在一起。

Sense.DEF: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The monks are bound by vows of silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 僧侣们必须遵守保持缄默的誓言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees are not bound to give their reasons for leaving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员辞职无须说明缘由。

Sense.DEF: to stick together in a mass, or to make small pieces of something stick together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flour mixture isn’t wet enough to bind properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这面粉混合料没加够水﹐所以团不起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hydrogen molecule binds with the oxygen molecule.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 氢分子会和氧分子结合。

Sense.DEF: to fasten the pages of a book together and put them in a cover
to sew cloth over the edge of a piece of material, or stitch over it, to strengthen it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The edges of the blanket were bound with ribbon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毯子的四边都用缎带滚了边。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is bound over by a court of law, they are warned that, if they cause more trouble, they will be legally punished
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The demonstrators were bound over to keep the peace.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威者被责令具结保证不再闹事。

Subsense.DEF:
if someone is bound over for
trial
, they are forced by law to appear in a court

Sense.DEF: an annoying or difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a real bind having to look after the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要照顾这些孩子很烦人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Caroline was really in a bind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗琳遇到了很大的麻烦。

Sense.DEF: a removable cover for holding loose sheets of paper, magazines etc
a person or machine that fastens the parts of a book together
a substance that makes things stick together
an agreement in which you pay money to show that you intend to buy a property
a promise, agreement etc that must be obeyed
Sense.TRAN: 具有约束力[必须履行]的合同/承诺/协议等

Sense.DEF: a book cover
material sewn or stuck along the edge of a piece of cloth for strength or decoration
a wild plant that winds itself around other plants
a short period when you do too much of something, such as eating or drinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔短时间内的〕无节制﹔大吃大喝
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drinking binge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一番痛饮
Sense.EXAMPLE: a week-long binge of shopping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周的疯狂购物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ken’s gone on a binge with his mates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯和他的伙伴们一起饮酒作乐去了。

Sense.DEF: to do too much of something, such as eating or drinking, in a short period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whenever she’s depressed, she binges on chocolates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每当情绪低落时她就狂吃巧克力。

Sense.DEF:
the activity of drinking a large amount of alcohol in a short period of time, usually in order to become
drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Binge drinking is an increasing problem among young people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人中的纵酒问题越来越严重。

Sense.DEF: a game played for money or prizes, in which numbers are chosen by chance and called out, and if you have the right numbers on your card, you win
Sense.TRAN: 宾戈游戏〔一种赌钱或有奖游戏﹐玩者持有一张数字牌﹐如果牌上的数字和开叫的号码对上﹐玩者便胜出〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vera won £20 at bingo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薇拉玩宾戈赢了20英镑。

Sense.DEF: used when you have just done something successfully and are pleased
Sense.TRAN: 好﹐妙〔做成某事后发出的欢呼声〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bingo! That’s the one I’ve been looking for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太好了！ 那正是我一直在找的。

Sense.DEF:
a plastic bag used inside a
bin
for holding waste
Sense.TRAN: 〔置于垃圾桶内的〕塑料垃圾袋

Sense.DEF: someone who comes to people’s houses to collect their waste
a pair of special glasses, that you hold up to your eyes to look at objects that are a long distance away

the ability to
focus
both eyes on one object, which humans, monkeys, and some birds and other animals have
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑猴﹑某些鸟类及其他动物具有的〕双目视觉

Sense.DEF: a mathematical expression that has two parts connected by the sign + or the sign −, for example 3x + 4y or x − 7
relating to or using living things
Sense.EXAMPLE: bio-genetics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物遗传学
Sense.EXAMPLE: biophysics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物物理学

Sense.DEF: someone who studies or works in biochemistry
the scientific study of the chemistry of living things

materials, chemicals etc that are biodegradable are changed naturally by
bacteria
into substances that do not harm the environment
Sense.TRAN: 可生物降解的﹐能进行生物降解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This carton is made of biodegradable plastic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这盒子是用生物降解塑料做的。

Sense.DEF:
a liquid made from vegetable oil or animal fat, which can be used instead of
diesel
in engines
Sense.TRAN: 生物柴油〔一种从植物油或动物脂肪中提取制成的油液﹐可代替柴油用于引擎中〕

Sense.DEF:
a large container in which plant material or animal waste is changed by bacteria, producing
methane
and
carbon dioxide
Sense.TRAN: 生物煮解器〔一种能将植物材料或动物排泄物煮解而产生甲烷和二氧化碳的大型容器〕

Sense.DEF: the variety of plants and animals in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the biodiversity of the rainforest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带雨林中的生物多样性

Sense.DEF: a method of helping people to relax by teaching them to control their heart rate, breathing etc, using an instrument attached to the body
Sense.TRAN: 生物反馈疗法〔利用连接人体的仪器来训练人们控制心率﹑呼吸等以放松身心〕

Sense.DEF: a substance made from plants or animal waste that can be used to produce heat or power
someone who writes a biography of someone else
a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Boswell’s biography of Dr. Johnson
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍斯韦尔为约翰逊博士写的传记

Sense.DEF: literature that consists of biographies

PronCodes.PRON: ˌbaɪəˈɡræfɪk ə l◂, ˌbaɪəˈɡræfək ə l◂

Sense.DEF:
something biological, such as a type of
bacteria
or a
virus
, that is dangerous to people's health

a small number of animals, plants, insects etc that are typical of all the animals, plants etc normally found in a particular area, which scientists study in order to get information about the whole area
Sense.EXAMPLE: This insect-bacteria bioindicator is a reliable tool for assessing environmental damage to the country’s wetlands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种昆虫－细菌生物指标是评估该国湿地环境破坏程度的可靠工具。

Sense.DEF:
the use of mathematics and computer science to solve biological problems, for example when studying the human
genome
relating to the natural processes performed by living things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the biological functions of the body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体的生物机能
Sense.EXAMPLE: Depression is both biological and psychological.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抑郁症与生理和心理都有关系。

Sense.DEF:
weapons, attacks etc that involve the use of living things, including
bacteria
, to harm other living things
Sense.TRAN: 生物武器/生物战/生物袭击等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ban on chemical and biological weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止生化武器

Sense.DEF: relating to biology
Sense.TRAN: 生物学的﹔与生物学有关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the biological sciences
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物科学

Sense.DEF:
a child’s parent through birth, rather than through
adoption
Sense.TRAN: 亲生父[母]亲/生父/生母等

Sense.DEF: the system in plants and animals that controls when they sleep, eat, produce babies etc
the idea that when a woman reaches a certain age, she will soon be too old to have a baby
Sense.TRAN: 受孕生理钟〔认为妇女到了一定年龄后不能生育的观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: career women who hear the biological clock ticking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感觉到受孕生理钟在滴答作响的职业妇女

Sense.DEF: someone who studies or works in biology
the scientific study of living things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a degree in biology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物学学位

Sense.DEF: the scientific laws that control the life of a particular type of animal, plant etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种动物﹑植物等的〕生活规律﹐生理习性
Sense.EXAMPLE: the biology of bacteria
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细菌的生理习性

Sense.DEF: plant and animal matter used to provide power or energy
a type of environment that is described according to the typical weather conditions and plants that exist there
Sense.TRAN: 生物群系〔根据气候和植被划分的地理环境〕

Sense.DEF:
relating to technology that can be used to measure things such as people’s eyes or fingerprints. These measurements can be kept on computer and then used to check someone’s
identity
, for example when they show a passport at an airport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物特征资料
Sense.EXAMPLE: biometric identifiers such as fingerprints or iris patterns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指纹﹑虹膜等生物识别码

Sense.DEF: bionic arms, legs etc are electronic and therefore stronger or faster than normal arms etc – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔手臂﹑腿等有电子装置而〕能力超人的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I swear Mom has bionic ears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定妈妈的耳朵有超能力。

Sense.DEF:
the scientific study of how
physics
relates to biological processes
a film that tells the story of someone’s life

the process in which large companies try to get
patent s
on
legal rights to
products that make use of plants, animals,
gene s
etc that were developed over many years by nature or by farmers, especially farmers in poorer countries
Sense.TRAN: 生物剽窃〔指大公司利用大自然或农民的成果给某些产品申请专利的行为〕

Sense.DEF:
the scientific study of plants and other living things found in nature, such as
bacteria
, in order to discover new drugs that can be used as medicines
Sense.TRAN: 生物勘探﹐生物多样性探究

Sense.DEF:
the removal of cells,
tissue
etc from someone’s body in order to find out more about a disease they may have
Sense.EXAMPLE: a breast biopsy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乳房切片检查﹔乳腺活组织检查

Sense.DEF: regular changes in the speed at which physical processes happen in your body, which some people believe can affect the way you feel
Sense.TRAN: 生物节律〔指体内生理过程中有规律的变化〕

Sense.DEF: things that are done to prevent diseases from spreading between people, animals, or crops
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poultry producers have started to adopt strict biosecurity measures .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家禽生产商开始采取严格的生物安全措施。

Sense.DEF: the part of the world in which animals, plants etc can live

the use of living things such as cells,
bacteria
etc to make drugs, destroy waste matter etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the biotech industries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物技术产业

Sense.DEF:
bacteria
or
virus es
very small living things that cause illness or disease
used as a weapon to kill a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He warned that influenza could be used as a bioweapon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他警告说﹐流感可被用作生物武器。

Sense.DEF: involving two political parties, especially parties with opposing views
Sense.TRAN: 由两党组成的﹔代表两党的〔尤指观点对立的两党〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bipartisan committee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个由两党代表组成的委员会

Sense.DEF: involving two different parts or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bipartite treaty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双边条约

Sense.DEF: an animal with two legs, such as a human
a type of aircraft with two sets of wings, especially one built in the early 20th century
Sense.TRAN: 双翼飞机〔尤指20世纪初期有两层机翼的飞机〕

Sense.DEF: involving two opposing countries, groups etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: the bipolar view of the world during the Cold War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷战时期两极分化的世界观

Sense.DEF: representing or including people from two different races
Sense.EXAMPLE: biracial families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双种族家庭

Sense.DEF:
a tree with smooth
bark
outer covering
and thin branches, or the wood from this tree
the practice of hitting people with birch sticks as an official punishment
a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs
Sense.EXAMPLE: wild birds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野鸟
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dawn was filled with the sound of birds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黎明时分﹐鸟鸣声不绝于耳。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a flock of birds
a group of birds flying together

Sense.EXAMPLE: a wooden bird cage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木制鸟笼

Sense.DEF: a word meaning a young woman, which some people think is offensive

Sense.DEF: the facts about sex – used humorously or to children
Sense.TRAN: 〔幽默用法或对儿童讲述的〕有关性的基本常识﹐性知识

Sense.DEF: used to say that you know something, but you will not say how you found out

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人告诉我说你订婚了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that two or more people have similar attitudes, beliefs etc
Sense.TRAN: 物以类聚﹐人以群分﹔有相同志趣[信念等]的人（聚在一起）

Subsense.DEF: to make a very rude sign at someone by holding your middle finger up
Subsense.TRAN: 对某人竖起中指〔一种下流手势〕

Subsense.DEF: to show strong disapproval of someone who is performing or speaking in public, by shouting, making rude noises etc
Subsense.TRAN: 向某人发嘘声﹐向某人喝倒彩

Sense.LEXUNIT: a bird in the hand (is worth two in the bush)
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to keep what you have than to risk losing it by trying to get more
Sense.TRAN: 一鸟在手胜过双鸟在林﹐千羊在望不如一兔在手

Sense.DEF: used to say that the person you are looking for has already left or escaped

Sense.DEF: to be silly, useless, or not practical
a person who seems wise, funny etc
Sense.TRAN: 聪明/狡猾/古怪/奇怪等的老东西

Sense.DEF: to serve a prison sentence

Crossrefto.REFLEX: kill two birds with one stone

Sense.DEF: a bowl in a garden that is filled with water for birds to wash in
someone who is silly or stupid
a dog that is trained to find and return with birds that have been shot for sport
Sense.TRAN: 猎鸟犬〔经训练能够捡回击落的鸟〕

Sense.DEF:
another name for
avian flu
a word meaning a little bird, used especially by or to children

in golf, a score that is one less than
par
Sense.TRAN: 小鸟球〔指高尔夫球中比标准杆数少一杆入洞〕

Sense.DEF:
a small object with feathers that you hit across the net in a game of
badminton

in golf, to get the ball into the hole in one hit less than
par
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球中〕以小鸟球打入（洞）

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伍兹最后两洞打出了小鸟球。

Sense.DEF: a brightly coloured bird from New Guinea
Sense.TRAN: 天堂鸟﹐极乐鸟〔一种色彩鲜艳的鸟﹐产于新几内亚〕

Sense.DEF: a tall orange flower
a bird that flies from one area or country to another, according to the seasons
someone who never stays in the same place for long
a bird that kills other birds or small animals for food

PIC.HEADING: BIRDS OF PREY 猛禽
PIC.PICCONTENT: beak 喙；talon 利爪；eagle 鹰；wing 翅膀；falcon 隼；owl 猫头鹰；vulture 秃鹫

Sense.DEF: a mixture of seeds for feeding birds
a view of something from high above it
Sense.TRAN: 鸟瞰（图）﹐〔自高处俯视的〕全景

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客在城堡的塔楼上可以鸟瞰这个地区。

Sense.DEF: a general report or account of something, without many details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bird’s-eye view of recent research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近期研究概观

Sense.DEF: a type of very small bullet that is fired in large numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd was dispersed by police using tear gas and birdshot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察用催泪瓦斯和小号铅弹驱散了人群。

Sense.DEF: the musical noises made by birds
a high wooden structure in a garden that you put food on for birds
someone who watches wild birds and tries to recognize different types

Sense.DEF: a square cap worn by Roman Catholic priests
Sense.TRAN: 〔天主教神职人员戴的〕法冠﹐四角帽

Sense.DEF:
a type of leather
sandal
a shoe that is open at the toes and heel
with a wide flat bottom
Sense.TRAN: 勃肯凉鞋〔一种鞋底宽平的皮制凉鞋〕

Sense.DEF: a pen with a small ball at the end that puts ink onto paper
if a woman gives birth, she produces a baby from her body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patsy was celebrating last night after giving birth to twins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕齐生下一对双胞胎﹐昨天晚上在庆祝。

Sense.DEF: the time when a baby comes out of its mother’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congratulations on the birth of your daughter!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恭喜你生了个女儿！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He only weighed 2 kilos at birth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出生时体重只有两公斤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry has been blind from birth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利先天失明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your date of birth ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的出生日期是哪一天？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exact place of birth is not recorded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确切的出生地没有记录。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They believe that the position of the planets at the time of birth determines the fate of the individual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们相信﹐出生时的星象决定了一个人的命运。
Sense.EXAMPLE: More and more women are choosing to have home births .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的女性选择在家分娩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking in pregnancy has been linked to premature birth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕期吸烟已被认为与早产有关联。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the association between birth weight and blood pressure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出生体重和血压的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug was found to cause serious birth defects .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药被发现可造成严重的先天缺陷。

Sense.DEF: the time when something new starts to exist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the birth of a nation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个国家的诞生

Sense.EXAMPLE: The film gave birth to a TV show of the same name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影催生了一部同名的电视剧。

Sense.DEF: the character, language, social position etc that you have because of the family or country you come from
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman of noble birth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位出身于贵族的女子

Sense.DEF: an official document showing when and where you were born, and your parents’ names
the practice of controlling the number of children you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: a safe method of birth control
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全的节育方法

Sense.DEF: your birthday is a day that is an exact number of years after the day you were born
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s my birthday on Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一是我的生日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My aunt called to wish me a happy birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姑妈打电话来祝我生日快乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne’s birthday party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮的生日派对

Sense.DEF: a day that is an exact number of years since an organization was established or an event first happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一组织的〕诞生日﹔〔事件〕开始的日子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The City of Cleveland Orchestra is celebrating its 200th birthday .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克利夫兰市管弦乐队正在庆祝乐队成立200周年。

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 光着身子﹐赤条条的﹐一丝不挂的〔幽默用法〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s Mum’s 50th birthday tomorrow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天是妈妈的50岁生日。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: said to someone on their birthday

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you have a nice birthday?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你生日过得开心吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What did you get for your birthday?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你收到了什么生日礼物？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He will celebrate his 90th birthday on 25th August.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将在8月25日庆祝90岁生日。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: remember to send a card or present
forget to send a card or present
the person whose birthday it is

Sense.DEF:
a child’s natural father, rather than a man who has become the child’s legal father through
adoption
the process of giving birth to a baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: a birthing class
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产课

Sense.DEF: a permanent mark on your skin that you have had since you were born
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul had a birthmark on his left cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗左脸颊上有块胎记。

Sense.DEF:
a child’s natural mother, rather than a woman who has become the child’s legal mother through
adoption
