a child’s natural mother or father, rather than someone who has become the child’s legal mother or father through
adoption
the place where someone was born, used especially when talking about someone famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stratford-upon-Avon was Shakespeare’s birthplace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文河畔的斯特拉特福是莎士比亚的出生地。

Sense.DEF: the place where something first started to happen or exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: New Orleans is the birthplace of jazz.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新奥尔良是爵士乐的发源地。

Sense.DEF: the number of births for every 100 or every 1,000 people in a particular year in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rising birthrate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上升的出生率

Sense.DEF: something such as a right, property, money etc that you believe you should have because of the family or country you belong to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freedom of speech is every American’s birthright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 言论自由是每一个美国人与生俱来的权利。

Sense.DEF: a small thin dry cake that is usually sweet and made for one person to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a packet of chocolate biscuits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包巧克力饼干
Sense.EXAMPLE: cheese and biscuits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶酪和饼干

Sense.DEF: a type of soft bread baked in small round pieces
a light brown colour
to be the most surprising, annoying etc thing you have ever heard
Sense.TRAN: 是听过的空前惊人[令人讨厌]的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard some excuses, but this really takes the biscuit!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也听过一些借口﹐可这个借口也太离谱了！

Sense.DEF: to divide something into two equal parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: A long cobbled street bisects the town from east to west.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条长长的鹅卵石街道从东向西把小镇一分为二。

Sense.DEF: sexually attracted to both men and women
having features of both males and females
Sense.TRAN: 具有雌雄两性特征的﹐雌雄同体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bisexual plant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雌雄同株的植物

Sense.DEF: a priest with a high rank in some Christian religions, who is the head of all the churches and priests in a large area
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教某些教派管辖大教区的〕主教
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Bishop of Durham
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达勒姆郡的主教

Sense.DEF:
a piece in the game of
chess
that can be moved sideways over any number of squares of the same colour
the area that a bishop is in charge of
the position of being a bishop

a grey-white metal that is often used in medicines. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Bi.
Sense.TRAN: 铋〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Bi〕

Sense.DEF: an animal like a large cow, with hair on its head and shoulders

a thick creamy soup made from
shellfish
Sense.EXAMPLE: lobster bisque
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙虾浓汤

Sense.DEF: a small restaurant or bar
Sense.EXAMPLE: a French bistro
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间法式小餐馆

Subsense.DEF: slightly or to a small degree
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Could you turn the TV up a bit?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把电视机稍微开响点儿好吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s a bit odd.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那可有点怪。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sorry to be leaving?’ ‘Yes, I am a bit.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要走了﹐心里难过吗？”“是的﹐有点难过。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Aren’t you being a little bit unfair?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这样是不是有点不公平？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think you’re a bit too young to be watching this.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你年纪还小﹐不适合看这个。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She looks a bit like my sister.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她长得有点儿像我妹妹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel a bit better now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在感觉稍微好些了。

Subsense.DEF: sometimes, but not very often
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I used to act a bit when I was younger.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我年轻时演过一点戏。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually avoid a (little) bit and use slightly , rather , or somewhat instead
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面语中﹐人们一般避免使用 a (little) bit﹐而使用 slightly﹐rather 或 somewhat
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This system is slightly more efficient.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套系统的效率略高一些。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The final cost was somewhat higher than expected.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终成本比原先估计的稍高些。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a substance or of something that is not a physical object

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I may need a bit of help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可能需要一些帮助。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He still likes to do a bit of gardening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍然喜欢干些园艺活儿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want to spend a bit of time with him before he goes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想在他走之前陪他一会儿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: With a bit of luck, we should have finished by five o'clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺利的话我们5点钟之前应该能够完成的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone needs a little bit of encouragement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁都需要一点鼓励。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like cream in your coffee?’ ‘Yes please, just a bit.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的咖啡要加奶油吗？”“好的﹐请加一点点。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can we have a bit less noise, please?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家稍微安静一点好吗？

Sense.DEF: a fairly large amount or to a fairly large degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s quite a bit older than you, isn’t she?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比你大很多吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knows quite a bit about painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很懂油画。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I expect you do quite a bit of travelling?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你是经常在外面跑的吧？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re worth quite a bit more than I thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们比我原先想的要贵很多。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time or a short distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to wait a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得等一会儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked on a bit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我继续走了一小段路。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you in a bit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一会儿见你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sat around for a bit, chatting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐着聊了一会儿。

Sense.DEF: used to show that the way you describe something is only true to a limited degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news came as a bit of a shock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个消息让人感到有点震惊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a bit of a fool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉自己有点傻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks like they left in a bit of a hurry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来他们走得有点匆忙。

Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re not a bit like your brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一点儿也不像你弟弟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Am I cross? No, not a bit of it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生气？没有﹐我一点也不生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not in the least bit interested in whose fault it is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于是谁的错﹐我一点也不感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, you haven’t surprised me, not one bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你并没有让我吃惊﹐一点也不。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is equally important, bad etc as something else
Sense.TRAN: 同样重要/糟糕/好等〔表示强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jodi plays every bit as well as the men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔迪打得一点儿也不比男人差。

Sense.DEF: gradually
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bit by bit, I was starting to change my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢地我开始改变主意了。

Sense.DEF: in several small parts or stages
Sense.EXAMPLE: Memorize it a bit at a time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次记一点。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a bit of doing/explaining etc
Sense.DEF: to be difficult to do, explain etc
Sense.TRAN: 做起来/解释起来等有点费劲
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new system took a bit of getting used to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的制度适应起来有点费劲。

Sense.DEF: to be unacceptable, impolite, or unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a bit much when he criticizes us for doing something that he does himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真有点过分﹐自己这样做﹐却还要批评我们这样不对。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a bit of all right
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is sexually attractive
someone’s bit on the side is a person they are having a sexual relationship with, even though they already have a wife, husband, or partner – used humorously or to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 婚外情人﹐相好〔幽默用法或含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stayed, in the hope that he’d tire of his bit on the side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她留下来了﹐希望他会厌倦他的相好。

Sense.DEF: offensive expressions meaning a young woman, especially one who is sexually attractive
someone of a lower social class that someone has a sexual relationship with – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔与社会地位较高者有性关系的〕粗人〔幽默用法〕

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法:a bit, a bit of
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a bit before an adjective, not before a noun or an adjective and noun
F2NBox.TRAN: a bit用于形容词之前﹐而不用于名词前﹐也不用于有形容词修饰的名词前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He’s a bit shy (NOT 不说 a bit shy man).
F2NBox.EXPL: Before a noun or an adjective and noun, use a bit of
F2NBox.TRAN: 名词或有形容词修饰的名词前用a bit of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There was a bit of trouble (NOT 不说 a bit trouble).
It was a bit of a strange decision (NOT 不说 a bit strange decision).
F2NBox.EXPL: You can also use a bit after a verb or its object
F2NBox.TRAN: 动词或其宾语之后也可以用a bit
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I cried a bit (NOT 不说 a bit cried).

Sense.DEF: a small piece of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: bits of broken glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃碎片
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wedged the door open with a bit of wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他塞了一小块木头抵住门不让它关上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The aircraft was blown to bits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机被炸得粉碎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s taken the engine to bits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把发动机拆开了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The old house was falling to bits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那栋老房子要塌了。

Sense.DEF: a part of something larger
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the boring bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部分很没劲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We did the last bit of the journey on foot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一段路程我们是步行的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you like the bit about the monkey?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢讲猴子的那一段吗？

Sense.DEF: very much or extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark’s a darling – I love him to bits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克是个可爱的人﹐我非常爱他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always wanted a car, so I’m thrilled to bits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直想要一辆汽车﹐所以我兴奋极了。

Sense.DEF: the smallest unit of information that a computer uses
Sense.TRAN: 位﹐比特〔计算机使用的最小信息单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 32-bit processor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 32位处理器

Sense.DEF: the sharp part of a tool for cutting or making holes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drill bit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钻头

Sense.DEF:
the metal bar attached to a horse’s
bridle
that is put into its mouth and used to control it
any small things of various kinds
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me get all my bits and pieces together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我把所有零零碎碎的东西都拾掇在一起。

Sense.DEF: to do a fair share of the work, effort etc that is needed to achieve something good or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone should do their bit for the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都应该尽自己的本分保护环境。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get the bit between your teeth

AmEVariant.LEXVAR: take the bit between your teeth

Sense.DEF: to do something or deal with something in a very determined way, so that you are not likely to stop until it is done

Subsense.DEF: 25 cents or 50 cents
a small coin

Sense.DEF: to criticize something strongly
Sense.TRAN: 把某事物批评得一文不值
Sense.EXAMPLE: The critics pulled his new play to bits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 评论家把他的新剧本说得一无是处。

Sense.DEF: used to mean a kind of behaviour or experience that is typical of someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Then she gave us the concerned mother bit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随后她像母亲般为我们担心起来。

Sense.DEF: to be extremely upset because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为发生不愉快或令人失望的事情而〕沮丧
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in bits after the race, and looked totally gutted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛结束以后她非常沮丧﹐看上去难过极了。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the noun bit in spoken and written English. 名词bit在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the noun bit is much more common in spoken English than in written English. This is because a bit is more common than a little in spoken English, and bit is used in a lot of common spoken phrases. 本图表显示﹐名词bit在英语口语中的使用频率远远高于书面语﹐因为a bit在口语中比a little常用﹐而且口语中很多短语是由bit构成的。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
bite
a female dog
an insulting word for a woman that you dislike or think is unpleasant – also used humorously between friends
Sense.TRAN: 泼妇﹐婆娘〔侮辱性用语﹐有时也在朋友中间使用﹐为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The silly bitch went and told the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个蠢婆娘去报告了警察。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ooh, you’re such a bitch!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗬﹐你这个小泼妇！

Sense.DEF: something that causes problems or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love that silk dress, but it’s a bitch to wash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很喜欢那条真丝裙子﹐但是洗起来太麻烦了。

Sense.DEF: to make unpleasant remarks about someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He never bitches about other members of the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来不说其他队员的坏话。

Sense.DEF: to complain continuously
Sense.TRAN: 没完没了地发牢骚﹐不停地埋怨
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop bitching!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别抱怨了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always bitching at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是对我发牢骚。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: That guy has one bitchin truck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家伙有一辆很棒的卡车。

Sense.DEF: unkind and unpleasant about other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bitchy remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刻薄的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can be really bitchy sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有时候会很恶毒。

Sense.DEF: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She bit into a croissant and took a sip of coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她咬了一口牛角面包﹐啜了一口咖啡。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: An adult conger eel can easily bite through a man’s leg.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成年的康吉鳗不费力就能咬穿人的腿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nina pushed her fist into her mouth and bit down hard .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妮娜把拳头塞进嘴巴﹐使劲地咬下去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a man whose arm was bitten off by an alligator
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被短吻鳄咬掉一条胳膊的男子

GramExa.GLOSS: bite the nails on your fingers, especially because you are nervous
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish I could stop biting my nails.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望自己能改掉咬指甲的毛病。

GramExa.GLOSS: because you are upset or not sure what to say
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔因为难过或不知道该说什么而〕咬着嘴唇
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She paused uncertainly, biting her lip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她犹豫着停了下来﹐咬着嘴唇。

Sense.DEF: to injure someone by making a hole in their skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ve been bitten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像被什么东西咬了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

Sense.DEF: if an object bites into a surface, it presses firmly into it and does not move or slip
Sense.TRAN: 卡紧﹐咬住﹐紧抓住〔某个表面〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hooves of the galloping horses had bitten deep into the soft earth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾驰的马儿在松软的泥土里踏出了深深的蹄印。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wore boots that bit into the ice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿了一双能卡住冰面的靴子。

Sense.DEF: to start to have an unpleasant effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new tobacco taxes have begun to bite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的烟草税已经开始产生不良效果。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The recession is biting into the music industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济衰退渐渐影响到了音乐行业。

Sense.DEF: to believe what someone tells you, or to buy something they are selling, especially when they have persuaded you to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new camcorders were withdrawn after consumers failed to bite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为不被消费者接受﹐这几款新型摄像机退出了市场。

Sense.DEF: if a fish bites, it takes food from a hook and so gets caught
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fish just aren’t biting today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天鱼儿就是不咬饵。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from saying what you really think, even though this is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: She should have bitten her tongue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她应当忍住不说出来的。

Sense.DEF: to die, fail, or be defeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: Italy’s championship hopes eventually bit the dust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利队夺冠的希望最后化为了泡影。

Sense.DEF: to start dealing with an unpleasant or dangerous situation because you cannot avoid it any longer
Sense.TRAN: 硬着头皮﹐咬紧牙关应付
Sense.EXAMPLE: I finally bit the bullet and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最后还是硬着头皮走了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: bite off more than you can chew
Sense.DEF: to try to do more than you are able to do
used to say that there is no need to be afraid of someone, especially someone in authority
Sense.TRAN: 他/她又不会咬你〔用于表示不用害怕某人﹐尤指有权势的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, go and ask him – he won’t bite!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去问问他吧——他又不会吃人！

Sense.DEF: used to ask why someone is annoyed or upset
Sense.TRAN: 你/她等有什么事不开心呢？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you dislike someone or something very much or think that something is very bad
used to say that if you have failed or been hurt once, you will be more careful next time
Sense.TRAN: 一回吃亏﹐两回学乖﹔一朝被蛇咬﹐十年怕井绳

Sense.LEXUNIT: bite the hand that feeds you
Sense.DEF: to harm someone who has helped or supported you

Sense.LEXUNIT: be bitten by the showbiz/travel/flying etc bug
Sense.DEF: to develop a very strong interest in something
Sense.TRAN: 迷上娱乐业/旅行/飞行等

Exponent.DEF: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog bit me!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这狗咬了我！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I sometimes bite my fingernails when I’m nervous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有时候紧张了就会咬指甲。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He bit into the apple.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他咬了一口苹果。

Exponent.DEF: to keep biting something that is in your mouth
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Helen was chewing a piece of gum.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦嚼着口香糖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was chewing on a cigar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他嚼着雪茄。

Exponent.DEF: if an animal gnaws something, it bites it repeatedly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog was in the yard gnawing on a bone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那狗在院子里啃骨头。

Exponent.DEF: to give someone or something a small sharp bite
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I took the hamster out of his cage, he nipped me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把仓鼠抓出笼子时﹐它咬了我一口。

Exponent.DEF: to take a lot of small bites from something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A fish nibbled at the bait.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条鱼咬饵了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She sat at her desk, nibbling her sandwich.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在书桌前啃着三明治。

Exponent.DEF: to bite someone or something with a lot of force, so that your teeth go right into them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog sank its teeth into my leg.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗狠狠咬住我的腿。

Exponent.DEF: to bite something and chew it in a noisy way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The donkey was chomping on a carrot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那头驴正咔嚓咔嚓地吃着胡萝卜。

Exponent.DEF: if an insect stings you, it makes a very small hole in your skin. You use sting about bees, wasps, and scorpions, and bite about mosquitoes, ants, spiders, and snakes
Exponent.TRAN: 〔昆虫〕叮﹐刺﹐蜇〔蜜蜂﹑黄蜂﹑蝎子等用sting﹐蚊子﹑蚂蚁﹑蜘蛛﹑蛇等用bite〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She stepped on a wasps’ nest and must have been stung at least 20 times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她踩到一个黄蜂窝﹐至少被蜇了20下。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from saying or showing what you really think
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tamar bit back the retort that sprang to her lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔马已经话到嘴边﹐却忍住了没有反驳。

Sense.DEF: to react strongly and angrily to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Determined to bite back at car thieves, he wired his car to an electric fence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决心回击盗车贼﹐把他的汽车连到了电围栏上。

Sense.DEF: the act of cutting or crushing something with your teeth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Antonio devoured half his burger in one bite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安东尼奥一口就咬下半个汉堡包。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take/have a bite (of sth/out of sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She picked up the sandwich and took a bite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿起三明治咬了一口。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I have a bite of your apple?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我咬一口你的苹果行吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some fish can give you a nasty bite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些鱼会把你咬得很痛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body was covered in bite marks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她浑身都是咬痕。

Sense.DEF: a small hole made where an animal or insect has bitten you

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 蛇咬的伤口/蚂蚁叮的印子等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The infection is passed by the bite of a mosquito.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病是通过蚊子叮咬传染的。

Sense.DEF: a small meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a bite to eat and a couple of drinks before the flight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起飞前我们简单吃了点东西﹐喝了几杯酒。

Sense.DEF: a pleasantly sharp taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goat’s cheese adds extra bite to any pasta dish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羊乳奶酪会增加面食的香味。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of coldness
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no mistaking the approach of winter; he could feel its bite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天无疑已经临近﹐他感到了寒意。

Sense.DEF: a special quality in a performance, piece of writing etc that makes its arguments very effective and likely to persuade people
Sense.TRAN: 〔表演﹑文章等的〕犀利﹐尖锐﹔感染力﹐说服力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film gains incisive bite from Sellers’ performance as the union chief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片因塞勒斯饰演工会领袖的表演而具有深深的穿透力。

Sense.DEF: when a fish takes the food from a hook
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I sit for hours and never get a bite .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我坐上几个钟头也没有一条鱼上钩。

Sense.LEXUNIT: another/a second bite at the cherry
Sense.DEF: a second chance to do something
the way that a person or animal’s top and bottom teeth touch when their mouth is closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our dentist said that Emmy should wear a brace to improve her bite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的牙医说埃米应该戴牙箍矫正牙齿的咬合。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: sb’s bark is worse than their bite

Sense.DEF: small enough to put into your mouth to eat
Sense.TRAN: 一口大小的﹐大小适于入口的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sushi served in convenient bite-size pieces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一口大小吃起来方便的寿司

Sense.DEF: a biting wind is unpleasantly cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: A biting wind blew down from the hills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山上吹来刺骨的寒风。

Sense.DEF: a biting criticism, remark etc is cruel or unkind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biting satire on corruption
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对腐败现象的辛辣嘲讽

Sense.DEF:
a computer image that is stored or printed as an arrangement of
bit s
Sense.EXAMPLE: bitmap fonts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 位图字体

Sense.DEF: a small and unimportant acting job in a play or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧或电影中的〕小角色﹔配角
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s had bit parts in a couple of soaps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一些肥皂剧中演过几个小角色。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not important and who has little influence in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个场合里的〕小角色﹐小人物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although he was NRC chairman, Hervey was strictly a bit player in government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫维虽然是美国核管理委员会主席﹐但在政府里他只是一个小角色。

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
bite
feeling angry, jealous, and upset because you think you have been treated unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 愤愤不平的﹐充满怨恨的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel very bitter about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对此非常不满。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a bitter old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个满腹怨恨的老人

Sense.DEF: making you feel very unhappy and upset
Sense.TRAN: 带来痛苦的﹐令人难过的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he failed, it would be a bitter disappointment to his parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他不成功﹐他父母会伤心失望。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His photo stirred up bitter memories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的照片勾起了痛苦的回忆。

GramExa.GLOSS: because of your own very unpleasant experiences
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She knew from bitter experience that it would be impossible to talk it over with Julian.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去痛苦的经历告诉她﹐这事没法和朱利安商量。

Sense.DEF: a bitter argument, battle etc is one in which people oppose or criticize each other with strong feelings of hate and anger
Sense.TRAN: 〔争论﹑战斗等〕激烈的﹐充满敌意的﹐怨愤的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The couple are locked in a bitter battle for custody of the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妻俩为争夺孩子的监护权闹得不可开交。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government faces bitter opposition to these policies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的这些政策遭到了激烈的反对。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The countries are still bitter enemies .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些国家彼此依然是死敌。

Sense.DEF: having a strong sharp taste, like black coffee without sugar
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enjoy the beer’s bitter taste as you slowly drink it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢地喝这啤酒﹐细细品尝它的苦味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: bitter chocolate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带苦味的巧克力

Sense.DEF: unpleasantly cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bitter wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺骨的寒风
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bitter cold of the Midwestern winters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中西部地区冬季的严寒

Sense.DEF: continuing until the end, even though this is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees have vowed to fight the closure to the bitter end .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员们誓死抗争到底﹐坚决抵制关闭企业。

Sense.DEF: something very unpleasant that you must accept
Sense.TRAN: 必须吞下去的苦药丸﹐不得不接受的现实
Sense.EXAMPLE: The knowledge that his friends no longer trusted him was a bitter pill to swallow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知朋友不再信任他﹐他很难接受。

Sense.DEF: a type of dark beer that is popular in Britain, or a glass of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: A pint of bitter, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来一品脱苦啤酒。

Sense.DEF: a strong bitter liquid made from plants that is added to alcoholic drinks
in a way that produces or shows feelings of great sadness or anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: He complained bitterly about his exam grades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他悲叹自己的考试成绩不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was bitterly disappointed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又伤心又失望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The march was bitterly opposed by local residents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次游行遭到了当地居民的愤怒抵制。

Sense.DEF: very cold
feelings, memories, or experiences that are bittersweet are happy and sad at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感﹑记忆或经历〕苦乐参半的﹐既有痛苦又有甜蜜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: bittersweet memories of childhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又苦又甜的童年记忆

Sense.DEF: a taste or smell that is bittersweet is both sweet and bitter at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔味道或气味〕甜中带苦的﹐又苦又甜的

Sense.DEF: having too many small parts that do not seem to be related or connected to each other
Sense.TRAN: 零碎的﹐东拼西凑的﹐不连贯的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the film was rather bitty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这部影片的情节相当混乱松散。

Sense.DEF: a dark sticky substance that is used for making the surface of roads
any sea animal that has two shells joined together
Sense.EXAMPLE: bivalve molluscs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双壳软体动物

Sense.DEF: a temporary camp built outside without any tents
to spend the night outside without tents in a temporary camp
Sense.EXAMPLE: The climbers bivouacked halfway up the mountain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山者在半山腰上露营。

Sense.DEF: appearing or happening every two weeks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biweekly magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双周刊

Sense.DEF: appearing or happening twice a week
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biweekly television drama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周播出两次的电视剧

Sense.DEF: a particular type of business, especially one relating to entertainment
Sense.EXAMPLE: the music biz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐行业

Sense.DEF: very unusual or strange
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bizarre coincidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪的巧合
Sense.EXAMPLE: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身着奇装异服的舞者

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that should be kept secret

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t go blabbing to your friends about this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把这事情抖出去说给你的朋友听。

Sense.DEF: to talk in a silly or annoying way for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish she’d stop blabbering on about her boyfriends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望她不要再没完没了地讲她那些男朋友的事了。

Sense.DEF: someone who tells secrets because they always talk too much
having the darkest colour, like coal or night
Sense.EXAMPLE: a black evening dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑色晚礼服

GramExa.GLOSS: very dark
GramExa.EXAMPLE: jet black hair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌黑的头发

Sense.DEF: very dark because there is no light
Sense.EXAMPLE:
It was still pitch black
very dark
out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面依然一片漆黑。

Subsense.DEF: belonging to the race of people who originally came from Africa and who have dark brown skin
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Over half the students are black.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有超过一半的学生是黑人。

Subsense.DEF: relating to black people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: politics from a black perspective
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑人政治
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Black and Asian music
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑人音乐和亚洲音乐

Sense.DEF: black coffee or tea does not have milk in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Black coffee, no sugar, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑咖啡﹐不加糖﹐谢谢。

Sense.DEF: very dirty

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 黑乎乎布满煤烟/黑乎乎布满灰尘/年久发黑等

Sense.DEF: sad and without hope for the future
Sense.TRAN: 无希望的﹔令人沮丧的﹔前景暗淡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the blackest period of European history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲历史上最黑暗的时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mood of black despair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲观绝望的心情
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been another black day for the car industry, with more job losses announced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车工业又经历了一个黑暗的日子﹐据公布称更多的人遭裁员。

Sense.DEF: making jokes about serious subjects, especially death
Sense.TRAN: 黑色的〔指拿严肃话题开玩笑﹐尤其是关于死亡〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very black joke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个很沉重的黑色笑话

Sense.DEF: full of feelings of anger or hate
Sense.TRAN: 怒气冲冲的﹔充满仇恨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Denise gave me a black look .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼丝恶狠狠地瞪了我一眼。

Sense.DEF: if there is a black mark against you, someone has a bad opinion of you because of something you have done

Sense.LEXUNIT: not be as black as you are painted
Sense.DEF: not to be as bad as people say you are
Sense.TRAN: 并不像人们说的那样坏

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: black deeds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶行

Sense.DEF: the dark colour of coal or night
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look good wearing black.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿黑色衣服挺好看。

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to the race of people who originally came from Africa and who have dark brown skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: laws that discriminated against blacks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歧视黑人的法律

Sense.DEF: to have money in your bank account

if a
trade union
blacks goods or a company, it refuses to work with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The union has blacked all non-urgent work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会拒绝了所有非紧急的工作。

Sense.DEF: to make something black

to become
unconscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a few seconds, he thought he was going to black out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有那么一会儿﹐他觉得自己快要晕过去了。

Sense.DEF: to put a dark mark over something so that it cannot be seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The censors had blacked out several words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审查员涂掉了几个单词。

Sense.DEF: to hide or turn off all the lights in a town or city, especially during war
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指战时〕对〔城镇或城市〕实行灯火管制

Sense.DEF:
skin that is black and blue has
bruise s
dark marks
on it as a result of being hit
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤被打得〕青一块紫一块的﹔有瘀痕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you do that again, I’ll beat you black and blue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你再那样做﹐我就把你打个鼻青脸肿。

Sense.DEF: showing pictures or images only in black, white, and grey
Sense.EXAMPLE: black and white photos
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑白照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old black and white TV
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台旧的黑白电视机

Sense.DEF: considering things in a way that is too simple and as if things are either completely good or completely bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔考虑问题的方式〕非黑即白的﹐绝对化的﹐简单化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s still a tendency to see the issues in black and white.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这些问题的观点仍然倾向于绝对化。

Sense.DEF: in written form, and therefore definite
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once it’s down in black and white, you can’t forget it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦白纸黑字写下来﹐你就不会忘记了。

Sense.DEF: to vote against someone, especially so that they cannot join a club or social group
Sense.TRAN: 投票反对〔某人参加某个俱乐部或社会组织〕

Sense.DEF:
a high rank in sports such as
judo
and
karate
Sense.TRAN: 黑腰带级〔柔道﹑空手道等运动中的一个高级水平〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has this rank

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sandy’s a black belt in judo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑迪是黑腰带级柔道选手。

Sense.DEF:
a small black or purple
berry
from a bush that has
thorn s
sharp points

a piece of
wireless
using electronic signals not wires
electronic equipment that you can hold in your hand. You can use it as a
PDA
small computer that you use to store information such as telephone numbers, addresses, and appointments
, as a
mobile phone
, to send and receive emails and
text message s
, and to look at the Internet.
Sense.TRAN: “黑莓”﹐黑莓手机〔一种智能手机〕

Sense.DEF: a common European and American bird, the male of which is completely black
Sense.TRAN: 乌鸫﹐黑唱鸫﹐黑鹂〔产于欧洲和美洲﹐其雄鸟遍体黑色〕

Sense.DEF:
a board with a dark smooth surface, used in schools for writing on with
chalk
a piece of equipment on an aircraft that records what happens on a flight and can be used to discover the cause of accidents
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机上的〕黑匣子﹐飞行记录器

Sense.DEF: a play, story etc that is funny, but also shows the unpleasant side of human life
an industrial area in the West Midlands of England
Sense.TRAN: 黑区〔英格兰西米德兰郡一工业地区〕

Sense.DEF:
a small blue-black
berry
that grows in bunches on a bush
the illness that killed large numbers of people in Europe and Asia in the 14th century
Sense.TRAN: 黑死病〔14世纪在欧亚蔓延导致大批人死亡的瘟疫〕

Sense.DEF: business activity that takes place secretly, especially in order to avoid tax
Sense.TRAN: 地下经济活动﹐黑色经济〔尤指为逃税而暗中进行的商业活动〕

Sense.DEF: to become black, or to make something black
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thunder became louder and the sky blackened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷声更响﹐天色也黑了下来。

Sense.DEF: to say unpleasant things about someone in order to make other people have a bad opinion of them
Sense.TRAN: 玷污某人的名声/品德/声誉

Sense.DEF: if you have a black eye, you have a dark area around your eye because you have been hit
Sense.TRAN: 〔被殴打所致的〕青黑色的眼眶﹐乌青的眼眶
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack looked like someone had given him a black eye .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克看上去好像被人打了﹐眼眶都乌青了。

Sense.DEF: a small white bean with a black spot on it
oil
a man who treats other people very badly
a small dark spot on the skin, with a black centre
an area in outer space into which everything near it, including light, is pulled
Sense.TRAN: 黑洞〔指宇宙中包括光线在内的一切事物都会被吸入的区域〕

Sense.DEF: something that uses up a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 无底洞〔指极耗钱的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m worried that the project could become a financial black hole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心这个项目会成为财政上的大黑洞。

Sense.DEF: a small, very crowded room or dark place is sometimes described as being ‘like the Black Hole of Calcutta’. This phrase comes from a small room used as a prison in Calcutta, India where many British prisoners died during one night in 1756.
Sense.TRAN: 加尔各答黑〔印度加尔各答的一座小牢房﹐1756年一夜之间许多英国囚犯死于此地﹔现喻指狭小拥挤的房间或黑暗的地方〕

Sense.DEF: jokes or funny stories that deal with the unpleasant parts of human life
an area of ice that is very difficult to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: Driving conditions are dangerous, with black ice in many areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路面情况很不安全﹐多处地区有薄冰。

Sense.DEF: a card game, usually played for money, in which you try to get as close to 21 points as possible
a weapon like a stick covered with leather, used to hit people

someone who continues to work when other workers are on
strike
– used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 破坏罢工的工人﹐工贼〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to put a person, country, product etc on a blacklist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people in the industry were blacklisted for their communist sympathies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行业里有许多人因为同情共产党而被列入了黑名单。

Sense.DEF: a list of people, countries, products etc that are disapproved of, and should therefore be avoided or punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: Friends of the Earth have produced a blacklist of environmentally damaging products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “地球之友”列出了一份破坏环境的产品的黑名单。

Sense.DEF: magic that is believed to use the power of the Devil for evil purposes
when someone tries to get money from you or make you do what they want by threatening to tell other people your secrets
when someone tries to make you do what they want by making threats or by making you feel guilty if you do not do it
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She had already tried emotional blackmail
tried to make him feel guilty
to stop him leaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试过以情相迫﹐不让他离开。

Sense.DEF: to use blackmail against someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was jailed for four years for blackmailing gay businessmen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因敲诈同性恋商人而入狱四年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I refuse to be blackmailed into making a quick decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会因为受到胁迫而作出仓促的决定。

Sense.DEF: the system by which people illegally buy and sell foreign money, goods that are difficult to obtain etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a thriving black market in foreign currency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外汇黑市猖獗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many foods were only available on the black market .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多食物只有在黑市上才能买到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: black market cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑市香烟

Sense.DEF: someone who sells things on the black market
a member of a group of black people who believe in the religion of Islam and want a separate black socety
Sense.TRAN: 黑人穆斯林〔指信奉伊斯兰教﹐并要建立独立黑人社会的黑人组织成员〕

Sense.DEF: a period of darkness caused by a failure of the electricity supply
a situation in which particular pieces of news or information are not allowed to be reported
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the crisis worsened, the authorities imposed a news blackout .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危机逐渐加深﹐当局实行了新闻封锁。

Sense.DEF: a period during a war when all the lights in a town or city must be turned off
if someone has a blackout, they suddenly become unconscious
pepper made from crushed seeds from which the dark outer covering has not been removed

a kind of thick dark
sausage
made from animal blood and fat
Sense.TRAN: 血肠﹐黑香肠〔用动物的血和脂肪制成的粗黑香肠〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is regarded by other members of their family or group as a failure or embarrassment
Sense.TRAN: 害群之马﹔〔家族或集体中的〕败类
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amy’s always been the black sheep of the family .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米一直是该家族的耻辱。

Sense.DEF:
someone who makes and repairs things made of iron, especially
horseshoe s
a place or area where there are more problems than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arbroath is now the unemployment blackspot of northeast Scotland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿布罗斯现在是苏格兰东北部的一个失业重灾区。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an accident blackspot
where there are a lot of road accidents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通事故多发区

Sense.DEF: a European bush that has small white flowers
Sense.TRAN: 黑刺李〔一种开白色小花的欧洲灌木〕

Sense.DEF:
a black-tie event is one at which people wear special formal clothes, such as
tuxedo s
for men
a thick black sticky substance that becomes hard as it dries, used to cover roads
the surface of a road covered by this substance

the activity of riding in an
inner tube
large rubber tube filled with air, like those inside a tyre
along a fast-flowing river that runs under the ground through
cave s

a very poisonous type of
spider
that is black with red marks
Sense.TRAN: 红斑寇蛛，黑寡妇蜘蛛〔一种剧毒的蜘蛛〕

Sense.DEF:
the organ in your body that holds
urine
waste liquid
until it is passed out of your body
a bag of skin, leather, or rubber, for example inside a football, that can be filled with air or liquid
Sense.TRAN: 〔可充气或充水的〕皮囊﹐气囊〔如足球的内胆〕

Sense.DEF: very drunk
the flat cutting part of a tool or weapon

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The blade of the knife flashed in the moonlight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光下刀刃闪闪发亮。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a razor blade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剃刀刀片

Sense.DEF: the flat wide part of an object that pushes against air or water
Sense.TRAN: 桨叶﹔螺旋桨叶﹔叶片状物
Sense.EXAMPLE: the blade of an oar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桨叶

Sense.DEF: a single thin flat piece of grass

the metal part on the bottom of an
ice-skate

someone who
skate s
or
rollerblade s
to obtain something you want by talking in a clever way
Sense.TRAN: 用言语巧妙地得到﹐用花言巧语骗取
Sense.EXAMPLE: He blagged his way in by saying he was a friend of the owner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他谎称是主人的朋友混了进去。

Sense.DEF: someone who gets something they want by lying to people in a clever way
Sense.TRAN: 骗子〔通过编故事说谎而得到某物的人〕

Sense.DEF: used when you do not need to complete what you are saying because it is boring or because the person you are talking to already knows it
Sense.TRAN: 什么什么的﹐诸如此类的〔表示不需要说完﹐因为内容无聊或听的人已经知道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know how Michelle talks: ‘Tommy did this, and Jesse did that, blah, blah, blah.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米歇尔说的那些你是知道的﹐都是汤米怎么啦﹐杰西怎么啦等等诸如此类的话。

Sense.DEF: remarks or statements that are boring and do not mean much
Sense.EXAMPLE: the usual blah about everyone working harder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家要更加努力之类的陈词滥调

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being sad and bored
Sense.EXAMPLE: a case of the winter blahs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季情绪低落的一例

Sense.DEF: not having an interesting taste, appearance, character etc
Sense.TRAN: 味道不好的﹔枯燥的﹔单调的﹔乏味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chili was kind of blah.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辣味肉豆味道不太好。

Sense.DEF: slightly ill or unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel really blah today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天真的有点不舒服。

Sense.DEF: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怪他母亲不好﹐她什么事都要为他做。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marie still blames herself for Patrick’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽仍在为帕特里克的死自责。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report blames poor safety standards for the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告把事故归咎于安全方面没有达标。
GramExa.EXAMPLE:
The decision to increase interest rates was widely blamed
blamed by many people
for the crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍认为加息的决定是引发这场危机的罪魁祸首。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the computers is broken and she’s blaming it on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中有台电脑坏了﹐她就怪罪于我。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crash was blamed on pilot error.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次空难被认为是飞行员失误造成的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is responsible for something bad
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事物（对某事）负有责任
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officials believe that more than one person may be to blame for the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府官员认为﹐这场火灾可能不止一个人负有责任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Television is partly to blame.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视也要负部分责任。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say something is someone's fault , rather than saying they are to blame
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说something is someone’s fault﹐而不说someone is to blame
F2NBox.BADEXA: He was to blame for the accident.

Sense.LEXUNIT: I don’t blame you/you can hardly blame him etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that you think it was right or reasonable for someone to do what they did
Sense.TRAN: 我不怪你/你不能怪他等〔表示某人做某事可以理解〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s left her husband.’ ‘I don’t blame her, after the way he treated her.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她离开她丈夫了。”“他那样对她﹐也难怪她这样做。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can hardly blame him for not waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能怪他不等你。

Sense.DEF: used when you are advising someone not to do something but you think that they will do it in spite of your advice
Sense.TRAN: 不要怪我〔用于劝阻某人而又认为某人不会听的时候〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buy it then, but don’t blame me when it breaks down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就买吧﹐可是坏了别怪我。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb only has himself/herself to blame
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s problems are their own fault
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he fails his exams, he’ll only have himself to blame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他考试不及格﹐那只能怪他自己。

Exponent.DEF: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad that has happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Democrats have blamed Republicans for the failure to reach an agreement.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党认为未能达成协议罪在共和党。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For many years I blamed myself for her death.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为她的死自责了许多年。

Exponent.DEF: to say who or what you think is responsible for something bad that has happened, often unfairly or wrongly
Exponent.TRAN: 把责任推给某人/某事物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to put the blame on me!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 休想把责任推到我头上！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Farmers have laid the blame for their problems entirely on EU policies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民把自己的问题全部怪罪于欧盟的政策。

Exponent.DEF: to say that someone is responsible for something bad that has happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you saying it’s my fault that we lost the game?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是说比赛输了该怪我吗？

Exponent.DEF: to say that someone is responsible for something bad that has happened, because it was their duty to prevent it from happening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was held personally responsible for the failure of the project.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目失败﹐他要个人承担责任。

Sense.DEF: responsibility for a mistake or for something bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you accept any blame for what happened?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了这一切﹐你认为你有错吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE:
I always get the blame
am blamed
for his mistakes!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的错总是我来背黑锅！
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She stole the money but she’s trying to put the blame on
blame
me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她偷了钱﹐却想赖到我身上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be blamed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sam knew that if something went wrong, he’d get the blame.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆知道一旦出了差错﹐他就会受到指责。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that something is your fault
Collocate.EXAMPLE: No one was prepared to take the blame for the disaster.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人愿意为这次灾难承担责任。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: blame someone, especially when it is not their fault
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to put the blame on me.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 别想把责任推到我身上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: blame someone else for something you did
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She always tried to shift the blame onto her brother.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是试图把责任推到弟弟身上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: find someone to blame for something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He seemed to want to apportion blame for her death.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像要把她的死怪罪于谁。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to say that someone is responsible for something bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In this case, the blame lay with the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这宗案件责任在于警方。

Collocate.COLLOC: point the finger of blame at sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that someone is responsible for something bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t believe it when they started pointing the finger of blame at me.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真难以相信﹐他们竟开始归罪于我。

Sense.DEF: not guilty of anything bad
Sense.TRAN: 无罪的﹔无可指责的﹔清白的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The police are not always entirely blameless
are guilty of doing something bad
in these matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这些事情上﹐警方并非总是毫无过错的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had led a blameless life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一生清白。

Sense.DEF: deserving blame or disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: blameworthy conduct
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应受谴责的行为

Sense.DEF: to put vegetables, fruit, or nuts into boiling water for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 用沸水烫﹐焯〔蔬菜﹑水果或坚果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blanch the peaches and remove the skins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把桃子用沸水烫一烫后去皮。

Sense.DEF: to become pale because you are frightened or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 〔因害怕或震惊而〕变得（脸色）苍白
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patrick visibly blanched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克的脸色明显地变得苍白。

Sense.DEF:
a cold sweet food made from
cornflour
, milk, and sugar
Sense.TRAN: 牛奶冻〔用玉米粉﹑牛奶和糖制成的甜食〕

Sense.DEF: without any excitement, strong opinions, or special character
Sense.TRAN: 平淡乏味的﹐平淡无奇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few bland comments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不痛不痒的几句评语

Sense.DEF: food that is bland has very little taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bland diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清淡的饮食

Sense.DEF: pleasant things that you say in order to persuade or influence someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: How sensible she had been to resist his blandishments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她多明智啊﹐没有听信他的甜言蜜语。

Sense.DEF: without any writing, print, or recorded sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave the last page blank .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一页留空。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blank cassette
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒空白磁带

Sense.DEF: a blank face or look shows no emotion, understanding, or interest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Zoe looked at me with a blank expression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佐伊看着我﹐表情木然。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She gazed at him in blank astonishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊愕地呆视着他。

Subsense.DEF: if your mind goes blank, or if you go blank, you are suddenly unable to remember something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My heart began to race and my mind went blank.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心跳开始加快﹐脑子里一片空白。

Subsense.DEF: to stop showing any images, writing etc
Subsense.TRAN: 出现空白〔指没有图像﹑文字等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly the screen went blank.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屏幕上突然一片空白。

Sense.DEF: an empty space on a piece of paper, where you are supposed to write a word or letter
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you’ve filled in the blanks , hand the form back to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你填好表格以后把它交还给我。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot remember something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to think of his name, but my mind’s a complete blank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我努力想他的名字﹐可脑子里一片空白。

Sense.DEF:
a
cartridge
container for a bullet in a gun
that contains an explosive but no bullet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers fired blanks into the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵向人群发射空弹。

Sense.DEF:
if a man is shooting blanks or firing blanks, his
sperm
is not able to make a woman
pregnant
Sense.TRAN: 放空枪﹐放空炮〔喻指男性的精子不能使女性怀孕〕

Sense.DEF: if you blank, or if your mind blanks, you are suddenly unable to remember something
Sense.TRAN: 突然记不起﹐〔脑子〕突然一片空白
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just blanked in the oral exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口试的时候﹐我脑子一片空白。

Sense.DEF: to ignore someone who you would usually greet or speak to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last time I saw Mike Adams he completely blanked me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上次我看到麦克·亚当斯﹐他都没看我一眼。

Sense.DEF: to cover something so that it cannot be seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The actual names had been blanked out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具体姓名已被涂掉。

Sense.DEF: to completely forget something, especially deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to blank out everything he had said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图忘记他所说的一切。

Sense.DEF: a cheque that has been signed, but has not had the amount written on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔签过名而未填金额的〕空白支票

Sense.DEF: to give someone permission to do whatever they think is necessary in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 给予某人全权[自由处理权]

Sense.DEF: a cover for a bed, usually made of wool
a thick covering or area of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hills were covered with a blanket of snow .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山覆盖着厚厚的白雪。

Sense.DEF: something that makes it hard for you to find information or the truth about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔使信息或真相难以被发现的〕蒙蔽之物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trial was held under a blanket of secrecy .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 审讯过程高度保密。

Sense.DEF: to cover something with a thick layer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rooftops were blanketed in snow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶上覆盖着白雪。

Sense.DEF: a statement, rule etc that affects everyone or includes all possible cases
Sense.TRAN: 全面[适用于所有人或所有情况]的陈述/规定/禁令等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the proposed blanket ban on tobacco advertising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全面禁止烟草广告的提议
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blanket strategy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全方位的策略

Sense.DEF: used to show annoyance when you want to avoid swearing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blankety-blank key is stuck!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这该死的钥匙卡住了！

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows no emotion, understanding, or interest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna stared blankly at the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜对着墙壁发呆。

Sense.DEF:
poetry that has a fixed
rhythm
but does not
rhyme
to make a very loud unpleasant noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Horns blared in the street outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面街道上汽车喇叭发出刺耳的鸣响。

Sense.DEF: pleasant but untrue things that you say to someone in order to trick or persuade them
a stone in the wall of Blarney Castle in the Republic of Ireland. People believe that, if you kiss it, it will bring you good luck and the ability to persuade people to do what you want.
Sense.TRAN: 巧言石〔爱尔兰共和国布拉尼城堡墙上的一块石头﹐据说亲吻此石会带来好运﹐并且变得口齿伶俐〕

Sense.DEF: not worried or excited about things that most people think are important, impressive etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对多数人认为重要或深刻的事〕漠不关心的﹐无动于衷的﹐不感兴趣的﹐厌倦的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s very blasé about money now that he’s got that job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有了那份工作后对钱也就无所谓了。

Sense.DEF: to speak in a way that insults God or people’s religious beliefs, or to use the names of God and holy things when swearing
something you say or do that is insulting to God or people’s religious beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 对上帝的亵渎﹔亵渎神明的言辞[行为]

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The book has been widely condemned as blasphemous.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书被广泛谴责为亵渎神明。

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong movement of wind or air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A blast of cold air swept through the hut.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一股寒气冲进小屋。

Sense.DEF: an explosion, or the very strong movement of air that it causes
Sense.TRAN: 爆炸﹔〔爆炸引起的〕气浪﹐冲击波

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thirty-six people died in the blast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有36人在爆炸中丧生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A bomb blast completely destroyed the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗炸弹爆炸﹐把大楼彻底炸毁。

Sense.DEF: a sudden very loud noise, especially one made by a whistle or horn
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指哨子或喇叭发出的〕响亮的声音

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The station master gave a blast on his whistle and we were off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 站长一声哨响﹐我们出发了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long trumpet blast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声悠长的号声

Sense.DEF: as powerfully or loudly as possible
Sense.TRAN: 全力地﹔以最大音量﹔开足马力
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had the gas fire going full blast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把煤气取暖器开到最大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The radio was on at full blast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收音机开到了最大音量。

Sense.DEF: an enjoyable and exciting experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert was a blast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会很精彩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a blast at the fair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在游乐场里玩得很开心。

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong expression of a powerful emotion
Sense.TRAN: 一阵感情迸发﹐感情的爆发

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was totally unprepared for the blast of criticism she received.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对这样言辞激烈的批评﹐她毫无思想准备。

Sense.DEF: something from the past that you remember, see, or hear again, and that reminds you of that time in your life
Sense.TRAN: 勾起回忆的旧物﹐唤醒记忆的往事
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a blast from the past. No one has called me that for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一下子勾起我的回忆﹐已经很久很久没有人这样叫我了。

Sense.DEF: to damage or destroy something, or to injure or kill someone, using a gun or a bomb
Sense.TRAN: 炸毁﹐炸伤﹐炸死﹔开枪打伤[打死]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She blasted her husband with a shotgun because he was having an affair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫有外遇﹐她就拿一把猎枪把他杀了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The first shot missed and blasted a hole in the far wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一枪没有打中﹐在远处墙上射出一个洞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was blasted out of the sky by a terrorist bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在空中被恐怖分子放置的炸弹炸成了碎片。

Sense.DEF: to break something into pieces using explosives, especially in order to build something such as a road
Sense.TRAN: 爆破﹐〔尤指为了筑路等〕炸开

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A 1.5 km tunnel was blasted through the mountain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条 1.5 公里长的隧道被炸了出来﹐穿山而过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The road will have to be blasted out of solid rock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 修这条路必须要炸开坚固的岩石。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Railway workers had blasted through the mountains 90 years before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路工人早在90年前就已经把那些山炸穿打通了。

Sense.DEF: to produce a lot of loud noise, especially music
Sense.TRAN: 大声发出（声音）〔尤指音乐声〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was woken by the radio alarm clock blasting out rock music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收音机闹钟发出震耳的摇滚乐声﹐把他吵醒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dance music blasted from the stereo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 立体声音响大声播放着舞曲。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something very strongly – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 抨击﹐猛烈批评〔尤用于新闻报道〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Union leaders blasted the government for failing to tackle the jobs crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会领袖大力抨击政府未能处理好就业危机。

Sense.DEF: to hit or kick a ball very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: With six minutes remaining, he blasted the ball through the Coleraine defences for his 19th goal of the season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还剩六分钟的时候﹐他攻破了高利宁队的防守﹐打进了他在这个赛季的第十九个进球。

Sense.DEF: if air or water is blasted somewhere, or if it blasts somewhere, it moves there with great force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind ripped through the trees and blasted a curtain of rain up the meadow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风横扫树木﹐挟着幕帘般的滂沱大雨掠过草地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Icy winds and driving snow blasted through the pine trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凛冽的寒风夹带着鹅毛大雪横扫松林。

Sense.DEF: to beat another team very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Seahawks were blasted 35–14 by the Broncos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海鹰队以14比35惨败给了野马队。

Sense.DEF: if a spacecraft blasts off, it leaves the ground
used when you are very annoyed about something
Sense.TRAN: 真讨厌﹐真该死 〔表示厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh blast! I’ve forgotten my key.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真讨厌！ 我忘了带钥匙。

Sense.DEF: used to express annoyance
Sense.TRAN: 该死的﹐讨厌的〔表示厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish that blasted baby would stop crying!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望那讨厌的小孩别再哭了！

Sense.DEF: a large industrial structure in which iron is separated from the rock that surrounds it

the moment when a
spacecraft
leaves the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten seconds to blast-off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十秒钟后发射升空。

Sense.DEF: something bad that is blatant is very clear and easy to see, but the person responsible for it does not seem embarrassed or ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: blatant discrimination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公然的歧视

Sense.DEF: to talk for a long time about unimportant things
a type of American film made in the 1970s, in which the main characters are black
Sense.TRAN: 黑人剥削电影〔流行于20世纪70年代的美国﹐以黑人为主角〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: blaxploitation films such as Shaft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《杀戮战警》等黑人剥削电影

Subsense.DEF: a big dangerous fire – used especially in news reports
Subsense.TRAN: 火灾﹐烈火﹐大火〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It took almost 100 firemen to bring the blaze under control.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出动了近100名消防员才控制住火势。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helicopters were used to help fight the blaze.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出动了直升机来协助灭火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a huge chemical factory blaze
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 化工厂的一场大火

Subsense.DEF: a fire burning with strong bright flames
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I lit the fire and soon had a cheerful blaze going.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我点了火﹐不一会儿就火光熊熊。

Sense.DEF: very bright light or colour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the blaze of light from the security lamps
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全灯的强光
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The garden is a blaze of colour at this time of year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时节花园里色彩斑斓。

Sense.DEF: a lot of public attention or success and praise
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as the trial was over, the blaze of publicity surrounding him vanished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审判一结束﹐媒体对他的关注随即消失。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She played the Canada tournament, then retired, going out in a blaze of glory
ending her career with a lot of success and praise
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打完加拿大锦标赛后退役﹐在一片盛誉中离去。

Sense.DEF: a sudden show of very strong emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: A blaze of anger flashed across his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他顿时面露怒色。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what the blazes/who the blazes etc
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a question when you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 到底是什么/是谁等〔厌烦时用于加强问题的语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What the blazes is going on here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里到底怎么回事？

Sense.DEF: as fast, as much, or as strongly as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to run like blazes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只得拼命地跑。

Sense.DEF: a white mark, especially one down the front of a horse’s face
to burn very brightly and strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was warm, with a fire blazing in the hearth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里暖融融的﹐壁炉里的火熊熊燃烧。

Sense.DEF: to shine with a very bright light
Sense.EXAMPLE: A huge truck was advancing towards us, its headlights blazing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆大卡车打着刺眼的前灯朝我们直冲过来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun blazed down as we walked along the valley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走在山谷里﹐太阳火辣辣地照射下来。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s eyes are blazing, their eyes are shining brightly because they are feeling a very strong emotion, usually anger
Sense.TRAN: 〔愤怒等强烈的感情在眼睛里〕燃烧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Linda leapt to her feet, her dark eyes blazing with anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳达猛然跳了起来﹐黑色的眼睛里燃烧着怒火。

Sense.DEF: if guns blaze, they fire bullets quickly and continuously
Sense.EXAMPLE: An enemy plane roared overhead, its guns blazing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌机在头顶上轰鸣﹐枪炮不停地射击。

Sense.DEF: to develop or do something new and important, or to do something important that no one has done before
Sense.EXAMPLE: an innovative young company that has blazed a trail for others to follow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家勇于创新的年轻公司﹐开辟了一条可供效法的新路径

Sense.DEF: if something is blazed across a newspaper etc, it is written in a way that everyone will notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: News of their divorce was blazed across all the tabloids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有小报都在显著位置上刊登了他们离婚的消息。

Sense.DEF: a jacket, sometimes with the special sign of a school, club etc on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔有时带有学校﹑俱乐部等标记的〕上衣﹐外套

Sense.DEF: extremely hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blazing August afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八月一个炎热的午后

Sense.DEF: full of strong emotions, especially anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: He jumped to his feet in a blazing fury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他暴跳如雷。

GramExa.GLOSS: very angry argument

Sense.DEF: to be written or shown on something in a very noticeable way

a chemical used to make things pale or white, or to kill
germ s
to make something pale or white, especially by using chemicals or the sun
Sense.TRAN: 使〔颜色〕变淡﹐使变白﹔漂白﹔晒白
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bleached her hair blonde.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把头发漂成了金黄色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wood had been bleached by the sun .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头已被太阳晒得褪了色。

Sense.DEF:
long wooden
bench es
arranged in rows, where you sit to watch sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育场的〕露天看台﹐露天座位

Sense.DEF: without anything to make you feel happy or hopeful
Sense.TRAN: 没有希望的﹔令人沮丧的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company still hopes to find a buyer, but the future looks bleak .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司仍然希望找到买家﹐但前景渺茫。

Sense.DEF: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bleak January afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一月里一个阴冷的下午
Sense.EXAMPLE: The landscape was bleak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色一片凄凉。

Sense.DEF: unable to see very clearly, because you are tired or have been crying
Sense.TRAN: 〔因疲劳或流泪〕视线模糊的﹔睡眼惺忪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve emerged from his room, unshaven and bleary-eyed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫从卧室里出来﹐胡子拉碴﹐睡眼惺忪。

Sense.DEF: to make the sound that a sheep or goat makes
to complain in a silly or annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But I’ve only just got here,’ bleated Simon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可是我刚刚才到这里呀。”西蒙抱怨道。

Subsense.DEF: to lose blood, especially because of an injury
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Your nose is bleeding.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的鼻子流血了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tragically, she bled to death .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常不幸﹐她失血过多死了。

GramExa.GLOSS: bleed a lot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Burke was found unconscious and bleeding profusely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯克夫人被发现时已经不省人事﹐血流如注。

Subsense.DEF: to take some blood from someone’s body, done in the past in order to treat a disease
Subsense.TRAN: 给…放血〔旧时的治病方法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When he fell sick several days later, he had a doctor bleed him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几天后他病倒了﹐就让一个医生给他做放血治疗。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to pay an unreasonable amount of money over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: His ex-wife clearly intends to bleed him for every last penny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的前妻显然是想榨干他每一分钱。

GramExa.GLOSS: take all their money, possessions etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ten-year war has bled the country dry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 十年战争耗尽了国力。

Sense.DEF: to remove air or liquid from a system in order to make it work properly, for example from a heating system
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to bleed the radiators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得把散热器中的水放掉。

Sense.DEF: to spread from one area of cloth or paper to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wash it in cold water so the colours don’t bleed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用冷水洗涤以防渗色。

Sense.DEF: if a company or business bleeds red ink, it loses a lot of money, rather than making money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Analysts predict the retailer will continue to bleed red ink, with losses topping $180 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析人士预测﹐这家零售企业将会继续亏损﹐亏损额将超过1.8亿美元。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a person, especially a man that you dislike
the condition of losing blood from your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use pressure to control the bleeding .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用力压住伤口止血。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bleeding had almost stopped .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血基本上已经止住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died of internal bleeding .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死于内出血。

GramExa.GLOSS: when someone is losing a lot of blood

Sense.DEF: an offensive way of emphasizing something when you are angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get your bleeding hands off my car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿开你的臭手﹐不要碰我的汽车！

Sense.DEF: someone who feels sympathy for poor people or criminals, in a way that you think is not practical or helpful
Sense.TRAN: 心肠过软的人﹐滥好人〔指不实际或无助益地同情穷人和罪犯的人〕

Sense.DEF: a short high sound made by a piece of electronic equipment
a bleeper
to make a high electronic sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The timer on the cooker started to bleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉灶上的定时器哔哔地响了起来。

Sense.DEF: to let someone know, through their bleeper, that you want them to telephone you
to prevent an offensive word being heard on television or the radio by making a high electronic sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或收音机中〕用哔哔声盖过〔粗话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the swear words had been bleeped out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的粗话都用哔哔声盖掉了。

Sense.DEF: a small machine that you carry with you, that makes short high electronic sounds to tell you that you must telephone someone
a small mark, especially a mark on someone’s skin or on the surface of an object, that spoils its appearance
to spoil the beauty or appearance of something, so that it is not perfect
to combine different things in a way that produces an effective or pleasant result, or to become combined in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a story that blends fact and legend
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实与传说相糅合的一个故事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leave the sauce to allow the flavours to blend together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让酱汁放一放﹐使各种味道调和起来。

Sense.DEF: to thoroughly mix together soft or liquid substances to form a single smooth substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blend the sugar, eggs, and flour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把糖﹑鸡蛋和面粉掺在一起。

Sense.DEF:
to produce tea, tobacco,
whisky
etc by mixing several different types together
Sense.TRAN: 混合调制〔茶﹑烟草﹑威士忌等〕

Sense.DEF: if someone or something blends in with people or objects, they match them or are similar, and you do not notice them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The old house blends in perfectly with the countryside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢老房子和这里的乡村融为一体。

Sense.DEF:
a product such as tea, tobacco, or
whisky
that is a mixture of several different types
Sense.TRAN: 混合品[物]〔如茶﹑烟草﹑威士忌等〕

Sense.DEF: a mixture of different things that combine together well
Sense.EXAMPLE: an excellent team, with a nice blend of experience and youthful enthusiasm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支优秀的队伍﹐既有经验又有年轻人的热情

Sense.DEF: a family in which one or both parents have children from previous marriages living with the family
Sense.TRAN: 混合家庭〔指有夫妻一方或双方前一次婚姻中的孩子同住的家庭〕

Sense.DEF: an electric machine that you use to mix liquids and soft foods together

Subsense.DEF:
what you say when someone
sneeze s
Subsense.TRAN: 长命百岁！〔别人打喷嚏时说的话〕

Subsense.DEF: used to thank someone for doing something for you
Subsense.TRAN: 愿上帝保佑你！〔感谢别人为你做了某事时说的话〕

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are fond of someone, amused by them, or pleased by something they have done
Sense.TRAN: 愿上帝保佑（他/她等）〔表示喜爱某人、被某人逗乐或对其所做的事感到满意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always willing to help. Bless him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向乐于助人﹐愿上帝保佑他！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Jess made this card for me.’ ‘Bless!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “杰斯给我做了这张卡。”“真不错！”

Sense.DEF: to have a special ability, good quality etc
Sense.TRAN: 有幸拥有某物﹐被赋予某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re both blessed with good health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩都有福气﹐身体很好。

Sense.DEF: if God blesses someone or something, he helps and protects them
Sense.EXAMPLE: May God bless you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愿上帝保佑你。

Sense.DEF: to ask God to protect someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 祈求上帝祝福[保佑]﹐求神赐福于
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple later had their marriage blessed in their local parish church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那对夫妇后来在他们当地教区的教堂里领受了婚姻祝福。

Sense.DEF: to make something holy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then the priest blesses the bread and wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后牧师给饼和酒祝圣。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise
used to express annoyance
Sense.TRAN: 该死的﹐倒霉的〔表示厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now where have I put that blessed book?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把那该死的书放在哪儿了呢？

Sense.DEF: very enjoyable or desirable
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉快的﹐可喜的﹐快乐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few moments of blessed silence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人愉快的宁静片刻

Sense.DEF: holy
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Blessed Virgin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣母马利亚

Sense.DEF: something that you have or something that happens which is good because it improves your life, helps you in some way, or makes you happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dishwasher has been a real blessing!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这洗碗机真是个好东西！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a blessing no one was badly hurt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所幸没有人受重伤。

Sense.DEF: someone’s approval or encouragement for a plan, activity, idea etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were determined to marry, with or without their parents’ blessing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管父母同意与否﹐他们都决心要结婚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Defense Department has given its blessing to the scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国防部已经批准了这个计划。

Sense.DEF: a situation that has both good and bad parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having children so early in their marriage was a mixed blessing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们婚后不久就有了孩子﹐有好处也有坏处。

Sense.DEF: something that seems to be bad or unlucky at first, but which you later realize is good or lucky
used to tell someone to remember how lucky they are, especially when they are complaining about something
Sense.TRAN: 想想你有多幸运﹔不要身在福中不知福

Sense.DEF: protection and help from God, or words spoken to ask for this
Sense.TRAN: 〔上帝的〕祝福﹐赐福﹔保佑﹔恩典﹔祈祷
Sense.EXAMPLE: The priest gave the blessing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师为大家祝福。

Sense.DEF: to talk about things that are not important – used especially in Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 瞎说一通﹐胡扯﹔喋喋不休〔尤用于苏格兰〕

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
blow
an unhealthy condition of plants in which parts of them dry up and die
something that makes people unhappy or that spoils their lives or the environment they live in
Sense.TRAN: 〔导致烦恼﹑影响生活或环境的〕有害因素﹔阴影

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her guilty secret was a blight on her happiness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个罪恶的秘密给她的幸福蒙上了阴影。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the blight of poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫穷的不幸

Sense.DEF: to spoil or damage something, especially by preventing people from doing what they want to do
Sense.TRAN: 损害﹐妨害﹔使〔某人〕遭遇挫折
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disease which, though not fatal, can blight the lives of its victims
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽不致命却会妨害患者生活的一种疾病
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country blighted by poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个受贫穷困扰的国家

Sense.DEF:
used to talk about someone that you feel sorry for or
jealous
of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor old blighter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的老家伙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You lucky blighter!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这走运的家伙！

Sense.DEF: a bad or unpleasant person

a name for Britain which was used especially by British soldiers and other British people working abroad for the British Empire during the 19th and early 20th centuries. It is now sometimes used humorously.
Sense.TRAN: 英国老家〔尤为19世纪和20世纪初的英国士兵和其他在海外工作的英国人使用﹐现在有时作幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blimey, look at that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天啊﹐看那儿！

Sense.DEF:
a small
airship
type of aircraft without wings
an offensive word for a very fat person
someone, especially an old man, with old-fashioned political ideas – used to show disapproval

Subsense.DEF: unable to see
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a school for blind children
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盲童学校
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the needs of blind people
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盲人的需要

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s almost blind in her right eye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她右眼近乎失明。

Subsense.EXAMPLE:
He was slowly going blind
becoming blind
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眼睛在渐渐失明。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Beverley was born blind .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝弗利先天失明。

Subsense.DEF: people who are unable to see
Subsense.EXAMPLE: talking books for the blind
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盲人有声读物

Subsense.DEF: unable to see well – used humorously
Subsense.TRAN: 看不清楚﹐像瞎子一样〔幽默用法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m as blind as a bat without my glasses.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不戴眼镜就像瞎子一样。

Subsense.DEF: unable to see because of tears, pain, or a strong emotion
Subsense.TRAN: 因为流泪/气愤/疼痛等视力变得模糊
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She screamed at him, her eyes blind with tears.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向着他尖叫﹐泪水模糊了她的双眼。

Sense.DEF: to completely fail to notice or realize something
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物缺乏识别能力
Sense.EXAMPLE: International companies are all too often blind to local needs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨国公司往往不了解本地的需求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was totally blind to the faults of his children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本觉察不到自己孩子的缺点。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately ignore something that you know should not be happening
Sense.TRAN: （对某事物）视若无睹﹐装作看不见
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers were turning a blind eye to smoking in school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师对学生在学校里抽烟睁一只眼闭一只眼。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not take/pay a blind bit of notice
Sense.DEF: to completely ignore what someone does or says, especially in a way that is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 对…视若无睹﹔把…不当一回事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never pays a blind bit of notice to what his staff tell him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对手下员工的话﹐他从来不当一回事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not make a blind bit of difference
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that whatever someone says or does will not change the situation at all
Sense.TRAN: 没有一点儿区别﹔于事无补﹔无任何作用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try and talk to her if you want, but I don’t think it’ll make a blind bit of difference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想的话就去和她谈谈﹐不过我认为根本不会有什么作用。

Subsense.DEF: strong feelings that someone has without thinking about why they have them – used to show disapproval
Subsense.TRAN: 盲目的信仰/偏见/顺从等〔含贬义〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Blind faith sent thousands of people to a pointless war.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盲目的信念把成千上万的人送上战场去打一场毫无意义的战争。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a story about blind loyalty
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个关于愚忠的故事

Subsense.DEF: strong feelings of fear or anger that you cannot control
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In a moment of blind panic, she had pulled the trigger and shot the man dead.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一阵莫名的恐惧之中扣动扳机﹐打死了那个男人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Blind rage took hold of him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他内心升起了一股无名之火。

Sense.DEF: a corner in a road that you cannot see beyond when you are driving
used to say that people who do not know much about what they are doing are guiding or advising others who know nothing at all
Sense.TRAN: 盲人给瞎子引路﹔瞎指挥

Sense.DEF: blind flying is when you use only instruments to fly an aircraft because you cannot see through cloud, mist etc
Sense.TRAN: 盲飞的〔指因为云雾太大等原因看不见前方﹐故此只靠仪表驾驶飞机〕

Sense.DEF: to make it difficult for someone to see for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 使目眩﹐使眼花﹐使看不见
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a moment, I was blinded by the glare of headlights coming towards me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一下子被迎面射来的车灯强光刺得两眼发花。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dust choked and blinded him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰尘呛得他呼吸困难﹐眼睛什么也看不见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blinded by tears, I walked towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我泪眼模糊﹐朝着门口走去。

Sense.DEF: to make someone lose their good sense or judgment and be unable to see the truth about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should have known better, but he was blinded by his own wants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本应该明白的﹐但是一己之欲使他昏了头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children’s bad behaviour should not blind us to their need for love.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不应该因为孩子的不良行为而看不到他们对爱的需求。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His single-minded determination to win the war is blinding him to other dangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一心想打赢这场战争﹐所以看不到其他危险的存在。

Sense.DEF: to permanently destroy someone’s ability to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had been blinded in an explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一场爆炸中双目失明了。

Sense.DEF: to confuse or trick someone by using complicated language
a covering, especially one made of cloth, that can be rolled up and down to cover a window inside a building
Sense.TRAN: 〔能上下卷迭的〕窗帘﹐卷帘﹔百叶帘
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The blinds were drawn
pulled down
to protect the new furniture from the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘都放了下来﹐避免太阳光照在新的家具上。

PIC.HEADING: BLIND 卷帘
PIC.PICCONTENT: shutters 百叶窗；roller blind BrE【英】/(window)shade AmE【美】卷帘；Roman blind 罗马帘；Venetian blind 百叶窗帘；slat 百叶板

Sense.DEF: a small shelter where you can watch birds or animals without being seen by them
Sense.TRAN: 〔窥视鸟或动物的〕隐蔽处﹐埋伏处

Sense.DEF: a trick or excuse to stop someone from discovering the truth
extremely drunk
a small narrow street with no way out at one end
a way of doing something that seems as if it will have a successful result, but which in fact does not
Sense.TRAN: 死胡同〔指行不通的做事方法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: False information has led the police up a series of blind alleys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假情报把警方引进了一个个死胡同。

Sense.DEF: an arranged meeting between a man and woman who have not met each other before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you ever go on a blind date?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有经人介绍跟陌生异性约会过？

Sense.DEF: an excellent performance, especially in sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育比赛中〕上佳的表现
Sense.EXAMPLE: He played an absolute blinder!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在比赛中的表现真是太棒了！

Sense.DEF: pieces of leather that are put beside a horse’s eyes to stop it from seeing objects on either side
Sense.TRAN: 〔系于马眼旁使之不能侧视的〕马眼罩

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth that covers someone’s eyes to prevent them from seeing anything
to cover someone’s eyes with a piece of cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blindfold the prisoner!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把囚犯的眼睛蒙上！

Sense.DEF: with your eyes covered by a piece of cloth
used to say that it is very easy for you to do something because you have done it so often
so bright or strong that you cannot see properly
Sense.TRAN: 刺眼的﹐刺目的﹐令人目眩的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the desert with its strange twisted plants and its blinding light
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长有奇形怪状的植物而且光线刺眼的沙漠

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I struggled back to the hut through blinding rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我顶着茫茫大雨艰难地回小屋去。

Sense.DEF:
a very bad
headache
a sudden realization, clear understanding, or new idea about something
Sense.TRAN: 猛然醒悟/豁然开朗/惊人的新发现等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was then that she realised, with blinding clarity, that she loved him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候她才猛然醒悟﹐她是爱他的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, I had a blinding flash of inspiration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心头霍然闪过一丝灵感。

Sense.DEF: very good and enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a blinding album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑非常棒。

Sense.DEF: very or extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was blindingly obvious that Max wasn’t interested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常明显﹐马克斯不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: not thinking about something or trying to understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just blindly accept what you are told.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要盲目相信别人的话。

Sense.DEF: not seeing or noticing what is around you, especially because you are upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t know,’ she repeated as she stared blindly down into her glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不知道。”她又说了一遍﹐眼睛茫然地看着她的杯子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ran blindly upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不顾一切地往楼上跑。

Sense.DEF: a children’s game in which one player whose eyes are covered tries to catch the others
to hit the side of a vehicle with your vehicle in an accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their car was blindsided by a bus at the intersection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的车在十字路口被一辆公共汽车拦腰撞上。

Sense.DEF: to give someone an unpleasant surprise
Sense.TRAN: 使惊讶﹐给〔某人〕一个不愉快的意外
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was blindsided by his suggestion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他的建议感到很惊讶。

Sense.DEF: something that you are unable or unwilling to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a blind spot where computers are concerned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对电脑一窍不通。

Sense.DEF: the part of the road that you cannot see when you are driving a car
the point in your eye where the nerve enters, which is not sensitive to light

expensive objects such as
jewellery
that are worn in a way that is very easy to notice
to shut and open your eyes quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I blinked as I came out into the sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走出来﹐在太阳光下直眨眼睛。

Sense.DEF: if lights blink, they shine unsteadily or go on and off quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The light on your answering machine is blinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你电话答录机上的指示灯在闪。

Sense.DEF: to not seem at all surprised
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I told her how much it would cost, she didn’t even blink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当我告诉她这个要多少钱时﹐她甚至连眼睛都没眨一下。

Sense.DEF: extremely quickly
to shut and open your eyes in order to get rid of tears
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lynn laughed, blinking back unexpected tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳恩笑了﹐眨眨眼睛﹐抑制住了突如其来的泪水。

Sense.DEF: not working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: My computer’s on the blink again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的电脑又出问题了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the blink of an eye
Sense.DEF: very quickly
the action of quickly shutting and opening your eyes
having a limited view of a subject, or refusing to accept or consider different ideas
Sense.TRAN: 狭隘的﹐有偏见的﹔保守的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a blinkered attitude to other cultures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对其他文化采取的偏狭态度

Sense.DEF: a horse that is blinkered is wearing blinkers
pieces of leather that are put beside a horse’s eyes to stop it from seeing objects on either side
Sense.TRAN: 〔系于马眼旁使之不能侧视的〕马眼罩

Sense.DEF: the small lights on a car that you flash on and off to show which way you are turning
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车上的〕转向指示灯﹐方向灯

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 该死的﹐讨厌的〔表示厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn that blinking music down!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那讨厌的音乐开小声一点！

Sense.DEF: a short high electronic sound, or a flashing light on the screen of a piece of electronic equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔电子仪器发出的〕哔哔声﹔〔电子仪器屏幕上的〕光点
Sense.EXAMPLE: blips on a radar screen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷达屏幕上的光点

Sense.DEF: a short pause or change in a process or activity, especially when the situation gets worse for a while before it improves again
Sense.TRAN: 暂时的问题﹐暂时的变故
Sense.EXAMPLE: A government spokesman described the rise in inflation as a temporary blip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位政府发言人称通货膨胀率上升只是暂时现象。

Sense.DEF: perfect happiness or enjoyment
Sense.TRAN: 极乐﹐无上幸福﹐福佑﹐至福

GramExa.EXAMPLE: six months of wedded bliss
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚后六个月的幸福生活

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have to get up till 11 – it was sheer bliss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以睡到11点才起来﹐真幸福啊。

Sense.DEF: extremely happy and relaxed, especially as a result of using illegal drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指使用毒品后〕极度快乐的﹐极度放松的
Sense.EXAMPLE: blissed-out partygoers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派对上处于极乐中的人

Sense.DEF: extremely happy or enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 极其幸福的﹔乐而忘忧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: blissful sunny days
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光下无忧无虑的日子

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you do not yet know about something unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 对〔不幸的事〕毫不察觉﹔无知的幸福

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉恩好像生活得极其幸福。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: blissfully unaware of the impending danger
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 因对将临的危险一无所知而无忧无虑的

Sense.DEF: among the group of film stars, musicians etc who are fairly famous or popular, but are not the most popular or famous
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影明星﹑音乐家等〕二流的﹐比较出名的〔但不是最出名或最受欢迎的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: B-list celebrities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二流名人
