Sense.DEF: a swelling on your skin containing clear liquid, caused, for example, by a burn or continuous rubbing
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤上因烫伤﹑持续摩擦等而起的〕疱﹐水泡
Sense.EXAMPLE: New shoes always give me blisters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我穿新鞋脚上总是起泡。

Sense.DEF: a swelling on the surface of metal, rubber, painted wood etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔金属﹑橡胶﹑油漆过的木料等表面的〕气泡﹐浮泡

Sense.DEF: to develop blisters, or make blisters form
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paint will blister in the heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆遇高温会起泡。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: My hands were blistered from all the digging.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挖挖刨刨的干了这么久﹐手上都磨出泡来了。

Sense.DEF: extremely hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: the blistering heat of the desert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠中的酷热

Sense.DEF: very critical remarks expressing anger and disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blistering attack on her boss
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对她老板的严厉指责

Sense.DEF: used to describe actions in sport that are very fast or forceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hamilton set a blistering pace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉密尔顿如脱缰的野马冲在前面。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个暑气熏蒸的大热天

Sense.DEF: a package that is made from hard clear plastic. It fits closely round the object inside it, and can hang on a hook. Blister packs are used so that customers in shops can see the things that are for sale without being able to touch them.
seeming not to care or worry about the effects of what you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blithe disregard for the facts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对事实的漠视

Sense.DEF: happy and having no worries

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He seems blithely unaware of how much anger he’s caused.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他漫不经心﹐好像不知道自己激起了多大的怒火。

Sense.DEF: someone who has done something very stupid
Sense.TRAN: 愚蠢的家伙﹐十足的傻瓜

Sense.DEF: a sudden military attack, especially from the air
Sense.TRAN: 闪电般的猛烈袭击〔尤指空袭〕﹔闪电战

GramExa.GLOSS: the bombing of British cities by German aircraft in 1940 and 1941
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔1940至1941年间德国对英国城市发动的〕空袭

Sense.DEF: a period of great effort in order to deal with something quickly and completely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to have a blitz on the house before your parents arrive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得行动麻利﹐在你父母到来之前把屋子打扫干净。

Sense.DEF: a big effort to make people notice something or buy something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为吸引注意力或吸引人们购买某物的〕大规模行动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The campaign was launched with a nationwide publicity blitz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次运动以一场声势浩大的全国性的宣传活动开始。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: News came that Rotterdam had been blitzed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有消息说鹿特丹遭到了空袭。

Sense.DEF: a severe snowstorm
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got stuck in a blizzard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被暴风雪困住了。

Sense.DEF: a sudden large amount of something unpleasant or annoying that you must deal with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a blizzard of emails
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大堆要处理的电子邮件

Sense.DEF: full of liquid, gas, food etc, so that you look or feel much larger than normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a red bloated face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张红红的﹑浮肿的脸
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel really bloated after that meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃完那顿饭后﹐我觉得肚子很鼓。

Sense.DEF: if you describe an organization as bloated, you mean that it is too big and does not work effectively
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bloated state bureaucracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臃肿的政府官僚机构

Sense.DEF: a smoked fish
a very small round mass of a liquid or sticky substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a blob of honey
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一滴蜂蜜

Sense.DEF: something that cannot be clearly seen, especially because it is far away
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因离得很远而〕看不清的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without a telescope, the comet will look like a fuzzy blob.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用望远镜的话﹐那颗彗星看上去就像一个模糊不清的亮点。

Sense.DEF: a large group of people or countries with the same political aims, working together
Sense.EXAMPLE: the former Soviet bloc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前苏联阵营

Sense.DEF: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
Sense.TRAN: 一块〔指木头﹑石头等有直边的坚硬物体〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a block of ice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块冰

Sense.EXAMPLE: a wall made of concrete blocks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

PIC.HEADING: BLOCK 块
PIC.PICCONTENT: breeze-block BrE【英】/cinder block AmE【美】煤渣砖；building blocks 积木；knife block 刀架；a block of ice 一块冰

Subsense.DEF: the distance along a city street from where one street crosses it to the next
Subsense.TRAN: 街段﹐一段街区〔两条平行街道之间的一段〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Head for 44th Street, a few blocks east of Sixth Avenue.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往44号街走﹐从第六大街往东走几个街区就是。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The church is down the block.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂就在这个街区那头。

Subsense.DEF: the four city streets that form a square around an area of buildings
Subsense.TRAN: 街区〔四条街道之内的区域〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let’s walk round the block.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们绕着街区走走吧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She grew up playing with the other kids on the block.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是和街区里其他孩子一起玩大的。

Subsense.DEF: a large piece of land
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a ten-acre block near the city
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离城市不远的一块十英亩土地

Sense.DEF: a large building divided into separate parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a block of flats
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋住宅楼

Sense.EXAMPLE: an office block
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋办公大楼
Sense.EXAMPLE: an apartment block
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋公寓楼
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school science block
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的理科大楼

Sense.DEF: a quantity of things of the same kind, considered as a single unit

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New employees receive a block of shares in the firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新雇员可以分得公司的一份股票。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Set aside blocks of time for doing your homework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要腾出一段时间做家庭作业。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement that is made for a whole group to buy something or to vote together
the temporary loss of your normal ability to think, learn, write etc
Sense.TRAN: 思维阻滞〔指暂时失去思考﹑学习﹑写作等能力的现象〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a mental block whenever I try to remember my password.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每次试图回忆密码的时候﹐思维就会阻塞。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
After his second novel, Garland had writer’s block
he could not write anything
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘉兰写完第二部小说之后陷入了创作瓶颈。

Sense.DEF: something that prevents movement or progress

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a major block to progress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进步的重大阻碍

Sense.DEF: in the past, a solid block of wood on which someone’s head was cut off as a punishment

Sense.LEXUNIT: put your head/neck on the block
Sense.DEF: to risk destroying other people’s opinion of you or losing your job by doing or saying something
Sense.TRAN: 拿自己来冒险〔指冒着败坏名誉或丢工作的危险去做某事或说某话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not prepared to put my head on the block for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不愿意为了他拿自己来冒险。

Sense.DEF: a movement in sport that stops an opponent going forward or playing the ball forward

to be sold, especially at an
auction
Sense.EXAMPLE: $500 million worth of art will go on the block.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价值5亿美元的艺术品将要拍卖。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be a chip off the old block

Sense.DEF: to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A fallen tree is blocking the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一棵倒下的树把路阻断了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sink’s blocked up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水槽堵住了。

Sense.DEF: to stand in front of someone, so that they cannot go past
Sense.TRAN: 挡住某人的去路/路/出口/逃跑的路等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to get through, but there were people blocking my way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想过去﹐但是有人挡着路。

Sense.DEF: to stop something happening, developing, or succeeding
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Senate blocked publication of the report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议院阻止这个报告发表。
Sense.EXAMPLE: laws designed to block imports of cheap tobacco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在阻挠廉价烟草进口的法规

Sense.DEF: to be in front of someone, so that they cannot see something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The huge building across the street blocked our view of the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马路对面那幢巨大的楼房挡住了我们看海的视线。

Sense.DEF: to stop light reaching a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you move? You’re blocking my light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你挪一挪好吗？你把光线挡住了。

Sense.DEF: to stop a ball, a blow etc from getting to where your opponent wants it to
Sense.TRAN: 阻截﹐拦截〔对方的击球等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shot blocked by the goalkeeper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被守门员拦截的射门

Sense.DEF: to park your car too close to another car, so that the other one cannot drive away
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为靠得太近而〕堵住〔别人的汽车〕

Sense.DEF: to paint or draw simple shapes or areas of colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just block in the main buildings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就勾画一下主要的建筑物。

Sense.DEF: to completely close something such as a road or an opening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police blocked off the city centre streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方封锁了市中心的街道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fireplace had been blocked off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 壁炉已经封起来了。

Sense.DEF: to stop light reaching a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a heavy curtain blocking out the light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅厚厚的窗帘挡住了光线。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself thinking about something or remembering it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a memory so terrible that she tried to block it out
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她努力想抹去的可怕记忆

Sense.DEF: the surrounding of an area by soldiers or ships to stop people or supplies entering or leaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: a naval blockade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海上封锁
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve imposed an economic blockade on the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对该国实行了经济封锁。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
an agreement to lift the blockade
end it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解除封锁的协议

Sense.DEF: something that is used to stop vehicles or people entering or leaving a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angry farmers used tractors as blockades on the streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的农民用拖拉机来堵塞街道。

Sense.DEF: to put a place under a blockade
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ships blockaded the port.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船只封锁了港口。

Sense.DEF: something that is stopping movement in a narrow place
Sense.TRAN: 堵塞物﹐造成阻塞的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blockage in the pipe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管子内的堵塞物

Sense.DEF: the state of being blocked or prevented
a piece of equipment with wheels and ropes, used for lifting heavy things
Sense.TRAN: 〔提升重物用的〕滑车装置﹐滑轮组﹐绞辘

Sense.DEF: a book or film that is very good or successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the latest Hollywood blockbuster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞最新大片

Sense.DEF: letters in their large form, such as A, B, C, rather than a, b, c
Sense.EXAMPLE: Complete the form in block capitals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用大写字母填写表格。

Sense.DEF: a very stupid person
a small strong building used as a shelter from enemy guns
block capitals
a party held in the street for all the people living in the area
Sense.TRAN: 〔为居住在同一街区里的所有人举行的〕街头聚会﹐街区派对

Sense.DEF: a web page containing information or opinions from a particular person or about a particular subject, to which new information is added regularly

personal websites and
weblog s
, considered as a group

a magazine on the Internet that is like a
blog
a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a nice bloke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人不错。

Sense.DEF: if you do blokish things, you behave in a traditionally male way
Sense.EXAMPLE: playing football, fixing the car, and other blokish activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 踢足球﹑修汽车等男人做的事情

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
blonde
a man who is blond has pale or yellow hair
blonde hair is pale or yellow in colour
a woman who is blonde has pale or yellow hair
a woman with pale or yellow-coloured hair
Sense.TRAN: 金发女子﹐浅色头发的女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful blonde
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金发美女

Sense.DEF: the red liquid that your heart pumps around your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body was found in a pool of blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的尸体被发现倒在血泊之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blood oozed from a cut on his forehead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血从他额头的伤口里渗了出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blood tests proved he was not the father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 验血证明他不是孩子的父亲。

Sense.DEF: to have caused someone’s death
Sense.EXAMPLE: dictators with blood on their hands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双手沾满鲜血的独裁者

Sense.DEF: in a cruel and deliberate way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evans had been murdered in cold blood .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊文斯被残酷谋杀。

Sense.DEF: to make someone extremely angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way they treat people makes my blood boil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们这样对人令我非常气愤。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel extremely frightened

Sense.LEXUNIT: like getting blood out of a stone
Sense.DEF: almost impossible
Sense.TRAN: 犹如从石头里榨油﹐犹如水中捞月
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting the truth out of her is like getting blood out of a stone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要她说出真话几乎是不可能的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that family relationships are more important than any other kind
to be angry enough to want to hurt someone
Sense.TRAN: 恨透了某人﹔恨不得要了某人的命

Sense.DEF: someone is extremely angry about something and determined to do something about it
Sense.TRAN: 某人动怒了﹐某人的怒气上来了
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tried to stop me, but my blood was up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想拦着我﹐可我已是怒不可遏了。

Sense.DEF: the family to which you belong from the time that you are born
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s Irish blood on his mother’s side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲有爱尔兰血统。

Sense.DEF: if an ability or tendency is in, or runs in, someone’s blood, it is natural to them and others in their family
Sense.TRAN: 是与生俱来的特征﹐是家族的遗传

Sense.DEF: to work extremely hard to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beth sweated blood over that article.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝花了很大的心血写那篇文章。

Sense.DEF: extremely hard work
new members in a group or organization who bring new ideas and energy
Sense.TRAN: 新鲜血液﹐新生力量﹐新成员
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to bring in some new blood and fresh ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要引进一些新成员和创新思想。

Sense.DEF: a situation where people have a very strong disagreement, with the result that something serious happens, such as someone losing his or her job
a fashionable young man
a way of greeting a friend, used by young men
Sense.TRAN: 你好啊〔年轻人的一种打招呼方式〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from a cut or wound
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had lost a lot of blood and was very weak.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他失血很多﹐非常虚弱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: provide blood from your body for the medical treatment of other people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Health Service is asking for more people to donate blood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗服务机构呼吁更多的人来献血。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone bleed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He touched me with the knife and it drew blood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用刀碰我﹐血流了出来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A quick walk will get the blood in your legs flowing again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 快步行走会让你腿部的血液重新流动起来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: moves slowly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The blood was beginning to trickle down his leg.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 血开始从他腿上一滴滴流下来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: comes out slowly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Blood was oozing from her forehead.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜血从她额头上渗出来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His face was covered in blood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满脸是血。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: moves fast
covered with dry blood
covered with small spots of blood
the force with which blood moves through your body
Collocate.EXAMPLE: High blood pressure increases the risk of a heart attack.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高血压会增加心脏病发作的风险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one of the different types of human blood
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What blood type are you?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是什么血型？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The red blood cells carry oxygen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 红细胞输送氧气。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a tube in your body through which blood flows
a mass formed when blood dries or sticks together
the blood that flows to a part of the body
a test done on your blood to see if you have a disease or another condition
a small amount of blood taken from your body to test
putting more blood in someone's body for medical reasons

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police found tiny drops of blood in the apartment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在公寓内发现有细小的血滴。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She suffered a massive loss of blood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大量失血。

Sense.DEF: to give someone their first experience of an activity, especially a difficult or unpleasant one
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕初次尝试〔尤指困难或令人不悦的事〕

Sense.DEF: full of action or violence
Sense.TRAN: 激烈的﹐猛烈的﹔充满暴力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blood-and-guts struggle between the two teams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两队之间的激烈较量

Sense.DEF: full of exciting and violent action or emotion
Sense.TRAN: 充满血腥和暴力场面的﹔令人血脉偾张的

Sense.DEF: a store of human blood to be used in hospital treatment
the violent killing of many people at one time
a man who promises loyalty to another, often in a ceremony in which the men’s blood is mixed together
Sense.TRAN: 歃血为盟的兄弟﹐拜把兄弟

Sense.DEF: a medical examination of someone’s blood to see if it contains the right substances in the right amounts
the number of cells in someone’s blood
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her blood count is very low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的血细胞总数很低。

Sense.DEF: extremely frightening
Sense.TRAN: 令人心惊胆战的﹐令人毛骨悚然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bloodcurdling scream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人毛骨悚然的尖叫声

Sense.DEF: someone who gives their blood to be used in the medical treatment of other people
something such as a film or video game that involves a lot of killing with weapons
Sense.TRAN: 暴力血腥的电影[电子游戏等]

Sense.DEF: a quarrel between people or families that lasts for many years, in which each side murders or injures members of the other side
Sense.TRAN: 〔个人或家族之间的〕宿仇﹐血仇

Sense.DEF: one of the classes into which human blood can be separated, including A,B,AB,and O
the normal temperature of the human body
Sense.TRAN: 人体血温﹐人体正常体温

Sense.DEF: a large dog with a very good sense of smell, often used for hunting
Sense.TRAN: 大警犬﹐大猎犬〔嗅觉灵敏﹐常用于追踪〕

Sense.DEF: without killing or violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bloodless coup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不流血的政变

Sense.DEF: a bloodless part of your body is very pale
Sense.EXAMPLE: His lips were thin and bloodless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的嘴唇薄薄的﹐没有血色。

Sense.DEF: lacking in human feeling
killing people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie contains scenes of violence and bloodletting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影里有暴力和血腥的镜头。

Sense.DEF: a medical treatment used in the past that involved removing some of a person’s blood
a reduction in the number of people working for an organization, industry etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many jobs have been lost, and the bloodletting isn’t over yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人已经失去了工作﹐然而裁员仍未结束。

Sense.DEF: all the members of a family of people or animals over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔一个家族的〕世系﹐血脉﹔〔动物的〕种系
Sense.EXAMPLE: a royal bloodline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇族血脉

Sense.DEF: a strong desire to be violent
money paid for murdering someone
Sense.TRAN: 血腥钱〔指付给杀手的酬金〕

Sense.DEF: money paid to the family of someone who has been murdered
Sense.TRAN: 〔偿付给被害人亲属的〕抚恤金

Sense.DEF: an orange with red juice
a serious illness in which an infection spreads through your blood
the force with which blood travels through your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: high blood pressure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高血压

GramExa.GLOSS: measure it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The nurse will take your blood pressure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士会给你量血压。

Sense.DEF: dark red, like blood
someone related to you by birth rather than by marriage
the killing of people, usually in fighting or war
Sense.EXAMPLE: diplomacy aimed at stopping further bloodshed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在阻止流血事件再次发生的外交活动

Sense.DEF: if your eyes are bloodshot, the parts that are normally white are red or pink
a sport that involves the killing of animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a demonstration against blood sports
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对猎杀动物活动的示威游行

Sense.DEF: a mark or spot of blood
horses that have been bred for racing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bloodstock auction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯种马拍卖

Sense.DEF: the blood flowing in your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug is injected directly into the bloodstream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药物是直接注射到血液中的。

Sense.DEF: a creature that sucks blood from the bodies of other animals
someone who always uses other people’s money or help – used in order to show disapproval
eager to kill and wound, or enjoying killing and violence
Sense.TRAN: 嗜杀成性的﹔耽于暴力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bloodthirsty crowd
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜欢看到流血的人群

Sense.DEF: describing or showing violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was too bloodthirsty for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影对我来说太血腥了。

Sense.DEF: the process of putting blood into someone’s body as a medical treatment
one of the classes into which human blood can be separated, including A,B,AB,and O
one of the tubes through which blood flows in your body
used to emphasize what you are saying, in a slightly rude way
Sense.TRAN: 很﹐太﹐十分﹐非常〔用于加强语气﹐略显粗鲁〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s bloody cold out there!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面真他妈的冷！
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a bloody good idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这主意真不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bloody hell!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该死的！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize an angry statement or order
Sense.EXAMPLE: It serves you bloody well right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你实在是活该。

Sense.DEF: covered in blood, or bleeding
Sense.TRAN: 血淋淋的﹐染满血的﹔流血的

Sense.DEF: with a lot of killing and injuries
Sense.TRAN: 血腥的﹔伤亡惨重的﹔残忍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bloody battle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场血战

Sense.DEF: to protest in a loud very angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was furious, screaming bloody murder at the manager!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怒不可遏﹐对着经理大声吼叫！

Sense.DEF: harmed by events but not defeated by them
Sense.TRAN: 流血不低头〔指受到伤害但没有被击倒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He emerged from the discussions bloody but unbowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这场争论中虽然遭受重创﹐却不低头认输。

Sense.DEF: to injure someone so that blood comes, or to cover something with blood

an alcoholic drink made from
vodka
, tomato juice, and spices
Sense.TRAN: 血腥玛丽，红玛丽混合酒〔由伏特加﹑番茄汁加香料调制而成的一种酒精饮料〕

Sense.DEF: deliberately making things difficult for other people
Sense.TRAN: 故意作对的﹐有意刁难的﹐与别人过不去的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop being so bloody-minded!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要再故意刁难了！

Sense.DEF: a flower or flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: beautiful red blooms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美丽的红花
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mass of bloom on the apple trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果树上的花团

Sense.DEF: with the flowers fully open
the healthy happy appearance that someone has, especially when they are young
Sense.TRAN: 健康的气色〔尤指某人年轻的时候〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rosy bloom of her cheeks had faded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双颊那红润的光泽已经消失。

Sense.DEF: if a plant or a flower blooms, its flowers appear or open
to become happier, healthier, or more successful in a way that is very noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was blooming the last time I saw her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上次见到她的时候她容光焕发。

Sense.DEF: underwear that women wore in the past, like loose trousers that end at the knees
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时长及膝部的女式〕宽松内裤

Sense.DEF: an embarrassing mistake that you make in front of other people – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔大庭广众前犯的〕错误﹐差错﹐洋相〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used for emphasizing a remark, especially when you are angry or surprised
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以加强语气﹐尤用于生气或惊讶时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s blooming ridiculous!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这真是太荒唐了！

Sense.DEF: a group of artists and writers who lived and met regularly in Bloomsbury, an area of Central London, in the early 20th century. The most famous member of the group was Virginia Woolf.
Sense.TRAN: 布卢姆斯伯里团体〔20世纪初在伦敦布卢姆斯伯里区活动的一个艺术家和作家团体﹐最著名的成员是弗吉尼亚. 吴尔夫〕

Sense.DEF: an embarrassing mistake that you make in front of other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔大庭广众前犯的〕错误﹐差错﹐洋相

Sense.DEF: a ball in baseball that is high and slow, and easy to catch or hit
a flower or the flowers on a tree or bush
Sense.EXAMPLE: pale pink blossoms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡粉色的花朵
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cherry tree was covered in blossom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 樱桃树花满枝头。

Sense.DEF: with the flowers fully open
if trees blossom, they produce flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The apple trees are just beginning to blossom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果树正开始开花。

Sense.DEF: to become happier, more beautiful, more successful etc
Sense.TRAN: 变得快乐﹔变得漂亮﹔兴旺
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pete’s blossomed out in his new school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特到了新学校后变得活泼开朗了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The idea blossomed into a successful mail order business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法最后发展成了一家成功的邮购公司。

Sense.DEF: to make a wet surface become dry by pressing soft paper or cloth on it
to do something that spoils the idea that people have of you
to cover or hide something completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thick white smoke blotted out the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的浓烟遮住了太阳。

Sense.DEF: if you blot out an unpleasant memory, a thought etc, you deliberately try to forget it
Sense.TRAN: 抹去﹐有意地忘记〔不快的记忆﹑想法等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said she took drugs to blot out her problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她吸毒是为了排遣烦恼。

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid from a surface by pressing soft paper or cloth onto it
a mark or dirty spot on something, especially made by ink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨水渍

Sense.DEF: a building, structure etc that is ugly and spoils the appearance of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new power station is a blot on the landscape .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座新建的发电站真是煞风景。

Sense.DEF: something that spoils the good opinion that people have of someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The increase in juvenile crime is a blot on our time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年犯罪率上升是我们这个时代的耻辱。

Sense.DEF: a pink or red mark on the skin, or a coloured mark on something
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤上的〕斑﹔疤﹔〔物件上的〕污渍

Sense.DEF: a large piece of blotting paper kept on top of a desk
a book in which an official daily record is kept
Sense.EXAMPLE: the police blotter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方拘捕记录簿

Sense.DEF: the drug LSD
soft thick paper used for drying wet ink on a page after writing
drunk
a shirt for women
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silk blouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丝质女衬衫

Sense.DEF:
to speak or write for too long and to use words that are too long and formal, especially on a
blog
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在博客上〕高谈阔论﹐发表长篇大论

Sense.DEF: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cold breeze was blowing hard .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒风劲吹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was blowing from an easterly direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是从东面吹过来的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面狂风大作。

Sense.DEF: to move, or to move something, by the force of the wind or a current of air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind blew the rain into our faces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风裹挟着雨点吹打在我们脸上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My ticket blew away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的票被风刮走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A sudden draught blew the door shut .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵突如其来的穿堂风把门吹上了。

Sense.DEF: to send air out from your mouth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She blew onto her coffee to cool it down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吹着咖啡让它凉下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He blew the smoke right in my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他直对着我的脸吐烟。

Sense.DEF: to make a sound by passing air through a whistle, horn etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whistle blew for half time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哨声响起﹐上半场结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A truck went by and blew its horn at her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆卡车驶过﹐对着她鸣喇叭。

Sense.DEF: to damage or destroy something violently with an explosion or by shooting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Part of his leg had been blown off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一条腿被炸掉一截。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A bomb like that could blow you to bits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样一颗炸弹可以把你炸得粉碎。

Sense.DEF: to lose a good opportunity by making a mistake or by being careless
Sense.TRAN: 〔因犯错或不小心〕失掉﹐断送〔机会〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve blown our chances of getting that contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们断送了得到那份合同的机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got a great future ahead of you. Don’t blow it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有很大好的前途﹐不要毁了它。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of money in a careless way, especially on one thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I blew all the money I won on a trip to Hawaii.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把赢来的钱全部挥霍在一次夏威夷之旅上了。

Sense.DEF: to clean your nose by forcing air through it into a cloth or a piece of soft paper
to kiss your hand and then pretend to blow the kiss towards someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She leant out of the window and blew him a kiss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她探出窗外﹐给他送上一个飞吻。

Sense.DEF:
if an electrical
fuse
blows, or a piece of electrical equipment blows a fuse, the electricity suddenly stops working because a thin wire has melted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floodlights blew a fuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泛光灯烧断了一根保险丝。

Sense.DEF: if a tyre blows, or if a car blows a tyre, it bursts
to make or shape something by sending air out from your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids were blowing bubbles in the backyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在后院吹泡泡。

GramExa.GLOSS: shape glass by blowing into it when it is very hot and soft

Sense.DEF: said to show annoyance or surprise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blow it! I forgot to phone Jane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糟糕！ 我忘记给简打电话了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blow me down if she didn’t just run off!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有逃走才怪呢！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I’m blowed !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇﹐真让我晕倒！

Sense.DEF: to make known something that was meant to be a secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your coming here has blown the whole operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来这里使整个行动泄了密。

GramExa.GLOSS: make known what someone’s real job or name is
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would only take one phone call to blow his cover.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需一个电话就能暴露他的身份。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel very surprised and excited by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seeing her again really blew my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再次见到她令我兴奋不已。

Sense.DEF: to become extremely angry quickly or suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: One day, I just blew my top and hit him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一天﹐我火了就打了他。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone in authority about something wrong that someone is doing
Sense.TRAN: 打某人的小报告﹐告发某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He blew the whistle on his colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打小报告说同事的不是。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem much more serious or important than it is
to talk a lot about your own achievements – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave spent the whole evening blowing his own trumpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫一整个晚上都在自吹自擂。

Sense.LEXUNIT: blow sb/sth out of the water
Sense.DEF: to defeat someone or something that you are competing with, or to achieve much more than they do
Sense.TRAN: 把某人/某物打得落花流水﹔把…彻底比下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: Motown had blown all the other record companies out of the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩城唱片公司把其他所有的唱片公司都打得落花流水。

Sense.DEF: to keep changing your attitude towards someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 反复无常﹐忽冷忽热﹐摇摆不定

Sense.DEF: to destroy an idea, plan etc by showing that it cannot be true or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: This new information blows his theory sky-high.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一新信息彻底粉碎了他的理论。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very surprised, especially about something they like or admire
Sense.TRAN: 使大为惊讶〔尤指对喜欢或羡慕的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It just blows me away, the way everyone’s so friendly round here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真是惊讶极了﹐这里人人都是这么友好。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by shooting them with a gun
to defeat someone completely, especially in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nancy blew away the rest of the skaters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希击败了其他的滑冰运动员。

Sense.DEF: if the wind blows something down, or if something blows down, the wind makes it fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden gate has blown down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园的门被风吹倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several trees were blown down in the night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里有好几棵树被刮倒了。

Sense.DEF: to arrive in a place, especially suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim blew in about an hour ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约一小时前吉姆突然来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guess who’s just blown into town ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猜猜刚才谁进城来了？

Sense.DEF: if a storm or bad weather blows in, it arrives and begins to affect a particular area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first snowstorm blew in from the north.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一场暴风雪从北方袭来。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone or something as unimportant, for example by not meeting someone or not going to an event
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bud got into trouble for blowing off the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴德逃避开会惹了麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to make known something that was secret, especially something involving important or famous people
Sense.TRAN: 揭发某事的内幕〔尤指与重要人物或名人有关的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her book blew the lid off the Reagan years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的书揭露了里根当政时期的内幕。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by shooting them in the head
to get rid of anger or energy by doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went jogging to blow off some steam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去跑步﹐以消消怒气。

Sense.DEF: if you blow a flame or a fire out, or if it blows out, it stops burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match blew out in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火柴被风吹灭了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blow out all the candles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把所有的蜡烛吹灭。

Sense.DEF: if a tyre blows out, it bursts
if a storm blows itself out, it ends
to kill yourself, or someone else, with a shot to the head
Sense.TRAN: 枪击头部自杀/杀死某人

Sense.DEF: to easily defeat someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We blew them out 28–0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以28比0大胜他们。

Sense.DEF: if you blow out your knee or another joint in your body, or if it blows out, you injure it badly

if an oil or gas
well
blows out, oil or gas suddenly escapes from it
to stop having a friendship or relationship with someone
if the wind blows something over, or if something blows over, the wind makes it fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our fence blew over in the storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的篱笆被风暴刮倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hurricane blew some palm trees over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飓风把一些棕榈树吹倒了。

Sense.DEF: if an argument or unpleasant situation blows over, it ends or is forgotten
Sense.TRAN: 〔争论或不愉快的事情〕结束﹔被遗忘
Sense.EXAMPLE: They weren’t speaking to each other, but I think it’s blown over now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以前互不理睬﹐但我想现在一切都过去了。

Sense.DEF: if a storm blows over, it goes away
to destroy something, or to be destroyed, by an explosion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane blew up in midair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在半空中爆炸了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rebels attempted to blow up the bridge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子企图炸毁桥梁。

Sense.DEF: to fill something with air or gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you blow up this balloon ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把这个气球吹起来吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll blow the tyres up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会把轮胎充好气。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, argument etc blows up, it suddenly becomes important or dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crisis had blown up over the peace talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和谈过程中爆发了一场危机。

Sense.DEF: if you blow up a photograph, you make it larger
to become very angry with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny’s father blew up when she didn’t come home last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮昨晚没回家﹐她的父亲大为光火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was surprised at the way he blew up at Hardy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对着哈迪发火的样子让我很吃惊。

Sense.DEF: if bad weather blows up, it suddenly arrives
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks as if there’s a storm blowing up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来暴风雨即将来临。

Sense.DEF: if something you have done or planned to do blows up in your face, it suddenly goes wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔事情〕出岔子﹔〔计划等〕突然告吹
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of his deals had just blown up in his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一桩生意好端端地就告吹了。

Sense.DEF: an action or event that causes difficulty or sadness for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe resigned, which was a severe blow because we needed him desperately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔辞职了﹐这是一个巨大的打击﹐因为我们非常需要他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother’s death was a shattering blow .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲的死是一个沉重的打击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The election result dealt a further blow to the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞选结果进一步打击了这个政党。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory closures came as a blow to the local economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂关闭是对当地经济的一个打击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final blow for many firms was the government’s abolition of import duties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于许多公司来说﹐政府取消进口税是最后致命的一击。

Sense.DEF: a hard hit with someone’s hand, a tool, or a weapon
Sense.EXAMPLE: She died from a heavy blow to the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头部受重击死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He struck a blow which threw her to the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一拳把她打倒在地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin received a blow on the nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁鼻子上被打了一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He had been struck a glancing blow
a blow that did not hit him directly
by the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被汽车从侧面刮到了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave her a violent blow to the head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在她脑袋上猛击了一下。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone gets hit or that something hits them, rather than using the noun blow
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说someone gets hit 或something hits someone﹐而不用名词blow
F2NBox.BADEXA: He received a blow to the head.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ He got hit on the head.

Sense.DEF: an action of blowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: One big blow and the candles were out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使劲一吹﹐蜡烛就都灭了。

Sense.DEF: if two people come to blows, they start arguing or hitting each other because they disagree about something
Sense.TRAN: （和某人）争吵起来﹔（和某人）打起来

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They almost came to blows over the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为钱的事差一点儿打起来。

Sense.DEF: to make something unpleasant easier for someone to accept
Sense.EXAMPLE: A reduction in interest rates would soften the blow of tax increases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 降息对增税带来的打击将起到缓和的作用。

Sense.DEF: something unkind you say to deliberately embarrass or upset someone
Sense.TRAN: 故意让人难堪的话﹐刻薄话

Sense.DEF: an account that includes all the details of an event exactly as they happened
Sense.TRAN: 一五一十的讲述﹐原原本本的叙述

Sense.DEF:
to dry hair and give it shape by using an electric
hairdryer
Sense.TRAN: 吹干〔头发〕﹔把〔头发〕吹出发型

Sense.DEF: a small electric machine that blows hot air onto your hair in order to dry it
a machine that blows out air, for example inside a car
on the telephone in order to talk to someone
a fly that lays its eggs on meat or wounds
Sense.TRAN: 〔产卵于腐肉﹑创口的〕丽蝇﹐绿头苍蝇

Sense.DEF: someone who talks too much and has very strong opinions
Sense.TRAN: 自吹自擂者﹐高谈阔论的人

Sense.DEF:
a hole in the surface of ice where water animals such as
seal s
come to breathe
Sense.TRAN: 〔冰面上供海豹等水生动物呼吸的〕冰孔﹐冰窟窿

Sense.DEF:
a hole in the top of the head of a
whale
,
dolphin
etc through which they breathe
the practice of touching a man’s sexual organs with your lips and tongue to give him sexual pleasure
a piece of equipment that produces a very hot flame, used especially for removing paint

the past participle of
blow
a sudden bursting of a tyre
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a blow-out on the driver’s side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我驾驶座这边的轮胎爆了。

Sense.DEF: a big expensive meal or large social occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went for a real blow-out to celebrate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去大大庆祝了一番。

Sense.DEF: an easy victory over someone in a game

a sudden uncontrolled escape of oil or gas from a
well

a tube through which you can blow a small stone,
arrow
etc, used as a weapon
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为武器用的〕吹箭筒﹐吹矢枪

Sense.DEF: a blowsy woman is fat and looks untidy
a piece of equipment that produces a small very hot flame, used especially for removing paint
a photograph, or part of a photograph, that has been made larger
a sudden big argument or disagreement
windy
another spelling of blowsy
the name of a sandwich that contains these foods
to cry noisily, especially in a way that annoys people
Sense.TRAN: 号哭﹐大哭〔尤指哭得让人讨厌〕

Sense.DEF:
the fat of sea animals, especially
whale s
to hit someone several times with something heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was bludgeoned to death with a hammer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被人用锤子连续重击致死。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to do something by making threats or arguing with them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t let myself be bludgeoned into marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不会让自己在别人的强迫下结婚。

Sense.LEXUNIT: bludgeon your way through/to/past etc sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to get somewhere, or achieve something, by pushing past other people or not caring about them
Sense.TRAN: 用力推开某人/某物走过去﹔为达到目的而不顾某人/某物

Sense.DEF: a heavy stick with a thick end, used as a weapon
having the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day
Sense.TRAN: 蓝色的﹐蔚蓝色的﹐天蓝色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the blue waters of the lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝蓝的湖水

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dark blue raincoat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件深蓝色的雨衣

Sense.DEF: sad and without hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been feeling kind of blue .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心情不大好。

Sense.DEF: blue jokes, stories etc are about sex, in a way that might offend some people

Sense.LEXUNIT: argue/talk etc till you’re blue in the face
Sense.DEF: to argue, talk etc about something a lot, but without achieving what you want
Sense.TRAN: 费尽唇舌﹐嘴巴说干了都没用
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can tell them till you’re blue in the face, but they’ll still do what they want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就算费尽唇舌﹐他们还是会独断独行。

Sense.DEF: someone who is blue with cold looks extremely cold
if someone goes blue, their skin becomes blue because they are cold or cannot breathe properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔因寒冷或呼吸不畅而〕脸色发青

Sense.DEF: to talk very quickly without stopping
the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day
Sense.EXAMPLE: She nearly always dresses in blue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎总是穿蓝色的衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich greens and blues of the tapestry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挂毯上浓艳的绿色和蓝色

Sense.DEF: a slow sad style of music that came from the southern US
Sense.TRAN: 布鲁斯音乐﹐蓝调音乐〔起源于美国南方的一种缓慢﹑忧郁的音乐风格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blues singer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁斯歌手

Sense.DEF: feelings of sadness
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of women get the blues after the baby is born.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多妇女产后会感到忧郁。

Sense.DEF: if something happens out of the blue, it is very unexpected
Sense.TRAN: 出乎意料地﹐突如其来地

Crossrefto.REFLEX: a bolt from/out of the blue

Sense.DEF: someone who has represented Oxford or Cambridge University at a sport, or the title given to such a person
Sense.TRAN: 蓝色选手〔指牛津或剑桥大学校队运动员〕﹔蓝色（选手的）荣誉

Sense.DEF: the sea or the sky
a baby whose skin is slightly blue when it is born because it has a heart problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔心脏有先天性缺陷的〕青紫婴儿﹐“紫娃”

Sense.DEF: a small plant with blue flowers that grows in woods
a small blue fruit, or the plant it grows on
Sense.TRAN: 越橘果﹐蓝莓﹔越橘树﹐蓝莓树

Sense.DEF: a small blue bird that lives in North America
Sense.TRAN: 〔产于北美的〕蓝鸲﹐蓝色知更鸟

Sense.DEF:
a blue-blooded person belongs to a royal or
noble
family
Sense.TRAN: 贵族血统的﹐出身名门的

Sense.DEF: a book with a list of prices that you can expect to pay for any used car
a book with a blue cover that is used in American colleges for writing answers to examination questions
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国大学生考试答题用的〕蓝皮簿

Sense.DEF: a large blue fly
a type of cheese with blue lines in it and a strong taste

companies or
share s
that make a profit and are considered safe
blue-collar workers do physical work, rather than working in offices
Sense.TRAN: 蓝领阶级的﹐从事体力劳动的

Sense.DEF: the man or boy in a group who is most liked and approved of by someone in authority

a type of music from the southern and western US, played on instruments such as the
guitar
and
violin
Sense.TRAN: 蓝草音乐〔起源于美国南部和西部的一种音乐风格﹐用吉他和小提琴等演奏〕

Sense.DEF:
the practice of using a
mobile phone
with
bluetooth
technology to send a
text message
to another person near you, without letting them know who has sent the message. This is usually done as a joke to surprise the person who receives the message.
Sense.TRAN: 蓝牙劫持〔指用蓝牙技术发送匿名手机短信给附近的人﹐通常是为了开玩笑让对方吃惊〕

Sense.DEF: a common large North American bird with blue feathers
blue trousers made in a heavy material
a law used in the past in the US to control activities that were considered immoral, such as drinking alcohol and working on Sundays
Sense.TRAN: 清教徒法规﹐蓝色法规〔美国旧时的法规﹐用以限制喝酒﹑星期日工作等被认为是不道德的活动〕

Sense.DEF: a film that shows a lot of sexual activity
used to describe an occasion during a battle or a war when a soldier, sailor, or pilot is accidentally killed by their own army
Sense.TRAN: 〔战争中〕被自己人误杀的﹐误伤自己人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ‘Blue on Blue’ incident which saw an RAF jet brought down by a Patriot missile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家空军战斗机被爱国者导弹击落的误伤友军事件

Sense.DEF: a plan for achieving something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a blueprint for health-care reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健改革蓝图

Sense.DEF: a photographic print of a plan for a building, machine etc on special blue paper

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a blueprint for the new shopping mall
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新购物中心的蓝图

Sense.DEF: a pattern that all living cells contain, which decides how a person, animal, or plant develops and what it looks like
Sense.EXAMPLE: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

Sense.DEF: the first prize in a competition, sometimes consisting of a small piece of blue material

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the club’s prized blue riband award
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个俱乐部珍贵的蓝绶带奖

Sense.DEF: concerned with thinking of new and interesting ideas, without worrying about whether they are practical or not
Sense.TRAN: 空想的﹐纯理论的﹐不切实际的
Sense.EXAMPLE: blue-sky thinking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯理论的想法

Sense.DEF: a woman who is more interested in ideas and studying than in parties, men etc – sometimes used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 女学究﹐女才子〔有时含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
bluesy music is slow and sad, like
blues

a system that allows you to connect computer equipment, such as a
keyboard
or
printer
, to a computer that is near it by using radio waves instead of wires. You can also use the system to connect a
mobile phone
to a computer without using wires.
Sense.TRAN: 蓝牙〔用于将键盘﹑打印机等设备与计算机进行短距离无线连接的一种技术﹐也可用于移动电话和计算机的连接〕

Sense.DEF: to pretend something, especially in order to achieve what you want in a difficult or dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: You wouldn’t really tell her. You’re bluffing!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会真的告诉她吧﹐你在吓唬我！

GramExa.PROPFORM: bluff your way out of/through/past etc sb/sth
GramExa.GLOSS: go somewhere or succeed in doing something by deceiving someone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 骗过某人出来/穿过/经过等﹔蒙混过关
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope we’ll be able to bluff our way past the guard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我们可以骗过保安。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
‘I was with Don,’ she said, deciding to bluff it out
continue to pretend something
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定装到底﹐就说:“我是和唐在一起。”

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone do something by deceiving them

Sense.DEF: an attempt to deceive someone by making them think you will do something, when you do not intend to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The threat was only a bluff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种威胁不过是吓唬人而已。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever you say, you must do it. This isn’t a game of bluff .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你说什么﹐你一定得去做﹐这可不是在唬人。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone to do what they have threatened because you do not believe that they will really do it
Sense.TRAN: 要求某人做其威胁要做的事〔因为不相信对方真的会那么做〕

Sense.DEF: a very steep cliff or slope
a bluff person, usually a man, is pleasant but very direct and does not always consider other people
Sense.TRAN: 率直的﹐爽快的﹐豪爽的〔但有时不顾及别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a bluff no-nonsense administrator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个干脆豪爽的主管。

Sense.DEF: slightly blue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her skin had a bluish tinge .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的皮肤微微透着蓝色。

Sense.DEF: a careless or stupid mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: A last-minute blunder cost them the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一刻的失误使他们输掉了这场比赛。

Sense.DEF: to move in an unsteady way, as if you cannot see properly
Sense.TRAN: 踉踉跄跄地走﹐跌跌撞撞

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone was blundering about in the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在厨房里四处瞎撞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Phil came blundering down the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔跌跌撞撞地跑下楼梯。

Sense.DEF: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们犯了大错﹐让他做这份工作。

Sense.DEF: to enter a place or become involved in a difficult situation by mistake
Sense.TRAN: 误入〔某地〕﹔不小心陷入〔困境〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somehow we blundered into the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不知怎么地就卷入了这场战争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He would have agreed if you hadn’t blundered in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是你冒冒失失跑进来﹐他都已经同意了。

Sense.DEF: a type of gun used in the past
careless or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: You blundering idiot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个愚蠢的傻瓜！

Sense.DEF: not sharp or pointed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharpen all your blunt knives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你所有的钝刀子都磨一磨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blunt pencil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钝铅笔

Sense.DEF: speaking in an honest way even if this upsets people
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话〕不客气的﹐直言不讳的﹐耿直的
Sense.EXAMPLE: To be blunt, many of the candidates cannot read or write.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说得不客气一点﹐很多申请人都不会读写。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julian’s blunt words hurt her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱利安一番唐突的话伤害了她。

Subsense.DEF: a heavy object that is used to hit someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The victim suffered a blow to the head from a blunt instrument.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害人头部遭到钝器袭击。

Subsense.DEF: a method of doing something that does not work very well because it has a lot of other effects that you do not want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The exams are a blunt instrument that will reveal little about children’s abilities.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试并不是有效的方法﹐它不大能反映孩子的能力。

Sense.DEF: to make a feeling less strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bad weather blunted their enthusiasm for camping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糟糕的天气冲淡了他们去露营的热情。

Sense.DEF: to make the point of a pencil or the edge of a knife less sharp
speaking in a direct honest way that sometimes upsets people
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re drunk,’ she said bluntly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你喝醉了。”她不客气地说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To put it bluntly , she’s not up to the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恕我直言﹐她不适合这份工作。

Sense.DEF: a shape that you cannot see clearly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw the blur of the car as it passed in front of me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车从我面前驶过﹐我只看到一个模糊的影子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The island was a blur through misty rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小岛在蒙蒙烟雨中影影绰绰。

Sense.DEF: something that you cannot remember clearly
Sense.TRAN: 模糊的记忆﹐记不清的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: The days before the accident were a blur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出事以前的那些日子只剩一片模糊的记忆。

Sense.DEF: to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: The street lights were blurred by the fog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街灯在迷雾的笼罩下十分昏暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the details in the picture are blurred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片中的许多细节部分都模糊了。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to see clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tears blurred her eyes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪水模糊了她的双眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His vision was blurred .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的视线模糊了。

Sense.DEF: to make the difference between two ideas, subjects etc less clear
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔想法﹑主题等〕难以区分﹐模糊
Sense.EXAMPLE: His films blur the boundaries between fact and fiction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的电影模糊了虚实的界限。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The design of the conservatory is meant to blur the distinction between the house and the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个暖房的设计意在把房子和花园融合起来。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a few blurry photos of their holiday
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们度假时拍的几张模糊的照片

Sense.DEF:
a way of storing
high-definition
very clear
video images on a
disc
Sense.TRAN: 蓝光〔一种在光盘上储存高清视频图像的技术〕

Sense.DEF: a short description giving information about a book, new product etc
unclear in shape, or making it difficult to see shapes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blurred photo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张模糊的照片

Sense.DEF: difficult to remember or understand clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: blurred memories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模糊的记忆

Sense.DEF: to say something suddenly and without thinking, usually because you are nervous or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因紧张或激动而〕不假思索地说出﹐脱口而出﹐说漏嘴
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter blurted the news out before we could stop him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还没来得及阻止﹐彼得就脱口说出了那个消息。

Sense.DEF: to become red in the face, usually because you are embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilson saw she was watching him and blushed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊看到她在注视着自己﹐不由得脸红了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joan blushed at the unexpected compliment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这意外的夸奖让琼脸红了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate blushed scarlet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特满脸绯红。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people often say go red rather than blush
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中﹐人们常说go red﹐而不说 blush
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She went red when he looked at her.

Sense.DEF: to feel ashamed or embarrassed about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I blush to admit that I haven’t read it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我都不好意思承认我没有看过。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth that would make sb blush
Sense.DEF: something so shocking that it would shock someone who is not normally easily shocked
Sense.TRAN: 连某人都会感到脸红的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: language that would make a sailor blush
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连水手听到都会脸红的语言

Sense.DEF: a young woman on her wedding day – used humorously
the red colour on your face that appears when you are embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donald felt a blush warm his cheeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐纳德感到双颊热辣辣的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bent her head to hide her blushes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她低下头﹐把羞红的脸掩藏起来。

Sense.DEF: when first thought of or considered
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first blush, this sounds like good news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乍一想﹐这似乎是个好消息。

Sense.DEF: cream or powder used for making your cheeks look red or pink
to speak in a loud angry way that is not really very impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s hardly the point,’ he blustered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那根本不重要。”他大声嚷道。

Sense.DEF: if the wind blusters, it blows violently
blustery weather is very windy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold and blustery day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷而狂风呼啸的一天

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= boulevard 大道﹐大街

Sense.DEF: an organization that represents medical doctors in the UK. There is a similar organization in the US called the A.M.A. (American Medical Association). The BMA produces a well-known medical magazine, The British Medical Journal .
Sense.TRAN: 英国医学会〔英国医生团体﹐美国也有类似机构称A.M.A.的类似机构〕
the abbreviation of 缩写= body mass index 【医】身体质量指数，体重指数

Sense.DEF: a film that is made cheaply and is of low quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔廉价制作﹑质量不高的〕二流影片﹐B级片

Sense.DEF:
a type of computer
file
that contains images
a strong bicycle with a frame that is very low to the ground, used to do special movements such as jumping high into the air

an unpleasant smell from someone’s body caused by
sweat
a large snake that is not poisonous, but kills animals by crushing them

a
feather boa
a wild pig
a male pig
a flat wide piece of wood, plastic etc that you can use to show information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plan of the new building is displayed on a board at the back of the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新大楼的设计图贴在房间后面的公告板上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve put a list of names up on the board.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在布告板上贴出了名单。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll check the departure board for train times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去查一下开车时刻表﹐看看火车的时间。

Sense.DEF: a flat piece of wood, plastic, card etc that you use for a particular purpose such as cutting things on, or for playing indoor games
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于切割﹑玩室内游戏等的〕平板
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martha was chopping vegetables on a wooden board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎正在用一块木砧板切蔬菜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chess board
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棋盘

Sense.DEF: a group of people in a company or other organization who make the rules and important decisions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Board of Directors met yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会昨天开了会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was disagreement among the agency's board of governors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机构的理事会成员之间意见有分歧。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sit on a board/have a seat on a board
GramExa.GLOSS: be a member of a board
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave up his seat on the board after 40 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他干满40年后退出了董事会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a board meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: a board member
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会成员

Sense.DEF: used in the name of some organizations
Sense.TRAN: 局﹐部﹐委员会〔用于机构名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the New York State Board of Elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约州选举委员会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British Boxing Board of Control
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国拳击运动管理委员会

Sense.DEF: a long thin flat piece of wood used for making floors, walls, fences etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于铺地板﹑筑墙﹑做篱笆等的〕长条木板
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to take the boards up to check the wiring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得把地板撬起来检查一下电线。

Subsense.DEF: on a ship, plane, or spacecraft
Subsense.TRAN: 在船上﹔在飞机上﹔在宇宙飞船上
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are 12 children on board the ship.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船上有12名儿童。

Subsense.DEF: involved with something or working for an organization
Subsense.TRAN: 卷入﹔加入﹐进入〔某机构工作〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Supporters of the treaty say that it will be necessary to have the United States on board.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个条约的支持者说有必要让美国加进来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He came on board in the late sixties and spent two decades with the agency.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于60年代末加入﹐在这个机构里干了20年。

Sense.DEF: the meals that are provided for you when you pay to stay somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the nursing home she will have to pay for room and board .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她进养老院就必须交膳宿费。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The landlord provides board and lodging
meals and a place to stay
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房东提供食宿。

Sense.DEF: if an idea, way of behaving, or plan goes by the board, it fails to happen, ends, or is no longer possible
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑计划等〕落空﹐失败﹔〔行为方式〕被摒弃
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loyalty has gone by the board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠诚观念已不复存在。

Sense.DEF:
a
surfboard
or
sailboard
if something happens or is done across the board, it affects everyone in a particular group, place etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The changes will affect local authorities across the board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变化将涉及所有的地方政府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We find jobs for people right across the board , from chief executives to cleaners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为各行各业人士寻找工作﹐从行政主管到清洁人员无所不包。

Sense.DEF: to listen to and accept a suggestion, idea etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school refused to take any of the parents’ criticisms on board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校拒绝接受家长提出的任何批评。

Sense.DEF:
a
circuit board
the stage in a theatre

the low wooden wall around the area in which you play
ice hockey
examinations that you take in the US when you formally ask to be accepted as a student at a college or medical school
Sense.TRAN: 大学/医学院的入学考试

Sense.DEF: to get on a bus, plane, train etc in order to travel somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 登上〔公共汽车﹑飞机﹑火车等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple boarded the train for New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妻俩登上了开往纽约的列车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Passengers were standing on the dock, waiting to board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客们站在码头上等待上船。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get on a bus, plane etc rather than board
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get on a bus, plane等﹐而不说board
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: When she heard the news, she got on the next plane for Chicago.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到消息后立即就赶了下一班飞机去了芝加哥。

Sense.DEF: if a plane or ship is boarding, passengers are getting onto it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Olympic Airways Flight 172 to Istanbul is now boarding at Gate No. 37.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥林匹克航空公司前往伊斯坦布尔的172次航班正在37号登机口登机。

Sense.DEF: to stay in a room in someone’s house that you pay for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several students boarded with Mrs. Smith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几名学生寄宿在史密斯夫人家里。

Sense.DEF: to stay at a school at night as well as during the day
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dickie was sent away to school as soon as he was old enough to board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪基一到可以寄宿的年龄就被送去学校了。

Sense.DEF: to pay money and arrange for an animal to stay somewhere
to cover a window or door, or all the windows and doors of a building, with wooden boards
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shop was boarded up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店用木板封起来了。

Sense.DEF: a student who stays at a school during the night, as well as during the day
someone who pays to live in another person’s house, with some or all of their meals provided
Sense.TRAN: 〔住在他人家里的〕寄宿者﹐寄膳宿者

Sense.DEF: an indoor game played on a specially designed board made of thick card or wood

PIC.HEADING: BOARD GAMES 棋类游戏
PIC.PICCONTENT: chessboard 棋盘；chess 国际象棋；counter 棋子；dice 骰子；backgammon 西洋双陆棋；Chinese chequers BrE【英】/Chinese checkers AmE【美】中国跳棋；draughts BrE【英】/checkers AmE【美】西洋跳棋；snakes and ladders BrE【英】/chutes and ladders AmE【美】蛇梯棋

Sense.DEF: the act of getting on a ship, plane etc in order to travel somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boarding is now taking place at Gate 38.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 38号登机口现在正在登机。

Sense.DEF: narrow pieces of wood that are fixed side by side, usually to cover a broken door or window
Sense.TRAN: 并排钉在一起的木板〔一般用来遮住破门窗〕

Sense.DEF:
a British word for
boarding pass
a private house where you pay to sleep and eat
an official card that you have to show before you get onto a plane
a school where students live as well as study

a room where the
director s
of a company have meetings

trousers that reach the knees, worn by men when swimming or
surfing
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子游泳或冲浪时穿的〕冲浪裤﹐沙滩裤

Sense.DEF: a raised path made of wood, usually built next to the sea
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常建于海滨的〕木板路﹐栈道

Sense.DEF: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I wouldn’t be afraid,’ she boasted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我才不怕呢。”她吹嘘道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Amy boasted that her son was a genius.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米夸耀自己的儿子是天才。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s boasting about how much money he has made.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在吹嘘自己赚了多少多少钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is inclined to boast of its success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司喜欢炫耀自己的成就。

Sense.DEF: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方﹑机构等〕自豪地拥有〔好的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city boasts two excellent museums.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

Sense.DEF: something that you like telling people because you are proud of it
Sense.TRAN: 引以自豪的事物﹐感到骄傲的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is the company’s proud boast that it can deal with all a customer’s needs in one phone call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司所引以自豪的是﹐一通电话它就能满足一位客户所有的需求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Philip’s boast is that he started out without any outside financial backing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普引以自豪的是他的起家没有依赖任何外来的资助。

GramExa.GLOSS: a false statement that something is good or possible
GramExa.EXAMPLE:
‘Making knowledge work’ is the university’s phrase, and it is no idle boast
not a boast, but true
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “学以致用”是这所大学的校训﹐这确实不是一句空话。

Sense.DEF: talking too proudly about yourself
a vehicle that travels across water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fishing boat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渔船
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The boat capsized
turned over
in heavy seas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船在波涛汹涌的大海上倾覆了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boat trip around the islands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘船环岛旅行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the beaches can only be reached by boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些海滩只有乘船才能抵达。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: MacKay said he would sleep on his boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦凯说他就睡在船上。

Sense.DEF: a ship, especially one that carries passengers
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re taking the night boat to St. Malo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算乘夜船去圣马洛。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the same boat (as sb)
Sense.DEF: to be in the same unpleasant situation as someone else
Sense.TRAN: 处于（与某人）相同的倒霉境地﹔（与某人）面临同样的危险
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone has lost their job. We’re all in the same boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都失去了工作﹐我们大家都是一样的处境。

Sense.DEF:
a hard
straw
hat with a flat top
a long pole with an iron hook at the end, used to pull or push a small boat
Sense.TRAN: 〔一端有钩﹐用来钩住或推开小船的〕撑篙﹐钩篙

Sense.DEF: a building beside a lake or river where boats are kept
the activity of travelling in a small boat for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go boating on the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到湖上划船去吧。

Sense.DEF: a man who you pay to take you out in a boat or for the use of a boat
people who escape from bad conditions in their country in small boats
Sense.TRAN: 乘小船出逃的难民﹐船民

Sense.DEF: a rowing race on the River Thames, held every year between teams from Oxford University and Cambridge University. The Boat Race is a popular national event and is shown on television.
Sense.TRAN: 〔每年在泰晤士河上举行的〕牛津剑桥划船比赛

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
bosun
a train that takes people to or from ships in a port
Sense.TRAN: 〔接送轮船乘客往返港口的〕联运火车

Sense.DEF: an area where boats are built and repaired
to move up and down when floating on the surface of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boat bobbed gently up and down on the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船在水面上轻轻起伏。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Foster bobbed about, gathering up her things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福斯特夫人跑来跑去﹐收拾自己的东西。

Sense.DEF: to move your head down quickly as a way of showing respect, greeting someone, or agreeing with them
Sense.TRAN: 点头〔表示尊敬﹑问候或赞同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke to the girl, who bobbed her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和女孩说着话﹐女孩频频点头。

Sense.DEF: to cut someone’s, especially a woman’s, hair in a bob
Sense.TRAN: 把〔尤指女性的头发〕剪成齐短发
Sense.EXAMPLE: her neatly bobbed hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那剪得整整齐齐的短发

Sense.DEF: a way of cutting hair so that it hangs to the level of your chin and is the same length all the way round your head
a quick up and down movement of your head or body, to show respect, agreement, greeting etc
Sense.TRAN: 点头﹔屈膝〔表示尊敬﹑赞同﹑问候等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The maid gave a little bob and left the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女仆略一欠身﹐离开了房间。

Sense.DEF:
a
shilling
coin used in the past in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 一先令〔旧时的英国硬币〕
Sense.EXAMPLE:
At last I’m making a few bob
a reasonable amount of money
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于能赚到一点钱了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will be easy to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just copy the disk, and Bob’s your uncle!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把磁盘拷贝一下就行﹐容易得很！

Sense.DEF:
a small round object that you wind thread onto, especially for a
sewing machine
a small soft ball, usually made of wool, that is used especially for decorating clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于装饰衣服的〕小羊毛球﹐小绒球
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her pullover had bobbles on the front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的套头毛衣前面有小绒球。

Sense.DEF: to drop or hold a ball in an uncontrolled way
if a piece of clothing bobbles, especially a sweater, it forms little balls on the surface of the cloth after it has been worn or washed

a
woollen
hat with a bobble on the top
Sense.TRAN: 〔顶上饰有小绒球的〕毛绒帽﹐绒球帽

Sense.DEF: a policeman
a thin piece of metal bent into a narrow U shape that you use to hold your hair in place
girls’ short socks that have the tops turned over
a large North American wild cat that has no tail
a small vehicle with two long thin metal blades instead of wheels, that is used for racing down a special ice track
Sense.TRAN: 雪橇〔一种供比赛用的小型车辆﹐用金属刀叶取代轮子﹐可在结冰的赛道上高速下滑〕

Sense.DEF: a sports event in which people race against each other in bobsleighs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sixteen teams took part in the 400 m bobsleigh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有16支队伍参加了400米雪橇比赛。

Sense.DEF: a bird from North America, often shot for sport
a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a clever bod.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个聪明的家伙。

Sense.DEF: someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got a lovely bod.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身材非常好。

Sense.DEF: a strange person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bit of an odd bod but very pleasant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有点古怪﹐但挺友善的。

Sense.DEF: excellent
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bodacious video
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很棒的录像

Sense.DEF: surprising or extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith's bodacious promise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯的大胆承诺

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
bide
to be a good or bad sign for the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opinion polls do not bode well for the Democrats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意调查的结果对于民主党不是个好兆头。

Sense.DEF: a mistake, or something that is not as good as it should be
Sense.TRAN: 差错﹐失误﹔不够好的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The builders have made a complete bodge of the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工人把厨房盖得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: the part of a woman’s dress above her waist

a tight-fitting woman’s
waistcoat
, worn over a
blouse
in former times
a piece of a woman’s underwear that covers the upper part of her body
related to the human body
Sense.EXAMPLE: bodily sensations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体的知觉

Sense.DEF: by moving the whole of your or someone else’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lifted the child bodily aboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把孩子整个抱起来放到车上。

Sense.DEF: by moving a large object in one piece
Sense.EXAMPLE: The column was transferred bodily to a new site by the bank of the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那根圆柱被整体迁到河堤边的一个新址。

Sense.DEF: a long thick needle without a point
the physical structure of a person or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: the human body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体
Sense.EXAMPLE: My fingers were numb and my whole body ached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我手指麻木﹐浑身疼痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your body temperature is higher in the daytime than at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人的体温白天高于夜晚。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: For their body size, these birds lay very small eggs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对于这些鸟的体形来说﹐它们下的蛋非常小。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
He needs to overcome a negative body image
what you think about your own body
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他需要克服对自己身体的负面印象。

Sense.DEF: the dead body of a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: A dog found the body of a girl in the woods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条狗在树林里发现了一具女孩的尸体。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who work together to do a particular job or who are together for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British Medical Association is the doctors’ professional body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国医学会是医生的专业团体。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were reports of a large body of armed men near the border.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有报道称边境附近有大批武装人员。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Kaplan served on the governing body of the museum
the group who control the museum
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡普兰在博物馆的主管部门供职。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The student body
all the students in a school or college
numbers 5,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生总数为5,000 人。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The research will be used by government departments and other public bodies
groups whose work is connected to the government
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究将用于政府部门以及其他公共机构。

GramExa.GLOSS: as a group, together
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The women moved towards the building in a body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这群妇女一起朝着大楼走去。

Subsense.DEF: a large amount or mass of something, especially something that has been collected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is now a considerable body of knowledge of the different stages of childhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在对儿童成长的不同阶段有了相当多的了解。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a growing body of evidence that charges are too high.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有越来越多的证据表明收费太高。

Subsense.DEF: the main, central, or most important part of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The arguments are explained in the body of the text.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些论点在正文里有解释。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Leave three blank lines between the date and the body of the letter.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信的日期和正文之间空三行。

Sense.DEF: a large area of water such as a lake
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city was built near a large body of water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市建在一大片水域的旁边。

Sense.DEF: the central part of a person or animal’s body, not including the head, arms, legs, or wings
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick had bruises on his face and body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克脸上和身上都有瘀伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bird has a small body and long wings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鸟身体小﹐翅膀长。

Sense.DEF: the main structure of a vehicle not including the engine, wheels etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers at the factory are making steel bodies for cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂里的工人正在打造钢铁车身。

Sense.DEF: an object that is separate from other objects
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Keep the caps on the bottles to prevent foreign bodies entering them
objects that should not be there
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓶子要盖好﹐以免异物进入。

Sense.DEF: if your hair has body, it is thick and healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: This shampoo will give more body to your hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种洗发剂会使你的头发更加浓密。

Sense.DEF:
if food or an alcoholic drink has body, it has a strong
flavour
taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small amount of tomato paste will give extra colour and body to the sauce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加少许番茄酱可以增加调味汁的色泽，并让它的味道格外浓郁。

Sense.DEF: used to describe how much taste an alcoholic drink has, with a full bodied drink having the strongest taste
Sense.TRAN: 酒味醇厚的/中度的/清淡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full bodied wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 醇厚的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: having a long, thick etc body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slim bodied orange-gold fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条体型小巧的金橙色的鱼

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist with only just enough food, money etc
Sense.TRAN: 勉强维持生活﹐挣钱糊口
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s working at the shop to keep body and soul together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这家商店里工作以维持生计。

Subsense.DEF: completely
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She threw herself body and soul into her work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她全心全意地投入工作。

Subsense.DEF: the whole of a person
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They think they own the employees, body and soul.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为雇员从头到脚都是他们的财产。

Sense.DEF:
the wide part of a musical instrument such as a
violin
or
guitar
, or of a sports
racket
bat
Sense.TRAN: 〔小提琴﹑吉他等乐器的〕琴体﹐器身﹔〔球拍的〕拍身
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guitar is 16 inches wide across the body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这把吉他的琴身宽16英寸。

Sense.DEF: a type of tight-fitting shirt worn by women that fastens between their legs
Sense.TRAN: 女式紧身衣﹐女式连身内衣

Sense.DEF: clothing worn by the police that protects them against bullets
a large bag in which a dead body is removed
a serious loss, disappointment, or defeat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopes of economic recovery were dealt a body blow by this latest announcement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新公布的消息对经济复苏的希望是个沉重打击。

Sense.DEF: a hard hit between your neck and waist during a fight
Sense.TRAN: 〔颈与腰之间的〕上半身受到的重击

Sense.DEF:
a short
surfboard
which you use lying on your front
an activity in which you do hard physical exercise in order to develop big muscles
the system in your body that controls types of behaviour that happen at regular times, such as sleeping or eating
the number of dead soldiers after a period of fighting, or the process of counting their bodies
Sense.TRAN: 〔战争中的〕死亡人数﹔死亡人数统计

Sense.DEF: someone whose body appears instead of an actor’s or actress’s in a film, especially in scenes where they are not wearing any clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指电影中出演裸露镜头的〕替身演员

Sense.DEF: a mental condition in which someone wrongly believes that part of their body is very ugly or not normal
Sense.TRAN: 躯体变形障碍﹐自觉躯体畸形症〔患者错误地认为自己的身体部位十分丑陋或畸形的一种精神障碍〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to protect an important person
Sense.TRAN: 〔重要人物的〕贴身卫士﹐保镖﹐警卫员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The senator arrived, surrounded by personal bodyguards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位参议员在私人保镖的簇拥下抵达。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who work together to protect an important person
changes in your body position and movements that show what you are feeling or thinking
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was obvious from Luke’s body language that he was nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从卢克的肢体语言明显看出他很紧张。

Sense.DEF: the relationship between your height and your weight, used as a measure of whether you have too much flesh on your body
Sense.TRAN: 身体质量指数，体重指数
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your body mass index is your weight in kilograms divided by the square of your height in meters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体质量指数是体重（千克）除以身高（米）的平方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Individuals with a BMI of 25 to 29.9 are considered overweight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体重指数为25至29.9的人被视为超重。

Sense.DEF: the natural smell of someone’s body, especially when this is unpleasant
making a hole in a part of the body in order to fix a ring or other piece of jewellery to the body
Sense.TRAN: 〔为佩戴饰物而作的〕人体穿刺

Sense.DEF: all the people in a nation forming a state under the control of a single government
Sense.TRAN: 政治实体﹔国家﹔〔被视为一个整体的〕民族

Sense.DEF:
a type of dancing to popular music, with movements that make you look like a
robot
Sense.TRAN: 机械舞﹐机器舞〔一种以流行音乐为伴奏﹑动作如机器人的舞蹈〕

Sense.DEF: a thorough search for drugs, weapons etc that might be hidden on someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone entering the building had a body search.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进入大楼的每一个人都接受了搜身。

Sense.DEF:
the shape of someone’s body, used especially when talking about exercise and
diet s
Sense.TRAN: 体形 〔尤用于谈论锻炼和减肥〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re not happy with your body shape, you should do more exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你对自己的体形不满意﹐就应该多锻炼。

Sense.DEF: a building where the main structure of a car is repaired
a chemical substance that you put onto your body to make it smell nice
Sense.TRAN: 香体液﹐体香剂﹐身体喷雾

Sense.DEF: a close-fitting piece of clothing that covers the whole of your body
Sense.TRAN: 连裤紧身衣﹐一件式紧身衣

Sense.DEF: a type of tight-fitting shirt worn by women that fastens between their legs
Sense.TRAN: 女式紧身衣﹐女式连身内衣

Sense.DEF:
a piece of warm clothing without arms that you wear over a
sweater
or a shirt, especially when you are outside
Sense.TRAN: 〔穿在毛衣或衬衣外面的〕保暖背心
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fleece body warmer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羊毛保暖背心

Sense.DEF: the metal frame of a vehicle, not including the engine, wheels etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bodywork’s beginning to rust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车车身开始生锈。

Sense.DEF: a white South African whose family is related to the Dutch people who settled in South Africa in the 1600s
Sense.TRAN: 布尔人〔南非白人﹐17世纪荷兰的后裔〕

Sense.DEF: a scientist
someone who is very clever
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was always a bit of a boffin, even at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向很聪明﹐甚至在上学的时候就是如此。
电脑奇才

Sense.DEF: an area of low wet muddy ground, sometimes containing bushes or grasses
a toilet
if a process or plan becomes bogged down, it is delayed so that no progress is made
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talks to settle the pay dispute have become bogged down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决工资纠纷的会谈陷入了僵局。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let yourself get bogged down in minor details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让细枝末节的问题拖住。

Sense.DEF: if something gets bogged down, it becomes stuck in soft ground and is unable to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car got bogged down in the mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车陷入了泥潭。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone rudely to go away
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just bog off!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚开！

Sense.DEF:
when you take one more shot than
par
the usual number of shots
to get the ball into the hole in
golf
Sense.TRAN: 柏忌〔在高尔夫球中比标准杆数多一杆入洞〕

Sense.DEF: a problem or difficult situation that makes you feel anxious

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bogey of recession
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济衰退的困境

Sense.DEF:
a piece of
mucus
from inside your nose
a bogeyman
an evil spirit, especially in children’s imagination or stories
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指孩子想象中的或故事中的〕鬼怪﹐怪物

Sense.DEF: someone who people think is evil or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manson was and remains America’s number one bogeyman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼森从过去到现在都是美国的头号坏蛋。

Sense.DEF: if your mind boggles when you think of something, it is difficult for you to imagine or accept it
Sense.TRAN: 使人无法想象﹔使人难以接受
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sheer amount of data makes the mind boggle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光是数据量就让人难以想象。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mind boggles at the amount of work still to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到还有那么多工作要做﹐我心里就发慌。

Sense.DEF: boggy ground is wet and muddy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boggy patch at the edge of the field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田野边缘一块泥泞的湿地

Sense.DEF:
a
bogey
Sense.TRAN: 柏忌〔在高尔夫球中比标准杆数多一杆入洞〕

Sense.DEF:
to use one more than
par
the usual number of strokes
to get the ball into the hole in
golf
an offer from a shop to sell you two things of the same type for the price of one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take advantage of special offers and BOGOFs in supermarkets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要利用超级市场特价和买一送一的机会去购物。

Sense.DEF: not special or interesting in any way
not true or real, although someone is trying to make you think it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: bogus insurance claims
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚报的保险索赔
Sense.EXAMPLE: bogus applications for asylum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚假的避难申请

Sense.DEF: living in a very informal or relaxed way and not accepting society’s rules of behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 不拘于传统的﹔放荡不羁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: bohemian cafés frequented by artists, musicians, and actors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家﹑音乐人和演员经常光顾的新潮咖啡馆

Sense.DEF: bohemian
Sense.TRAN: 不拘于传统的﹔放荡不羁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boho lifestyle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放荡不羁的生活方式

Sense.DEF: when a liquid boils, or when you boil it, it becomes hot enough to turn into gas

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The solution boiled at 57.4°C.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 溶液在57.4摄氏度时沸腾。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Put the spaghetti into plenty of boiling salted water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把意大利面放入大量煮沸的盐水中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were advised to boil the water before drinking it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人建议我们把这水烧开后再喝。

Sense.DEF: to cook something in boiling water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boiled egg
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个煮鸡蛋
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boil the rice for 15 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把米饭煮十五分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fried the chicken and put the vegetables on to boil .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把鸡肉炸了炸﹐再把蔬菜放进去煮。

Sense.DEF: if something containing liquid boils, the liquid inside it is boiling
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kettle’s boiling – shall I turn it off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水壶里的水开了——我把火关了好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The saucepan boiled dry on the stove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锅在炉子上烧干了。

Sense.DEF: to wash something, using boiling water
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always boil the cotton sheets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是用开水洗棉质床单。

Sense.DEF: if you are boiling with anger, you are extremely angry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lewis was boiling with rage and misery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯恼羞成怒。

Sense.DEF: if a liquid boils away, it disappears because it has been heated too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soup’s almost boiled away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤几乎要烧干了。

Sense.DEF: if a long statement, argument etc boils down to a single statement, that statement is the main point or cause
Sense.EXAMPLE: It boils down to a question of priorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 归根到底是事情轻重缓急的问题。

Sense.DEF: to make a list or piece of writing shorter by not including anything that is not necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can boil this down so that there are just two main categories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以把这个压缩到只有两大类。

Sense.DEF: if a food or liquid boils down, or if you boil it down, it becomes less after it is cooked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spinach tends to boil down a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菠菜一煮会缩掉许多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: glue made from boiling down old sheepskins
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用旧羊皮熬制的胶水
