Sense.DEF: if a liquid boils over when it is heated, it rises and flows over the side of the container
Sense.EXAMPLE: The milk was boiling over on the stove behind her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身后炉子上的牛奶潽出来了。

Sense.DEF: if a situation or an emotion boils over, the people involved stop being calm
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the bitterness of the last two years seemed to boil over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去两年里的所有苦痛似乎全都爆发了出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anger eventually boils over into words that are later regretted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 怒火最终会爆发出来﹐变成事后懊悔的话语。

Sense.DEF: if a situation or emotion boils up, bad feelings grow until they reach a dangerous level
Sense.TRAN: 〔局面或情绪〕发展到危险程度
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could sense that trouble was boiling up at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉到办公室里要出大乱子了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could feel the anger boiling up inside him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到怒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: to heat food or a liquid until it begins to boil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boil the fruit up with sugar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把水果加糖煮沸。

Sense.DEF: the act or state of boiling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add the seasoning and bring the sauce to the boil .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入调味料﹐把酱汁煮开。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She waited for the water to come to the boil
begin to boil
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她等待水烧开。

Sense.DEF: a painful infected swelling under someone’s skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy’s body is covered in boils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个男孩满身是疖子。

Sense.DEF: to become less good at something that you are usually very good at
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s gone off the boil after a tournament win in Dubai.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在迪拜的锦标赛中夺冠后就开始走下坡路了。

Sense.DEF:
a hard
sweet
that often tastes of fruit
a container for boiling water that is part of a steam engine, or is used to provide heating in a house
Sense.TRAN: 〔蒸汽机内或室内供暖的〕锅炉

Sense.DEF: a standard piece of writing or a design for something that can be easily used each time you need it, for example in business or legal documents
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boilerplate for a fax message
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传真件的标准化文本
Sense.EXAMPLE: lawyers selling boilerplate wills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兜售格式化遗嘱的律师

Sense.DEF: a room in a large building where the building’s boiler is

a room or office where people sell
share s
or services on the telephone, using unfair and sometimes dishonest methods
Sense.TRAN: 非法证券交易所﹔电话推销室〔通过电话用不法手段推销证券或服务的地方〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of loose clothing like trousers and a shirt joined together, that you wear over your clothes to protect them
very hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I open a window? It’s boiling in here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开扇窗好吗？这里热死人了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a boiling hot morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个奇热无比的早晨。

Sense.DEF: the temperature at which a liquid boils
a point where people can no longer deal calmly with a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relations between the two countries have almost reached boiling point .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间的紧张关系已趋白热化。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who is boisterous makes a lot of noise and has a lot of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a class of boisterous five-year-olds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一班活泼爱动的五岁孩子

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
pak choi
not afraid of taking risks and making difficult decisions
Sense.TRAN: 果敢的﹐敢于冒险的﹐大胆的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a surprisingly bold move , he is threatening court action against the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动﹐威胁要起诉这家公司。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My aunt Flo was a bold determined woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had the ability to take bold imaginative decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

Sense.DEF: so confident or determined that you sometimes offend people
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should be feeling confident and bold when you meet your bank manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会见银行经理的时候要大胆自信。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She marched into his office as bold as brass
very confident and not showing enough respect
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

Sense.DEF: very strong or bright so that you notice them
Sense.TRAN: 醒目的﹐显眼的﹐轮廓清晰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: bold geometric shapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晰的几何图形
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stripes are bold, bright, and fun to wear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条纹衫醒目明亮﹐穿起来很好玩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: bold colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜艳夺目的色彩

Sense.DEF: written or drawn in a very clear way
Sense.EXAMPLE: an envelope addressed to her in a bold black hand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用又粗又黑的字写给她的一个信封
Sense.EXAMPLE: The graphics are bold and colourful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图表很醒目﹐色彩很丰富。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The print should be bold and easy to read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 字应该印得粗大醒目﹐容易看清。

Sense.DEF: printed in letters that are darker and thicker than ordinary printed letters
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the headings are in bold type.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有标题都采用黑体字。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make/be so bold (as to do sth)
Sense.DEF: to do something that other people feel is rude or not acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 无礼地（做某事）﹔好意思（做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: I see you have been so bold as to ask for food at this hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看这个时候你还好意思来要东西吃。

Sense.LEXUNIT: if I may be so bold
Sense.DEF: used when asking someone a question, to show that you are slightly annoyed with them
Sense.TRAN: 恕我冒昧地问〔表示对某人略有不悦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell me, if I may be so bold as to ask, precisely what you are talking about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请恕我冒昧地问一句﹐你到底在说什么？

Sense.DEF: a way of printing letters that makes them thicker and darker than normal
the main part of a tree
a type of Spanish dance, or the music for this dance
Sense.TRAN: 〔西班牙〕波莱罗舞﹔波莱罗舞曲

Sense.DEF: a short jacket for a woman
the part of a cotton plant that contains the seeds

a short thick post in the street that is used to stop traffic entering an area or to show a
junction
more clearly
Sense.TRAN: 〔街上阻止汽车进入的〕安全柱﹐矮柱﹔〔路口的〕护柱

Sense.DEF: a thick stone or metal post used for tying ships to when they are in port
to tell someone angrily that you do not like what they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll bollock him for sticking his rubbish in my cupboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把乱七八糟的东西塞进我的柜子﹐我要好好骂他一顿。

Sense.DEF: when someone tells you that they are very angry with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I expect I’ll get a right bollocking from my boss when she finds out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我估计老板发现后我要挨她一顿臭骂。

Sense.DEF: used to say rudely that you think something is wrong or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your lyrics are complete bollocks; they don’t actually mean anything, do they?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的歌词完全是废话﹐什么意思都没有﹐不是吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just talking a load of old bollocks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她简直是一派胡言。

Sense.DEF: a word used to emphasize that you are annoyed or angry
Sense.TRAN: 太糟糕了〔用于强调厌烦或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, bollocks! We’ve missed it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真糟糕！ 我们没有赶上。

Sense.DEF: used when you refuse to accept or obey something
Sense.TRAN: 妄想〔表示不接受或不服从〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yeah? Well, bollocks to you too, mate!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是吗？ 哼﹐老兄﹐你也休想！

Sense.DEF:
the two round male organs that produce
sperm
an insect that eats and destroys cotton plants
the Indian film industry
Sense.TRAN: 宝莱坞〔指印度的电影业〕

Sense.DEF: a type of cooked meat often eaten in sandwiches
Sense.TRAN: 博洛尼亚香肠﹐大香肠〔通常夹在三明治里食用〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
baloney
a string worn around your neck that you fasten with a decoration
Sense.TRAN: 波洛领带〔用饰扣系住的一种细带〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who supported the
communist
party at the time of the Russian Revolution in 1917
Sense.TRAN: 1917布尔什维克〔在1917年俄国革命中支持共产党的人〕

Sense.DEF:
an insulting way of talking about a Communist or someone who has strong
left-wing
opinions
Sense.TRAN: 共产党人﹔极左翼分子〔侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF: tending to be angry or annoyed and not to obey people
Sense.TRAN: 易怒的﹔不服从的﹔爱争吵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to be so bolshie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要这样动不动就不高兴。

Sense.DEF: to help someone to feel better and more positive
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is making a bold attempt to bolster the territory’s confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在采取大胆行动以提振辖区信心。

Sense.DEF: to improve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: his efforts to bolster his career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为发展事业所付出的努力

Sense.DEF:
a long firm
pillow
, usually shaped like a tube
a metal bar that you slide across a door or window to fasten it
a screw with a flat head and no point, for fastening things together

Sense.LEXUNIT: a bolt from/out of the blue
Sense.DEF: news that is sudden and unexpected
Sense.TRAN: 突如其来的消息﹔晴天霹雳
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was this money a bolt from the blue or did you know you were going to get it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一笔意料之财呢﹐还是你本来就知道会有的？

Sense.DEF: lightning that appears as a white line in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s not much left of his house after it was struck by a bolt of lightning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的房子遭雷击之后差不多全毁了。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly try to escape from somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: They attacked the driver and he straightaway made a bolt for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们袭击司机﹐司机立刻没命地逃跑。

Sense.DEF:
a short heavy
arrow
that is fired from a
crossbow
a large long roll of cloth

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the nuts and bolts of sth

Sense.DEF: to suddenly run somewhere very quickly, especially in order to escape or because you are frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The horse reared up and bolted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马抬起前腿狂奔起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kevin had bolted through the open window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文从开着的窗子窜了出去。

Sense.DEF: to eat very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bolted down his breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他狼吞虎咽地吃早餐。

Sense.DEF: to fasten two things together using a bolt

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cell contained an iron bedframe bolted to the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牢房里有一张用螺栓固定在地板上的铁床架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boxes were made of heavy panels of metal bolted together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些箱子是用厚重的金属板钉起来的。

Sense.DEF: to lock a door or window by sliding a bolt across
to sit or stand with your back very straight, often because something has frightened you
Sense.TRAN: 〔常因受到惊吓〕挺直地坐着/站着
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat bolt upright in the back seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她直直地坐在后座上。

Sense.DEF: a place where you can escape to and hide
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bolthole in the country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡下的藏身处

Sense.DEF: something that is connected to the outside of a machine after it has been made, and is then part of the machine
a weapon made of material that will explode
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bomb went off at 9.30 in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹在早上9点半爆炸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enemy planes dropped over 200 bombs during the raid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击中敌机投下了两百多枚炸弹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was killed in a bomb explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一次炸弹爆炸中身亡。

Sense.DEF: a play, film, event etc that is not successful
Sense.TRAN: 失败的电影[戏剧]﹔失败的事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is just another one of Hollywood’s bland and boring bombs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不过是好莱坞的又一部枯燥乏味的烂片。

Sense.DEF: to be very good or exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: That new P Diddy CD is the bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “吹牛老爹”那张激光唱片非常轰动。

Sense.DEF:
used to describe
nuclear
weapons, and especially the
hydrogen bomb
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voices of dissent began to rise against the bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对核武器的声音开始响起来了。

Sense.DEF: to cost a lot of money
to get a lot of money by doing something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Forty people were injured when the bomb exploded.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹爆炸﹐造成40人受伤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a bomb explode
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The area was cleared and the police safely detonated the bomb.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方疏散了这一地区的人﹐将这枚炸弹安全引爆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from a plane
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Government forces began dropping bombs on rebel positions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府军开始向叛军据点投炸弹。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A bomb fell on the cathedral during the war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间有一枚炸弹落在大教堂上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: put a bomb somewhere

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country was developing a nuclear bomb.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国在研发核弹。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Oppenheimer was the father of the atomic bomb.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥本海默是原子弹之父。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that kills people but does not damage buildings much
that makes a car explode
sent in a letter or parcel
that is set to explode at a particular time
containing petrol
containing nails
that sends out smaller bombs when it explodes
that spreads radioactive material
that is guided to the right place
the person carrying the bomb dies when it explodes

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The restaurant was destroyed in a massive bomb blast.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐馆毁于一次威力巨大的炸弹爆炸。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: No one has yet claimed responsibility for the bomb attack.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尚未有人声称对此次炸弹袭击事件负责。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone leaves a message saying there is a bomb somewhere
when people think there might be a bomb somewhere

Sense.DEF: to attack a place by leaving a bomb there, or by dropping bombs on it from a plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town was heavily bombed in World War II.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城镇在第二次世界大战中遭到猛烈轰炸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Government aircraft have been bombing civilian areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府军飞机一直在轰炸平民区。

Sense.DEF: to move or drive very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly a police car came bombing down the high street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然一辆警车在大街上疾驶而过。

Sense.DEF: to fail a test very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bombed my midterm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我期中考试考砸了。

Sense.DEF: if a play, film, event etc bombs, it is not successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑电影等〕演砸﹔〔事情〕不成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: His latest play bombed on Broadway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新剧作在百老汇演砸了。

Sense.DEF: if a building or the people in it are bombed out, the building is completely destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: My family were bombed out in 1941.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1941年我家被炸毁。

Sense.DEF: to attack a place for a long time using large weapons, bombs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had been in action, bombarding the Normandy coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我参加过轰炸诺曼底海岸的行动。

Sense.DEF: to do something too often or too much, for example criticizing or questioning someone, or giving too much information
Sense.TRAN: 大肆批评﹔连珠炮似的质问﹔向…大量提供信息
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office was bombarded by telephone calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里电话响个不停。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They bombarded him with questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们连珠炮似的向他提问。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today we are bombarded with advice on what to eat and what to avoid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我们不断地听到什么该吃﹐什么不该吃这一类的忠告。

Sense.DEF: the person on a military aircraft who is responsible for dropping bombs
a low rank in the British army
a continuous attack on a place by big guns and bombs
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bombardment continued for a terrible nine hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸可怕地持续了九个小时。

GramExa.GLOSS: attack from the air, land, or sea

Sense.DEF: bombastic language contains long words that sound important but have no real meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is best known for three rather bombastic poems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以三首辞藻华丽空洞的诗歌最为知名。

Sense.DEF: the job of dealing with bombs that have not exploded, and making them safe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The device, which contained 400lbs of explosive, was made safe by army bomb disposal experts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个装有400磅炸药的装置已被军队的拆弹专家安全拆除。

Sense.DEF: very drunk or affected by illegal drugs
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel like going out and getting completely bombed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想出去喝个一醉方休。

Sense.DEF: a plane that carries and drops bombs
someone who hides a bomb somewhere in order to destroy something
a short jacket that fits tightly around your waist
Sense.TRAN: 紧身短上衣﹐紧腰短夹克

Sense.DEF: the use of bombs to attack a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The southwest of the country suffered an intensive bombing campaign .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国西南部地区遭受了密集的轰炸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were planning bombing raids in some of America’s major cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们计划在美国的一些大城市进行炸弹袭击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a terrorist network responsible for a wave of bombings in Paris
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在巴黎策划了一连串炸弹袭击事件的恐怖分子网络

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bombing of Hiroshima
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸广岛

Sense.DEF: when people have to be moved out of a building because there may be a bomb there
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bomb scare in Central London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦中心区一起炸弹恐吓事件

Sense.DEF: an unexpected and very shocking piece of news
Sense.TRAN: 意外消息﹔令人震惊的消息
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then came the bombshell: the factory was to close down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接着传来了令人震惊的消息: 工厂要关闭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally, she dropped the bombshell . She was pregnant, she said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐她宣布了一个令人震惊的消息﹐说她怀孕了。

Sense.DEF: a sexually attractive woman with light-coloured hair
a room or building that is built to protect people from bomb attacks
a place where a bomb has destroyed several buildings in a town
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve pulled down so many buildings around here it looks like a bomb site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把这儿的许多建筑物都推倒了﹐看起来就像一片被轰炸后的废墟。

Sense.DEF: real, true, and not intended to deceive anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only bona fide members are allowed to use the club pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有真正的会员才允许使用俱乐部的泳池。

Sense.DEF: if you check someone’s bona fides, you check that they are who they say they are, and that their intentions are good and honest
a lucky or successful situation where people can make a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 财运﹐获利之道﹐致富之源
Sense.EXAMPLE: 2008 was a bonanza year for the oil industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2008年是石油业兴旺发达的一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an amazing cash bonanza
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人惊喜的赚钱机会

Sense.DEF: said to someone before they start eating a meal, to tell them you hope they enjoy their food
Sense.TRAN: 祝你好胃口〔进餐前对某人的祝愿〕

Sense.DEF: your head

an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with
interest
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: furious trading on the bond market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 债券市场疯狂的交易

Sense.DEF: something that unites two or more people or groups, such as love, or a shared interest or idea
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个或更多人或团体之间的〕纽带﹐联系﹐契合﹐关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the emotional bond between mother and child
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the United States’ special bond with Britain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和英国之间的特殊关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: lifelong bonds of friendship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 终生的友谊纽带

Sense.DEF: something that limits your freedom and prevents you from doing what you want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bonds of fear and guilt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐惧和内疚的枷锁

Sense.DEF: the way in which two surfaces become attached to each other using glue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a glue gun to form a strong bond on wood or china.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用喷胶枪使木头或瓷器牢固地黏合起来。

Sense.DEF:
the chemical force that holds atoms together in a
molecule
Sense.EXAMPLE: In each methane molecule there are four CH bonds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个甲烷分子中有四个碳氢键。

Sense.DEF: a written agreement to do something, that makes you legally responsible for doing it
used to say that you will definitely do what you have promised
Sense.TRAN: 我的诺言就是契约﹐我言出必行

Sense.DEF:
in or out of a
bonded warehouse
Sense.TRAN: 〔进口货物〕存入关栈中以待完税/已完税出关

Sense.DEF: if two things bond with each other, they become firmly fixed together, especially after they have been joined with glue
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes less than ten minutes for the two surfaces to bond.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用不了十分钟两个表面就会黏合起来。

Sense.DEF: to develop a special relationship with someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某人〕培养一种特殊的关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Time must be given for the mother to bond with her baby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 母婴之间必须通过时间来培养亲情。

Sense.DEF: to keep goods in a bonded warehouse
Sense.TRAN: 把〔货物〕存入关栈[保税仓库]中

Sense.DEF: the state of having your freedom limited, or being prevented from doing what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bondage of early motherhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚刚做母亲时所受的束缚

Sense.DEF: the state of being a slave

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Since the age of 13, he had been in bondage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他13岁起沦为奴隶。

Sense.DEF: the practice of being tied up for sexual pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 〔以被捆绑寻求性快感的〕性受虐癖

Sense.DEF: an official place for storing goods that have been brought into a country before tax has been paid on them

someone who owns government or industrial
bond s
a process in which a special relationship develops between two or more people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bonding between mare and foal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 母马和小马驹之间亲情的形成

Sense.DEF: the activity of doing things with other people of the same sex, so that you feel good about being a man or a woman
Sense.TRAN: 男人之间/女人之间的感情联络
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re in the bar again, doing some male bonding!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又在酒吧里联络感情了！

Sense.DEF: the connection of atoms or of two surfaces that are glued together
Sense.TRAN: 〔原子的〕键合﹔〔两个表面的〕黏合
Sense.EXAMPLE: chemical bonding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学键合

Sense.DEF: one of the hard parts that together form the frame of a human, animal, or fish body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The X-ray showed that the bone was broken in two places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: X光检查显示有两处骨折。

GramExa.GLOSS: the bone in your hip etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He broke his collar bone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他锁骨骨折。

GramExa.GLOSS: with big etc bones
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 骨架大的/纤细的/小的等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was tall and big-boned.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她个子高﹐骨架子很大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Amelia had inherited her mother’s good bone structure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿梅莉亚遗传了母亲的优美骨架。

Sense.DEF: a substance made of bones
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bone handle of his dagger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他短剑上的骨质手柄

Sense.DEF: the simplest and most important details of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t tell you more than the bare bones of what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能把发生的事情说个大概给你听。

Sense.DEF: to not feel nervous or ashamed about doing or saying something
Sense.TRAN: 对（做）某事毫无顾忌﹐对（做）某事毫不犹豫
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary made no bones about enjoying a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽大大方方地喝了一杯。

Sense.DEF: something that causes arguments between people
Sense.TRAN: 争执的原因﹐争议的焦点
Sense.EXAMPLE: The examination system has long been a serious bone of contention in this country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试制度长期以来都是这个国家争议很大的话题。

Sense.DEF: to be extremely cold
very thin
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was all skin and bone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她瘦得皮包骨。

Sense.DEF: someone who is much too thin
Sense.TRAN: 骨瘦如柴的人﹐骨头架子

Sense.DEF: to be certain that something is true, even though you have no proof and cannot explain why you are certain
Sense.TRAN: 从内心里感受到某事﹐凭直觉确信某事为真﹐预感到会有某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew that something good was sure to happen; she could feel it in her bones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得肯定有好事要发生了﹐她有这样的预感。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a bone to pick with sb
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are annoyed with them and want to talk about it
Sense.TRAN: 对某人不满﹐对某人有怨言

Sense.DEF: a remark, statement etc that is close to the bone is close to the truth in a way that may offend someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: His jokes were a bit close to the bone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的玩笑有点露骨。

Sense.DEF: to reduce costs, services etc as much as possible
Sense.TRAN: 把〔成本、服务等〕削减到最低程度
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shops cut prices to the bone in the January sales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1月份大减价的时候﹐各个商店都把价格降到了最低。

Sense.DEF: meat that is served on the bone is still joined to the bone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boiled ham on the bone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮熟的带骨火腿

Sense.DEF: meat that is served off the bone has been cut away from the bone
Sense.EXAMPLE: roasted duck, off the bone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去骨烤鸭

Crossrefto.REFLEX: work your fingers to the bone

Sense.DEF: to remove the bones from fish or meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: boned breast and thigh meat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去骨的胸脯肉和大腿肉

Sense.DEF: to learn as much as you can about a subject, because you need the knowledge, for example for an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to bone up on criminal law for a test next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得苦读刑法准备下个星期的考试。

Sense.DEF: delicate and expensive cups, plates etc that are made partly with crushed bone
completely dry
Sense.EXAMPLE: There had been no rain for months and the land was bone dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个月没下雨﹐地都干透了。

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
extremely lazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s just bone idle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真是懒透了。

Sense.DEF: boneless meat or fish has had the bones taken out
the soft substance in the hollow centre of bones
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bone marrow transplant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骨髓移植

Sense.DEF: a substance used to feed plants that is made of crushed bones

an
erection
a large outdoor fire, either for burning waste or for a party

November 5th, when people in Britain light
firework s
and burn a
guy
model of a man
on a large outdoor fire
Sense.TRAN: 篝火之夜﹐营火之夜﹐盖依·福克斯之夜〔11月5日﹐英国人在当晚会燃放烟火并焚烧盖依·福克斯的模拟像〕

Sense.DEF: a deep sound made by a large bell

an object used for smoking
cannabis
, in which the smoke goes through water to make it cool
a pair of small drums that you play with your hands
Sense.TRAN: 邦戈鼓﹐小手鼓﹐拉丁小鼓

Sense.DEF: a friendly feeling among a group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were relaxed and full of bonhomie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们轻松自在﹐相当友好。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone – used humorously
to hit someone lightly on the head or to hit your head on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fell, bonking his head against a tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摔倒了﹐头撞到一棵树上。

Sense.DEF: the action of having sex – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quick bonk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速交合

Sense.DEF: the action of hitting someone lightly on the head, or hitting your head against something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人头部的〕轻击﹔〔头部受到的〕撞击

Sense.DEF: a sudden short deep sound, for example when something hits the ground
slightly crazy
to make someone feel crazy or very annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thinking about the whole problem has driven me nearly bonkers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想着这整个问题﹐我都快发疯了。

Sense.DEF: a clever remark
the metal lid over the front of a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll need to check under the bonnet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要把引擎盖打开看看。

Subsense.DEF: a warm hat that a baby wears which ties under its chin

a type of hat that women wore in the past which tied under their chin and often had a wide
brim
Subsense.TRAN: 包头软帽〔旧时女人所戴﹐在颏下系带﹑帽前有宽边〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a bee in your bonnet (about sth)

Sense.DEF: when a man and woman work together as criminals, newspapers sometimes refer to them as being like ‘Bonnie and Clyde’. These names come from two young criminals, Bonnie Parker (a woman) and Clyde Barrow (a man), who stole from US banks and businesses in the 1930s. A popular film was made about them in 1967.
Sense.TRAN: 邦妮和克莱德﹐雌雄大盗〔20世纪30年代美国的两名罪犯﹐现在报纸有时会用这两个名字形容合谋犯罪的一对男女〕

Sense.DEF: pretty and healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bonny baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康漂亮的婴儿

Sense.DEF: a tree that is grown so that it always stays very small, or the art of growing trees in this way
money added to someone’s wages, especially as a reward for good work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long-term savers qualify for a cash bonus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期储户可获现金红利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Further additions to your pay may take the form of bonus payments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资以外的钱可能以奖金的形式发放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Christmas bonus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节奖金
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each worker receives an annual bonus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个员工都可获得一笔年度奖金。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £20,000 bonus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔2万英镑的奖金

Sense.DEF: something good that you did not expect in a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain’s possession of North Sea oil has proved a bonus for British technology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国拥有北海油田是上天对英国科技的一个恩赐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He promised to take me to the match, with the added bonus of an afternoon off school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他答应带我去看比赛﹐还可以请假一个下午不用上学。

Sense.DEF:
a reduction in the cost of your car insurance when you do not make a
claim
in a particular year
Sense.TRAN: 无索赔赠金〔因一年没有索赔而可以享受的汽车保险费减免〕

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys good food and wine, and being with people
Sense.TRAN: 讲究饮食和生活的人﹐享乐主义者

Sense.DEF: used to wish someone a good journey
someone or part of their body that is bony is very thin
Sense.TRAN: 骨瘦如柴的﹐瘦得皮包骨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a bony intelligent face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸很瘦，看来很聪明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was tall and bony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很高﹐而且瘦骨嶙峋。

Sense.DEF: bony meat or fish contains a lot of small bones
a part of an animal that is bony consists mostly of bone

Sense.DEF: to shout ‘boo’ to show that you do not like a person, performance, idea etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the audience started booing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些观众开始喝倒彩。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She was booed off stage
they shouted ‘boo’ until she left the stage
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被一片嘘声轰下了台。

Sense.DEF: a noise made by people who do not like a person, performance, idea etc
a word you shout suddenly to someone as a joke in order to frighten them
Sense.TRAN: 啵〔惊吓别人时发出的声音〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: wouldn’t say boo to a goose
Sense.DEF: an expression used to describe a shy quiet person
a woman’s breast
a silly mistake
a stupid or silly person
to make a stupid mistake

Sense.DEF: a silly mistake

Sense.DEF: a piece of women’s clothing made of material that stretches, that covers her chest
the television
a silly or stupid person
a mental hospital
a prize given as a joke to the person who is last in a competition

Sense.DEF: a hidden bomb that explodes when you touch something else that is connected to it

Sense.EXAMPLE: He lost both legs in a booby trap bomb blast.

Sense.DEF:
a
harmless
trap that you arrange for someone as a joke
Sense.TRAN: 〔开玩笑的〕陷阱﹐机关﹐恶作剧的把戏

Sense.DEF:

rhythm and blues

Sense.DEF: a dance that young people did to this music, which involves moving your feet in a regular pattern of usually 12 steps

a thick piece of
mucus
from your nose

a
bogeyman
to dance, especially to fast popular music

Sense.DEF:
a type of music played on the piano with a strong fast
rhythm

Sense.EXAMPLE: boogie rock at its finest

Sense.DEF: a dance, or an occasion when you dance, especially to fast popular music

a
bodyboard
used in stories to show that someone is crying
Sense.TRAN: 呜呜〔用于故事中表示哭泣〕

Sense.DEF: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚开始看格雷厄姆·格林写的一本书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cookery book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烹饪书

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a book about cats
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于猫的一本书

Sense.DEF: a set of sheets of paper held together in a cover so that you can write on them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a black address book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本黑色通讯录
Sense.EXAMPLE: a notebook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笔记本

Sense.DEF: a set of things such as stamps, matches, or tickets, held together inside a paper cover
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheque book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支票簿

Subsense.DEF: written records of the financial accounts of a business
Subsense.EXAMPLE: An accountant will examine the company’s books.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名会计师将给公司查账。
Subsense.EXAMPLE:
a small firm that is having problems balancing the books
keeping its profits and spending equal
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能保持收支平衡的一家小公司

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have £50 billion worth of orders on the books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们账上有价值500亿英镑的订单。

Subsense.DEF: the names of people who use a company’s services, or who are sent by a company to work for other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an agent with a lot of popular actors on his books
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手上有许多当红演员的经纪人

Sense.DEF: exactly according to rules or instructions
Sense.EXAMPLE: She feels she has to go by the book and can’t use her creativity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得她只能照章办事﹐发挥不了自己的创造力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police were careful to do everything by the book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方很小心﹐一切都照章办事。

Sense.DEF: a subject that you do not understand or know anything about
Sense.TRAN: 不理解的事﹐一无所知的事﹔谜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chemistry is a closed book to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对化学一窍不通。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is pleased or annoyed with you
if a law is on the books, it is part of the set of laws in a country, town, area etc
one of the parts that a very large book such as the Bible is divided into

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Book of Isaiah
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《以赛亚书》

Sense.DEF: said when giving your opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my book, nothing is more important than football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐没有什么比足球更重要。

Sense.DEF: to punish someone for breaking laws or rules, especially when you have been trying to punish them for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 将某人绳之以法﹐将某人依法治罪
Sense.EXAMPLE: War criminals must be brought to book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战犯必须绳之以法。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: take a leaf out of sb’s book
can read sb like a book

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What book are you reading at the moment?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这阵子在看什么书？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look at the pages quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I looked through the book until I found the right section.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我翻了翻这本书﹐找到了所需的章节。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s written several interesting travel books.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写了几本很有趣的游记。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book is published by Penguin.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书由企鹅出版社出版。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it is published for the first time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone was waiting for the new Harry Potter book to come out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都在等待新一部的《哈利·波特》出版。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from a library
to a library
arrange to continue borrowing it from a library

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I got it from that little book shop in the village.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是从村里那家小书店买到的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a person, shop, or company selling books
Collocate.EXAMPLE: High street book sellers are experiencing a drop in sales.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业区大街的书店销量在下滑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a ticket that you can use to pay for a book
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She always bought me book tokens for my birthday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是买书券送给我作生日礼物。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an article giving critical opinions of a book

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His picture is on the cover of the book.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的照片印在书的封面上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The first chapter of the book is about his childhood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书第一章讲述他的童年生活。

Exponent.DEF: a book about imaginary people and events

Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片是根据尼克·霍恩比的畅销小说改编的。

Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史小说

Exponent.DEF: books that describe imaginary people and events

Exponent.DEF: novels and plays that are considered to be important works of art
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m studying American literature at university.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在大学里攻读美国文学。

Exponent.DEF: books that describe real people and events
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Men tend to prefer non-fiction.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人往往喜欢读写实作品。

Exponent.DEF: books about imaginary events in the future or space travel
a book such as a dictionary or encyclopedia, which you look at to find information
a book about a particular subject that you use in a classroom
a book that you have to study as part of your course
a book telling visitors about a city or country
a book that has a hard stiff cover
a book that has a paper cover
a book about a real person’s life, written by another person
a book that someone has written about their own life
a book that tells you how to cook different meals

Sense.DEF: to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you booked a holiday this year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今年有没有预订去度假？
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The flight was already fully booked
no more seats were available
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个航班已经订满了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To get tickets, you have to book in advance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须提前订购才能买到票。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The show’s booked solid
all the tickets have been sold
until February.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个演出2月份之前的票已全部售罄。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for someone such as a singer to perform on a particular date

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队约好在洛杉矶举行一场义演。

Subsense.DEF: if a hotel, restaurant etc is booked up, there are no more rooms, places, seats etc still available
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The courses quickly get booked up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些课程很快便满额了。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is booked up, they are extremely busy and have arranged a lot of things they must do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m all booked up this week – can we get together next Friday?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这个星期都排满了，我们下个星期五再聚好吗？

Sense.DEF: to arrange for someone to go to a hotel, fly on a plane etc
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人〕预订〔酒店﹑航班等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve booked you a flight on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你订了星期六的航班。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll book you in at the Hilton.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会给你在希尔顿酒店预订房间。

Sense.DEF: to put someone’s name officially in police records, along with the charge made against them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith was booked on suspicion of attempted murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯涉嫌企图谋杀被立案。

Sense.DEF:
when a
referee
in a sports game books a player who has broken the rules, he or she officially writes down the player’s name in a book as a punishment

Sense.TRAN: 〔到达旅馆后〕办理入住登记手续
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several tourists were booking in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几名游客正在办理入住手续。

Sense.DEF: tickets for a concert, performance etc that are bookable can be ordered before it happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐会﹑演出等的门票〕可预订的

Sense.DEF:
an offence for which a sports player can be punished by having his or her name written into the
referee 's
book
the process of fastening the pages of books inside a cover
a piece of furniture with shelves to hold books
a club that offers books cheaply to its members
Sense.TRAN: 〔廉价卖书给会员的〕读书俱乐部﹐书友会

Sense.DEF: a group of people who meet regularly to discuss a particular book they have all read
Sense.TRAN: 〔会员定期会面讨论所阅读书籍的〕读书会﹐读书小组

Sense.DEF: the practice of leaving books in public places or on buses, trains etc, so that other people will read them and then leave them for others to read. There is a website where people can record details of the books and the places where they found or left them.
Sense.TRAN: 图书漂流〔指将图书放在公共汽车﹑火车等公共场所让他人阅读的做法。 有相关网站供读者记录图书信息﹑得书地点和放漂地点〕

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of objects that you put at the end of a row of books to prevent them from falling over

Sense.TRAN: 〔成员定期会面讨论约定阅读的书籍的〕读书会﹐读书小组

Sense.DEF:
a
bookmaker
an arrangement to travel by train, use a hotel room etc at a particular time in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: bookings on cruise ships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预订游船船位
Sense.EXAMPLE: I made a booking for two double rooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我预订了两个双人房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I’m calling to confirm my booking
say definitely that I want to travel etc
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打电话是想确认一下我的预订。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you cancel your booking , there will be a small charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你取消预订﹐就要付一小额费用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Places on the course are limited and advance booking is essential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程名额有限﹐必须预订。

GramExa.GLOSS: a booking for a large number of dates, seats, rooms etc

Sense.DEF: an arrangement made by a performer to perform at a particular time in the future
the act of writing a football player’s name in a book as a punishment for breaking the rules
a place where you can buy train or bus tickets
Sense.TRAN: 〔火车或公共汽车的〕售票处﹐订票处

Sense.DEF: someone who is bookish is more interested in reading and studying than in sports or other activities
Sense.TRAN: 嗜书的﹐好读书的﹐书呆子气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shy bookish man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个腼腆的书呆子

Sense.DEF: the job or activity of recording the financial accounts of an organization
a very short book that usually contains information on one particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: a free booklet on drug abuse

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to collect money that people want to risk on the result of a race, competition etc, and who pays them if they guess correctly

Sense.DEF: to save the address of a page on the Internet so that you can find it again easily
a vehicle that contains a library and travels to different places so that people can use it
a decorated piece of paper with your name on it, that you stick in the front of your books
Sense.TRAN: 〔贴在书上的〕藏书者标签﹐藏书票

Sense.DEF: a metal or wooden frame that holds a book upright so that you can read it without holding it in your hands
Sense.TRAN: 阅读架﹐看书架〔供放置摊开的书用〕

Sense.DEF: a person or company that sells books
a shelf that you keep books on, or a piece of furniture used for holding books
a shop that sells books
a small shop that has an open front and sells books and magazines, often at a railway station
a shop that sells books
a card that you can exchange for books
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave me a book token for Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节她送了我一张购书券。

Sense.DEF: how much a car of a particular age, style etc should be worth if you sold it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个车龄﹑款式等的汽车的〕账面价值

Subsense.DEF:
the value of a business after you sell all of its
asset s
and pay all of its debts
the value of something that a company owns, which it lists in its accounts

Sense.DEF: someone who likes reading very much
Sense.TRAN: 极爱读书的人﹐书虫﹐书呆子

Sense.DEF: an insect that eats books

a Boolean system is based on things that can be either true or false, but not both. It links statements with words called
operator s
, such as AND, OR, and NOT. Boolean systems are used to write computer programs, especially Internet search programs
Sense.TRAN: 〔逻辑体系〕布尔的〔用于编写电脑程序﹐尤其是网络搜索程序〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The program searches for information using Boolean logic .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一程序运用布尔逻辑搜索信息。

Sense.DEF: a quick increase of business activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boom has created job opportunities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济繁荣创造了就业的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sudden boom in the housing market
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房产市场的突然兴旺

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the post-war property boom
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后房地产业的蓬勃发展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In boom times, airlines do well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经济繁荣时期﹐航空公司生意很好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the economic boom of the 1950s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪50年代的经济繁荣
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The economy went from boom to bust
from increasing to decreasing
very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济很快就从繁荣走向了萧条。

Sense.DEF: an increase in how popular or successful something is, or in how often it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: the disco boom of the 1970s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪70年代的迪斯科热

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the boom in youth soccer in the U.S.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的青年足球热

Sense.DEF: a deep loud sound that you can hear for several seconds after it begins, especially the sound of an explosion or a large gun
a long pole on a boat that is attached to the bottom of a sail, and that you move to change the position of the sail

Subsense.DEF: a long pole used as part of a piece of equipment that loads and unloads things

a long pole that has a camera or
microphone
on the end
Subsense.TRAN: 〔一端安装有摄影机或麦克风的〕活动支架﹐吊杆

Sense.DEF:
something that is stretched across a river or a
bay
to prevent things floating down or across it
Sense.TRAN: 〔横拦于河面或港湾以阻止物件漂走的〕挡栅﹐水栅

Sense.DEF: if business, trade, or a particular area is booming, it is increasing and being very successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔商业﹑贸易或某一地区〕繁荣﹐迅速发展
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business was booming , and money wasn’t a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意非常兴隆﹐钱已不是问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tourism on the island has boomed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上的旅游业迅速发展。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a loud deep voice
Sense.TRAN: 用洪亮而低沉的声音说
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Ladies and gentlemen,’ his voice boomed out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “女士们﹐先生们。”他的声音低沉而有力。

Sense.DEF: to make a loud deep sound
Sense.TRAN: 发出低沉的声音﹐隆隆作响
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guns boomed in the distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处大炮隆隆作响。

Sense.DEF:
a
ghetto blaster
a curved stick that flies in a circle and comes back to you when you throw it, first used in Australia
Sense.TRAN: 飞去来器﹐回飞棒﹐回力镖 〔最早在澳大利亚使用〕

Sense.DEF: if a plan or action boomerangs on someone, it affects them badly instead of affecting the person who it was intended to affect
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划或行动〕起反作用﹐害人反害己﹐自食其果

Sense.DEF: young people who come back to live with their parents after finishing university
Sense.TRAN: 回巢族〔指大学毕业后回家和父母同住的年轻人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boomerang generation are saving thousands in rent by living at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回巢族住在父母家里﹐从而节省了不少房租。

Sense.DEF: a town or city that suddenly becomes very successful because there is a lot of new industry
something that is very useful and makes your life a lot easier or better
Sense.TRAN: 裨益﹔为生活带来方便的东西﹔有用之物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus service is a real boon to people in the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车服务对村里的人来说是一大便利之处。

Sense.DEF: a very close friend
a place that is a long way from the nearest town
an officially organized plan or activity that is very complicated and wastes a lot of time, money, and effort
Sense.TRAN: 庞大而浪费的计划[活动]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bureaucratic boondoggle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官僚排场

Sense.DEF: the boondocks
a man who behaves in a very rude way
to increase or improve something and make it more successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The win boosted the team’s confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一场胜利增加了球队的信心。

Sense.DEF: to help someone reach a higher place by lifting or pushing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He boosted her up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他托了她一把。

Sense.DEF:
if a
rocket
or motor boosts a
spacecraft
, it makes it go up into space or go in a particular direction
to steal something
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a major boost to the economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对经济的大力推动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a multimillion-pound boost for the British film industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 推动英国电影业发展的数百万英镑的资金

Sense.EXAMPLE: Add a little more vanilla, to give the flavor a boost .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再加一点香草提提味。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The community will get a boost from a new library and recreation center.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 兴建新的图书馆和娱乐中心将会推动该社区的发展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The poll provided a morale boost for the Conservatives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次民意测验鼓舞了保守党的士气。

Sense.DEF: to lift someone so that they can reach a higher place
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I give you a boost, could you reach the window?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我托你一把﹐你可以够到窗户吗？

Sense.DEF:
an increase in the amount of power available to a
rocket
, piece of electrical equipment etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔火箭﹑电器等的〕动力增强﹐助推

Sense.DEF: a small quantity of a drug that increases the effect of one that was given before, so that someone continues to be protected against a disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: a booster shot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加强针

Sense.DEF: something that helps someone or something to increase or improve, or to be more successful or confident
Sense.TRAN: 起推动作用的事物﹐令人鼓舞的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: a booster pump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增压泵
Sense.EXAMPLE: a profit booster for the company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对公司利润的刺激

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mail from home is a big morale booster for faraway troops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家书可以大大提振远方军队的士气。

Sense.DEF:
a rocket that is used to provide extra power for a
spacecraft
to leave the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a giant booster rocket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个巨大的助推火箭

Sense.DEF: someone who gives a lot of support to a person, organization, or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dance organized by the school’s booster club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由学校球迷俱乐部举办的一场舞会

Sense.DEF: a special seat for a small child that lets them sit in a higher position in a car or at a table
Sense.TRAN: 〔放在汽车内或餐桌旁供幼儿使用的〕加高坐椅﹐加高坐垫

Sense.DEF: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg
Sense.EXAMPLE: hiking boots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远足靴
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of boots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双靴子

Sense.DEF: an enclosed space at the back of a car, used for carrying bags etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new model has a bigger boot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新型号的行李箱更大。

Sense.DEF: when someone is forced to leave their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman denied that he had been given the boot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席否认他是被炒鱿鱼的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should have got the boot years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早就该被炒掉了。

Sense.DEF: in addition to everything else you have mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a great sportswoman, and beautiful to boot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一名伟大的运动员﹐同时也是个大美人。

Subsense.DEF: to criticize or be cruel to someone who is already in a bad situation
Subsense.TRAN: 〔对本已倒霉的人〕再踩上一脚﹐落井下石

Subsense.DEF: to attack someone by kicking them repeatedly, especially when they are on the ground

Sense.LEXUNIT: the boot is on the other foot
Sense.DEF: used to say someone who has caused problems for other people in the past is now in a situation in which people are causing problems for them
a metal object that the police attach to one of the wheels of an illegally parked car so that it cannot be moved
Sense.TRAN: 车轮夹锁〔用于锁住违规停放的车辆〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be/get too big for your boots

Sense.DEF: to start the program that makes a computer ready to be used
to kick someone or something hard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper booted the ball upfield.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员一脚把球踢向前场。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from moving their illegally parked vehicle by fixing a piece of equipment to one of the wheels
Sense.TRAN: 给〔违规停放的车辆〕加上夹锁

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave a place, job, or organization, especially because they have done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: His fellow students booted him out of the class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的同学把他赶出了班级。

Sense.DEF: a training camp for people who have just joined the US army, navy, or Marine Corps
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国陆军﹑海军或海军陆战队的〕新兵训练营

Sense.DEF:
bootcut
jean s
and trousers become slightly wider at the end of each leg
a short thick sock that a baby wears instead of a shoe
Sense.TRAN: 〔婴儿当鞋穿的〕毛绒袜﹐毛绒鞋

Sense.DEF: a small partly enclosed place where one person can do something privately, such as use the telephone or vote
Sense.TRAN: 〔供一人打电话﹑投票等的隔开的〕小间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voting booth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票间

Sense.DEF:
a small partly enclosed structure where you can buy things, play games, or get information, usually at a market or a

Sense.EXAMPLE: a crafts booth

Sense.DEF: a partly enclosed place in a restaurant, with a table between two long seats

an attractive woman who works in a company’s booth at a
trade fair
an event when many companies show their goods or services in one place
in order to encourage people to visit the booth
Sense.TRAN: 〔展销会上的〕摊位女郎﹐促销小姐

Sense.DEF: a long piece of string that you use to fasten a boot

bootleg alcohol, software, or
recording s
are made and sold illegally

Sense.EXAMPLE: bootleg tapes

Sense.DEF:
bootleg
jean s
, trousers etc become wider at the end of each leg
