Sense.DEF: an illegal recording of a music performance

to illegally make or sell alcohol, or to illegally make or sell copies of software or
recording s
Sense.TRAN: 非法酿造[出售]〔酒〕；非法制作[销售]〔软件或影音制品〕

Sense.DEF:
a
car boot sale

Sense.LEXUNIT: pull/haul yourself up by your bootstraps
Sense.DEF: to improve your position and get out of a difficult situation by your own efforts, without help from other people
Sense.TRAN: 自力更生〔改善境遇、摆脱困境〕

Sense.DEF: valuable things that a group of people, especially an army that has just won a victory, take away from somewhere
extremely nice, enjoyable, or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 非常美好的﹔非常漂亮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: bootylicious babes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的小妞

Sense.DEF: alcoholic drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bottle of booze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶酒

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
He’s been on the booze
drinking too much alcohol
for five days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开杯痛饮了五天。

GramExa.EXAMPLE:
My husband is now off the booze
no longer drinking too much alcohol
and he is a different person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我丈夫现在戒了酒﹐像换了个人似的。

Sense.DEF:
an occasion when a group of people travel together on a
ferry
from England to France in order to buy a lot of wine, beer, or
spirit s
cheaply
Sense.TRAN: 购酒游〔指一批人结伴从英国乘渡船到法国购买许多便宜的葡萄酒﹑啤酒或烈酒〕

Sense.DEF:
a
pub
someone who often drinks a lot of alcohol
a party where people drink a lot of alcohol
when someone drinks alcohol, especially a lot of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve been out boozing, haven’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你又在外面喝酒来着﹐是吗？

Sense.DEF: showing that someone has drunk too much alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 喝醉酒的﹐喝了许多酒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: boozy laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满醉意的笑

Sense.DEF: to hit someone, especially gently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom bopped him on the nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆轻轻拍拍他的鼻子。

Sense.DEF: to dance to popular music
Sense.EXAMPLE: kids happily bopping on the dance floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在舞池里开心地跳着舞的年轻人

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere or to several different places, especially to enjoy yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent the afternoon just bopping around town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午我们就在镇上随便逛了逛。

Sense.DEF:
another word for
bebop
a gentle hit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bop on the head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头上的一记轻拍

Sense.DEF: a dance

another word for
teenybopper
a mineral used for cleaning
a house where men can pay to have sex
the official line that separates two countries, states, or areas, or the area close to this line
Sense.EXAMPLE: To cross the border, you will need a valid passport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过边境需要持有效护照。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the border between the US and Mexico
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和墨西哥之间的边界

GramExa.EXAMPLE: regular patrols along the border with France
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿与法国交界的边境地区的定期巡逻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a market town on the border of England and Wales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰和威尔士边界上的一个集镇

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He helped them to get across the border.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他帮助他们越过边境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coach took us south of the border to Tia Juana.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长途客车把我们带到了边境以南的蒂亚胡瓦娜。

Sense.DEF: a band along or around the edge of something such as a picture or piece of material
Sense.EXAMPLE: writing paper with a black border
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饰有黑边的信纸

Sense.DEF: an area of soil where you plant flowers or bushes, along the edge of an area of grass
Sense.TRAN: 〔草坪边缘的〕狭长花坛，灌木带
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flower and shrub border
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草坪边缘的鲜花灌木带

Sense.DEF: something that separates one situation, state etc from another
Sense.TRAN: 〔区分两种情形﹑状态等的〕界线
Sense.EXAMPLE: new scientific discoveries that are stretching the borders of knowledge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拓展知识疆界的科学新发现

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The army crossed the border and advanced on Warsaw.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队越过边境﹐向华沙进发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Over 100,000 civilians fled across the border.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 逾10万平民逃过边境。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The river forms the border between the two countries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河成为两国的分界线。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: prevent people from crossing
start allowing people to cross

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had reached the Swiss border.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已抵达瑞士边境。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They renewed their attacks on Ethiopia’s northern border.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们再次对埃塞俄比亚北部边境发起进攻。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that countries share
a disagreement about where the border should be
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a long-running border dispute between Iraq and Iran
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊拉克与伊朗之间由来已久的边境纠纷

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a place where you cross a border
controls on who crosses a border

Collocate.COLLOC: this/the other side of the border
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her friend lives on the other side of the border.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的朋友居住在边境的另一边。

Exponent.DEF: the official line that separates two countries, or the area close to this line
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The town lies on the border between Chile and Argentina.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小镇坐落在智利与阿根廷的边界上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Strasbourg is very close to the German border.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉斯堡距离德国边境很近。

Exponent.DEF: the border
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They crossed the Libyan frontier into Egypt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们穿过利比亚边境进入埃及。

Exponent.DEF: the official line that separates states and counties in the US
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His family lived across the state line in West Virginia.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家人住在州界的那一边的西弗吉尼亚。

Exponent.DEF: the line that marks the edge of an area of land that someone owns, or one of the parts of a country
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fence marks the boundary between the two properties.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这道篱笆是两座地产的界线。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Mississippi River forms the boundary between Tennessee and Arkansas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 密西西比河是田纳西州与阿肯色州的分界线。

Sense.DEF: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: countries that border the Mediterranean
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地中海沿岸的国家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The area borders on the Yorkshire Dales.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区与约克郡河谷相邻。

Sense.DEF: to form a border along the edge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a path bordered by a high brick wall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与一道高高砖墙相邻的小路

Sense.DEF: to be very close to being something extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: His confidence bordered on arrogance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的自信近乎自负。

Sense.DEF: the land near the border between two countries
the borderland between two qualities is an unclear area that contains features of both of them
Sense.TRAN: 介于两种特质之间的状态﹔边缘状况

Sense.DEF: very close to not being acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: In borderline cases , the student’s coursework is considered, as well as exam grades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在难以决定的情况下﹐学生的作业和考试成绩都要考虑进去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The referee’s decision was borderline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判的判罚颇具争议。

Sense.DEF: having qualities of both one situation, state etc and another more extreme situation or state
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a borderline schizophrenic
someone who has some signs of being mentally ill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临界精神分裂症患者

Sense.DEF: the point at which one quality, situation, emotion etc ends and another begins
Sense.TRAN: 介于两者之间的不明朗状态﹔暧昧状况﹐中间地带
Sense.EXAMPLE: She slipped over the borderline into sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她先是半睡半醒，后来慢慢睡着了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was on the borderline between a first- and a second-class degree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的成绩处在一级和二级荣誉学位的交界地带。

Sense.DEF: a border between two countries

the past tense of
bear
to make someone feel bored, especially by talking too much about something they are not interested in
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the sort of person who bores you at parties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人会在派对上烦你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a film that will bore its young audience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会让年轻观众感到无聊的一部电影

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t bore you with all the technical details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想讲技术上的细节让大家烦。

GramExa.GLOSS: make them very bored

Sense.DEF: to make a deep round hole in a hard surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The machine bores a hole through the cards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器会在卡上打一个洞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To build the tunnel they had to bore through solid rock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了修建这条隧道﹐他们得打通坚硬的岩石。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s eyes bore into you, they look at you in a way that makes you feel uncomfortable
something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Waiting is a bore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等人很没劲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll find it’s a terrible bore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会觉得这事极无聊。

Sense.DEF: someone who is boring, especially because they talk too much about themselves or about things that do not interest you
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He turned out to be a crashing bore
used to emphasize that someone is very boring
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人原来无聊透顶。

Sense.DEF:
the measurement of the width of the inside of a long hollow object such as a pipe or the
barrel
of a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a length of piping with a bore of about 15 mm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带上一根口径为15毫米左右的管子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 12-bore shotgun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把12毫米口径的猎枪

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fine-bore tube
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 细口径管子

Sense.DEF: a wave of water that moves quickly along a river from the sea at particular times of the year
Sense.TRAN: 涌潮〔每年特定时间涌入河流的海潮〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Severn bore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞文河涌潮

Sense.DEF:
a
borehole
tired and impatient because you do not think something is interesting, or because you have nothing to do
Sense.TRAN: 厌烦的﹐不感兴趣的﹔烦闷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was easily bored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很容易感到厌烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a while, I got bored and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了一会儿﹐我觉得无聊﹐就走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you bored with your present job?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对现在的工作厌倦了？

GramExa.PROPFORM: bored stiff/to tears/to death/out of your mind
GramExa.GLOSS: extremely bored
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 感到极度厌烦﹐极其厌倦﹐烦得要命

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse bored , which describes a feeling, and boring , which describes someone or something that makes you feel bored. 不要混淆bored和boring﹐前者是形容人的感受﹐后者是形容某人或某事物让人感到无聊: bored students 不感兴趣的学生 | a boring job 无聊的工作

Sense.DEF: the feeling you have when you are bored, or the quality of being boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: a game to relieve the boredom of a long journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长途旅行中解闷的一个游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sheer boredom of being in jail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牢狱生活的单调乏味

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his boredom with life in a small town
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对小镇生活的厌倦

Sense.DEF: something that is very boring
Sense.TRAN: 很无趣的事物﹐极乏味的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game was turning out to be a borefest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场比赛结果极其无聊。

Sense.DEF: a deep hole made using special equipment, especially in order to get water or oil out of the ground
not interesting in any way
Sense.TRAN: 无趣的﹐无聊的﹐乏味的﹐令人生厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband is about the most boring person I’ve ever met.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫可以说是我见过的最无聊的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job was dull and boring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作枯燥乏味。

GramExa.GLOSS: very boring

Exponent.DEF: not interesting in any way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a boring speech
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味的演讲
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He found school incredibly boring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得上学无聊透顶。

Exponent.DEF: very ordinary and therefore rather boring. People often use this phrase in everyday English, instead of saying directly that something is boring
Exponent.TRAN: 不大有趣的﹐不太有意思的〔常用以避免直接说某事物乏味〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The story wasn’t very interesting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这故事不太有趣。

Exponent.DEF: boring
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The conference was usually a dull affair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个会通常是很乏味的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Life was never dull.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活从来都不无聊。

Exponent.DEF: very boring and continuing for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The process was tedious and slow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个过程乏味而且缓慢。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jake began the tedious task of sorting through his papers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克开始做整理文件的枯燥工作。

Exponent.DEF: boring and always the same
Exponent.TRAN: 单调乏味的，一成不变的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The work was monotonous and unchallenging.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作单调乏味﹐缺乏挑战性。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was only half listening to the monotonous voice of the teacher.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只心不在焉地听着老师单调乏味的说话声。

Exponent.DEF: rather boring, because it is connected with things you do regularly as part of your daily life
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He busied himself with the mundane task of cleaning the house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他忙着做打扫房子的乏味工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most arguments are over mundane issues like spending or saving money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数争吵都是围绕花钱或存钱之类的琐事。

Exponent.DEF: boring because nothing new or interesting ever happens
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因毫无新意或趣味而〕单调乏味的﹐刻板的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He wanted to escape his humdrum life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想要摆脱单调乏味的生活。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a humdrum existence
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 平淡的生活

Exponent.DEF: a subject, piece of writing etc that is dry is boring because it is very serious and does not contain any humour
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The students complained that the lecture was dry and uninspiring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们抱怨课上的枯燥乏味﹐平淡无奇。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a dry academic volume
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 枯燥乏味的学术著作

Sense.DEF: when a person or animal is born, they come out of their mother’s body or out of an egg
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forty lambs were born this spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年春天有40头小羊羔出生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Swift was born in 1667.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯威夫特生于1667年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Then, most babies were born at home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐大多数小孩都在家里出生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was born on December 15th, 1973.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生于1973年12月15日。

GramExa.GLOSS: be born in a particular situation, type of family etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 出生于某种境况[家庭等]
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One third of all children are born into single-parent families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三分之一的孩子都生于单亲家庭。

GramExa.GLOSS: have a particular disease, type of character etc since birth
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 生来就有某种疾病[性格等]
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny was born with a small hole in her heart.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮生下来心脏就有个小洞。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
I was born and raised
was born and grew up
in Alabama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是土生土长的亚拉巴马人。

GramExa.GLOSS: be blind, deaf etc when born

Sense.EXAMPLE: a newly-born baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生儿﹐初生婴儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: the queen’s firstborn son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王的长子

GramExa.GLOSS: always be lucky, unlucky etc
born in or as a citizen of Australia etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 澳大利亚/法国等出生的

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说‘I born’, ‘I have been born’, or ‘I am born’. Say而要说 I was born : I was born in Pakistan. 我在巴基斯坦出生。

Sense.DEF: something that is born starts to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country where the sport of cricket was born
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 板球运动起源的国家

GramExa.GLOSS: as a result of a particular situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The alliance was born of necessity in 1941.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1941年，因为时局需要成立了这个联盟。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill spoke with a cynicism born of bitter experience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔说话尖酸刻薄﹐那是因为他曾经有过痛苦的遭遇。

Sense.DEF: born and having grown up in a particular place and having the typical qualities of someone from that place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was born and bred in Liverpool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是土生土长的利物浦人。

Sense.DEF: to be very suitable for a particular job, activity etc
Sense.TRAN: 天生适合做某事﹐有成为某类人的天赋
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was born to be a politician.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他天生就是当政治家的材料。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone you think is lying to you that you are not stupid enough to believe them
used to say that someone has been very stupid or easily deceived

Sense.LEXUNIT: be born under a lucky/unlucky star
Sense.DEF: to always have good or bad luck in your life
Sense.TRAN: 生来就幸运/不幸﹐天生走运/倒霉

Sense.LEXUNIT: be born with a silver spoon in your mouth
Sense.DEF: to be born into a rich family
Sense.TRAN: 含着银匙出生﹐生在富贵人家

Sense.DEF: someone who has a strong natural ability to lead, play music etc
Sense.TRAN: 天生的领袖/音乐家/教师等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the skill of a born actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天生的表演技巧

Sense.DEF: someone who always seems to have bad things happen to them
Sense.TRAN: 永远的失败者﹐天生的倒霉蛋

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or annoyance at something that you have never heard about before
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示惊讶或恼怒〕这辈子〔闻所未闻〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who has become an
evangelical
Christian
Sense.TRAN: 重生的基督徒〔指信奉基督教福音派的人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has recently stopped smoking, eating meat etc, and who is always talking about it and suggesting that other people do the same
Sense.TRAN: 如获新生的戒烟者/素食者等

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
bear
carried by water, the sea, air etc
Sense.TRAN: 由水/海洋/空气等传播[携带]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: water-borne diseases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由水传播的疾病

Sense.DEF: if a fact is borne in on someone, they realize that it is true
Sense.TRAN: 某人意识到﹐某人认识到

Sense.DEF: a town, or part of a large city, that is responsible for managing its own schools, hospitals, roads etc
Sense.TRAN: 自治市[镇]﹔城市的行政区
Sense.EXAMPLE: the borough of Queens in New York City
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约市昆斯区
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lambeth Borough Council
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兰贝斯自治市议会

Sense.DEF: the organization that controls a borough
to use something that belongs to someone else and that you must give back to them later
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I borrow your pen for a minute?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以借你的笔用一下吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You are allowed to borrow six books from the library at a time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你每次可从图书馆借六本书。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
They borrowed heavily
borrowed a lot of money
from the bank to start their new business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向银行贷了巨款来创办新公司。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse borrow and lend (=give someone permission to use something of yours). 不要混淆borrow和lend（借出）: I borrowed his bike. 我借了他的自行车。 | Can you lend me your pen? 你可以把笔借给我用一下吗？

Sense.DEF: to take or copy someone’s ideas, words etc and use them in your own work, language etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I borrowed my ideas from Eliot’s famous poem ‘The Waste Land’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的主题思想借自艾略特的名诗《荒原》。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
To borrow a phrase
use what someone else has said
, if you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我借用一句老话﹐受不了热就别在厨房待着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: English has borrowed words from many languages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语借用了很多语言中的词汇。

Sense.DEF: to worry about something when it is not necessary
someone who has borrowed money and has not yet paid it all back
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most borrowers pay 7% interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数借款人支付7%的利息。

Sense.DEF: when a person, government, company etc borrows money, or the money that they borrow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Public borrowing has increased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共借贷数额增加了。

Sense.DEF: something such as a word, phrase, or idea that has been copied from another language, book etc
Sense.TRAN: 借用的词语﹐外来语﹔借来的概念
Sense.EXAMPLE: words that are French borrowings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从法语中借用的词语

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his musical borrowings from other composers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他借自其他作曲家的音乐元素

Sense.DEF: the total amount of money that a company or organization owes
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或组织的〕借贷﹐债款﹐欠款总额

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that a company is allowed to borrow, according to its own rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司章程所规定的〕举债能力﹐借款权

Sense.DEF: a special prison for criminals who are not old enough to be in an ordinary prison
Sense.TRAN: 少年犯教养院﹐少年犯感化院

Sense.DEF: something that you think is silly, not good, or not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thinks modern art is bosh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得现代艺术是垃圾。

Sense.DEF: the front part of a woman’s chest
Sense.EXAMPLE: She cradled the child to her bosom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把那孩子抱入怀中。

Sense.DEF: a woman’s breast

Sense.LEXUNIT: the bosom of the family/the Church etc
Sense.DEF: the situation where you feel safe because you are with people who love and protect you
Sense.TRAN: 家庭/教会等的温暖怀抱

Sense.DEF: a word meaning someone’s feelings and emotions, used especially when these are bad or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drury harboured bitterness in his bosom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德鲁里怀恨在心。

Sense.DEF: a very close friend
having large breasts
Sense.TRAN: 胸部丰满的﹐乳房发达的

Sense.DEF: the person who employs you or who is in charge of you at work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have to ask my boss for a day off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得向老板请一天假。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Since I’m my own boss
I work for myself, rather than for an employer
, my hours are flexible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己当老板﹐所以我的时间很灵活。

Sense.DEF: someone with an important position in a company or other organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new boss at Paramount Pictures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派拉蒙电影公司的新领导
Sense.EXAMPLE: union bosses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会的头头们

Sense.DEF: the person who is the strongest in a relationship, who controls a situation etc
Sense.TRAN: 作主的人﹐控制局势的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you first start training a dog, it’s important to let him see that you’re the boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚开始训练狗时﹐一定要让它知道是你说了算。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to show the kids who’s boss .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须让孩子们明白是谁说了算。

Sense.DEF: a round decoration on the surface of something, for example on the ceiling of an old building
Sense.TRAN: 圆形装饰物﹐〔旧式建筑天花板上的〕饰球

Sense.DEF: to tell people to do things, give them orders etc, especially when you have no authority to do it
Sense.TRAN: 对…发号施令﹐指挥〔尤指无权这样做时〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five-year-old girls love to boss people around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五岁的女孩就爱支使别人。

Sense.DEF: very good, attractive, or fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boss car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部很棒的车

Sense.DEF: a dance that comes from Brazil, or the music for this dance
Sense.TRAN: 〔巴西的〕波萨诺伐舞﹔波萨诺伐舞曲

Sense.DEF: always telling other people what to do, in a way that is annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: her loud bossy sister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那个爱管人的大嗓门姐姐

Sense.DEF: someone who you think tells other people what to do too often
a protest in Boston in 1773 against the British tax on tea, when tea was thrown from British ships into the water. This is often considered to be the event that started the American Revolution.
Sense.TRAN: 波士顿倾茶事件〔1773年因反对英国政府征收茶叶税而发生于波士顿的抗议行动﹐常被视为美国独立战争的肇端〕

Sense.DEF: an officer on a ship whose job is to organize the work and look after the equipment

a computer
program
that performs the same operation many times in a row, for example one that searches for information on the Internet as part of a
search engine
Sense.TRAN: 自动程序〔可连续反复执行同一命令的计算机程序〕

Sense.DEF: relating to plants or the scientific study of plants
a large public garden where many different types of flowers and plants are grown for scientific study
someone whose job is to make scientific studies of wild plants
the scientific study of plants
to do something badly, because you have been careless or because you do not have the skill to do it properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不经心或缺乏技术而〕把…做得拙劣
Sense.EXAMPLE: The builders really botched up our patio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工人把我们的露台修得一塌糊涂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a botched investigation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敷衍了事的调查

Sense.DEF: a piece of work, a job etc that has been badly or carelessly done
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just made an awful botch of my translation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我翻译得一塌糊涂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole thing was a botch job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整件事做得很差劲。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about two people, things etc together, and emphasize that each is included
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both Helen’s parents are doctors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦的父母都是医生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold it in both hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用两只手拿好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can both swim, can’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们俩都会游泳﹐对吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They both started speaking together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩一起开了口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oxford is not far from Stratford, so you can easily visit both in a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛津镇离斯特拉特福德不远﹐所以两个地方可以在一天内游览。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both of my grandfathers are farmers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖父和外祖父都是农民。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can’t have it both ways
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone cannot have the advantages that come from two separate situations because they cannot exist together
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s either me or her. You can’t have it both ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要么我﹐要么她﹐你不可能两个人都要。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use both (of) before 'the', 'my', 'these' etc, or use both directly before a plural noun
F2NBox.TRAN: both (of) 用在 the﹐my﹐these等前面﹐复数名词前则直接用 both
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Both my parents are dead (NOT My both parents are dead).
Both of her parents went to college.
Both parents seem to be working very hard.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母两个似乎都很勤劳。
F2NBox.EXPL: When both follows a pronoun or noun referring to two people or things, it should come after the first auxiliary if there is one
F2NBox.TRAN: 当both用于指两个人或物的代词或名词之后时﹐如果句中有助动词﹐则both应置于第一个助动词之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We have both worked in Scotland for some time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩都在苏格兰工作过一段时间。
F2NBox.EXPL: It comes after a simple tense of 'be'
F2NBox.TRAN: both应置于be的一般式之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a subject in which you are both interested
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们俩都感兴趣的话题
F2NBox.EXPL: Both is not usually used in a negative clause. Use a clause with neither instead
F2NBox.TRAN: both一般不用于否定分句。在否定分句中应使用含neither
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Neither of these methods is perfect (NOT Both of these methods is not perfect).

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is true not just of one person, thing, or situation but also of another
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s lived in both Britain and America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在英国和美国都生活过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can both speak and write Japanese.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她会用日语说和写。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both he and his wife enjoy tennis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和他妻子都喜欢打网球。

Sense.GRAM: I,T usually in questions and negatives
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: to make the effort to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t bother to answer the question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他懒得回答这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t bother with a reply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他懒得回复。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many young people didn’t bother voting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻人都懒得投票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want me to wait for you?’ ‘No, don’t bother.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “要我等你吗？”“算了﹐不用麻烦了。”

Sense.EXAMPLE: Why bother to go abroad, when there are so many nice places here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有这么多好地方﹐干吗还要费事去国外？

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel slightly worried, upset, or concerned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being in a crowd really bothers me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很讨厌人多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was very noisy, but that didn’t bother me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很吵﹐但是我不在意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I try not to bother about what other people think.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量不去管别人怎么想。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It really bothered me that he’d forgotten my birthday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把我的生日忘了﹐我很不高兴。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone, especially by interrupting them when they are trying to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Danny, don’t bother Ellen while she’s reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼﹐埃伦看书的时候不要去打扰她 。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would it bother you if I put on some music?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我放点音乐会你介意吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It didn’t seem worth bothering the doctor about.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好像不用去麻烦医生。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can’t/couldn’t be bothered (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not want to make the effort to do something, or that you are not interested in doing something
Sense.TRAN: 某人不想费心（去做某事）﹐某人没兴趣（做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was so hot I couldn’t be bothered to cook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气这么热﹐我都懒得做饭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should be revising, but I just can’t be bothered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该温习功课﹐可就是不想去做。

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body bothers you, it is slightly painful or uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: My back’s been bothering me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直背痛。

Sense.DEF: used as a very polite way of interrupting someone when you want their attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to bother you, but Mr. Grey is on the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起打扰您一下﹐格雷先生打电话找您。

Sense.DEF: to upset or frighten someone by talking to them when they do not want to talk to you, trying to hurt them, touch them sexually etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry – my dog won’t bother you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我的狗不会咬你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he starts bothering you, let me know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他来烦你就告诉我。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not bother yourself/not bother your head
Sense.DEF: to not spend time or effort on something, either because it is not important or because it is too difficult
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不重要或太难而〕不为…操心[伤脑筋]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cliff didn’t want to bother himself with details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克利夫不想过问细节问题。

Sense.DEF: used to express a sudden feeling of annoyance about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh bother it! The thread’s broken again!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐真讨厌！ 线又断了！

Sense.DEF: trouble or difficulty that has been caused by small problems and that usually only continues for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an old car, but it’s never caused me any bother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是辆旧车﹐但从来不给我添麻烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe’s been having a bit of bother with his back again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近乔的背部又有点不适。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
‘Thanks for your help.’ ‘ It was no bother
used to emphasize that you were happy to help someone
at all.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “谢谢你帮忙。”“没什么。”
Sense.EXAMPLE:
My mother hardly ever went to the bother of
the effort of
making cakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲几乎从来不会费心去做蛋糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure the station is on your way? I don’t want to give you any extra bother .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站真的顺路吗？ 我不想给你添麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should have phoned the shop first and saved myself the bother of going there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该先给商店打个电话的﹐就省得跑一趟了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sth is more bother than it’s worth
GramExa.GLOSS: it is too difficult to be worth doing

Sense.DEF: a person or job that slightly annoys you by causing trouble or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate to be a bother, but could you show me how the copier works?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐麻烦一下﹐你能告诉我复印机怎样用吗？

Sense.DEF: used when you are slightly annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh bother! I forgot to phone Jean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀坏了！我忘记给琼打电话了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are slightly annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Botheration. I forgot my glasses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可恶﹐我忘了戴眼镜。

Sense.DEF: worried or upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t seem too bothered about the things that are written about him in the papers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上写他的那些东西﹐他好像不是太在意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one else seemed bothered that Grandfather wasn’t there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 祖父不在﹐别人好像都不担心。

Sense.DEF: if you are not bothered about something, it is not important to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What film do you want to see?’ ‘I’m not bothered.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想看什么电影？”“我随便。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s not bothered about getting the facts right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不要把事情搞清楚﹐他无所谓。

Sense.DEF: slightly annoying
Sense.TRAN: 引起麻烦的﹐讨厌的﹔令人为难的

Sense.DEF:
a large number of computers that someone has secretly gained control of and uses to do things such as send
spam unwanted emails
Sense.TRAN: 殭尸网络﹐机器人网络〔被恶意控制的大量电脑﹐用以散布垃圾邮件等〕

Sense.DEF: a container with a narrow top for keeping liquids in, usually made of plastic or glass
Sense.EXAMPLE: an empty bottle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个空瓶子

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一个葡萄酒瓶/牛奶瓶/啤酒瓶等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bottle of champagne
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶香槟酒

Sense.DEF: the amount of liquid that a bottle contains
Sense.EXAMPLE: Between us, we drank three bottles of wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩喝了三瓶葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF: a container for babies to drink from, with a rubber part on top that they suck, or the milk contained in this bottle
Sense.EXAMPLE: My first baby just wouldn’t take a bottle at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第一个孩子根本就不肯用奶瓶喝奶。

Sense.DEF: alcoholic drink – used when talking about the problems drinking can cause
Sense.TRAN: 酒〔用于谈论喝酒引起的问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter let the bottle ruin his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得让酒毁了他的生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: regularly drink too much
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was under a lot of stress, and started hitting the bottle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她压力很大﹐于是开始酗酒。

GramExa.GLOSS: be drinking a lot of alcohol regularly

Sense.DEF: courage to do something that is dangerous or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔做危险或不愉快的事情的〕勇气﹐胆量
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never thought she’d have the bottle to do it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想不到她有胆量做这样的事！

Sense.DEF: used when you invite someone to an informal party, to tell them that they should bring their own bottle of alcoholic drink
Sense.TRAN: 自己带酒〔用于邀请某人自己带酒来参加聚会〕

Sense.DEF: to put a liquid, especially wine or beer, into a bottle after you have made it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔葡萄酒﹑啤酒等〕装进瓶中
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whisky is bottled here before being sent abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威士忌在这里装瓶后运往国外。

Sense.DEF: to put vegetables or fruit into special glass containers in order to preserve them
Sense.TRAN: 把〔蔬菜或水果〕装瓶保存

Sense.DEF: to suddenly decide not to do something because you are frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you tell him?’ ‘No, I bottled out at the last minute.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你告诉他了吗？”“没有﹐我在最后一分钟退缩了。”

Sense.DEF: to deliberately not allow yourself to show a strong feeling or emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is far better to cry than to bottle up your feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哭出来比憋在心里要好得多。

Sense.DEF: to cause problems by delaying something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill has been bottled up in Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个议案一直被压在国会。

Sense.DEF: a container in the street that you put empty bottles into, so that the glass can be used again
water, beer etc that is sold in a bottle
to feed a baby or young animal with milk from a bottle rather than from their mother’s breast
a very dark green colour
a place in a road where the traffic cannot pass easily, so that there are a lot of delays
Sense.TRAN: 瓶颈路段﹐交通阻塞点﹐狭窄路段

Sense.DEF: a delay in one stage of a process that makes the whole process take longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Understaffing has caused a real bottleneck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人手不足严重妨碍了整个进度。

Sense.DEF: a small tool used for removing the metal lids from bottles
the lowest part of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you hold the bottom of the ladder for me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我扶住梯子底部好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Grandma was standing at the bottom of the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 祖母正站在楼梯的下面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: at the bottom of the page
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一页的底部
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Go downstairs and wait for me at the bottom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你下楼去﹐在楼梯底下等我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There should be a menu bar at the bottom of your screen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在屏幕的下方应该有一个菜单栏。

Sense.DEF: the flat surface on the lowest side of an object

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s that on the bottom of your shoe?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你鞋底上的是什么东西？

Sense.DEF: the lowest inner surface of something such as a container

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found the keys – they were at the bottom of my handbag.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找到钥匙了——在我手提包的底部。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The drugs had been hidden in a suitcase with a false bottom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品藏在一个带假底板的行李箱里。

Sense.DEF: the lowest position in an organization or company

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Giants are at the bottom of the league.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨人队在联赛中排名垫底。

GramExa.GLOSS: the lowest position in society, an organization etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Immigrants were at the bottom of the pile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民处于社会的最底层。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
Higgins had started at the bottom
in a low position in a company
and worked his way up to become managing director.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希金斯从最低的职位做起﹐一步一步升至总经理的位置。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: United currently lie second from bottom of the Premier League.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队目前排在英超联赛的倒数第二位。

Sense.DEF: the ground under a sea, river etc, or the flat land in a valley

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bottom of the pool is very slippery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 池底很滑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A body was found at the bottom of the canal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运河河底发现了一具尸体。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fish living on the sea bottom
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在海底的鱼

Sense.DEF: the part of your body that you sit on
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just sat on my bottom and slid down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就坐着滑了下去。

Sense.DEF: the part of a set of clothes that you wear on the lower part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: pyjama bottoms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡裤
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blue bikini bottom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条蓝色比基尼泳裤

Sense.LEXUNIT: the bottom of a road/garden etc
Sense.DEF: the part of a road, area of land etc that is furthest from where you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a shop at the bottom of the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条街的尽头有家商店。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get to the bottom of sth
Sense.DEF: to find out the cause of a problem or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never got to the bottom of this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事我从来都没有弄明白！

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/lie at the bottom of sth
Sense.DEF: to be the basic cause of a problem or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lack of money is at the bottom of many family problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺钱是造成许多家庭问题的根本原因。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a very bad situation that could not be any worse
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was at rock bottom, and knew I had to try and stop drinking.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那时状况糟糕透顶﹐我知道自己必须得戒酒了。

Subsense.DEF: to be at a very low level
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We bought the house when prices were at rock bottom.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在房价触底时买下了这幢房子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: from the bottom of your heart
Sense.DEF: in a very sincere way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我衷心地感谢你。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the bottom drops/falls out of the market
Sense.DEF: when people stop buying a particular product, so that the people who sell it can no longer make any money
used to tell someone to enjoy or finish their alcoholic drink
having a bottom or base that is big, round etc
Sense.TRAN: 屁股大的/圆的等﹔底部大的/圆的等

Sense.DEF: the way a person or situation really is, although they may seem different
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a good kind person at bottom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她实际上是个善良的好人。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: you can bet your bottom dollar
scrape the bottom of the barrel

Exponent.DEF: the lowest part of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house is at the bottom of that hill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子在那座山的山脚下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She scrolled down to the bottom of the screen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把页面滚动到屏幕底部。

Exponent.DEF: the bottom surface on the outside of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You will find the serial number on the underneath of the vacuum cleaner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在真空吸尘器底部可以找到序列号。

Exponent.DEF: the lowest part or the wide bottom part on which something stands
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The lamp has a square base.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这灯有一个正方形的底座。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had broken a bone at the base of his spine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脊椎底部有一处骨折。

Exponent.DEF: the bottom of a tree, a hill, or some stairs
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a small village at the foot of the mountain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 山脚下有一座小村庄。

Exponent.DEF: the ground at the bottom of a river, a lake, or the sea
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the sea bed
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海底
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They found some interesting stones on the river bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在河床上找到了一些有趣的石头。

Exponent.DEF: the layer of cement and stones that forms the bottom of a building
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The builders have begun laying the foundations for the house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工人开始为房子打地基。

Sense.DEF: in the lowest place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s on the bottom shelf .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它在架子的最底层。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The towels are in the bottom drawer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛巾在最下面的抽屉里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got some butter on your bottom lip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你下嘴唇上粘了点黄油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bottom right-hand corner of the page
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一页的右下角

Sense.DEF: the least important, successful etc
Sense.TRAN: 最不重要的﹐最末的﹐最差的
Sense.EXAMPLE:
I was bottom of the class
the least successful student
in Spanish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的西班牙语在班上是最后一名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain came bottom on efforts to tackle pollution and global warming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在处理污染和全球变暖问题上，英国最落后。

Sense.DEF: in the place furthest away from where you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bottom field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最远的田地

Sense.DEF:
the lowest
gear
of a vehicle
if a situation, price etc bottoms out, it stops getting worse or lower, usually before improving again
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are signs that the recession has bottomed out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有迹象表明经济衰退已经见底。

Sense.DEF: all the things, especially things that you use in a house, that a woman collects to use when she is married
Sense.TRAN: 女子结婚前准备的（家居）用品﹐嫁妆

Sense.DEF: a bottomless hole, sea etc is one that is extremely deep
Sense.TRAN: 无底的﹐深不可测的﹐极深的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a rope dangling down into a dark bottomless hole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根绳子悬垂到一个深不见底的黑洞。

Sense.DEF: seeming to have no end or limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bottomless well of information available through the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网上无限的信息源泉
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The government does not have a bottomless pit
a supply with no limits
of money to spend on public services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府并没有取之不尽的钱可以花在公共事业上。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone what the most important part of a situation is, or what the most important thing to consider is
Sense.EXAMPLE: In radio, you have to keep the listener listening. That’s the bottom line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干电台工作你得吸引听众来听﹐这是起码的要求。

Sense.DEF: the profit or the amount of money that a business makes or loses
the least amount of money that you are willing to accept in a business deal
Sense.TRAN: 〔一桩生意中可接受的〕底线﹐底价

Sense.DEF: in the lowest, furthest, or deepest position or place
a bottom-up plan is one in which you decide on practical details before thinking about general principles
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划〕从细节到整体的﹐从实际出发的，自下而上的

PronCodes.PRON: ˈbɒtʃʊlɪz ə m, ˈbɒtʃəlɪz ə m

Sense.DEF:
serious food poisoning caused by
bacteria
in preserved meat and vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 肉毒（杆菌）中毒﹐腊肠毒菌病

Sense.DEF: a woman’s bedroom or private sitting room
a bouffant hairstyle is one in which your hair is raised away from your head at the top
a tropical plant that has red or purple flowers and grows up walls
Sense.TRAN: 叶子花﹐三角花〔一种热带攀缘植物﹐开红色或紫色花朵〕

Sense.DEF: a main branch on a tree

the past tense and past participle of
buy
a clear soup made by boiling meat and vegetables in water
a small square made of dried meat or vegetables, used to give a stronger taste to soups
a large round piece of rock
a wide road in a town or city, often with trees along the sides
used as part of the name of a particular road
Sense.TRAN: 大道﹐大街〔用于街道名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sunset Boulevard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日落大道

Sense.DEF: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ball bounced off the post and into the goal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球从门柱上弹入了球门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids were bouncing a ball against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们正在对着墙打球。

Sense.DEF: to move up and down, especially because you are hitting a surface that is made of rubber, has springs etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lyn was bouncing on the trampoline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 林恩在蹦床上蹦跳。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop bouncing up and down on the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别在沙发上蹦来蹦去了。

Sense.DEF: if a cheque bounces, or if a bank bounces a cheque, the bank will not pay any money because there is not enough money in the account of the person who wrote it
to walk quickly and with a lot of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Olivia came bouncing into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利维娅蹦蹦跳跳地进了房间。

Sense.DEF: if something bounces, it moves quickly up and down as you move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair bounced when she walked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走起路来头发上下飘动。

Sense.DEF: if light or sound bounces, it hits a surface and then moves quickly away from it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The radio signals are bounced off a satellite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无线电信号从卫星上反射回来。

Sense.DEF: if an email that you send bounces or is bounced, it is returned to you and the other person does not receive it because of a technical problem
to talk about your ideas with someone in order to get their opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you work in a team you can bounce your ideas off each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你们在一个小组里工作﹐互相之间可以探讨意见。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave a place, job, or organization, especially because they have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 驱逐﹐赶走﹐解雇〔尤指做错事的人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Taylor was bounced from the team for assaulting another player.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒因为殴打另一名球员而被球队开除。

Sense.DEF: to discuss ideas with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to have a meeting so that we could bounce a few ideas around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本想开个会﹐让大家交流一下意见。

Sense.DEF: to feel better quickly after being ill, or to become successful again after failing or having been defeated
Sense.TRAN: 恢复健康﹐恢复元气﹔重整旗鼓
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s had a lot of problems in the past, but it’s always managed to bounce back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去这家公司经历过不少困难﹐但每次总能重整旗鼓。

Sense.DEF: if an email that you send bounces back or is bounced back, it is returned to you and the other person does not receive it because of a technical problem
to force someone to decide to do something, especially without giving them time to consider it carefully
Sense.TRAN: 逼迫〔某人〕做〔某事〕〔尤指不容仔细考虑〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Party members feel that they were bounced into accepting the policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内人士觉得他们是被迫接受这项政策的。

Sense.DEF: the action of moving up and down on a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to catch the ball on the second bounce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量在球第二次弹起时接住。

Sense.DEF: the ability to move up and down on a surface, or that surface’s ability to make something move up and down
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ball had completely lost its bounce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这球已经没有弹性了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a basketball court with good bounce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹力好的篮球场

Sense.DEF: a lot of energy that someone has
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise is great. I feel like there’s a new bounce in my step.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动真好﹐我感觉到自己的脚步轻快有力起来了。

Sense.DEF: hair that has bounce is in very good condition and goes back to its shape if you press it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brand-new styling spray that gives your hair body and bounce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种全新的定型剂﹐可以让你的头发更浓密有弹性

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to stand at the door of a club, bar etc and stop unwanted people coming in, or make people leave if they are behaving badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔夜总会﹑酒吧等的〕保安人员﹐门卫﹐保镖

Sense.DEF:
a fast ball in
cricket
that passes or hits the
batsman
above the chest after it bounces
Sense.TRAN: 反弹球〔板球运动中指反弹后以高过击球手胸部的高度擦过或击中击球手的球〕

Sense.DEF: healthy and full of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bouncing baby girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个健壮的女婴

Sense.DEF: a bouncy ball etc quickly moves away from a surface after it has hit it
a bouncy surface is made of a substance that makes people move up and down when they are on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new bed is nice and bouncy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张新床很舒服﹐弹性很好。

Sense.DEF: someone who is bouncy is always very happy, confident, and full of energy
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕生气勃勃的﹐精神饱满的﹐充满活力的

Sense.DEF: hair or material that is bouncy goes back to its shape when you press it
a large object filled with air, often shaped like a castle, that children jump on for fun
Sense.TRAN: 〔供儿童在上面蹦跳玩耍的〕充气城堡

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
bind
to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别骗她﹐她肯定会发现的。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something should have been expected
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s hot!’ ‘Well, it was bound to be – I just took it out of the oven.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “真烫！”“肯定烫﹐我刚从烤箱里拿出来。”

Sense.EXAMPLE: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要照顾这么多病人﹐失误在所难免。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Bound to is used mainly in spoken English. In written English, people usually use certain to, it is inevitable that instead
F2NBox.TRAN: bound to主要用在口语中﹐书面语中一般用certain to﹐it is inevitable that
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ It is inevitable that mistakes will happen.

Sense.DEF: to be forced to do what a law or agreement says you must do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Foundation is bound by the treaty to help any nation that requests aid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据条约规定﹐这个基金会应为任何请求援助的国家提供帮助。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You are legally bound to report the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律上你有责任报告这起事故。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you ought to do something, because it is morally right or your duty to do it
Sense.TRAN: 有义务做某事﹐有责任做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ian felt bound to tell Joanna the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩觉得有责任告诉乔安娜真相。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Well, I’m bound to say
I feel I ought to say
, I think you’re taking a huge risk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐我必须告诉你﹐我觉得你是在冒很大的风险。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be duty bound/honour bound to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A son is duty bound to look after his mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子照顾母亲是义不容辞的。

Sense.DEF: travelling towards a particular place or in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plane bound for Somalia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞往索马里的飞机
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tried to get seats on a Rome-bound flight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想办法弄到飞往罗马的机票。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
homeward-bound
travelling towards home
commuters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家路上的上班族

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All eastbound trains have been cancelled due to faulty signals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于信号故障﹐所有东行列车均已停运。

Sense.DEF: if two people or groups are bound together by something, they share a particular experience or situation that causes them to have a relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔两者〕因为某事而联系在一起
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two nations were bound together by a common history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个国家因为有着共同的历史而联系在一起。

Sense.DEF: to be very involved in something, so that you cannot think about anything else
Sense.TRAN: 忙于某事〔而无暇顾及其他〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was too bound up in his own problems to listen to mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只顾自己的问题﹐无心倾听我的烦恼。

Sense.DEF: to be very closely connected with a particular problem or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark’s problems are all bound up with his mother’s death when he was ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克的问题和他十岁丧母有很大的关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people of Transkei began to realize that their future was inseparably bound up with that of South Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特兰斯凯人开始明白﹐他们的未来和南非的未来休戚相关。

Sense.DEF: controlled or limited by something, so that you cannot do what you want or what other people want you to
Sense.TRAN: 被大雪困住[封锁]的/因罢工而停顿的/受传统束缚的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fog-bound airport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因大雾而关闭的机场
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who are wheelchair-bound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离不开轮椅的人
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a desk-bound sergeant
having to work in an office, instead of doing a more active job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被困于案头工作的警官

Sense.DEF: a bound book is covered on the outside with paper, leather etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Bible bound in leather
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本皮面的《圣经》

Sense.EXAMPLE: a leather-bound volume of Shakespeare’s plays
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一册皮面的莎士比亚戏剧

Sense.DEF: used when you are very sure that what you have just said is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had good reasons for doing that, I’ll be bound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信﹐他那样做一定有道理。

Sense.DEF: very determined to do or achieve something, especially something difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Klein is bound and determined to win at least five races this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱因下定决心﹐今年至少要赢五场比赛。

Sense.DEF: to run with a lot of energy, because you are happy, excited, or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 跳跃﹐跳跃着前进﹐蹦蹦跳跳地跑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Suddenly a huge dog came bounding towards me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐一条大狗跳向我扑来。

Sense.DEF: if a country or area of land is bounded by something such as a wall, river etc, it has the wall etc at its edge
Sense.EXAMPLE: a yard bounded by a wooden fence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用木栅栏围起来的一个院子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US is bounded in the north by Canada and in the south by Mexico.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国北面与加拿大接壤﹐南面与墨西哥毗邻。

Subsense.DEF: the limits of what is possible or acceptable
Subsense.TRAN: 界限﹐限度﹐极限﹐限制范围

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are here to make sure that the police operate within the bounds of the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们此行的目的是确保警方依法执行公务。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be/go beyond the bounds of credibility/reason/decency etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The humor in the movie sometimes goes beyond the bounds of good taste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片中的幽默成分有时流于低俗。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be within/beyond the bounds of possibility
GramExa.GLOSS: be possible/not possible
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was not beyond the bounds of possibility that they could meet again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们再次相逢也不是没有可能的。

Subsense.DEF: the edges of a town, city etc

Sense.DEF: if a place is out of bounds, you are not allowed to go there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The path by the railway line is officially out of bounds to both cyclists and walkers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路沿线的小路按规定禁止骑车者和步行者进入。

Sense.LEXUNIT: by leaps and bounds/in leaps and bounds
Sense.DEF: if someone or something increases, develops etc by leaps and bounds, they increase etc very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie’s reading is improving in leaps and bounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉的阅读能力提高得很快。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s honesty, kindness etc knows no bounds, they are extremely honest etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔指某人的诚实﹑善良等〕没有止境﹐无限

Sense.DEF:
inside or outside the legal playing area in a sport such as American football or
basketball
a long or high jump made with a lot of energy
the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Mississippi River forms a natural boundary between Iowa and Illinois.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 密西西比河是艾奥瓦州和伊利诺伊州的天然边界。

Sense.EXAMPLE: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在全球经济中﹐国界已经变得越来越没有意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小河打了个弯﹐为他这块地划出了边界。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们穿过教堂墓地﹐向院墙走去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻国之间的边界争端

Sense.DEF: the limit of what is acceptable or thought to be possible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the boundaries of human knowledge
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类知识的极限

GramExa.EXAMPLE: within the boundaries of the law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在法律许可的范围内

GramExa.GLOSS: to make a new discovery, work of art etc that is very different from what people have known before, and that changes the way they think
GramExa.EXAMPLE: art that pushes back the boundaries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突破界限的艺术

Sense.DEF: the point at which one feeling, idea, quality etc stops and another starts
Sense.TRAN: 〔不同情感﹑思想﹑品质等之间的〕分野﹐分界线

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the boundaries between work and play
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作和娱乐之间的界线
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the blurring of the boundaries between high and popular culture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高雅文化和通俗文化之间界线的模糊

Sense.DEF:
the outer limit of the playing area in
cricket
, or a shot that sends the ball across this limit for extra points
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球场的〕边界线﹔越过边界线的加分球

Sense.DEF: something that you should do because it is morally correct
Sense.TRAN: 义不容辞的事﹐应尽的义务

Sense.DEF: a man who has behaved in a way that is morally wrong
having no limit or end
Sense.EXAMPLE: boundless energy and enthusiasm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无限的精力和热情

Sense.DEF: very generous
if something is bountiful, there is more than enough of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: bountiful harvests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大丰收

Sense.DEF: generous
Sense.EXAMPLE: bountiful God
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慷慨的上帝

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is given to someone by the government as a reward for doing something, especially catching or killing a criminal
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府给予的〕奖励金﹐赏金〔尤因抓获或杀死罪犯〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a notorious cattle rustler with a bounty on his head
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个被悬赏捉拿的臭名昭著的偷牛贼

Sense.DEF: food or wealth that is provided in large amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: People came from all over the world to enjoy America’s bounty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们从世界各地而来﹐享受美国的富足。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being generous
someone who catches criminals and brings them to the police for a reward
Sense.TRAN: 为领赏而追捕罪犯的人；赏金猎手

Sense.DEF: an arrangement of flowers, especially one that you give to someone

PIC.HEADING: BOUQUET 花束
PIC.PICCONTENT: ribbon 丝带；bouquet 花束；a bunch of roses 一束玫瑰；garland 花环；posy 小花束

Sense.DEF: the smell of a wine
a small bag full of herbs that you put into food that you are cooking to give it a special taste

a type of American
whisky

belonging to the
middle class
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came from a bourgeois family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来自一个中产阶级家庭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: bourgeois morality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中产阶级的道德准则

Sense.DEF: too interested in having a lot of possessions and a high position in society
Sense.TRAN: 过分注重名利的﹐追求物质享受的﹔市侩的﹐庸俗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the backlash against bourgeois materialism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对世俗的物质主义的鞭挞

Sense.DEF: belonging to or typical of the part of society that is rich, educated, owns land etc, according to Marxism
the people in a society who are rich, educated, own land etc, according to Marxism
about
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you talking 'bout?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在说什么？

Sense.DEF: a short period of time during which you suffer from an illness
Sense.TRAN: 抑郁/流感/恶心等的发作（时期）

Sense.DEF: a short period of time during which you do something a lot, especially something that is bad for you
Sense.TRAN: 一阵﹐一回﹐一场﹐一番〔尤指做对自己有害的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drinking bout
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一番痛饮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bout of unemployment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段时间的失业

Sense.DEF:
a
boxing
or
wrestling
match
a small shop that sells fashionable clothes or other objects
a small expensive hotel, decorated in a fashionable way
a flower that a man wears fastened to his jacket at a wedding
Sense.TRAN: 〔婚礼上男士别在西服上的〕胸花

Sense.DEF:
a Greek musical instrument similar to a
guitar
relating to cows
Sense.EXAMPLE: bovine diseases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛病

Sense.DEF: slow and slightly stupid, like a cow – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 笨拙的﹔反应迟钝的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bovine expression of contentment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副满足的傻相

Sense.DEF: violent behaviour, especially by a group of young men

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who behaves in a violent way

Sense.DEF:
to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an
audience
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bowed and left the stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科比特走进房间﹐恭敬地鞠了一躬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仆人深深一鞠躬﹐把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He bowed before the king.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向国王躬身行礼。

Sense.DEF: to bend your neck so that you are looking at the ground, especially because you want to show respect for God, or because you are embarrassed or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bowed her head and prayed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她低头祈祷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil stood, his head bowed in shame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔站在那里﹐羞愧地低着头。

Sense.DEF: to bend your body over something, especially in order to see it more closely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teague sat at his desk, bowed over a book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂格坐在桌子旁边﹐欠着身子看书。

Sense.DEF: to bend, or to make something bend
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees bowed in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木被风吹弯了腰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His back was bowed under the weight of the heavy bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉重的包压得他背都弯了。

Sense.DEF: to show too much respect to someone in authority – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 点头哈腰﹐卑躬屈膝〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to bend your body forward, especially when you are already kneeling, in order to show respect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maria bowed down before the statue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚拜倒在塑像前。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Come, let us bow down in worship .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐让我们来跪地敬拜。

Sense.DEF: to let someone give you orders or tell you what to do – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 向某人屈服﹔屈从于某人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to stop taking part in an activity, job etc, especially one that you have been doing for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reeves thinks it is time for him to bow out of politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里夫斯认为他应该退出政坛了。

Sense.DEF: to not do something that you have promised or agreed to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re not trying to bow out of this, are you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事你不会说话不算数吧？

Sense.DEF: to finally agree to do something, even though you do not want to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress may bow to public pressure and lift the arms embargo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会也许会屈服于公众的压力﹐解除武器禁运。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Myers finally bowed to the inevitable
accepted something he could not change
and withdrew from the campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈尔斯最后迫于无奈﹐退出了这场竞选。

Sense.DEF:
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an
audience

GramExa.GLOSS: bow to the audience at the end of a performance
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The music ended and the girl took a bow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐结束﹐女孩鞠躬致谢。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave a final bow just as the curtains came down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帷幕落下时﹐他鞠了最后一躬。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

Sense.DEF: the front part of a ship

a weapon used for shooting
arrow s
, made of a long thin piece of wood held in a curve by a tight string
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bow and arrow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弓箭

Sense.DEF:
a knot of cloth or string, with a curved part on either side and two loose ends, worn in the hair as decoration or for tying
shoelace s
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ella wore a bow in her hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉头发上扎着一个蝴蝶结。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: long chestnut hair tied back in a bow
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用蝴蝶结束在脑后的红棕色长发

Sense.DEF:
a long thin piece of wood with a tight string fastened along it, used to play musical instruments such as the
violin
or
cello

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have more than one string to your bow

Sense.DEF:
to play a piece of music on a musical instrument with a
bow 3
the bells of St Mary-le-Bow Church in London. It is said that a person born in a place where you can hear Bow Bells is a true cockney.
Sense.TRAN: 圣玛莉里波的钟声〔据说在听得到此钟钟声的地方出生的人才是真正的伦敦东区人〕

Sense.DEF: to remove all the parts of a book, play etc that you think might offend someone – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 删改﹐删除〔书、剧本等中认为有冒犯性的部分﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bowdlerized version of ‘Antony and Cleopatra’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《安东尼和克里奥帕特拉》的删节本

Sense.DEF: the system of tubes inside your body where food is made into solid waste material and through which it passes out of your body

Sense.DEF: one part of this system of tubes
Sense.EXAMPLE: cancer of the bowel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肠癌

Sense.DEF: the act of getting rid of solid waste from your body
the lowest or deepest part of something

Sense.DEF: a pleasant place in the shade under a tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rose-scented bower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰飘香的树荫

Sense.DEF: a wide round container that is open at the top, used to hold liquids, food, flowers etc

a player in

a

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A group of teenage boys stood talking in a group outside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群十几岁的男孩站在外面交谈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘You naughty boy!’ she said in a harsh voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你这个皮小子！”她厉声说道。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
What a polite little boy
young male child
you are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真是个有礼貌的小男孩。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Come on, Timmy, act like a big boy
an older boy
now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行了﹐蒂米﹐要有大男孩的样子了。

Sense.DEF: a son
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love my boys, but I’d like to have a girl, too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爱我的儿子﹐但还是希望再有个女儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
How old is your little boy
young son
?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的小儿子多大了？

Sense.DEF: a young man who does a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 〔年轻男性〕办公室杂务员/送报员/送货员等

Sense.DEF: a man of any age who is typical of people from a particular place, or who feels a strong connection with the place he grew up in
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The classic story of a local boy who’s made good
who has succeeded
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲一个本地人如何出息成材的经典故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just a country boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不过是个乡下人。

Sense.DEF: a group of men who are friends and often go out together
Sense.TRAN: 男性朋友们﹔一群男伙伴
Sense.EXAMPLE: Friday is his night out with the boys .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五晚上是他和一班弟兄们出去玩的时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He considers himself just one of the boys
not anyone special, but liked by other men
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为自己只是这群伙伴中的一份子。

Sense.DEF: a way of talking to a male horse or dog
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good boy!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好伙计！

Subsense.DEF: a group of men who do the same job
Subsense.TRAN: 一群从事同一职业的男子
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Oh no! Wait until the press boys get hold of this story.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐不！记者发现了这个新闻就好看了。

Subsense.DEF: men in the army, navy etc, especially those who are fighting in a war
Subsense.EXAMPLE: our boys on the front lines
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在前线的男儿

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not be surprised when boys or men behave badly, are noisy etc
Sense.TRAN: 男孩子总归是男孩子〔表示不需为男性的淘气、吵闹感到惊讶〕

Sense.DEF: the police
a friendly way for one man to speak to another man
Sense.TRAN: 老兄〔男人之间的友好称呼〕

Sense.DEF: an offensive way of talking to a black man
Sense.TRAN: 小子〔对黑人男性的冒犯语〕

Sense.DEF: used when you are excited or pleased about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boy, that was a great meal!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐那顿饭真不错！

Sense.DEF: used when you are slightly annoyed or disappointed about something
Sense.TRAN: 唉！〔表示有点厌烦或失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh boy! Bethany’s sick again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唉！ 贝瑟妮又病了。

Sense.DEF: a group of attractive young men who perform by singing and dancing, and who are especially popular with teenage girls
Sense.TRAN: 男孩乐队；男子偶像团体

Sense.DEF: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
Sense.TRAN: 抵制﹐排斥﹐杯葛﹔拒绝参加
Sense.EXAMPLE: We boycott all products tested on animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

Sense.DEF: an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted
Sense.TRAN: 抵制行动﹐杯葛行动﹔受抵制时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are now trying to organize a boycott .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a boycott on GM crops
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抵制转基因作物的行动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He called for a boycott of the elections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吁大家抵制选举。

Sense.DEF: a man that you are having a romantic relationship with
the time of a man’s life when he is a boy
Sense.EXAMPLE: boyhood memories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 童年的记忆

Sense.DEF: someone who is boyish looks or behaves like a boy in a way that is attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: boyish good looks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小男孩般的漂亮外貌
Sense.EXAMPLE: At 45, she still had a trim boyish figure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 45岁的她依然保持着男孩般的匀称身材。

Sense.DEF: a young man who likes driving cars very fast - used to show disapproval

a member of the
scout s

used to describe men doing brave exciting things, like a
hero
in an adventure story
Sense.EXAMPLE: His life story is like a nonstop Boys' Own adventure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一生的经历就像是一段永不停歇的冒险旅行。

Sense.DEF: an attractive young man who an older, usually rich or successful woman has a sexual relationship with
Sense.TRAN: 富姐玩物﹐小白脸〔指和较年长的有钱或成功女子有性关系的年轻漂亮的男子〕

Sense.DEF: a young man who is very successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robson, the boy wonder of the department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部门里的青年才俊罗布森

Sense.DEF: someone who you think is silly or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s the bozo in the pyjamas?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个穿着睡衣的傻瓜是谁？

Sense.DEF: the practice of asking people from outside a company to take charge of running a part of its activities
Sense.TRAN: 业务流程外包〔将公司部分业务外包给别人经营的做法〕

Sense.DEF:
a measurement of how fast a computer or
modem
can send or receive information
Sense.TRAN: 每秒比特数〔计算机或调制解调器的信息传输速度单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 28,800 bps modem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速率为28.8K的调制解调器

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= brother 兄弟﹔哥﹔弟
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= British 英国的﹔英国人的﹔英国人

Sense.DEF: a piece of underwear that a woman wears to support her breasts
to mentally or physically prepare yourself or someone else for something unpleasant that is going to happen
Sense.TRAN: 准备迎接〔令人不快的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nancy braced herself for the inevitable arguments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希为这场无法避免的争论作好了准备。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The military needs to brace itself for further spending cuts, says McCoy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦科伊称﹐军方需要做好再次削减开支的准备。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cathy braced herself to see Matthew, who she expected to arrive at any minute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯茜打起精神准备见马修﹐他随时可能到来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The base was braced for an attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基地已经准备好应付进攻。

Sense.DEF: to push part of your body against something solid in order to make yourself more steady

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gina braced her back against the wall and pushed as hard as she could.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉娜后背抵住墙﹐尽最大力气来推。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pilot told passengers and crew to brace themselves for a rough landing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员叫乘客和机组人员坐稳﹐准备硬着陆。

Sense.DEF: to make something stronger by supporting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait until we’ve braced the ladder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我们把梯子支撑住再说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers used steel beams to brace the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人用钢梁支撑屋顶。

Sense.DEF: to make your body or part of your body stiff in order to prepare to do something difficult
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔身体或身体某部位〕绷紧﹐（使）鼓足力气

Sense.DEF: something that is used to strengthen or support something, or to make it stiff
Sense.EXAMPLE: The miners used special braces to keep the walls from collapsing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矿工用特殊的支架撑住墙体﹐以免倒塌。

GramExa.GLOSS: a brace that supports the neck etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 颈箍/背部夹板/膝部护具
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was being fitted for a back brace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在试背部夹板。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had to wear a brace after the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出事以后她只得使用支架。

Sense.DEF: a system of metal wires that people, usually children, wear on their teeth to make them grow straight
a metal support that someone with weak legs wears to help them walk
Sense.TRAN: 〔装在腿上帮助腿力弱者行走的〕金属支架﹐双脚规形夹

Sense.DEF: two long pieces of material that stretch over someone’s shoulders and fasten to their trousers at the front and the back to stop them falling down
one of a pair of signs { } used to show that information written between them should be considered together
two things of the same type, especially two birds or animals that have been killed for food or sport
Sense.TRAN: 一对某物﹐一双某物〔尤指鸟、兽等猎物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brace of partridge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对猎获的山鹑

Sense.DEF: a band or chain that you wear around your wrist or arm as a decoration
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gold bracelet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只金手镯

Sense.DEF: bracing air or weather is cold and makes you feel very awake and healthy
Sense.TRAN: 〔空气﹑天气〕令人神清气爽的﹐提神的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bracing sea breeze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清新宜人的海风

Sense.DEF: a plant that often grows in forests and becomes reddish brown in the autumn
one of the pair of signs ( ) put around words to show extra information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last year’s sales figures are given in brackets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年的销售额放在括弧中。

Sense.DEF: a particular income, tax etc range
Sense.TRAN: 收入等级/税级/年龄组别等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the highest tax bracket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高税级
Sense.EXAMPLE: families in lower income brackets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 较低收入家庭

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal, wood, or plastic, often in the shape of the letter L, fixed to a wall to support something such as a shelf
Sense.TRAN: 〔钉在墙上的〕托架﹐托座﹐角撑架〔通常为L形〕

Sense.DEF: to consider two or more people or things as being similar or the same
Sense.TRAN: 把…视为同类﹔将…相提并论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women and minors were bracketed together for the legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法规中妇女和未成年人被归为一类。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Arizona has been bracketed with Iowa in the tournament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次锦标赛﹐亚利桑那队和艾奥瓦队被编在一组。

Sense.DEF: to put brackets around a written word, piece of information etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Debit amounts are bracketed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 借项金额标在括弧内。

Sense.DEF: brackish water is not pure because it is slightly salty
a small metal object like a button with two metal sticks that are put through several pieces of paper and folded down to hold the papers together
a small thin wire nail with either a small head or a part that sticks out to the side instead of a head
a small tool with a sharp point for making holes

people sometimes describe a large happy family with well-behaved children as being like the Brady Bunch. The Brady Bunch was a US television programme of the 1960s and 1970s about this type of family and their adventures.
Sense.TRAN: 布雷迪一家〔源于美国20世纪60–70年代的一部同名电视剧﹐有时用来形容子女品行良好的幸福大家庭〕

Sense.DEF: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I came out top in the test,’ he bragged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我测验得了最高分。”他吹嘘道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben’s always bragging about his success with women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本总是吹嘘他对女人很有办法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Julia used to brag that her family had a villa in Spain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅以前老吹嘘她家在西班牙有一栋别墅。

Sense.DEF: proud talk about something that you claim to own, to have done etc
someone who is always talking too proudly about what they own or have done
someone of the highest rank in the Hindu faith
Sense.TRAN: 婆罗门〔印度教中的最高等级〕

Sense.DEF: a narrow band of material formed by twisting threads together, used to decorate the edges of clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jacket trimmed with red braid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色穗带镶边的夹克

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Suzy always wears her hair in braids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏济总是梳着辫子。

Sense.DEF: to weave or twist together three pieces of hair or cloth to form one length
Sense.TRAN: 把…编成辫子﹔把…打成缏子

Sense.DEF: a form of printing for blind people, with raised parts that they can read by touching the paper with their fingers
the organ inside your head that controls how you think, feel, and move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Messages from the brain are carried by the central nervous system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大脑发出的信息是通过中枢神经系统传递的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the chemistry of the brain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大脑的化学性质
Sense.EXAMPLE: the human brain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人脑

GramExa.PROPFORM: the right/left hemisphere of the brain
GramExa.GLOSS: the right or left side of the brain
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emotional responses are a function of the right hemisphere of the brain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 情绪反应是右脑的一项功能。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She died of a brain tumour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她死于脑瘤。

Sense.DEF: the ability to think clearly and learn quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you had any brains, you’d know what I meant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果有点脑子﹐就会知道我的意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job requires brains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这工作需要头脑。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Something’s addled your brains
made you confused
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么事让你脑子糊涂了吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, use your brain , John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拜托﹐动动脑筋﹐约翰。

Sense.DEF: someone who is intelligent, with good ideas and useful skills
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of our best brains are leaving the country to work in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们当中一些最优秀的人才要离开本国去美国工作。

Sense.DEF: the brain of an animal, used as food
to be always thinking about something
Sense.TRAN: 一直想着某事物﹐牵挂着某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got that song on the brain today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我脑子里一直想着那首歌。

Sense.DEF: to be the person who thought of and developed a particular plan, system, or organization, especially a successful one
Sense.TRAN: 是某事的策划者[智囊﹐中枢人物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Danny’s definitely the brains of the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼绝对是这个项目的策划者。

Subsense.DEF: in a state where your brain has stopped working properly, even though your heart may still be beating
in a state in which you seem stupid or uninteresting, especially because you live a boring life or are very tired
Subsense.TRAN: 不会动脑子的﹐愚蠢的〔尤因生活无聊或极其疲惫〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not difficult to do
to hit someone very hard on the head – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 重击〔某人〕的头部〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to brain him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想把他脑袋打开花。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very intelligent
an idea, plan, organization etc that someone has thought of without any help from anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 智力产物﹐脑力劳动的成果

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The festival was the brainchild of Reeves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节庆活动全是里夫斯的主意。

Sense.DEF: damage to someone’s brain caused by an accident or illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Potts suffered severe brain damage in the crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波茨在车祸中遭受严重的脑损伤。

Sense.DEF: a movement of highly skilled or professional people from their own country to a country where they can earn more money
the process of writing everything you know about something on paper or storing it electronically on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 大脑转储〔指把自己对某方面所知道的一切都写在纸张上或储存在计算机里〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you suddenly cannot think of what you should say when you are in the middle of saying something
Sense.TRAN: 脑筋短路﹐记忆中断〔指话说了一半突然忘记自己要说什么〕

Sense.DEF: the process of measuring the electrical activity in someone’s brain to see if they react to a particular object or picture. This process could be used to check if someone is telling the truth, for example if they are answering questions from the police.
Sense.TRAN: 脑指纹技术〔指通过脑电波测出某人对某一物体或图片的反应﹔该技术可用于测谎〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is very intelligent
completely stupid
Sense.TRAN: 没有头脑的﹐傻的﹐愚笨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a brainless thing to do!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样做真是没有脑子！

Sense.DEF: intelligence, or the ability to think
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of brainpower went into solving the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这个问题费了不少脑筋。

Sense.DEF: educated intelligent people who have special skills, especially in science, considered as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s shortage of scientific brainpower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国科技人才的短缺

Sense.DEF: a process in which detailed photographs of the inside of your brain are taken and examined by a doctor
a sudden clever idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kirby had a sudden brainstorm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柯比突然有了灵感。

Sense.DEF: if you have a brainstorm, you are suddenly unable to think clearly or sensibly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must have had a brainstorm that afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天下午我肯定是一时糊涂了。

Sense.DEF: when a group of people meet in order to try to develop ideas and think of ways of solving problems
Sense.TRAN: 集思广益﹐脑力激荡﹐头脑风暴
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brainstorming session to come up with slogans for new products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新产品广告标语献策会

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Employees get together and brainstorm ideas .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工聚集起来献计献策。

Sense.DEF: a difficult problem that is fun trying to solve
Sense.TRAN: 有趣的难题﹐智力测验题

Sense.DEF: to make someone believe something that is not true, by using force, confusing them, or continuously repeating it over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people are being brainwashed by this religious group.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个宗教组织正在对年轻人进行洗脑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Commercials brainwash consumers into buying things they don’t need.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告宣传能给消费者洗脑﹐使他们购买并不需要的东西。

Sense.DEF: a sudden clever idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a brainwave! Let’s go this weekend instead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有好主意！我们改在这个周末去吧。

Sense.DEF: an electrical force that is produced by the brain and that can be measured
able to learn easily and think quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always was the brainy one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向是个聪明人。

Sense.DEF: to cook meat or vegetables slowly in a small amount of liquid in a closed container
a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle go more slowly or stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: Test your brakes after driving through water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车子涉水之后要检验一下刹车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to put the brakes on just in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最终及时刹了车。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Moira slammed on the brakes
used them suddenly and with a lot of force
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫伊拉猛踩刹车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He applied the brakes but failed to stop in time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踩了刹车﹐可未能及时停下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
the screech of brakes
the loud unpleasant noise they can make
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刹车的刺耳噪音

Sense.LEXUNIT: act as a brake on sth
Sense.DEF: to make something develop more slowly, be more difficult to do, or happen less
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物起抑制作用﹐遏制某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rises in interest rates act as a brake on expenditure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加息对消费起抑制作用。

Sense.DEF: to stop something that is happening
to make a vehicle or bicycle go more slowly or stop by using its brake

GramExa.GLOSS: brake quickly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He braked sharply to avoid the dog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然急刹车﹐想避开那条狗。

Sense.DEF: liquid used in certain kinds of brakes so that the different parts move smoothly
a light on the back of a vehicle that comes on when you use the brake
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车尾部的〕制动灯﹐刹车指示灯
