Sense.DEF: one of the two curved parts that press against the wheel of a vehicle in order to make it go more slowly or stop

a wild
blackberry
bush
the crushed outer skin of wheat or a similar grain that is separated from the rest of the grain when making white flour

a part of a tree that grows out from the
trunk
main stem
and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the storm, the ground was littered with twigs and branches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨过后﹐满地都是大大小小的树枝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The topmost branches were full of birds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树梢上停满了鸟儿。

Sense.DEF: a local business, shop etc that is part of a larger business etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bank has branches all over the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家银行在全国各地都有分行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a branch office in Boston
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在波士顿的分公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: She now works in our Denver branch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在她在我们的丹佛分部工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s their nearest branch?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最近的分店在哪里？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re planning to open a branch in St. Louis next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们计划明年在圣路易斯开一家分店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you met our branch manager , Mr. Carlson?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有见过我们的分公司经理卡尔森先生？

Sense.DEF: a part of a government or other organization that deals with one particular part of its work
Sense.EXAMPLE: All branches of government are having to cut costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有政府部门都必须削减开支。

GramExa.GLOSS: the three main parts of the US government

Sense.DEF: one part of a large subject of study or knowledge

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 数学/物理/生物学等的分支

Sense.DEF:
a group of members of a family who all have the same
ancestor s
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wealthy South American branch of the family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家族在南美洲的富裕分支

Sense.DEF: a smaller less important part of a river, road, or railway that leads away from the larger more important part of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rail company may have to close the branch line to Uckfield.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路公司有可能不得不关闭到阿克菲尔德的支线。

Sense.DEF: to divide into two or more smaller, narrower, or less important parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you reach the village green, the street branches into two .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了村中心的公共草地﹐这条街就分岔成两条路。

Sense.DEF: if a road, passage,railway etc branches off from another road etc, it separates from it and goes in a different direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a passage branching off from the main tunnel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从主隧道岔开的通道

Sense.DEF: to leave a main road
Sense.TRAN: 离开主路[干线]﹐走入岔道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We branched off from the main road and turned down a country lane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们离开干道﹐转入一条乡村小路。

Sense.DEF: to start talking about something different from what you were talking about before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Then the conversation branched off into a discussion about movies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接着谈话转入对电影的讨论。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something different from the work or activities that you normally do
Sense.TRAN: 扩大〔工作﹑活动〕范围﹐开辟新的领域
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be afraid to branch out and try something new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要害怕另辟蹊径﹐尝试新的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profits were falling until the bookstore branched out into selling CDs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书店扩大经营范围出售光盘之前，利润一直在下降。

Sense.DEF: a type of product made by a particular company, that has a particular name or design

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What brand of detergent do you use?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用什么牌子的洗涤剂？

GramExa.GLOSS: the brand that sells the most

Sense.EXAMPLE: products which lack a strong brand image
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏鲜明品牌形象的产品

GramExa.GLOSS: the tendency to always buy a particular brand
a product made and sold by a particular store

Sense.DEF: a particular type of humour, politics, religion etc
Sense.TRAN: 某种类型的幽默/政治/宗教等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strange macabre brand of humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种怪异而可怕的幽默

Sense.DEF: a mark made or burned on a farm animal’s skin that shows who it belongs to
to describe someone or something as a very bad type of person or thing, often unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 给…加上〔往往是不公的〕恶名

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t brand all football supporters as hooligans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能给所有的足球迷都加上流氓的恶名。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Stealing that money has branded Jim for life – no one will trust him again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆偷了那笔钱﹐就一辈子背上了恶名﹐再也没有人信任他。

Sense.DEF: to burn a mark onto something, especially a farm animal, in order to show who it belongs to
Sense.TRAN: 给〔牲畜〕打烙印〔以标明其主人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each cow was branded with the ranch’s logo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每头母牛都烙上了该牧场的标记。

Sense.DEF: to give a name to a product or group of products so that they can be easily recognized by their name or design
a branded product is made by a well-known company and has the company’s name on it
a practice that involves a company giving a group of their products the same brand name, helping this name to become well-known
a piece of metal that is heated and used for burning marks on cattle or sheep, to show who they belong to
to wave something around in a dangerous or threatening way, especially a weapon
Sense.TRAN: 〔危险或气势汹汹地〕挥舞〔尤指武器〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A man leapt out, brandishing a kitchen knife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个男人挥着一把菜刀跳了出来。

Sense.DEF: the name given to a product by the company that makes it
new and not yet used
Sense.TRAN: 全新的﹐崭新的﹐未用过的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brand-new car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆崭新的汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: His clothes looked brand-new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衣服看上去是全新的。

Sense.DEF: a strong alcoholic drink made from wine, or a glass of this drink

a mixture of butter, sugar, and brandy, usually eaten with
Christmas pudding
Sense.TRAN: 白兰地黄油〔由黄油加糖和白兰地做成﹐通常和圣诞布丁一起吃〕

Sense.DEF: behaving too confidently and speaking too loudly – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 无礼的﹐自以为是的﹔急躁的﹐莽撞的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: brash journalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嚣张的新闻记者

Sense.DEF: a brash building, place, or object attracts attention by being very colourful, large, exciting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting was bold, brash, and modern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画大胆﹑醒目﹐而且现代。

Sense.DEF:
a very hard bright yellow metal that is a mixture of
copper
and
zinc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old brass bedstead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式黄铜床架

Subsense.DEF:
musical instruments that are made of metal, such as the
trumpet
and the
trombone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: brass instruments
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铜管乐器

Subsense.DEF:
the people in an
orchestra
or band who play musical instruments that are made of metal

PIC.HEADING: BRASS INSTRUMENTS 铜管乐器
PIC.PICCONTENT: valve 阀键；cornet 短号；mouthpiece 吹口；French horn 法国号；tuba 大号；trombone 长号；trumpet 小号

Sense.DEF: an object made of brass, usually with a design cut into it, or several brass objects
to start talking about the most important facts or details of something
Sense.TRAN: 言归正传﹐谈实质性问题﹐谈正事

Sense.DEF: people who hold the most important positions
used to say that it is very cold
money

a band consisting mostly of brass musical instruments such as
trumpet s
, horns etc
annoyed
a cheap informal restaurant, usually serving French food

a
bra
a set of connected metal rings worn over a person’s fingers, used as a weapon
a woman who is brassy is too loud, confident, or brightly dressed
Sense.TRAN: 〔妇女〕吵吵嚷嚷的﹐说话无礼的﹔打扮艳丽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drunken brassy nightclub singer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个喝醉酒﹑吵吵嚷嚷的夜总会歌手

Sense.DEF:
sounding hard and loud like the sound made by a
brass
musical instrument
Sense.TRAN: 声音像铜管乐器的﹐响亮刺耳的

Sense.DEF:
having a bright gold-yellow colour like
brass
a badly behaved child
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spoiled brat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个被宠坏的顽劣儿童

Sense.DEF: a child whose family moves often, because one or both parents work for the army, navy etc
Sense.TRAN: 陆军/海军/军队等的军中小鬼〔指父母一方或双方在军队工作﹑经常随父母迁居的孩子〕

Sense.DEF: a type of German sausage
behaviour that is deliberately intended to make other people believe you are brave and confident
Sense.TRAN: 逞能﹐逞强的行为﹐虚张声势
Sense.EXAMPLE: youthful bravado
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人的逞强行为

Subsense.DEF: dealing with danger, pain, or difficult situations with courage and confidence
Subsense.EXAMPLE: brave soldiers
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇敢的士兵
Subsense.EXAMPLE: her brave fight against cancer
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她与癌症的勇敢搏斗

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is brave of sb (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was brave of you to speak in front of all those people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你很勇敢﹐能在那么多人面前说话。

Subsense.DEF: brave people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Today we remember the brave who died in the last war.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我们要纪念在上一场战争中牺牲的勇士。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite their captain’s brave performance, Arsenal lost 2–1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管队长表现出色﹐但阿森纳队还是以1比2告负。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the brave efforts of the medical staff to save his life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医务人员为挽救他的生命所作的极大努力

Sense.DEF: to pretend that you are happy when you are really very upset
a situation or a way of doing something that is new and exciting and meant to improve people’s lives
Sense.TRAN: 美好的新世界〔指旨在改善人们生活的美好新事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the brave new world of digital television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字电视的美好新世界

Exponent.DEF: showing that you are not afraid to do things that other people find dangerous or difficult
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think he was incredibly brave to do a parachute jump.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他敢跳伞真是胆大惊人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a brave attempt to change the system
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 改变体制的勇敢尝试

Exponent.DEF: very brave – used especially about someone fighting for what they believe in, or fighting against a disease
Exponent.TRAN: 勇敢的〔尤指为信仰而战或与疾病抗争的人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a courageous speech
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇敢的演说
Exponent.EXAMPLE: her courageous fight against cancer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她与癌症的勇敢斗争

Exponent.DEF: brave and willing to take a lot of risks
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a daring escape from a prison camp
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大胆的越狱行动
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a daring fighter pilot
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无畏的战斗机飞行员

Exponent.DEF: willing to make difficult decisions or say what you think, even though it may involve risks
Exponent.TRAN: 果敢的﹐大胆的〔指不顾风险作出艰难决定或说出自己的想法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a bold move to set up his own company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自己成立公司是一个大胆的举动。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was very bold in criticizing the leadership.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很大胆﹐敢于批评领导层。

Exponent.DEF: willing to do dangerous things or go to dangerous places
Exponent.TRAN: 勇敢的﹐不怕艰险的〔指敢于做危险的事或去危险的地方〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an intrepid traveller
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个无畏的旅行者
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We sent our intrepid reporter to find out what is happening.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们派了勇敢无畏的记者去了解情况。

Exponent.DEF: used about someone who enjoys going to new places and doing new, possibly dangerous, things
Exponent.TRAN: 爱探险的﹐有冒险精神的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More adventurous visitors can go skiing or snowboarding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 更喜欢冒险的游客可以去玩滑雪或单板滑雪。

Exponent.DEF: not afraid of anything or anyone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fearless campaigner for human rights
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名无畏的人权斗士

Exponent.DEF: very brave and admired by many people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: heroic rescuers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英勇的救援人员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Despite heroic efforts to save him, he died.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管人们奋勇挽救他﹐他还是身亡了。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to take the train to work rather than brave the traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定乘火车上班﹐不和拥挤的交通较劲。

GramExa.GLOSS: go out in bad weather
GramExa.EXAMPLE: More than 100 people braved the elements and attended the rally.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一百多人不顾天气恶劣参加了集会。

Sense.DEF: to deal bravely with something that is frightening or difficult
a young fighting man from a Native American tribe

an advanced society of the future, in which many people seem to have easy and pleasant lives but in fact nobody has any freedom. This type of society is described in the novel Brave New World by Aldous Huxley. The phrase was first used in Shakespeare's play The Tempest .
Sense.TRAN: 美丽新世界〔源于奥尔德斯·赫胥黎的同名小说﹐指未来的先进社会﹐其中许多人看似生活幸福﹐实则全无自由〕

Sense.DEF: actions, behaviour, or an attitude that shows courage and confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: an act of great bravery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常勇敢的行为

Sense.DEF: used to show your approval when someone, especially a performer, has done something very well
Sense.TRAN: 好〔尤指表演精彩时的喝彩声〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bravo! Encore!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好极了！ 再来一个！

Sense.DEF: great skill shown in the way you perform, write, paint etc, especially when you do something very difficult
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出﹑写作﹑绘画等中表现出来的〕精湛技艺
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bravura performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技艺高超的表演

Sense.DEF: a noisy quarrel or fight among a group of people, especially in a public place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在公共场所的〕争吵﹐斗殴﹐闹事
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drunken brawl in the street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上的酒后斗殴

Sense.DEF: to quarrel or fight in a noisy way, especially in a public place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在公共场所〕争吵﹐打斗﹐闹事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fans brawled outside the stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们在体育馆外面闹事。

Sense.DEF: physical strength, especially when compared with intelligence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mina has the brains, I have the brawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米娜有头脑﹐我有体力。

Sense.DEF: meat from a pig’s head that has been boiled and pressed in a container and is often served in thin flat pieces
very large and strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: His brawny arms glistened with sweat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强壮的胳膊上有亮晶晶的汗水。

Sense.DEF:
if a
donkey
brays, it makes a loud sound
if someone brays, they laugh or talk in a loud, slightly annoying way
used to describe a person, or the actions of a person, who is not embarrassed about behaving in a wrong or immoral way
Sense.EXAMPLE: her brazen admission that she was cheating on him
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恬不知耻地承认自己对他不忠

Sense.DEF: having a shiny yellow colour
to deal with a situation that is difficult or embarrassing for you by appearing to be confident rather than ashamed
Sense.TRAN: 〔面对困难或尴尬的处境时〕硬着头皮﹐厚着脸皮
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew she could either admit the truth or brazen it out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心里明白﹐她要么承认事实﹐要么厚着脸皮死撑到底。

Sense.DEF: doing something openly, without showing or feeling any shame
Sense.EXAMPLE: She smiled at him brazenly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恬不知耻地朝着他笑了笑。

Sense.DEF: a metal container that holds a fire and is used to keep people warm outside
a type of curved nut that has a hard shell
relating to Brazil or its people
someone from Brazil

a beauty treatment in which most of a woman's
pubic hair
is removed, leaving just a small strip
Sense.TRAN: 巴西式（热蜡）除毛〔一种美体方法﹐去除女性的大部分阴毛﹐只留细细的一条〕

Sense.DEF: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This was a clear breach of the 1994 Trade Agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这显然违反了1994年的《贸易协定》。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sued the company for breach of contract .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们起诉这家公司违反合同。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a breach of professional duty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失职

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was clearly in breach of the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明显违反了法律。

Sense.DEF: a serious disagreement between people, groups, or countries

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain did not want to risk a breach with the US over sanctions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国不想为制裁问题去冒与美国决裂的风险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What had caused the sudden breach between Henry and his son?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么事情让亨利和他儿子突然闹翻的？

Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to help heal the breach between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想帮助他们修复破裂的关系。

Sense.DEF: an action in which someone does something that people have trusted them not to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: We regard the publication of this information as a serious breach of trust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认为公开这一信息就是严重的失信。

Sense.DEF: an action in which someone manages to learn secret information or manages to get into a place that is guarded
Sense.EXAMPLE: There had been a major breach of security at the airbase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空军基地发生了一宗严重违反安全规则的事故。

Sense.DEF: the crime of making too much noise or fighting in a public place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was arrested and charged with breach of the peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被警方拘捕并以扰乱治安罪起诉。

Sense.DEF: a hole made in a wall that is intended to protect a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a breach in the castle wall
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡墙上的缺口

Sense.DEF: to help by doing someone else’s job or work when they are unable to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks for stepping into the breach last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你上个星期代理我的工作。

Sense.DEF: to break a law, rule, or agreement
Sense.TRAN: 违背﹐违反〔法律﹑规定﹑协议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company accused him of breaching his contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司控告他违反合同。

Sense.DEF: to break a hole in a wall that is intended to protect a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The storm had breached the sea wall in two places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风暴在海堤上造成两处缺口。

Sense.DEF: a type of food made from flour and water that is mixed together and then baked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like some bread with your soup?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喝汤时要吃点面包吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loaf of brown bread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条黑面包
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piece of bread and butter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块黄油面包

PIC.HEADING: BREAD 面包
PIC.PICCONTENT: loaf of bread 一条面包；bagels 面包圈；bread rolls 小圆面包；toast 烤面包片；sliced bread 切片面包；croissant 羊角面包；dough 生面团；pitta bread BrE【英】/pita bread AmE【美】口袋面包；baguettes 法式长棍面包

Sense.DEF: the work that provides you with most of the money that you need in order to live
Sense.TRAN: 你的/某人的生计[谋生手段]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Writing is my bread and butter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写作是我谋生的手段。

Sense.LEXUNIT: know which side your bread is buttered on
Sense.DEF: to know which people to be nice to in order to get advantages for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 知道该讨好谁才对自己有利

Sense.DEF: money

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eat the bread while it’s nice and fresh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 趁着新鲜把面包吃了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: hard and no longer fresh
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This bread’s stale – shall I throw it away?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这面包不新鲜了﹐我把它扔了吧？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: having a hard crust that is nice to eat
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Serve the soup with crusty bread.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤和脆面包一起上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: bread made with flour that contains all of the grain

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can I have another slice of bread?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以再吃一片面包吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s gone to buy a loaf of bread.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去买面包了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We usually make our own bread.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们通常自己做面包。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Could you cut some bread?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你切一些面包好吗？

Sense.DEF: bread-and-butter questions are very important basic ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: bread-and-butter political issues such as jobs and housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就业和住房等关乎民生的政治问题

Sense.DEF: bread-and-butter work is work that is not very exciting but provides you with most of the money that you need in order to live
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作〕赖以养家糊口的﹐赖以为生的

Sense.DEF: a basket in which you keep or serve bread
the part of a country or area that provides most of its food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Zambia could be the breadbasket of Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞比亚可能成为非洲重要的产粮区。

Sense.DEF: a container that you keep bread in so that it stays fresh
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来保持面包新鲜的〕面包箱[盒]

Sense.DEF: a wooden board on which you cut bread

a
bread bin
very small pieces of bread that are left after cutting bread, or are used in cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coat the fish in breadcrumbs and fry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鱼裹上面包糠油炸。

Sense.DEF: covered in breadcrumbs before cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: breaded plaice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裹有面包屑的鲽鱼

Sense.DEF: a large tropical fruit that looks like bread when it is cooked
a very low level of income that allows people to eat but not have any extra things
Sense.TRAN: 贫困线﹐贫困户的收入水平
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family living on the breadline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个生活在贫困线上的家庭

Sense.DEF: the distance from one side of something to the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the breadth of the river
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 河宽

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat measured 15 feet in length and 4 feet in breadth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条船长15英尺﹐宽4英尺。

Sense.DEF: the quality of including a lot of different people, things, or ideas

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job wasn’t giving him the breadth of experience he wanted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个工作没有让他获得他想要的多方面的经验。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His breadth of knowledge was amazing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他学识渊博令人惊叹。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a politician known for his breadth of vision
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以远见卓识闻名的政治家

Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to provide more breadth in the college curriculum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要扩大学院课程的范围。

Sense.DEF: the member of a family who earns the money to support the others

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I had to break a window to get into the house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t lean on the fence like that – you’ll break it!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要那样靠在篱笆上——会把它弄断的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He broke the biscuit in half and handed one piece to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把饼干掰成两半﹐递了一块给我。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Break the chocolate into small pieces and melt it over a gentle heat.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把巧克力破成小块﹐放在文火上化开。

Subsense.DEF: if something breaks, it separates into two or more pieces
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He kept pulling at the rope until it broke.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直拉到绳子，直到把它拉断。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The frames are made of plastic and they tend to break quite easily.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些框架是塑料做的﹐很容易碎裂。

PIC.HEADING: BREAK 打破
PIC.PICCONTENT: smash 打碎；snap 折断；split 劈开；shatter 砸碎

Sense.DEF: to damage a bone in your body by making it crack or split
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell downstairs and broke her hip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从楼梯上摔下来﹐髋部骨折。

Subsense.DEF: to damage a machine so that it does not work properly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t mess about with my camera – you’ll break it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别乱动我的照相机﹐你会把它弄坏的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s broken the TV.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把电视机弄坏了。

Subsense.DEF: if a machine breaks, it stops working properly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The washing machine’s broken again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗衣机又坏了。

Sense.DEF: to disobey a rule or law
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re breaking the law by employing such young children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们雇用这么小的孩子是违法的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you break the rules , you will be punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违反规定要受到惩罚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cameras catch motorists who break the speed limit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄像头会拍下超速的司机。

Sense.DEF: to not do something that you have promised to do or signed an agreement to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never break my promises .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从不食言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You betrayed me. You broke your word .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你出卖了我﹐你说话不算数。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was worried that he might be breaking his contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他担心自己可能会违约。

Sense.DEF: to stop for a short time in order to have a rest or eat something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall we break for lunch now?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在停下来吃午饭好吗？

Sense.DEF: to stop something from continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to break the cycle of poverty and crime in the inner cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要打破旧城区里贫困和犯罪的恶性循环。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We took turns driving, in order to try and break the monotony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们轮流开车，免得乏味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: New talks will begin on Monday in an effort to break the deadlock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为打破僵局，星期一将重启会谈。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel that they have been completely defeated and they cannot continue working or living
Sense.EXAMPLE: Losing his business nearly broke him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意亏本几乎将他击垮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t give in. I won’t be broken by him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不服输﹐我不会被他击垮的。

Sense.DEF: to damage an organization so badly that it no longer has any power
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government succeeded in breaking the unions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府成功地瓦解了工会。

Sense.DEF:
when the day or the
dawn
breaks, the sky gets light
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dawn was breaking by the time we arrived home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到家的时候天蒙蒙亮。

Sense.DEF: if a storm breaks, it begins
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were keen to get back to the hotel before the storm broke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们急于赶在暴风雨来临之前回到宾馆。

Sense.DEF: if the weather breaks, it suddenly changes and becomes cold or wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: The following day the weather broke and we had ten days of solid rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天天气突变﹐一连下了十天的雨。

Sense.DEF: when waves break, they fall onto the land at the edge of the water
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat and watched the waves breaking on the shore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐着看波涛拍击海岸。

Subsense.DEF: when a boy’s voice breaks, it becomes lower and starts to sound like a man’s voice
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was fifteen, and his voice was just beginning to break.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他15岁﹐正开始变声。

Subsense.DEF: if your voice breaks, it does not sound smooth because you are feeling strong emotions
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her voice broke as she told us what had happened.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向我们诉说发生的一切时﹐声音都变了。

Subsense.DEF: if news about an important event breaks, it becomes known
Subsense.EXAMPLE: News of his resignation broke yesterday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天传出了他辞职的消息。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The minister has refused to give any interviews since the scandal broke.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从丑闻传出以后﹐部长就拒绝接受采访。

Subsense.DEF: if you break unpleasant news to someone, you tell it to them
Subsense.TRAN: 告诉〔某人不愉快的消息〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know how I was going to break the news to my mother.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道该怎样把这个消息告诉母亲。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The doctor finally broke it to me that there was no cure.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生最后终于和我明说﹐这个病没法治愈。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something that you do regularly, especially something that you should not do
Sense.TRAN: 改掉某习惯〔尤指坏习惯〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new drug which helps smokers to break their habit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助吸烟者戒烟的一种新药

Sense.DEF: to do something even faster or even better than the previous best time, amount etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to break the 10,000-metres world record
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打破10,000米世界记录的努力

Sense.DEF: to stop somewhere for a short time during a long journey
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to break our journey in Oxford.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定中途在牛津停留。

Sense.DEF: to make someone very unhappy by ending a relationship with them or doing something that upsets them a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: He broke my heart when he left me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开我时﹐我的心都碎了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll break your father’s heart if you tell him you’re giving up college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你告诉父亲你不上大学了﹐他会很伤心的。

Sense.DEF:
to force workers to end a
strike
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has threatened to bring in the army to break the 10-month-old strike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府威胁要调派军队来结束这场历时十个月的罢工。

Sense.DEF: to end a relationship with a person or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US has now broken all diplomatic links with the regime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国现已和这个政权断绝了所有外交关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes it is necessary to break family ties in order to protect the child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候为了保护孩子，必须切断他和家人的联系。

Sense.DEF: to cut the skin on your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their teeth are sharp enough to break the skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们牙齿锋利﹐足以咬破皮肤。

Sense.DEF: to finish the main or worst part of something
Sense.TRAN: 完成某事物的主要部分﹔攻克某事物的难关
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we’ve broken the back of the job now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们现在已经把这工作最难的部分完成了。

Sense.DEF: to cost a lot of money, or more money than you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new hard drive doesn’t have to break the bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个新的硬盘驱动器要不了多少钱。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt someone and stop them from being able to continue thinking or talking about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The slightest sound would break his concentration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍有一点动静就会分散他的注意力。

Sense.DEF: to end a period of silence by talking or making a noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The silence was broken by a loud scream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声尖叫打破了寂静。

Sense.DEF: to destroy someone’s feeling of determination
Sense.TRAN: 摧毁某人的意志﹐挫某人的锐气
Sense.EXAMPLE: They could not break her spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们摧毁不了她的意志。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spirit of our soldiers will never be broken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们战士的意志永远不会被摧垮。

Sense.DEF: to take away someone’s position of power or control
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last the power of the Church was finally broken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐教会的权力终于被削弱了。

Sense.DEF: to make people feel more friendly and willing to talk to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam’s arrival broke the ice and people began to talk and laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆的到来打破了沉默﹐大家开始又说又笑起来。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in understanding something that is written in a secret way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists worked day and night to break the code.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了破译密码﹐科学家们日夜工作。

Sense.DEF: to allow gas to escape from your bottom, making a noise and an unpleasant smell
to win a game in tennis when your opponent is starting the game by hitting the ball first
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球中〕破（某人的）发球（局）得分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hewitt broke serve twice in the second set.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休伊特在第二盘中两次破对方发球局得分。

Sense.DEF: used to wish someone luck, especially just before they perform on stage
Sense.TRAN: 祝你成功﹐祝你好运〔尤用于在某人上台表演前〕

Exponent.DEF: to damage something and make it separate into pieces, for example by dropping it or hitting it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Careful you don’t break the chair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心别把椅子弄坏。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He broke his leg.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的腿摔断了。

Exponent.DEF: to break something with a lot of force
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A policeman smashed his camera.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名警察砸碎了他的照相机。

Exponent.DEF: to break something into two pieces, making a loud noise – used especially about long thin objects
Exponent.TRAN: 啪地折断〔尤用于指细长的物体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He snapped the sticks in two.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他啪的一声折断了枝条。

Exponent.DEF: to separate something into two pieces along a straight line
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Using a sharp knife, split the melon in half.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用快刀把瓜切成两半。

Exponent.DEF: to damage a bone, especially so that a line appears on the surface
Exponent.TRAN: 使断裂﹐使折断〔尤指骨骼等表面有裂痕〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I fell over and fractured my wrist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我摔倒了﹐手腕骨折。

Exponent.DEF: to damage paper or cloth by pulling it so that it separates into pieces
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tore up the letter and put it in the bin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把信撕碎后扔进了垃圾筒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tore my jacket.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把外套给扯破了。

Exponent.DEF: to become damaged and separate into pieces
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Plastic breaks quite easily.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料很容易碎裂。

Exponent.DEF: to break after being hit with a lot of force
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bowl smashed as it hit the floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 碗打在地上摔碎了。

Exponent.DEF: to break into a lot of small pieces
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The glass shattered all over the pavement.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃在人行道上碎得到处都是。

Exponent.DEF: if something cracks, a line appears on the surface, which means that it could later break into separate pieces
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ice was starting to crack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰开始裂了。

Exponent.DEF: if a tyre, balloon, pipe etc bursts, it gets a hole and air or liquid suddenly comes out of it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She blew up the balloon until it burst.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吹着气球﹐直到把它吹爆。

Exponent.DEF: to break in a straight line
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The damp had caused the wood to split.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为潮湿，木头开裂了。

Exponent.DEF: to break into a powder or a lot of small pieces
Exponent.TRAN: 碎裂﹐崩裂〔成粉末或碎屑〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cork just crumbled in my hand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 软木塞就在我手中碎裂了。

Sense.DEF: to leave a group or political party and form another group, usually because of a disagreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因意见不合而从某个团体或政党〕脱离出去
Sense.EXAMPLE: More than 30 Labour MPs broke away to form a new left-wing party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三十多名工党议员脱离工党﹐成立了一个新的左翼党派。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They broke away from the national union and set up their own local organization.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们脱离了全国工会﹐自己成立了一个地方组织。

Sense.DEF: to leave your home, family, or job and become independent

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt the need to break away from home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得有必要从家里出来。

Sense.DEF: to move away from someone who is holding you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She started crying and tried to break away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大叫起来﹐想要挣脱开去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She broke away from him and ran to the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她甩开他，跑到门口。

Sense.DEF: to move away from other people in a race or game
Sense.EXAMPLE: Radcliffe broke away 200 metres before the finish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉德克利夫在距终点200米处甩开了其他对手。

Sense.DEF: to become loose and no longer attached to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Part of the plane’s wing had broken away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机翼的有些地方脱开了。

Sense.DEF: if a car or machine breaks down, it stops working
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car broke down just north of Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车就在巴黎以北的地方抛锚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The printing machines are always breaking down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印刷机老是出故障。

Sense.DEF: to fail or stop working in a successful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Negotiations broke down after only two days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判只进行了两天就破裂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I left London when my marriage broke down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我婚姻破裂以后就离开了伦敦。

Sense.DEF: if you break down a door, you hit it so hard that it breaks and falls to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police had to break down the door to get into the flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方只得把门撞开，进入公寓。

Sense.DEF: to change or remove something that prevents people from working together and having a successful relationship with each other
Sense.TRAN: 消除﹐驱除〔人与人之间的隔阂等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting young people together will help to break down the barriers between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把年轻人聚集起来可以帮助他们消除彼此之间的隔阂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes a long time to break down prejudices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消除偏见需要很长时间。

Sense.DEF: if a substance breaks down, or something breaks it down, it changes as a result of a chemical process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Food is broken down in the stomach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物在胃里分解。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bacteria are added to help break down the sewage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下水道中加入了细菌，帮助分解污物。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to stop yourself crying, especially in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在公共场合〕禁不住哭出来
Sense.EXAMPLE: He broke down and cried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他情绪崩溃﹐哭了出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She broke down in tears when she heard the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到这个消息禁不住泪流满面。

Sense.DEF: to separate something into smaller parts so that it is easier to do or understand
Sense.TRAN: 拆分﹐把…分成若干部分〔以方便做或理解〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He showed us the whole dance, then broke it down so that we could learn it more easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我们演示了整段舞蹈﹐然后拆分开来方便我们学习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question can be broken down into two parts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题可以分为两个部分。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly run towards something, especially in order to escape from someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为指想避开某人〕突然跑向﹐冲向
Sense.EXAMPLE: He broke for the door, but the guards got there before he did.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向门口冲去﹐但是警卫先他一步赶到了那里。

Sense.DEF: to enter a building by using force, in order to steal something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thieves broke in and stole £10,000 worth of computer equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼破门而入﹐盗走了价值10,000英镑的计算机设备。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt someone when they are speaking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to break in on his telephone conversation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想打断他的通话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad would occasionally break in with an amusing comment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸时不时插进一句有趣的评论。

Sense.DEF: to make new shoes or boots less stiff and more comfortable by wearing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went for a walk to break in my new boots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我出去走了走﹐好让新靴子合脚。

Sense.DEF: to help a person get used to a certain way of behaving or working
Sense.TRAN: 使某人适应〔某种行为或工作方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s quite new to the job, so we’re still breaking her in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她才做这份工作不久﹐所以我们还在带着她熟悉业务。

Sense.DEF: to teach a young horse to carry people on its back
Sense.EXAMPLE: We break the horses in when they’re about two years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小马两岁左右的时候，我们就开始训练它们驮人。

Sense.DEF: to enter a building or car by using force, in order to steal something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone broke into my car and stole the radio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人撬了我的车﹐把收音机偷走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her house was broken into last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她家上个星期遭窃了。

Sense.DEF: to become involved in a new job or business activity
Sense.TRAN: 打入﹐进入﹐参与〔新的工作或行业〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made an attempt to break into journalism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图进入新闻界。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a profession that is very hard to break into.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个行业很难挤进去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many British firms have failed in their attempts to break into the American market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多英国公司试图打入美国市场﹐但都失败了。

Sense.DEF: to start to spend money that you did not want to spend
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to break into my savings unless I have to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非迫不得已﹐我不想动用自己的积蓄。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start running
Sense.EXAMPLE: He broke into a run as he came round the corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走到拐角处，突然拔腿就跑。

Sense.LEXUNIT: break into a smile/a song/applause etc
Sense.DEF: to suddenly start smiling, singing etc
Sense.TRAN: 突然笑起来/唱起来/鼓起掌来等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face broke into a smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上突然绽放出笑容。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience broke into loud applause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众中爆发出热烈的掌声。

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop having a bad habit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to break yourself of the habit of eating between meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量改掉正餐之间吃东西的习惯。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly stop talking
Sense.EXAMPLE: She started to speak, then broke off while a waitress served us coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始说了起来 ﹐后来服务员给我们上咖啡﹐她就打住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He broke off in mid-sentence to shake hands with the new arrivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他话说了一半﹐停下来和新到的人握手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I broke off the conversation and answered the phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我中断谈话去接电话。

Sense.DEF: to end a relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: She broke off their engagement only a few weeks before they were due to be married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在他们将要结婚的前几个星期﹐她取消了婚约。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US has broken off diplomatic relations with the regime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国已经和这个政权断绝了外交关系。

Sense.DEF: if something breaks off, or if you break it off, it comes loose and is no longer attached to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the car’s wing mirrors had broken off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车上的一块后视镜已经脱落。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He broke off a piece of bread.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他掰下一块面包。

Sense.DEF: if something unpleasant such as a fire, fight, or war breaks out, it starts to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was still living in London when the war broke out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争爆发的时候我还住在伦敦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does everyone know what to do if a fire breaks out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果发生火灾﹐大家都知道该怎么办吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fighting broke out between demonstrators and the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行示威者和警方发生了冲突。

Sense.DEF: to escape from a prison

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three men have broken out of a top-security jail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名男子从一所戒备极其森严的监狱逃跑了。

Sense.DEF: to change the way you live because you feel bored

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt the need to break out of her daily routine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得必须从日常生活中解脱出来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: break out in spots/a rash/a sweat etc
Sense.DEF: if you break out in spots etc, they appear on your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: I broke out in a painful rash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我出了疹子﹐很痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My whole body broke out in a sweat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我浑身冒汗。

Sense.DEF: to manage to get past or through something that is in your way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several demonstrators broke through the barriers despite warnings from the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几名游行示威者不顾警方警告﹐冲破了路障。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After hours of fierce fighting, rebels broke through and captured the capital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过数小时的激战﹐叛军突破防线﹐占领了首都。

Sense.DEF: if the sun breaks through, you can see it when you could not see it before because there were clouds
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun broke through at around lunch time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约午饭时分﹐太阳破云而出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun soon broke through the mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久﹐太阳拨开云雾出来了。

Sense.DEF: to manage to do something successfully when there is a difficulty that is preventing you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a very talented young actor who’s just ready to break through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一名天赋很高﹑正待破茧而出的青年演员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is possible that at this election some of the minority parties might succeed in breaking through into parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这次选举中，可能会有一些少数党派成功杀入议会。

Sense.DEF: if something breaks up, or if you break it up, it breaks into a lot of small pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems that the plane just broke up in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机似乎突然就在空中解体了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Use a fork to break up the soil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用叉子松松土。

Sense.DEF: to separate something into several smaller parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are plans to break the company up into several smaller independent companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有计划要把这家公司分拆成几家独立的小公司。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need a few trees and bushes to break up the lawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要种些树和灌木把草坪分隔开来。

Sense.DEF: to stop a fight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three policemen were needed to break up the fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有要三名警察才能制止这场斗殴。

Sense.DEF: to make people leave a place where they have been meeting or protesting
Sense.TRAN: 驱散〔集会或抗议的人群〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Government soldiers broke up the demonstration .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府军驱散了示威人群。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police moved in to break up the meeting .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察进来驱散集会。

Sense.DEF: if a marriage, group of people, or relationship breaks up, the people in it separate and do not live or work together any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lost his job and his marriage broke up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他丢了工作﹐婚姻也破裂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple broke up last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对情侣去年分手了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many bands break up because of personality clashes between the musicians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多乐队因为音乐人之间性格之间的冲突而解散。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Has Sam really broken up with Lucy?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山姆真的和露茜分手了吗？

Sense.DEF: if a meeting or party breaks up, people start to leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party didn’t break up until after midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会直到过了半夜才结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting broke up without any agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场会议无果而终。

Sense.DEF: when a school breaks up, it closes for a holiday
Sense.EXAMPLE: School breaks up next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校下个星期放假。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When do you break up for Easter?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们复活节什么时候开始放假？

Sense.DEF: to make someone laugh by saying or doing something funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: He breaks me up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让我笑破了肚皮！

Sense.DEF: to leave a group of people or an organization, especially because you have had a disagreement with them
Sense.TRAN: 与…断绝关系﹐与…决裂﹐脱离
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had broken with her family years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她多年前就和家里断绝了关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They broke with the Labour Party and set up a new party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们脱离工党﹐成立了一个新的党派。

Sense.DEF: to stop following old customs and do something in a completely different way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now is the time to break with the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是该和过去告别的时候了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His work broke with tradition in many ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品在很多地方打破了传统。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when you stop working in order to rest, eat etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have a short break for lunch, then start again at two o'clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们稍微休息一下吃午饭﹐两点钟再开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s take a ten-minute break .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们休息十分钟吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d worked for ten hours without a break .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经连续工作十小时了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll go shopping during my lunch break .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在午休时间去买点东西。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when you stop doing something before you start again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wanted a break from university life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想暂时从大学里休学。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided to take a career break when she had children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有了孩子﹐决定暂时放下工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a welcome break in my normal routine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使我暂时摆脱平常生活的好机会

Sense.DEF: a short holiday
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was beginning to feel that I needed a break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始觉得自己需要休假了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We flew off for a week’s break in Spain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们飞往西班牙度假一个星期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re offering weekend breaks in Paris for only £100.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在推出周末巴黎游﹐只要100英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you looking forward to the summer break?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你期待放暑假吗？

Sense.DEF: the time during the school day when classes stop and teachers and students can rest, eat, play etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll speak to you at break.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课间休息的时候我再找你谈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They get together with their friends at break time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课间休息的时候他们就和朋友聚在一起。

Sense.DEF: a pause for advertisements during a television or radio programme
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播节目中的〕广告时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Join us again after the break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告之后请继续收看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be back with more after a short break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小段广告之后精彩继续。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when something stops happening before it starts again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll go for a walk if there’s a break in the rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨停了我们就去散散步。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Latecomers will be admitted at a suitable break in the performance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到者须等演出中途适当的间歇方可入场。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She waited for a break in the conversation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她等着谈话暂停。

Sense.EXAMPLE:
There was no sign of a break in the weather
an improvement in bad weather
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气没有好转的迹象。

Sense.DEF: a time when you leave a person or group, or end a relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted a clean break so that I could restart my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想彻底了断﹐开始新的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was years before I plucked up enough courage to make the break and leave him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年以后我才鼓足勇气分手﹐离开了他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was beginning to regret his break with the Labour Party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始后悔脱离工党。

Sense.DEF: a space or hole in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We crawled through a break in the hedge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从树篱的一个缺口爬了过去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sun shone through a break in the clouds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳光透过云层的缝隙照射下来。

Sense.DEF: a sudden or unexpected chance to do something that allows you to become successful in your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are hundreds of young musicians out there looking for their first break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许许多多的年轻音乐人在寻找崭露头角的机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got his first big break in 1998.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1998年他得到了第一次大好机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lucky break
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好运气

Sense.DEF: the place where a bone in your body has broken
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s quite a bad break, which will take several months to heal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骨折很严重﹐需要好几个月才能痊愈。

Sense.DEF: a situation in a game of tennis in which you win a game when your opponent is starting the game by hitting the ball first
Sense.EXAMPLE: She really needs a break of serve now if she wants to win this match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她要打赢这场比赛﹐现在非得破掉对方发球局才行。

Sense.DEF:
the number of points that a player wins when it is their turn to hit the ball in a game such as
snooker
a time when people stop following old customs and do something in a completely different way
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is time for a complete break with the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是时候彻底告别过去了。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start running towards something in order to escape from a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as the guard’s back was turned, they made a break for the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警卫一转身﹐他们就赶快向门口跑去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of the prisoners made a break for it but were soon recaptured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名囚犯越狱逃跑﹐但是很快就被抓了回来。

Sense.DEF: used when you want someone to stop doing or saying something that is annoying you
to stop being strict with someone so that a situation becomes easier for them
Sense.TRAN: 给某人一次机会﹐不苛求某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the kid a break. It’s only his second day on the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放过这小伙子吧﹐他干这活才第二天呢。

Sense.DEF: the time early in the morning when it starts getting light
made of a material such as glass or clay that breaks easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you pack breakable ornaments carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 易碎装饰品一定要仔细包装好。

Sense.DEF: something that someone breaks, especially when they must pay for it
Sense.TRAN: 损坏的物品〔尤指需要赔偿的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All breakages must be paid for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡有损坏﹐必须赔偿。

Sense.DEF: a breakaway group etc is formed by people who have left another group because of a disagreement
Sense.TRAN: 脱离原组织的集团/政党/运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a breakaway group of journalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群另立门户的新闻记者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of miners joined the breakaway union.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多矿工加入了这个独立出来的工会。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which some people leave a group or organization after a disagreement and start a new group or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He led a breakaway from the ruling party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带头脱离了执政党。

Sense.DEF: a change from the usual or accepted way of doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His work marks a breakaway from traditional building styles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品标志着对传统建筑风格的改变。

Sense.DEF:
a type of dance music that uses different patterns of sound based on one, two, or three beats in every
bar
group of notes into which music can be divided
, rather than the regular four beats in every bar
Sense.TRAN: 碎拍音乐〔一种舞曲﹐不按每小节四拍﹐而是一﹑二﹑三拍不等 〕

Sense.DEF: a type of dancing to popular music that involves a lot of jumping and rolling on the floor
the failure of a relationship or system
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系的〕破裂﹔〔体系的〕崩溃﹐失败

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He moved away after the breakdown of his marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他婚姻破裂以后就搬走了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A sudden rise in oil prices could lead to a breakdown of the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价暴涨会导致经济崩溃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a serious breakdown in relations between the two countries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国关系出现了重大裂痕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Family breakdown can lead to behavioural problems in children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭破裂会导致孩子的行为问题。

Sense.DEF: a serious medical condition in which someone becomes mentally ill and is unable to work or deal with ordinary situations in life
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was worried he might have a breakdown if he carried on working so hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心他这样辛苦地做下去﹐精神会崩溃的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two years ago he suffered a mental breakdown .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年前﹐他有过一次精神崩溃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had already had one nervous breakdown .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经有过一次神经崩溃。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a car or a piece of machinery breaks and stops working
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always carry a phone with you in case you have a breakdown on the motorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要随身带电话﹐以防汽车在高速公路上抛锚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a breakdown in the cooling system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷却系统故障

Sense.DEF: a list of all the separate parts of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you give us a breakdown of the figures?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我们看一下数字的明细好吗？

Sense.DEF: the changing of a substance into other substances
Sense.EXAMPLE: the breakdown of glucose in the body to release energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葡萄糖在体内分解释放出能量

Sense.DEF: a vehicle with special equipment that is used to pull a car that is broken and does not work to a place where it can be repaired
Sense.TRAN: 〔拖走抛锚汽车的〕牵引车﹐救险车

Sense.DEF: a large wave with a white top that rolls onto the shore
Sense.TRAN: 〔冲击岸边﹑带有白色浪头的〕巨浪﹐白浪

Sense.DEF: the level of business activity at which a company is making neither a profit nor a loss

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm should reach breakeven point after one year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年后这家公司应该会达到收支平衡。

Sense.DEF: the meal you have in the morning
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had bacon and eggs for breakfast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们早餐吃了熏肉鸡蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never eat breakfast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来不吃早饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
After a hearty breakfast
large breakfast
, we set out for a hike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们吃了一顿丰盛的早餐﹐然后出发去远足了。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a light breakfast
small breakfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单的早餐
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a working breakfast
a breakfast at which you talk about business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作早餐

Crossrefto.REFLEX: make a dog’s breakfast of sth

Sense.DEF: television programmes that are broadcast in the early part of the morning
an act of entering a building illegally and by force, especially in order to steal things
Sense.TRAN: 非法闯入﹔〔尤指〕入室行窃
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since the break-in we’ve had all our locks changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从发生入室盗窃案后﹐我们更换了所有的锁。

Sense.DEF: the crime of entering a building illegally and by force
extremely and often dangerously fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drove away at breakneck speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以惊险的速度开车疾驰而去。

Sense.DEF: an escape from a prison, especially one involving a lot of prisoners
an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists have made a major breakthrough in the treatment of cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家在癌症治疗方面取得了重大突破。

Sense.DEF: the act of ending a marriage or relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: the breakup of her marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她婚姻的破裂

Sense.DEF: the separation of a group, organization, or country into smaller parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the breakup of the Soviet Union
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏联的解体

Sense.DEF: a wall built out into the sea to protect the shore from the force of the waves
one of the two round raised parts on a woman’s chest that produce milk when she has a baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: These bras are specially designed for women with large breasts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些胸罩专为乳房丰满的女性设计。
Sense.EXAMPLE: breast milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母乳
Sense.EXAMPLE: breast cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乳腺癌

Sense.DEF: the part of your body between your neck and your stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dick cradled her photograph against his breast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪克把她的照片轻轻拥在胸前。

Sense.DEF: the front part of a bird’s body, below its neck
Sense.EXAMPLE: a robin with a red breast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红胸知更鸟

GramExa.EXAMPLE: red-breasted geese
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 红胸黑雁

Sense.DEF: meat that comes from the front part of the body of a bird such as a chicken
Sense.EXAMPLE: turkey breast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火鸡胸脯肉

Sense.DEF: the part of a jacket, shirt etc that covers the top part of your chest

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a clean breast of it/things
Sense.DEF: to admit that you have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 和盘托出﹐如实供认﹐坦白

Sense.DEF: where your feelings of sadness, love, anger, fear etc come from
Sense.EXAMPLE: a troubled breast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烦乱的心绪

Sense.DEF: to reach the top of a hill or slope
to push against something with your chest

a long flat bone in the front of your chest that is connected to the top seven pairs of
rib s
if a woman breast-feeds, she feeds her baby with milk from her breast rather than from a bottle
a leather or metal protective covering worn over the chest by soldiers during battles in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时士兵打仗穿的〕护胸甲﹐胸铠

Sense.DEF:
a pocket on the outside of a shirt or
jacket
, above the breast
a way of swimming in which you push your arms out and then bring them back in a circle towards you while bending your knees towards your body and then kicking out

Subsense.DEF: the air that you send out of your lungs when you breathe
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Leo could smell the wine on her breath.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利奥闻到她呼吸中有葡萄酒的味道。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let your breath out slowly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢地呼气。

Subsense.DEF: air that you take into your lungs
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When he reached the top of the stairs, his heart was pounding and he was gasping for breath.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爬到楼梯顶端时﹐心怦怦直跳﹐大口地喘着气。

Subsense.DEF: an amount of air that you take into your lungs
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Shaun took a deep breath and dived in.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖恩深深地吸了口气﹐然后一头扎入水中。

Sense.HINTTRAN:
Do not confuse the noun breath
breθ brɛθ
with the verb breathe
briːð brið
. 不要混淆名词breath和动词breathe: She took a breath and continued. 她吸了一口气﹐然后继续。 | I can’t breathe in here! 我在这里都没法呼吸！

Subsense.DEF: something that is new and different in a way you think is exciting and good
Subsense.TRAN: 一股新的气息﹐新的活力
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Osborne’s play brought a breath of fresh air to the British theatre.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥斯本的戏剧给英国戏剧带来一股新的气息。

Subsense.DEF: clean air outside, that you feel you need after being inside for a long time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m going outside for a breath of fresh air.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要出去透透气。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not going to happen soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system’s due for an update, but don’t hold your breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统应该要更新了﹐不过有你等的。

Sense.DEF: to start breathing normally again after running or making a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slow down, I need to catch my breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢一点﹐我要喘口气。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will not be able to persuade someone else, so there is no point in trying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Save your breath. She’s already made up her mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别浪费口舌了﹐她已经打定主意了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will he listen to me or will I just be wasting my breath?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会听我的吗？或者我只是在白费口舌？

Sense.DEF: to be extremely beautiful or exciting
Sense.TRAN: 令某人惊叹﹐令某人叫绝
Sense.EXAMPLE: The view from the top will take your breath away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从山顶眺望﹐景色美得令人窒息。

Sense.DEF: in a quiet voice so that no one can hear you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Son of a bitch,’ he muttered under his breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “畜生。”他压低声音说。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone has said two things at once that are so different from each other they cannot both be true
Subsense.TRAN: 但紧接着﹐但同时〔指说自相矛盾的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He criticized the film, then predicted in the same breath that it would be a great success.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他批评这部影片不好﹐但紧接着又说它会很卖座。

Subsense.DEF: if you mention two people or things in the same breath, you show that you think they are alike or are related
Subsense.TRAN: 和...一起〔提及，表示认为二者相似或相关联〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I became nervous when the doctor mentioned my mother’s name and ‘cancer’ in the same breath.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当医生把我母亲的名字和“癌症”联系在一起时﹐我就变得紧张了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a young poet mentioned in the same breath as T.S. Eliot
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和T.S.艾略特齐名的一位年轻诗人

Sense.DEF: at the moment when you are dying
Sense.EXAMPLE: With his last breath, he cursed his captors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用最后的一口气诅咒绑架他的人。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount or a sign of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They did everything they could to avoid the slightest breath of scandal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想尽一切办法避免有一丝一毫的丑闻传出。

Sense.DEF: a slight movement of air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scarcely a breath of air disturbed the stillness of the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有一丝微风搅扰白日的宁静。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: breathe in
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Alex took a deep breath, then jumped into the pool.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿历克斯深深吸了一口气﹐然后跳入池中。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: breathe out
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let your breath out slowly and relax.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢吐气﹐放松。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not breathe out for a few seconds or minutes
Collocate.EXAMPLE: How long can you hold your breath underwater?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在水里能憋气多长时间？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have difficulty breathing after running, hurrying etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Andrew hurried in, slightly out of breath.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁匆匆进来﹐有点上气不接下气。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be unable to breathe easily because you are ill, old etc
have difficulty breathing
breathe
that smells unpleasant
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Smoking gives you bad breath.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟会让你有口臭。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you breathe a lot of air in slowly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She took a deep breath and knocked on the door.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深吸一口气﹐敲了敲门。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you breathe a small amount of air in
when you are unable to breathe easily
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Symptoms include dizziness and shortness of breath.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 症状包括眩晕和呼吸急促。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you breathe in very quickly and suddenly, especially because you are surprised
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He gave a sharp intake of breath.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地倒吸一口气。

Sense.DEF: clothing that is breathable allows air to pass through it easily
to make someone breathe into a special piece of equipment in order to see if they have drunk too much alcohol to be allowed to drive
Sense.TRAN: 对…作呼气测醉检查﹐对…作酒精检测

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used by the police to see if a driver of a car has drunk too much alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 呼气测醉器﹐呼气酒精检测仪

Sense.DEF: to take air into your lungs and send it out again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room filled with smoke, and it was becoming difficult to breathe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里全是烟﹐呼吸越来越困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People are concerned about the quality of the air they breathe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们关心他们所呼吸的空气的质量。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Relax and breathe deeply
take in a lot of air
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放松﹐深呼吸。

Sense.DEF: to blow air or smoke out of your mouth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roy breathed on his hands and rubbed them together vigorously.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊往双手上哈了一口气﹐然后使劲地搓手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fat man opposite was breathing garlic all over me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对面的那个胖男人满口大蒜味﹐直向我熏来。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that someone can relax because a worrying or dangerous situation has ended
Sense.TRAN: 某人可以放心了﹐某人可以松一口气
Sense.EXAMPLE: With stocks going up, investors can breathe easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票上涨﹐投资者可以放心了。

Sense.DEF: to stop being worried or frightened about something
Sense.TRAN: 轻松地舒口气﹐松一口气
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once the deadline passed, everyone breathed a sigh of relief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后期限一过﹐大家都松了一口气。

Sense.DEF: to pay very close attention to what someone is doing, in a way that makes them feel nervous or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 紧盯某人﹔严密监视某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can I concentrate with you breathing down my neck all the time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你总是这样盯着我﹐我怎么能集中注意力？

Sense.DEF: to not tell anyone anything at all about something, because it is a secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t breathe a word; it’s supposed to be a surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个字都不要透露出去﹐这是一个惊喜。

Sense.DEF: to change a situation so that people feel more excited or interested
Sense.EXAMPLE: Critics are hoping the young director can breathe new life into the French film industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影评家希望这位年轻导演会给法国的电影业注入新的生命。

Sense.DEF: if your skin can breathe, air can reach it
if cloth or clothing breathes, air can pass through it so that your body feels pleasantly cool and dry
if you let wine breathe, you open the bottle to let the air get to it before you drink it
to say something very quietly, almost in a whisper
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Wait,’ he breathed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “等一下。”他轻声说道。

Sense.DEF: to die
to talk and behave in a very angry way

Exponent.DEF: to take air into your lungs and send it out again
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mary knew he was asleep because he was breathing deeply.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽知道他睡着了﹐因为他呼吸很深。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He breathed the clear spring air.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吸着春天清爽的空气。

Exponent.DEF:
to breathe out slowly and make a noise that shows you are disappointed, tired,
relieved
etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She just sighed and shook her head.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是叹着气摇了摇头。

Exponent.DEF: to breathe quickly and noisily through your mouth, because you have been using a lot of effort
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were panting by the time they got to the finish line.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 到达终点时他们都气喘吁吁。

Exponent.DEF: to breathe very quickly and deeply and with difficulty
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因呼吸困难而〕喘气﹐上气不接下气
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were wide, and she was gasping for breath.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双目圆睁﹐大口喘着气。

Exponent.DEF: to breathe noisily while you are sleeping
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t sleep because my husband was snoring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我睡不着﹐因为我丈夫在打鼾。

Exponent.DEF: to breathe with difficulty, making a noise in your throat and chest, because you are ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His asthma was making him wheeze.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哮喘发作﹐呼哧呼哧地喘着气。

Sense.DEF: to take air into your lungs
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor made me breathe in while he listened to my chest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生给我听胸部时，叫我吸气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wyatt breathed in the cool ocean air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀亚特呼吸着凉爽的海风。

Sense.DEF: to send air out from your lungs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim breathed out deeply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆深深地呼出一口气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lauren lit up a cigarette, then breathed out a puff of smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳伦点起一支香烟﹐吐出一口烟来。

Sense.DEF: to stop what you are doing for a short time in order to rest, especially when you are exercising
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指锻炼时〕休息一下﹐喘一口气

Sense.DEF: the process of breathing air in and out
Sense.EXAMPLE: His breathing was deep and regular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的呼吸深沉而均匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
When I picked up the phone, all I heard was heavy breathing
loud breathing
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拿起电话﹐只听到粗重的呼吸声。

Sense.DEF: a short time when you have a rest from doing something before starting again
Sense.EXAMPLE: This deal should give the company some extra breathing room before its loans are due.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔生意可以让公司在贷款到期之前多一些喘息的机会。

Sense.DEF: enough room to move or breathe easily and comfortably in
Sense.TRAN: 活动的空间﹔呼吸的空间

Sense.DEF: having difficulty breathing, especially because you are very tired, excited, or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 气喘吁吁的﹐喘不过气来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The long climb left Jan feeling breathless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 攀爬了那么长时间，简感到喘不过气来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They waited, breathless with anticipation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们屏息以待。

Sense.DEF: excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: His first novel drew breathless superlatives from critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一部小说赢得书评家的高度赞誉。

Sense.DEF: extremely fast
unpleasantly hot, with no fresh air or wind
Sense.TRAN: 闷热无风的，令人透不过气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the breathless heat of a midsummer night in Rome
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马仲夏夜令人窒息的暑气

Sense.DEF: very impressive, exciting, or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 激动人心的﹔惊人的﹔令人惊叹的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The view from my bedroom window was absolutely breathtaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我卧室窗外的景色美得令人窒息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an act of breathtaking arrogance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人咋舌的傲慢举动

Sense.DEF: a test in which the police make a car driver breathe into a special bag to see if he or she has drunk too much alcohol
if someone’s voice is breathy, you can hear their breath when they speak
Sense.TRAN: 〔嗓音〕带有气音的﹐带喘息声的

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
breed
the part of a gun into which you put the bullets
a birth in which the lower part of a baby’s body comes out of its mother first
short trousers that fasten just below the knees
Sense.EXAMPLE: riding breeches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马裤

Sense.DEF:
if animals breed, they
mate
in order to have babies
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

Sense.DEF: to keep animals or plants in order to produce babies or new plants, especially ones with particular qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: These dogs were originally bred in Scotland to round up sheep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些狗最初在苏格兰是为了圈羊而饲养的。

Sense.DEF: to cause a particular feeling or condition
Sense.TRAN: 引起﹐酿成﹐招致〔某种情感或状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor living conditions breed violence and despair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困的生活条件滋生暴力和绝望情绪。

Sense.DEF: if a place, situation, or thing breeds a particular type of person, it produces that type
Sense.TRAN: 养育﹐哺育﹐生养〔某一类型的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Society’s obsession with sex has bred a generation of unhappy children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纵欲的社会生养了一代不幸的儿童。

Sense.DEF: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

Sense.DEF: a particular kind of person or type of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Real cowboys are a dying breed
not many exist anymore
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真正的牛仔现在已非常少见。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Dodd was one of that rare breed
there are not many of them
who could make the game of football look simple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多德可以让足球比赛变得很简单﹐很少有人能做到这样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new breed of international criminal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新型国际罪犯

Sense.DEF: someone who breeds animals or plants as a job
Sense.TRAN: 育种者﹔饲养者﹔繁殖者﹔栽培者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dog breeder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 育狗人

Sense.DEF: when animals produce babies
Sense.EXAMPLE: Open-sea fish lay several million eggs each breeding season .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外海鱼类每个繁殖季节都会产数百万的卵。

Sense.DEF: the activity of keeping animals or plants in order to produce animals or plants that have particular qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: the breeding of pedigree dogs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯种狗的繁育
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Benson took great care in selecting breeding stock
animals you keep to breed from
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本森选择种畜极为仔细。

Sense.DEF: the fact of coming from a family of high rank and having polite social behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: The young lieutenant had an air of wealth and good breeding .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位年轻中尉显示出富家子弟的气度和良好的教养。

Sense.DEF: a place or situation where something bad or harmful develops

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Overcrowded slums are breeding grounds for crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口过于拥挤的贫民窟是滋生犯罪的温床。

Sense.DEF: a place where animals go in order to breed
a gentle wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: flowers waving in the breeze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在微风中摇曳的花儿

Sense.DEF: to be very easy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t think that learning Dutch will be a breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要以为学荷兰语是件轻松的事。

Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere in a calm confident way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She just breezed into my office and said she wanted a job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她信步走进我的办公室﹐说要一份工作。

Sense.DEF: to do very well in a test, a piece of written work etc, with very little effort
Sense.TRAN: 轻松完成〔考试﹑书面作业等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t bother studying for the English exam – you’ll breeze it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语考试不用复习——你肯定能轻松通过。

Sense.DEF: to achieve something very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: He breezed through the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毫不费力地通过了考试。

Sense.DEF:
a light brick used in building, made of
cement
and
cinder s
a breezy person is happy, confident, and relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a breezy and relaxed air of confidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻松自信的神态

Sense.DEF: if the weather is breezy, the wind blows quite strongly
used to address or talk about the members of an organization or group, especially a religious group
Sense.TRAN: 弟兄（们）〔尤指宗教团体内对成员的称呼〕

Sense.DEF:
a musical note that continues for twice as long as a
semibreve
the quality of expressing something in very few words
Sense.EXAMPLE: Letters published in the newspaper are edited for brevity and clarity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报上刊登的来信都要编辑得简洁明了。

Sense.DEF: the quality of continuing for only a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the brevity of her visit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的短暂来访

Sense.DEF: to make beer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every beer on the menu was brewed locally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒单上的所有啤酒都是本地酿造的。

Sense.DEF: if a drink of tea or coffee is brewing, the taste is getting into the hot water
Sense.EXAMPLE: He read the paper while the tea brewed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他趁泡茶的时候读报纸。

Sense.DEF: to make a drink of tea or coffee
Sense.EXAMPLE: freshly brewed coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚刚煮好的咖啡

Subsense.DEF: if something unpleasant is brewing, it will happen soon
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s trouble brewing in the office.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里要有麻烦了。

Subsense.DEF: if a storm is brewing, it will happen soon

Sense.DEF: to make a drink of tea
a drink that is brewed, especially tea
Sense.TRAN: 泡好的饮料﹐〔尤指〕泡好的茶

Sense.DEF: beer, or a can or glass of beer
Sense.TRAN: 啤酒﹔一罐啤酒﹔一杯啤酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold brew in a frosty glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰冷的杯子里装的冰啤酒

Sense.DEF: a combination of different things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band played a strange brew of rock, jazz, and country music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个乐队演奏摇滚乐﹑爵士乐和乡村音乐混合的一种奇怪音乐。

Sense.DEF: a person or company that makes beer
Sense.TRAN: 啤酒商﹔酿啤酒者﹔啤酒公司

Sense.DEF: a place where beer is made, or a company that makes beer
a wild bush with branches that have small sharp points
Sense.TRAN: 欧石楠〔一种有刺的野生灌木〕

Sense.DEF: a tobacco pipe made from briar
to illegally give someone, especially a public official, money or a gift in order to persuade them to do something for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only way we could get into the country was by bribing the border officials.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要进入这个国家﹐唯一的办法是贿赂边境官员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He bribed one of the guards to smuggle out a note.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他买通其中的一个警卫﹐让他偷偷地带一张字条出去。

Sense.DEF: to offer someone, especially a child, something special in order to persuade them to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam wouldn’t do her homework until I bribed her with ice cream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用冰激凌哄萨姆﹐她才肯做家庭作业。

Sense.DEF: money or a gift that you illegally give someone to persuade them to do something for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The officials said that they had been offered bribes before an important game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几名官员说﹐有人在一场重要比赛之前向他们行贿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A Supreme Court judge was charged with taking bribes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高法院的一名法官被指控收受贿赂。

Sense.DEF: something special offered to someone, especially a child, in order to persuade them to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用来哄小孩做事的〕好处

Sense.DEF: the act of giving bribes
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tried everything – persuasion, bribery, threats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们什么都试过——劝过﹐给过好处﹐也威胁过。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
He was found guilty of bribery and corruption
bribery and dishonest behaviour
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判犯有贿赂和徇私舞弊罪。

Sense.DEF: small objects that are not worth very much money but are interesting or attractive
a hard block of baked clay used for building walls, houses etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brick wall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砖墙
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house made of brick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砖房
Sense.EXAMPLE: Protesters attacked the police with stones and bricks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者用石头和砖块袭击警察。

Sense.DEF:
houses – used especially when talking about them as an
investment
Sense.TRAN: 房产〔尤指作为一种投资〕

Sense.DEF: a small square block of wood, plastic etc used as a toy
a good person who you can depend on when you are in trouble

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be (like) banging/bashing etc your head against a brick wall

Sense.DEF: to feel very nervous or frightened
to separate an area from a larger area by building a wall of bricks
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the rooms had been bricked off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几间房是用砖墙隔出来的。

Sense.DEF: to fill or close a space by building a wall of bricks in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windows were bricked up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户用砖堵起来了。

Sense.DEF: a criticism of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan has drawn both brickbats and praise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家对这个计划褒贬不一。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to build walls, buildings etc with bricks
a brownish red colour
the bricks that have been used to build something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brickwork was cracked and in need of repair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砖墙出现裂缝﹐需要修补。

Sense.DEF: the work of building something with bricks
relating to a wedding or a woman who is getting married
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bridal gown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘礼服

Sense.DEF: the group of people who arrive at the church with the bride
a special set of rooms in a hotel for two people who have just got married
a woman at the time she gets married or just after she is married
a man at the time he gets married, or just after he is married
a girl or woman, usually unmarried, who helps a bride on her wedding day and is with her at the wedding
a woman who is going to be married soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jonathan’s bride-to-be
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔纳森的准新娘

Sense.DEF: a structure built over a river, road etc that allows people or vehicles to cross from one side to the other

PIC.HEADING: BRIDGES 桥
PIC.PICCONTENT: flyover BrE【英】/overpass AmE【美】立交桥；footbridge 步行桥；road bridge 公路桥；suspension bridge 悬索桥；viaduct 高架桥；hump-backed bridge BrE【英】弓形桥

Sense.DEF: something that provides a connection between two things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The training programme is seen as a bridge between school and work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该培训计划被视为衔接学校和职场的桥梁。
GramExa.EXAMPLE:
a scheme to build bridges
make a better relationship
between the police and the community
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搭建警民联系桥梁的计划

Sense.DEF: the raised part of a ship from which the officers control it
a card game for four players, who play in pairs
the upper part of your nose between your eyes
the part of a pair of glasses that rests on your nose

a small piece of wood under the strings of a
violin
or
guitar
, used to keep them in position
a small piece of metal that keeps false teeth in place by attaching them to your real teeth

Crossrefto.REFLEX: cross that bridge when you come to it

Sense.DEF: to reduce or get rid of the difference between two things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The differences between our two cultures can be bridged if we continue to communicate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果保持沟通﹐我们两种文化之间的分歧可以消除。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alvin managed to bridge the gap between ballet and modern dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔文设法弥合了芭蕾舞和现代舞蹈之间的差异。

Sense.DEF: to build or form a bridge over something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fallen tree bridging the stream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒下来架在小溪上的树

Sense.DEF: a strong position far forward in enemy land from which an army can go forward or attack
an amount of money that a bank lends you for a short period of time until you receive money from somewhere else
a set of leather bands put around a horse’s head and used to control its movements
to become angry and offended about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The senator bridled at the reporter’s question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者的问题惹怒了参议员。

Sense.DEF: to put a bridle on a horse
a path that you ride a horse on
a soft French cheese
Sense.TRAN: 布里干酪〔法国产的一种软干酪〕

Sense.DEF: continuing for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们长话短说吧﹐我还要赶飞机。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greene spent a brief time at Cambridge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林在剑桥短暂生活过一段时间。

Sense.DEF: using very few words or including few details
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president read a brief statement to reporters before boarding his plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统登机前向记者宣读了一篇简短的声明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brief description of the film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片的简短介绍

Sense.DEF: to say or write something using only a few words, especially because there is little time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be brief; a lot of changes are going to happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就长话短说吧﹐接下来将会发生许多变化。

Sense.DEF: clothes that are brief are short and cover only a small area of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very brief bikini
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常暴露的比基尼泳装

Sense.DEF: official instructions that explain what someone’s job is, what their duties are etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The architect’s brief is to design an extension that is modern but blends with the rest of the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对建筑师的要求是扩建部分的设计既要有现代感﹐又要与大楼的其他部分浑然一体。

Sense.DEF: a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case
Sense.EXAMPLE:
The ACLU filed a brief
gave one to the court
opposing the decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国公民自由联盟提交了辩护状反对这个判决。

Sense.DEF: a law case that a lawyer will argue in a court
a short report about something

Subsense.DEF: in as few words as possible
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We should, in brief, invest heavily in digital systems.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总之﹐我们应该在数字化系统上大力投资。

Subsense.DEF: without any details
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Here again are today’s headlines in brief.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在再次播报今天的新闻提要。

Sense.DEF: men’s or women’s underwear worn on the lower part of the body
to give someone all the information about a situation that they will need

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president has been fully briefed on the current situation in Haiti.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统听取了海地当前局势的全面汇报。

Sense.DEF: a flat case used especially by business people for carrying papers or documents
information or instructions that you get before you have to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事前得到的〕简要指示，情况简介

Sense.DEF: for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped off briefly in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在伦敦短暂停留。

Sense.DEF: in as few words as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sonia explained briefly what we had to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索尼娅简要地说明了我们要做的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Briefly, I think we should accept their offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简言之﹐我认为我们应该接受他们的建议。

Sense.DEF:
a
briar

a ship with two
mast s
poles
and large square sails
a military prison, especially on a ship
a large group of soldiers forming part of an army
an insulting word for a group of people who have the same beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: the anti-nuclear brigade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反核派

Sense.DEF: a group of people who are organized to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snowmobile brigades delivered food and medicine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪车队送来了食物和药品。
