Sense.DEF: a small shiny yellow wild flower
Sense.TRAN: 毛茛〔一种有光泽的黄色小野花〕

Sense.DEF: the natural fat in milk
someone who often drops things they are carrying or trying to catch
a type of insect that has large wings, often with beautiful colours
to feel very nervous before doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事前〕情绪紧张﹐心里发慌
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always get butterflies before an exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试前我总是很紧张。

Sense.DEF: a way of swimming by lying on your front and moving your arms together over your head while your legs move up and down
someone who usually moves on quickly from one activity or person to the next
Sense.TRAN: 见异思迁的人；无常性的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gwen’s a real social butterfly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格温是个十足的交际花。

Sense.DEF: the liquid that remains after butter has been made
a type of sweet or sauce made from butter and sugar boiled together, or the taste this has
Sense.TRAN: 奶油硬糖﹔奶油硬糖汁﹔奶油硬糖味
Sense.EXAMPLE: butterscotch pudding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶油硬糖味布丁

Sense.DEF:
someone’s
anus
used to insult someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: You butthole!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这笨蛋！

Sense.DEF: one of the fleshy parts of your body that you sit on
a small round flat object on your shirt, coat etc that you pass through a hole to fasten it
Sense.EXAMPLE: small pearl buttons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小的珍珠纽扣
Sense.EXAMPLE: A button was missing from his shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衬衫上掉了一颗纽扣。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
She undid
unfastened
the buttons of her blouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她解开衬衫的纽扣。

GramExa.GLOSS: fasten a button

PIC.HEADING: BUTTON 纽扣
PIC.PICCONTENT: buckle 带扣；button 纽扣；zip BrE【英】/zipper AmE【美】拉链；Velcro 尼龙搭扣；toggle 栓扣；eye 钩环；hook 钩；hook and eye 钩眼扣；safety pin 安全别针；stud/snap AmE【美】摁扣

Sense.DEF: a small part or area of a machine that you press to make it do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press the pause button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按暂停键。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Click on the icon with the right mouse button .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用鼠标右键点击图标。

Sense.DEF:
a small area on a computer screen, especially on a website, that you
click
on in order to perform an action
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕﹐尤指网页上的〕按钮

Sense.DEF: a small metal or plastic pin with a message or picture on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔印有文字或图案的〕金属[塑料]小徽章
Sense.EXAMPLE: presidential campaign buttons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统竞选徽章

Sense.DEF: a nose or eyes that are small and round
exactly right, or at exactly the right time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got to our house at two, on the button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她两点钟准时到了我们家。

Sense.DEF: to get what you want by behaving in a clever way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed to push all the right buttons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像步步正确﹐一路顺利。

Sense.DEF: to make someone angry by doing or saying something that annoys them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He really knows how to push Dad’s buttons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最拿手的就是把爸爸激怒。

Sense.LEXUNIT: at/with the push/touch of a button
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how easy a machine is to use because it is controlled by pushing a button
Sense.TRAN: 只要按一下按钮〔用于强调机器容易操作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The instrument can gauge a distance with the push of a button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台仪器只要一按按钮就能测出距离。

Sense.DEF: to fasten clothes with buttons, or to be fastened with buttons
Sense.TRAN: 用纽扣扣住﹐扣上…的扣子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam, make sure Nina buttons up her jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆﹐要让尼娜把上衣扣好。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone in a rude way to stop talking
a button-down shirt or collar has the ends of the collar fastened to the shirt with buttons
a button-down company or style is formal and traditional
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或风格〕一本正经的﹐传统的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t fit in with the button-down culture of his new boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不习惯新老板一本正经的处事作风。

Sense.DEF: someone who is buttoned-up is not able to express their feelings, especially sexual feelings
Sense.TRAN: 感情封闭的﹐沉默寡言的〔尤指对性方面的感觉〕

Sense.DEF: a hole for a button to be put through to fasten a shirt, coat etc
a flower you fasten to your clothes
a brick or stone structure built to support a wall
to support a system, idea, argument etc, especially by providing money
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过出钱〕支持〔某一体制﹑主张﹑论点等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence seemed to buttress their argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证据似乎支持他们的论点。

Sense.DEF:
a
sandwich
a woman who is buxom is attractively large and healthy and has big breasts

Subsense.DEF: to get something by paying money for it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where did you buy that dress?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条裙子你在哪儿买的？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ricky showed her the painting he’d bought that morning.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里基给她看了那天早上他买的画。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me buy you a drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你买杯饮料吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money will be used to buy equipment for the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱将用来给学校购买设备。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s cheaper to buy direct from the manufacturer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直接从厂家那里购买会便宜一些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dan bought the car for $2,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹以2,000美元买下这辆车。

Subsense.EXAMPLE:
It’s much cheaper to buy in bulk
buy large quantities of something
.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大批量购买要便宜很多。

Subsense.DEF: if a sum of money buys something, it is enough to pay for it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: $50 doesn’t buy much these days.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在50美元买不了多少东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: $15 should buy us a pizza and a drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 15美元应该够我们买一个比萨饼和一杯饮料。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make more time for yourself to do something, for example by delaying a decision
Sense.TRAN: （为某人）争取时间﹔（为某人）设法拖延
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can we talk about it later?’ he said, trying to buy a little more time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们待会儿再谈这事好吗？”他说道，想尽量再拖延一点时间。

Sense.DEF: to believe something that someone tells you, especially when it is not likely to be true
Sense.TRAN: 接受﹐相信〔尤指不大可能属实的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Let’s just say it was an accident.’ ‘ He’ll never buy that .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们就说这是个意外。”“他才不会相信呢。”

Sense.DEF: to pay money to someone, especially someone in a position of authority, in order to persuade them to do something dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 贿赂﹐收买﹐买通〔尤指有权势人士〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People say the judge had been bought by the Mafia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们都说法官被黑手党收买了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: buy sth at the cost/expense/price of sth
Sense.DEF: to get something that you want, but only by losing something else
Sense.TRAN: 牺牲某事物去换取某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town has been careful not to buy prosperity at the expense of its character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座小镇一直很注意不拿自己的特色作代价来换取繁荣。

Sense.DEF: someone was killed
Sense.TRAN: 某人被杀死﹐某人已送命

Sense.DEF: if you buy property off-plan, you buy a house, flat etc that is just starting to be built, with an arrangement to pay part of the cost of the property at that time and the balance when the property is finished

Exponent.DEF: to pay money for something so that you can own it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve just bought a new car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚买了辆新车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The painting was bought by a museum in New York.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画被纽约一家博物馆买走了。

Exponent.DEF: to buy something, especially something large or expensive, in a business deal or by a legal contract
Exponent.TRAN: 购买﹐购置〔尤指在商业交易中或依照法律合同购买大件物品或昂贵物品〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They purchased 5,000 acres of land.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们购买了5,000英亩土地。

Exponent.DEF: to become the owner of something large or expensive such as property, a company, or a valuable object
Exponent.TRAN: 购得﹐获得〔地产﹑公司、昂贵物品等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 2007 the business was acquired by a Dutch company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 2007年，这家企业被荷兰的一家公司收购。

Exponent.DEF: to buy something, especially ordinary things such as food, clothes, or things for your house
Exponent.TRAN: 买〔尤指衣食等日常用品〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you remember to get some bread?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你记得要买些面包吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I never know what to get Dad for his birthday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都不知道该给爸爸买什么生日礼物。

Exponent.DEF: to buy something immediately, especially because it is very cheap, or because you want it very much and you are worried that someone else might buy it first
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Real estate in the area is being snapped up by developers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发商在抢购这一地区的房地产。

Exponent.DEF: to buy something, especially something ordinary such as food or a newspaper, or something that you have found by chance and are pleased about owning
Exponent.TRAN: 顺手购买某物〔尤指食物﹑报纸等普通物品﹐或偶然发现的东西〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Could you pick up some milk on your way home?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家路上顺便买些牛奶行吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s just a little thing I picked up when I was in Kathmandu.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我在加德满都随手买的一个小东西。

Exponent.DEF: to buy a lot of something you use regularly, because you may not be able to buy it later, or because you are planning to use more of it than usual
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The supermarkets are full of people stocking up for the New Year’s holiday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 超市里全是为过新年备货的顾客。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verbs buy, get and purchase in spoken and written English. 动词buy﹐get和purchase在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

All three verbs are used to mean ‘get something by paying for it’. The graph shows that in this meaning get is extremely common in spoken English. However, get is informal and is not at all common in written English. Purchase is used in formal or business contexts. It is not very common and is used more in written English than in spoken English. 三个动词都用于表示“购买”。本图表显示﹐在英语口语中﹐用get表示这个意思极为常见﹐但get是非正式用语﹐不常用于书面英语中。purchase用于正式或商业语境﹐不是十分常用﹐它在书面语中的使用频率高于口语中。

Sense.DEF: to buy something in large quantities
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies are buying in supplies of paper, in case the price goes up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司大量买进纸张﹐以防纸价上涨。

Sense.DEF: to accept that an idea is right and allow it to influence you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never bought into this idea that you have to be thin to be attractive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来就不信这种瘦才会漂亮的说法。

Sense.DEF: to buy part of a business or organization, especially because you want to control it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investors were invited to buy into state-owned enterprises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者获邀购买国有企业的股份。

Sense.DEF: to pay someone money to stop them causing trouble or threatening you
to buy someone’s share of a business or property that you previously owned together, so that you have complete control
Sense.TRAN: 买下…的全部股权﹐买断…的股份

Sense.DEF: to pay money so that someone can leave an organization such as the army before their contract has ended
Sense.TRAN: 花钱让某人离开某机构〔如出钱让某人提前从军队退役〕

Sense.DEF: to quickly buy as much of something as possible, for example land, tickets, or goods
Sense.TRAN: 〔迅速地〕囤积﹐大量买下〔土地﹑票券或商品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of the land was bought up by property developers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多土地都被房地产开发商买下来了。

Sense.DEF: something that is worth buying, because it is cheap, good quality, or likely to gain in value

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wine is a good buy at $6.50.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这葡萄酒6.50美元﹐买得很合算。
GramExa.EXAMPLE:
It’s worth shopping around for the best buy
what you want at the lowest price
.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该多看看﹐找最合算的买。

Sense.DEF: an act of buying something, especially something illegal
Sense.TRAN: 购买〔尤指购买非法的东西〕

Sense.DEF: someone who buys something expensive such as a house or car
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋或汽车等的〕买主﹐买方﹐买家
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were several potential buyers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有好几个潜在的买家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: discounts for first-time buyers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为首次购买的顾客提供的折扣

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to choose and buy the goods for a shop or company
Sense.EXAMPLE: a buyer for a chain store
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家连锁店的采购员

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is plenty of something available, so that buyers have a lot of choice and prices tend to be low

a situation in which someone gains control of a company by buying all or most of its
share s
Sense.EXAMPLE: a management buyout
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层收购

Sense.DEF:
to make a continuous sound, like the sound of a
bee
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loud buzzing noise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很大的嗡嗡声

Subsense.DEF:
to move around in the air making a continuous sound like a
bee
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bees were buzzing around the picnic tables.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜜蜂在野餐桌旁边嗡嗡地飞来飞去。

Subsense.DEF: to move quickly around a place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Pamela buzzed around checking that everything was ready.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕梅拉忙得团团转﹐确保一切准备就绪。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were all sorts of rumours buzzing through the office.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里流传着各种谣言。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people or a place is buzzing, there is a lot of activity or excitement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a classroom buzzing with activity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 闹哄哄的教室

Subsense.DEF:
to call someone by pressing a
buzzer
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kramer buzzed at the security door, and I let him in.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克雷默按响防盗门的门铃﹐我就开门让他进来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tina buzzed for her secretary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂娜按铃呼叫她的秘书。

Subsense.DEF: to make something happen, for example make a door or gate open or close, by pressing a buzzer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She buzzed them in and greeted them warmly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她按蜂鸣器开门﹐热情地迎接他们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guard buzzed me through the gate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警卫按蜂鸣器开门让我进去。

Sense.DEF: if your head or mind is buzzing with thoughts, ideas etc, you cannot stop thinking about them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mind was buzzing with new ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我满脑子都是新主意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Questions started buzzing round in my head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脑子里冒出一个个问题。

Sense.DEF: if your ears or head are buzzing, you can hear a continuous low unpleasant sound
to fly an aircraft low and fast over buildings, people etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Military jets buzzed the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军用喷气机在城市上空低飞。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone in a rude way to go away
to go away
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve finished everything, so I’ll buzz off now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情我都做完了﹐现在要走了。

Sense.DEF:
a continuous noise like the sound of a
bee

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the buzz of mosquitoes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蚊子的嗡嗡声

Sense.DEF: a lot of activity, noise, and excitement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the buzz of conversation and laughter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈天说笑的喧闹声

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of excitement, pleasure, or success, or a similar feeling from drinking alcohol or taking drugs
Sense.TRAN: 兴奋之感﹔喜悦心情﹔〔喝酒或吸毒产生的〕快感
Sense.EXAMPLE: Playing well gives me a buzz .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球打得好我就开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neil gets a buzz from drinking one beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔一杯啤酒下肚就兴奋起来了。

Sense.DEF: to telephone someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you a buzz on Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期一给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: unofficial news or information that is spread by people telling each other

a type of large
hawk
hunting bird
a type of large bird that eats dead animals
a hair style that is very short, usually worn by men

a small thing, usually shaped like a button, that
buzz es
when you press it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press the buzzer if you know the answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你知道答案﹐就按抢答器。

Sense.DEF:
a
saw
with a round blade that is spun around by a motor
a word or phrase from one special area of knowledge that people suddenly think is very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Multimedia’ has been a buzzword in the computer industry for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “多媒体”这个词语在计算机行业里已经流行多年了。

Sense.DEF:
used especially with a
passive
verb to say who or what does something or makes something happen
Sense.TRAN: 被﹐由〔尤与被动语态动词连用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was attacked by a dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被一条狗袭击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a church designed by the famous architect, Sir Christopher Wren
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名建筑师克里斯托弗·雷恩爵士设计的一座教堂
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are all alarmed by the rise in violent crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都对暴力罪案的增加感到忧虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: interference by the state in the affairs of the Church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家对教会事务的干预
Sense.EXAMPLE: his appointment by the BBC as a producer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国广播公司委任他为制片人

Sense.DEF: used to say what means or method someone uses to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can reserve the tickets by phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以通过电话订票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send it by airmail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用航空邮件把它寄走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some customers prefer to pay by cheque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些客户喜欢用支票支付。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They travelled to Chicago by train.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们乘火车去芝加哥。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All supplies are transported by air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 补给品全部空运。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She earns her living by selling insurance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以推销保险为生。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was taken from his home by force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被人从家里强行带走。

Sense.DEF: used to say which road, entrance, door etc someone uses to get to a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: They came in by the back door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从后门进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s quicker to go by the country route.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走乡村小路更快。

Sense.DEF: used to say which part of an object or of a person’s body someone takes hold of
Sense.TRAN: 抓着〔物体或身体的某个部位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took Elaine by the arm and led her across the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他搀着伊莱恩的胳膊﹐领她过马路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She grabbed the hammer by the handle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓着锤子的柄。

Sense.DEF: used to give the name of someone who wrote a book, produced a film, wrote a piece of music etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ‘New World Symphony’ by Dvorak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德沃夏克所作的《新世界交响曲》
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short story by Charles Dickens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯·狄更斯写的一个短篇小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s it by?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是谁的作品？

Sense.DEF: beside or near something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood by the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在窗边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane went and sat by Patrick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简走过去坐在帕特里克身旁。

Sense.DEF: past someone or something without stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked right by me without even saying hello.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他径直从我身边走过﹐连招呼都不打。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I pass by the farm every day on my way to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天上班都要经过这个农场。

Sense.DEF: before or not later than a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The documents need to be ready by next Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件必须在下星期五之前准备好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I reckon the film should be over by 9.30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我估计电影9点半应该结束了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of the day we had sold over 2,000 tickets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天下来我们卖出了2,000多张票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time we got home we were tired and hungry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回到家的时候﹐我们已经又累又饿了。

Sense.DEF: according to a particular rule, method, or way of doing things
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to play by the rules.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须按规则比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Profits were £6 million, but by our standards this is low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润有600万英镑﹐但按照我们的标准﹐这算是少的。

Sense.DEF: used to say how great a change or difference is
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示变化或差异的程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price of oil fell by a further $2 a barrel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每桶油价又下跌了两美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was overcharged by £3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被多收了3英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
Godard’s first film was better by far
by a large amount or degree
.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈达尔的第一部电影要好得多。

Sense.DEF: used to give the measurements of a room, container etc
Sense.TRAN: 乘〔用于表示房间﹑容器等的大小〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a room 15 metres by 23 metres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间15米宽23米长的房间

Sense.DEF: used to show what unit of measurement or quantity is involved in selling, paying for, producing etc something
Sense.TRAN: 按﹐以〔用于表示量度单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eggs are sold by the dozen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡蛋按打出售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re paid by the hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们按小时计酬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to tear his hair out by the handful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她真想一把扯下他的头发。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens gradually
Sense.EXAMPLE: Day by day, he grew weaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一天比一天虚弱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Little by little, I was beginning to discover the truth about Garfield.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渐渐地﹐我对加菲尔德的真实情况开始有所了解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One by one, the men stepped forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人一个一个走上前来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something or someone is quickly becoming worse, better etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示某事物或某人迅速地变坏﹑变好等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The financial crisis was growing more serious by the hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金融危机每时每刻都在加剧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens in a particular kind of light
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked through the palace gardens by moonlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们借着月光穿过御花园。

Sense.DEF: during the day or the night
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tour of Paris by night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜游巴黎

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving information about someone’s character, job, origin etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于说明某人的性格﹑工作﹑出身等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: George I and George II were Germans by birth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治一世和乔治二世是德国血统。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cautious by nature, Simpkin was reluctant to interfere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛普金天性谨慎﹐不愿意出面干预。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robert Key was a teacher by profession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特·基的职业是教师。

Sense.DEF: in order to visit a person or place for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the way, I stopped by the post office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上我顺便去了一下邮局。

Subsense.DEF: completely alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dave spent Christmas all by himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫一个人过圣诞节。

Subsense.DEF: without help from anyone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can’t move the furniture all by yourself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一个人是搬不动家具的。

Sense.DEF: used between two numbers when talking about multiplying or dividing
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s 48 divided by 4?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 48除以4等于多少？

Sense.DEF: used when expressing strong feelings or making serious promises
Sense.TRAN: 对…发誓〔表示强烈的情感或庄严的承诺〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: By God, I’ll kill that boy when I see him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对上帝发誓﹐我要是看见那小子﹐非杀了他不可！

Sense.DEF: if a woman has children by a particular man, that man is the children’s father
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got two children by her previous husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和前夫生有两个孩子。

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning something that may be interesting but is not particularly important
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the by, Ian said he might call round tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺便告诉你﹐伊恩说他也许今天晚上会过来。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法:by, with
F2NBox.EXPL: By is used, especially after passive verbs, to say who or what does something
F2NBox.TRAN: by尤用于被动语态动词之后，表示何人或何物做了某事
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The article was written by a university professor.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章是一位大学教授写的。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She was hit by a truck.
F2NBox.EXPL: With is used after verbs that describe a state rather than an action
F2NBox.TRAN: with用于描述状态而不是行为的动词之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The books were covered with dust (NOT by dust).
Her house is always filled with music.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她家中总是充满了音乐声。
F2NBox.EXPL: By is used to say what means or method someone uses to do something
F2NBox.TRAN: by用于表示某人采用何种方式或方法来做某事
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He replied by email.
F2NBox.EXPL: With is used to say what tool is used to do something
F2NBox.TRAN: with用于说明使用何种工具来做某事
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Clean the surface thoroughly with a wire brush (NOT 不说 by a wire brush).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 用钢丝刷把表面彻底清洗一下。

Sense.DEF: past someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: As I was standing on the platform, the Liverpool train went whizzing by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我站在月台上﹐开往利物浦的火车飞驰而过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: James walked by without even looking in my direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯走了过去﹐甚至没有朝我这边看。

Sense.DEF: used to say that time passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the summer days slipped by, it was easy to forget about the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天悄悄过去﹐战争很快就被人遗忘了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten years had gone by since I had last seen Marilyn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经有十年没有见到玛丽莲了。

Sense.DEF: beside or near someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd of people were standing by, waiting for an announcement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群人站在旁边等待消息公布。

Sense.DEF: in order to visit a person or place for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you stop by for a drink after work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下班后过来喝一杯怎么样？

Sense.DEF: used when making a general statement
Sense.TRAN: 大体上﹐一般地说﹐总的说来
Sense.EXAMPLE: By and large, the new arrangements have worked well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐新的安排很好。

Sense.DEF: soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: She will be better by and by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快就会好起来的。

Sense.DEF: less important
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a by-product
something made in addition to the main product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 副产品
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a by-election
one held between regular elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 补缺选举

Sense.DEF: goodbye
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bye, Dave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再见﹐戴夫。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you will see or speak to someone again soon

Sense.DEF: a situation in a sports competition in which a player or a team does not have an opponent to play against and continues to the next part of the competition
Sense.TRAN: 轮空〔指体育比赛中因没有对手而直接进入下一轮比赛〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
by-
goodbye – used especially when speaking to children, friends, or members of your family
Sense.TRAN: 再见﹐拜拜〔尤用于向小孩子﹑朋友或家人道别〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Say bye-bye to Daddy, Tommy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和爸爸说再见﹐汤米。

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning go to sleep, used by or to children
a special election to replace a politician who has left parliament or died
a period of time in the past
Sense.TRAN: 过去的时期/年代/岁月等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The buildings reflect the elegance of a bygone era.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建筑物反映了过去年代的典雅。

Sense.DEF: to forget something bad that someone has done to you and forgive them
Sense.TRAN: 过去的事就让它过去吧

Sense.DEF: a law made by a local government that people in that area must obey
a rule made by an organization to control the people who belong to it
a line at the beginning of an article in a newspaper or magazine that gives the writer’s name
Sense.TRAN: 〔报刊文章开头的〕作者署名行

Sense.DEF:
an operation to direct blood through new
vein s
blood tubes
outside the heart because the veins in the heart are blocked or diseased
Sense.TRAN: 心脏搭桥手术﹐旁通管手术
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triple heart bypass operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏三重旁通管手术

Sense.DEF: a road that goes around a town or other busy area rather than through it
a tube that allows gas or liquid to flow around something rather than through it
to go around a town or other busy place rather than through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interstate 8 bypasses the town to the north.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八号州际公路绕城向北而行。

Sense.DEF: to avoid obeying a rule, system, or someone in an official position
Sense.TRAN: 绕过〔规定﹑制度或某个官员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Francis bypassed his manager and wrote straight to the director.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西斯绕过他的经理﹐直接写信给董事。

Sense.DEF: something additional that is produced during a natural or industrial process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a by-product of oil refining
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 炼油产生的副产品

Sense.DEF: an unplanned additional result of something that you do
Sense.TRAN: 意外收获﹐额外收获﹔附带的结果

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Job losses are an unfortunate byproduct of the recession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业是经济衰退的不幸产物。

Sense.DEF: a farm building in which cattle are kept
someone who watches what is happening without taking part
Sense.TRAN: 旁观者﹐局外人﹐看热闹的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several innocent bystanders were killed by the blast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个无辜的旁观者在爆炸中丧生。

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring computer information, equal to eight
bit s
the smallest unit on which information is stored on a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each character requires one byte of storage space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个字符需要一个字节的储存空间。

Sense.DEF: a small road or path that is not used very much
the less important parts of an activity or subject
Sense.EXAMPLE:
a scholar exploring the highways and byways of Russian music
the important and less important parts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究俄罗斯主流和非主流音乐的一位学者

Sense.DEF: to be so well known for a particular quality that your name is used to represent that quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name has become a byword for honesty in the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个社区里﹐他的名字成了诚实的代名词。

Sense.DEF: a word, phrase, or saying that is very well known
Sense.EXAMPLE: Caution should be a byword for investors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “小心谨慎”应该是投资者的格言。

Sense.DEF: complicated and difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 错综复杂的﹔难以理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the byzantine complexity of our tax laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们税法的繁杂难懂

Sense.DEF: relating to the Byzantines or the Byzantine Empire
Sense.TRAN: 拜占庭的﹐拜占庭帝国的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 5th-century Byzantine church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座5世纪的拜占庭教堂
